author: Nudu
review: Great game. Buy it if your a fan - otherwise I would avoid it.Unacceptable status for release of a AAA game that is already 1 year old.40 hours in - already experienced about 5 crashed (which isn't horrible - but really annoying in immersive games) Hackers on Online play (seems Rockstar didn't learn much from GTA Online) , When I booted the game for the first time it started on an insane resolution and not my desktop native resolution.In short - Manageable issues - but really not what I would expect for a AAA release.Edit: Adding specs since people keep thinking its a spec issue:CPU:  i7 6800KGPU: 1080 GTX G1 8GBRAM: 32GB DDR4Installed on HD: 500GB SSD Samsung EVO Edit: another 80 hours in - I wish I could say something has changed, still enjoying the game - still enduring crashes and tons of disconnects on online :(Last Edit: Clocked in 170 hours and I'm putting it down for good, Cant shake the disappointment from Rockstar after waiting a year for this port, I will personally learn from this and will avoid pre-ordering the next GTA / investing much time into the online. (I ended up paying for a VPN service to solve connectivity issues to rockstar servers, an issue I never had with other game services. without the VPN i would get DCed every 30 minutes or so - but its possible this is an issue from my ISP)Really sad for me since I truly think Rockstar were special, they wanted to profit from the online play market without properly preparing the grounds for us players - I feel like GTA Online and Read Dead 2 Online just shows me they don't respect my time or money as a customer.Message received - I shall continue to support the single player aspect of Rockstar games but I'm done waiting for proper online play from a developer who doesn't respect its customers.God speed Rockstar - I hope I'm wrong and you will come around - I just wont be waiting anymore.

author: CoNtRoL
review: I'll start off by saying I rarely write reviews.  But I was compelled enough to come and share my experience. This is my rig:ASUS ROG OC 2080 Superi9820x @3.5 GhzASUS Strix II (quad channel)64GB Corsair RGB Ram (16x4) SSD m.2 x 2 and SSD Samsung 1TB (OS)Windows 10 HomeYou would think with a rig like that, the game would run as smooth as pancakes. Nope. This game will crash every 1-3 hours of playtime. The VRAM usage continues to rise as you play the game.  Because I have an 8GB graphics card, I have ample space for the VRAM.. except, I don't. My VRAM starts at 51% usage (baseline 8% for background). As I continue to play the game, the usage increases to 56%. 61%. 70%. 75%. And usually around this time (if it made it this far) is where it would crash, as it will continue to go up with no limit. Sometimes it crashes 45m into the game.The game itself is absolutely stunning and the physics are next level. However, due to the constant crashes (especially during critical times!!!), it ruins a really great experience.  I would rate this a positive review, but the lack of optimization for PC is deplorable.Edit: I am 100% willing to update this review if or when the developers decide to do something about it.Edit 2: Still crashing. However, not as often. And to respond to the comments about the issue being on my end:I built this rig about 3 days before playing RDR2. So it is only about 1-2 weeks old by now. Everything is brand spanking new (my old rig fried). Understanding it may not happen to everyone since every pc is different, it is happening to me, and to a lot of others.  So given that fact, the issue isn't with our pc's, it is with their settings and optimization.With that being said...I shouldn't have to juggle the settings around just to get it not to crash. Why should I have to do that after paying $60 for the game? If I have the option to play everything on ultra, then I'm going to play everything on ultra and expect the ♥♥♥♥ to work flawlessly. Not "well some options have to be medium, others high and ultra...." ♥♥♥♥ that. Optimize the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ game so I DON'T have to do that ♥♥♥♥.Edit 3: Lots of these comments are about my rig being too OP.  No one is flexing, but if I can afford a steak, why the ♥♥♥♥ would I go to McDonalds.Anyways, I don't have these optimization problems with ANY other game.  Even ♥♥♥♥♥♥ EA's Jedi: Fallen Order (EA is the ♥♥♥♥♥♥ one here, the game itself is gorgeous) runs perfectly fine on all ultra. Far Cry 5 runs fine on all ultra. Everything runs fine on all ultra EXCEPT this game.  I understand they are "not gods", but knowing there was this problem and releasing it anyways, is the problem. At least have the game work first, and if it breaks down later, I get it. But from the outset the port to PC was just bad, which is inexcusable for a company that makes millions of dollars.

author: Inspector Morose
review: First, let me get this out of the way by saying that I finished this game on a friend's console and I think that this game is an absolute masterpiece that deserves to be bought full price. However, I cannot recommend it just because of Rockstar's blatantly anti-consumer software called Rockstar Games Social Club. Bottom line, I can't be bothered to deal with all that rubbish, so I refunded the game.

author: 茗泽 宇轩
review: I believe the story rivals that of television and film’s greatest, and should definitely have the character lineup considered as one of the greatest ever written. The characters, including Arthur Morgan and Dutch Van Der Linde, have some of the most complicated moral dilemmas and plot lines in all of media history, and it’s more than interesting to watch unfold in the game as you play.Red Dead Redemption 2 also currently possess the most intricate and detailed open world to ever be created. With a technical marvel of an AI system, an artificially intelligent animal ecosystem, and incredibly dynamic and interactive NPCs, the technical aspects of what make the open world fantastic as truly some of the best to ever hit the market. All this, combined with the beautiful and detailed map are what really bring the world into fruition.I could look on and on about the writing and how fantastically executed it is but despite all this, this isn’t a very “gamer” game. There’s no “double jump”, or points system, or fancy fantasy game mechanics, It’s very detached from gaming as a whole and a lot more focused on telling a story. This type of style appeals to me, but I can see why it isn’t as treasured in some gaming circles either. This is a game made to be brutally realistic, and that to me feels more relatable and embraceable than any other game will ever.

author: ✪ΔŁ€Ж✪
review: Red Dead Redemption 2 - Rated M for masterpiece!First i have to start by saying that this game is a masterpiece. This is the first game i have taken 100 screenshots in the first 10 hours of the game. Playing as Arthur was the best thing in a game because he is one of the best protagonist i have played as.The animations and the voice actors just fit so good one with each other. This is the first game in a long time that made me do every possible mission. The side quests are so well done. Some of them change some things in the story mode. Red Dead Redemption 2 is the prequel of the first Red Dead Redemption and it's a good this cause we finally saw what happened to the gang that John was in. And now a lot of things make more sense in the first one.Red Dead Online it's a prequel of a prequel, it's really weird. Online is not bad, but is hard for new players to make the gold and money. And it needs some heists/robberies but other then that is good.The graphics and visuals of the game are astonishing and really well made.The gameplay it's just so good like no other game.The soundtrack just amazing and really well fitted. A really great choice with the western like vibe of the music and game. Oh and i like it when the horse testicles shrink when it's cold.I fell in love with the game in the first 2 hours of it because it's just so good. I played like 10-12 hours per day cause it's great. No game really made me do that.  That's how much i love it. I don't regret buying this game. I bought it on sale for 40 euros. The best decision. The game is worth every penny you have. I hope they will port Red Dead Redemption to pc so i can play it or maybe a remake or remastered version of it and maybe Undead Nightmare 1&2.So if you have the money buy the game it's worth it.If you want to look at the screenshots that i have, some are spoilers so be carefull.    Red Dead OnlineOk after playing online for some time i can say i like some elements from it. Love the grind like in GTA Online. Love the trader role because of the animal hunting.I can say that RDO is not that bad but it does need content.The game kinda has a somewhat a lot of content online. You will need to grind a lot as well.After a lot of hours that went into online i can say that Red Dead Online is not that bad, is really great actually. You can really make money easy if you know how. To get gold is kinda a pain in the ass but is worth getting it for the roles and other items that have nothing to do with getting money or such, just for the cosmetic purpose. Online does have a story driven kinda gameplay that happens before the single player campaign. The game is really great if you have friends to grind with. More people the easy it is to get money and gold but mostly money. So after all that online is quite fun but it does need more content.

author: Risker
review: This is one of the best games I've ever played, hands down. I would say in my top 5. HOWEVER- I could not recommend buying for PC through Steam or any other PC game platform because, like some others have said, the Rockstar social club app is a forced install and is complete garbage. So this would effect other Rockstar games as well. When I installed this game it made me create a Social Club account and must launch when you try to run the game. I get an error when I launch the game that says "Code 17 Social Club failed to initialize". It then will force you to try to look at a solution and a browser will pop up in RDR2 for Rockstar. The solution will say something about GTA5 and the solution didn't work for me. I've read other possible solutions from other sources and nothing worked. I know my way around a computer and have figure out how to fix just about any issue I've ever had with games and could not figure this one out. But I shouldn't have to and I'm not going to waste my time. RDR2 is excellent but don't buy this because of Social Club and maybe buy for console insteadUPDATE: Against my better judgement, because I'm not a quitter and I must be a masochist and after getting a refund I REPURCHASED this game and tried again to get this game to work. Not sure which of that many new things I tried did the trick. Moving a file here or there and deleting this other file. I was happily playing for about four days and suddenly Social Club stopped working randomly saying it couldn't connect even though the Rockstar servers are not down. And now down I go into another rabbit hole of fixes to get this garbage app working with this new issue. It sucks because I only have so much time each day to play a game and I'm sitting here for hours troubleshooting Social Club on my own instead of actually playing. Who knows if I will ever get it working again but still can't recommend this game after all Social Club has put me through- it can't be worth it.

author: Marios
review: Ladies and gentlemen it is challenging to decide where to begin with,concerning this game.. The technical sector is outstanding and the graphics (on my rig at least) unfold the admirable world of the Wild West, which is.. hands down one of the most impressive i have ever seen, only compared with the world of GTAV (which happens to belong to Rockstar as well). Additionally all the landscapes you will see are a beauty and many times you'll just want to run with your horse around to enjoy the view! Moreover as far as the story is concerned, i couldn't help but develop a bond with certain characters. I don't think you can avoid getting absorbed by their adventures and you will definitely feel touched by certain events and situations! We are talking about a title which was made with pure craftsmanship, destined to maintain your interest till the very ending! When i reached the credits it was like ..i had to say goodbye to a dear friend!! There is no doubt in my mind it will be a long time before we witness a game that offers ..an incredible abundance of intense feelings like RDR2! Just go buy this unique masterpiece!!!!!!!!

author: BadKarma
review: BUYER BEWARE - ROCKSTAR SOCIAL CLUB WILL NOT LET ME PLAY THIS GAME AND IT MAY BLOCK YOU TOOIf you ever had an old Rockstar Social Club account you might not be able to play this game.  Please see my experience below:A number of years ago I purchased GTAV – this game required me to install Rockstar Social club to play it (even offline).  Now, years later, I purchased Red Dead and tried to run it and apparently this also requires Social Club.  However, the last time I used Social Club was with an email address I don’t have access to anymore (like I said it was years ago) and it won’t let me log in now.  As such, it won’t let me launch red dead (or presumably GTAV if I ever wanted to play that again).  I tried making a new Social Club account and Rockstar won’t let me associate it with my Steam account until I verify my old email address that I don’t have access to anymore.  I contacted tech support and provided them with screenshots of my receipt, Steam ID, CD keys for GTAV, and some other stuff they asked for and they actually wrote me back saying that the problem is unfixable!  Like no next steps, no we need to do something else – NOTHING – just a big screw you.  I was really looking forward to playing this game – I guess I won’t be able to play this or any other future Rockstar releases that use Social Club???  Stupid.  Anyway – figured I would share this to spare someone else the pain in case they also may have previously used social club and can’t access the email they previously used it with.

author: alexortiz
review: English and Spanish reviewReseña en ingles y españolI bought the game two days ago, I would like to tell you about the complicated process to make the game work, first my basic specifications- Core i7 7700 3.6 Ghz processor- Nvidia RTX 2060 6Gb- RAM 20 GB 2400 MhzI have the requirements to run the game well. Once I downloaded the game and the rockstar launcher, when running the game I started to get the problem that the game did not run directly getting the message to run the game safely but still did not run.I am a software engineer so I set out to find the causes of the errors and try to solve them, analyzing the launcher's log, where the game's events and errors are recorded, this file can usually be found in the following path 'C: \ Users \ USER-NAME \ Documents \ Rockstar Games \ Launcher \ launcher.txt ' I found some problems:.First error 0xc0000005, this error is associated with a blockage by another external program, normally the antivirus, so by deactivating the antivirus I was able to overcome this problem, I tried to run the game and received another error.Second error 0xc0000374, in programming this problem is associated with something called Heap Corruption, something that should not happen unless the game is badly programmed or there is a problem with the compilers or the hardware, in a few cases the hardware is responsible so I discarded this option, a bad programming also discarded because the game worked on other machines so I set out to see if it was compiler problems, in this case I noticed that the launcher uses Visual C ++ Redistributable 2015 and in its installation add this to the system, so I went to control panel> programs and uninstalled the versions of visual c ++ Redistributable 2015 and the rockstar launcher.Then download and install the c ++ version from the microsoft page,  and reinstall the rockstart launcher, with this I could access the game .Once there the game worked in multiplayer mode but not in campaign mode, when I tried to run the single player mode the game was loading indefinitely, seeing this I decided to use steam to analyze the integrity of the game, finding that I needed Downloading a corrupt 7.9 Gb file again, additionally proceeded to perform a clean installation of the video driver with the DDU program because the game performance was not as expected on multiplayer mode, once I finished these processes I could fully access the game.The game is great, but all these problems make my rating negative, it is not possible for the launcher to have such bad error management, they should minimally guide the user depending on the error he throws and not only leave it registered in a log file that most users will not know how to read and interpret.A lot of work ahead is left to rockstar with this game, hopefully improve in the future------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Compre el juego hace dos días, me gustaría comentarles el complicado proceso para hacer funcionar el juego, primero mis especificaciones básicas- Procesador core i7 7700 3.6 Ghz- Nvidia RTX 2060 6Gb- RAM 20 GB 2400 MhzTengo los requisitos para correr bien el juego. Una vez descargue el juego y el lanzador de rockstar al correr el juego empece a obtener el problema de que el juego no corría directamente obteniendo el mensaje de ejecutar el juego de forma segura pero aun así no ejecutaba.Soy un ingeniero de software asi que me propuse encontrar las causas de los errores y tratar de resolverlos, analizando el registro del lanzador, donde se registran los eventos y errores del juego, este archivo se puede encontar normalmente en la siguienete ruta 'C:\Users\USER-NAME\Documents\Rockstar Games\Launcher\launcher.txt'. Encontre varios problemas: Primer error 0xc0000005, este error es asociado a un bloqueo por otro programa externo, normalmente el antivirus, asi que desactivando el antivirus pude superar este problema, intente ejecutar el juego y recibi otro error.Segundo error 0xc0000374, en programacion este problema se asocia a algo llamado Heap Corruption, algo que no deberia ocurrir a menos que este el juego mal programado o que exista un problema con los compiladores o el hardware, en pocos casos el hardware es el responsable asi que descarte esta opcion, una mala programacion tambien la descarte debido a que el juego funcionaba en otras maquinas asi que me dispuse a ver si era problemas del compilador, en este caso note que el launcher utiliza Visual C++ Redistributable 2015  y en su instalacion agrega este al sistema, asi fui a panel de control > programas y desinstale las versiones de visual c++ Redistributable  2015 y el launcher de rockstar.Luego descargue e instale  la version de c++ desde la pagina de microsoft,  y reinstale el launcher de rockstart, con esto pude acceder al juego.Una vez alli el juego funcionaba en el modo multijugador pero no en el modo campaña, cuando intentaba ejecutar el modo de un solo jugador el juego se quedaba ejecutando de manera indefinida, viendo esto decidi utilizar steam para analizar la integridad del juego, encontrando que necesitaba descargar de nuevo un archivo corrupto de 7.9 Gb, adicionalmente procedi a realizar una instalacion limpia del driver de video con el programa DDU debido a que el rendimiento del juego no era el esperado, una vez termine estos procesos pude acceder completamente al juego.El juego esta genial, pero todos estos problemas hacen que mi calificacion sea negativa, no es posible que el launcher tenga tan mala gestion de los errores, minimamente deberian guiar al usuario dependiendo del error que este arroje y no solo dejarlo registrado en un archivo log que la mayoria de usuarios no sabra leer e interpretar.Mucho trabajo por delante le queda a rockstar con este juego, esperemos mejore a futuro

author: Phoenix
review: This game is an accomplishment of visuals and narrative, but the game design is more complicated. The story missions and open world content feel so vastly different its almost jarring. Exploration is absolutely wonderful and incredibly immersive, and I even got way more invested in hunting then I ever expected. Discovering new locations and stranger missions is always enjoyable, and the first time I stumbled upon  was genuinely jaw dropping. The attention to every minute detail, and the admittedly tedious at times animations, create a truly unmatched sense of realism. It may not be for everyone but the slow pace of everything is definitely for me. On the other hand the story missions are so on rails that after a while I just treated it more like TV show more than a game. I don't actually have a problem with this, sometimes its nice to just soak in the world and story without much effort. But the mission design is at best good and at worst boring and tedious. The ride - talk - shoot - ride loop becomes incredibly rote by the end that I was so tired of it, especially the amount of shooting gallery's. None of that really matters because god darn this game has one of the greatest narratives I have ever experienced. Arthur Morgan might just be my favorite character in all of fiction. When all of the open world systems are working together, it creates an opportunity for role-play more than any RPG I have ever played, I felt like I WAS Arthur. If the mission design matched the quality of the writing this would have the potential to be the greatest game ever created. My only real issue with the game, what I believe to be objectively bad, is the epilogue. Right after the grand crescendo of the story I spent over 90 hours with at that point comes to a dramatic end, the pacing takes a massive nose dive and never recovers. It isn't all bad, and still retains its quality in writing with genuinely great moments here and there. There was just so much bloat and pointless missions that didn't add anything to the story. So many drawn out shooting galleries, I was so bored most of the time. I would almost recommend you skip it but its worth playing for that one song. Lastly I'll touch briefly on the graphics. I don't think I have ever taken more screenshots while playing a game before. There are some aw-inspiring vistas, but the graphics can get extremely muddy at a distance. That may have just been my graphics settings so if you're like me and still making the best out of your 10 series card just keep that in mind. I cant believe this came out in 2018, and is easily the best looking open world game I have ever played, and it could have easily released this year. Overall I would give Red Dead 2 a 9/10.

author: ScratRedemption
review: TL;DR: RDR2 is legendary, the Rockstar Launcher is a garbage-tier POS. Avoid the steam version and go get it for console to work around the launcher. Let me begin by saying RDR2 is one of the best games I've ever played, and i'd rate it 10/10. It will go down as one of the best games ever made, but I cannot recommend the steam version because of two words: ROCKSTAR LAUNCHER. It's atrocious. I recieved an error message today saying I could not open the launcher because my social club installation was incorrect, which was odd considering I never mess with game files, so I go to try to redownload the social club and every link on Rockstar's support page leads me to the Launcher download link........something I don't need. Also, the only way to validate your social club information is by OPENING THE LAUNCHER and verifying there. See my issue? Looks like my experience of rdr2 concludes at 33 percent game completion, because the game will refuse to play if your launcher and social club crap isnt perfect, and if you're unlucky like me and get stuck in a catch 22, then you might as well get your money back and uninstall, because after 5 hours of trying to get it to work, i finally give up. I'd ask for a refund through steam but I know I wont be getting that 60 dollars back. I'd stay away from the steam version until the launcher is either completely removed or improved on. Absolutely rediculous.EDIT: I only managed to get the launcher working again after deleting the 120GB rdr2 and reinstalling it onto my computer. HOWEVER, now the launcher is saying it cannot create a sign in token, and it's been saying this for the past hour, so STILL waiting to play the game I PAYED FOR.EDIT 2: I managed to log in after enabling my vpn. Apparently, being region locked prevents the launcher and social club from updating properly. I an now able to play my games again. I will not be changing my recommendation, because it SHOULD NOT BE THIS MUCH OF A HASSLE TO PLAY A GAME I PAID FOR.EDIT 3: The launcher refuses to work without a vpn. It complains that I have no network connection when I obviously do. This single program is the only one on my computer that doesnt sense the internet connection, but for some ungodly reason, when I enable my vpn, it works like a charm. The launcher, in it's current state, WILL NOT WORK WITHOUT A VPN, SO IF YOU CAN'T FORK OVER MONEY TO GET ONE, DON'T BOTHER BUYING RDR2.EDIT 4: And now for the cherry on top of this dung cake: The launcher is working without a vpn now. So it had nothing to do with any of the internet crap apparently, and just decided to spontaneously grace me with it's single braincell functionality after I tore my hair out for hours trying yo get it to work. I'm not holding my breath, because if it F***s up this badly once, it will most likely do it again at some point. What a gigantic waste of my time for absolutely no reason.EDIT 5: And like Nostradamus himself, I predicted exactly what would happen. Not only is the launcher not working AGAIN, but now it won't work with ANYTHING. Vpn? Restart computer? Mess with DNS settings? Mess with the router? Mess with wifi settings? Delete and redownload? Nothing. It doesn't work with anything now. Keeps saying there isnt any internet connection WHEN THERE IS. I'm actually at a loss for words. I cannot describe how incompetent Rockstar is for releasing a launcher that doesn't even ♥♥♥ work half of the time. I will never buy another Rockstar product if this piece of malware launcher is connected with it, and I suggest that everyone here does the same. Dont bother going to the rockstar support. A piece of molding bread that's nailed to the wall will be of more help then they would be, and it'll have more brain power to boot. Save yourself the headache and play on console. If you dont have a console, then watch a lets play or something, because the pc version of any Rockstar title will be ruined by this idiotic launcher.

author: Edward Bear
review: This game is unplayable. Crashes consistently in the early missions preventing any story progress. But because I was silly enough to try for longer than 2 hours to get it to work, I can no longer return it. I can understand not wanting to refund games after people have already played it too much. But when you're selling a clearly defective product on your platform, you have to take some responsibility for that. This release reflects just as badly on Steam as it does on Rockstar.I feel like somebody owes me $60.EDIT:Just felt like I should update this. After much back and forth with Steam customer support, we've worked out an agreement that I'm happy with. 'Sall good. And it's just in time, too. I was starting to think radical thoughts like "video games are a waste of time anyway."

author: Old Man Gamer (OMG)
review: Red Dead Redemption 2 is the product of a well made interactive open world game. The main story is compelling in itself, but there are also a slew of well written and enjoyable side stories. The game can easily become the only game you play for months, without any regrets.For me, the first and foremost is the game play. The game plays well, has an open world feel that few games fully achieve, a weapon system that functions very well, and horse mechanics that will both frustrate and add enjoyable dynamics. Even when there are issues with graphics or physic simulated behaviors, the game delivers far more positively than those can retract. Typically my first and foremost is story. The story in this game is absolutely brilliant, along with the writing and voice acting. This is one of the few story style games that I could find myself enjoying, even with a bad story, however. Fortunately, the story is sacrificed, and worth the experience as well. There are liberties taken with the approach to what historically occurred, but overall, the researchers did their homework. There are a great many small details that would be easily overlooked, but are actually true. The developers also did not get so bogged down on the story, to forget to make the game for entertainment. From the writing to the voice acting to the animations, the personalities are well established with great characterization. There are also a great many life lessons within the game, such as the two competing brothers, which add to the realism and give insight to wisdom for those paying attention. The writing of the two convicts shows how far hatred typically went in the real world. There are a great many side stories that show many truths and offer pearls of wisdom, without making the game politicized or preachy. There is a great balance that gives realism and believe-ability to the impossible Author Morgan and his environment. The music is relaxing and fits the game well. There is not anything that stands out with the score, but their are quite a few songs within the game that are comical and enjoyable. The sound effects seem very meticulously and deliberately placed. This adds a great dimension to the game while fishing, hunting, robbing a home and so forth. This is something that I rarely see this well done in a video game. Ambient sounds are more present than just background noises. For example, if you hear a frog, there is quite possibly a frog right next to you, or a chatter of a raccoon, or growl of a cougar. In summation, Red Dead Redemption 2 is a must play for open world and story driven gamers, in my opinion. There are more positive aspects to share of this game. From the attention to detail of the audio, maintaining historical accuracies without turning it into a daunting social political agenda, to the realistic human interaction that has been lost in so many modern games (that makes you question if the developers ever had a healthy interaction with another human). The game is not without its flaws, but they are often more comical than frustrating. At the time of this review, I have only played the single player portion of this game.

author: Jack_Rabbit
review: Be me, spending money on a game I've already owned:>Me: "Hey Rockstar I loved playing Red Dead 2 on ps4 so I'm going to buy it on PC seeing as I no longer have my ps4">Rockstar: "Great stuff, we love money. Just remember you need our launcher to play the game.">Me: "Uhm... Okay sure no problem. I can live with that.">Launcher doesn't work and I can't play the game>Me: "Hey Rockstar, your launcher doesn't work can you help me?">Rockstar: "How about no, you've got the internet for that.">Me: "Uhm... I really love cowboys so why not.">30 Minutes to an hour of searching for a solution. But get it working.>Launcher now working but game doesn't>Me: "Hey Rockstar, I fixed the launcher now how do I fix the game.">Rockstar: "Oh we don't know but the internet will.">Me: "Uhm... Okay sure... For Arthur...">After 30 more minutes, find a solution.>Game launches in all its glory. Excitement builds>Check Red Dead Online. Ps4 file there, but not usable>Me: "Hey Rockstar, can I maybe get my file that I spent real world currency on and a couple hundred hours in?">Rockstar: "Sure, if you don't mind paying the migration fee.">Me: "The what now?">Rockstar: "Yeah, we know you love our product so much that you bought it a second time. We know that you loved our product to spend real world money on it, so what's a small migration fee really?">Me: "Yeah I don't think so... That seems a little unfair to me.">Rockstar: "Yeah sorry pal, then I can't help you.">Me: "Well then I guess I'm refunding your product.">Rockstar: "Sure you do what you think is best pal."10/10 Best troll experience from Rockstar ever.

author: "TROJAN
review: Arabicتعود لنا روكستار بتحفة فنية بصرية رائعة , موسيقى تشدك بأجواء اللعبة من البداية وحتى النهاية (خصوصاً النهاية ), وجرافيكس اقل ما يقال عنه إنه بديع, والأداء الصوتي اللي كان له قدرة مذهلة على نقلك لحقبة الغرب القديم مع عالم اللعبة طبعا اللي كان واسع ومكتظ بالأحداث البسيطة والجوهرية اللي جعلت العالم أكثر جمالية كما عودتنا عليه روكستار, والشيء اللي عودتنا عليه أيضا هو طور الأونلاين الخايس ومشاكل السيرفرات اللي تطلعك من أجواء اللعبة والحماس.  طور القصه عباره عن فيلم سينمائي أنت فيه مجرد مشاهد لا لاعب, بالنسبة لي هذا الشيء مقبول لأنهم أخذوا منك القصة وأعطوك ما تبقى منها عبر (نظام الشرف) وكيف يمكن إنه يغيير أحداث بسيطة جدا من القصة. أحداث القصة وقعت قبل الجزء الأول ومن الممكن إنك تتنبأ ببعض الأحداث اللي راح تمر عليك. مع ذكر القصه كان لازم أذكر أفضل شخصية قدمتها روكستار لنا وهي شخصية آرثر مورقن العظيمة وصراعه مع . عجبني التنقل السريع وكيف أنه موزون وما هو متواجد في كل ممر, أقدر أقول عنه السهل الممتنع وعجبني التنقل السينمائي ووجوده كخيار للي ما يبي يوصل بسرعة وبمجرد ضغطة زر. رغم كل الإيجابيات كان من الممكن إنها تكون أفضل لعبة في السنة (سنة صدورها) إلا أن رتم اللعبة البطيء والمهمات الخطية والأنميشن الزايد عن اللزوم هو اللي قتلها وجعل الكثير ينفر منها. للي ما تهمه القصه أنصحه يبتعد عن  المهمات الرئيسية لأن الأغلب منها عبارة عن سرقة أو قتل أو انقاذ بطابع سينمائي ومشوار طويل وحديث بين شخصين عن القصة (اللي المفروض انها تهمك). أرجع لطور الأونلاين وكيف يمكن تكون التجربة ممتازة اذا مشت كما مخطط لها لكن الانتظار وقت طويل حتى تلعب أحد الأطوار اللي ما يتجاوز وقت اللعب فيها بالكثير خمس دقائق. المشكلة ما توقف هنا, الأونلاين مليان هاكات ومن النوع القذر جدا اللي مشغل قود مود والا يجبر شخصيتك انها ما تتحرك, لكن وقت ما يجتمع الأصدقاء تتلاشى كل العيوبThere isn’t much more I can say about this game that has not been said before, amazingly well-written story. Fantastic graphics, great songs. Online experience: “You have been disconnected from Red Dead Online due to a fault on Rockstar game services. (Error: 0x20010006).”As if rockstar want to say “That's the way it is”

author: Romelov Lukakuvic
review: It's a shame to see that my favorite game has been one of the worst PC game releases of 2019. This game had such great potential to be one of the best titles on PC for Rockstar, but they decided to take the easy way and release it too early. This game is filled with bugs and optimization issues that ruin the whole experience of what a Rockstar game should be. It's a joke. I used to think Rockstar was an amazing company, but after this, I will never spend a dime on any of their future releases or anything that is Rockstar affiliated.

author: MaitieS
review: In my review I will focus on Single Player because I didn't play Multiplayer. I finished my game on 93% +/- which took me more than 200-250 hrs. (played on Rockstart launcher)I think that RDR2 story is the most epic story I ever played. I really enjoyed most of the missions. I didn't even feel like there were some kind of filler missions which didn't have any impact on the main story or character development.I really like how they were able to create such unique gang characters. I played a lot of games in my life but I never cared that much about other "main" characters in the game until I played RDR2. This game really made me care for other characters. Every single character felt unique and through the story you learned even more about these characters.Amazing combat. Shooting is really feels real. Reloading etc. is realistically correct which is amazing. Dead Eye ability is really neat and with options to upgrade it with talismans etc. Melee combat is also good.Wow. I must say that RDR2 is my the most favorite open world game I played in A REALLY LONG TIME. I don't even remember the last time I just went to the woods and enjoy the world by hunting or just chilling. RDR2 really nailed the world.Horse physic is really great and on spot. I like that there are different types of horses and bond system is really cool as well.Map is HUGE and BEAUTIFUL! I never used fast travel in my whole  play through. Every time my ride felt unique with so many random events. Even in the very end of the game I still experienced NEW random events. Did I mention that you can hunt in the game? And that animals are very real? I spent a lot of hrs. by just hunting. Yes, it's true that RDR2 has a really bad performance but sadly it's mainly because of Rockstar Launcher and too strong protection but otherwise game is really beautiful. You have a tons of settings you can change. Overall quality of textures looks really good. RDR2 is one of my most favorite games I ever played. Story was amazing. Arthur Morgan is the most realistic in-game character I ever played as. Thanks a lot Rockstar for creating this masterpiece. Even if you heard that Multiplayer is bad, you should really try it at least for Single Player because it's really worthy.- Arthur Morgan(Product is not refunded, I own it on Steam as well, it's just a bug)

author: HAYUL
review: "I played a beautiful game with a wonderful story, memorable soundtracks, realistic visuals, atmospheric huge open world and full of attractive experiences!" they would not be able to get any idea of that game at all. You would have to say to them: "I played a game that metascore 93 (PS/XB 97)." Then they would exclaim: "Oh, what a fantastic game that is!"...Anyway,Words can't even describe enough how wonderful this is. But numbers can.10/10"스토리 멋지고, 배경음악도 끝내주고, 그래픽도 좋고, 분위기 있는 오픈월드에 매력적인 경험으로 가득한 게임을 했어요!"라고 말하면 그들은 그 게임이 어떤 게임인지 상상하지 못해. 그들에게는 "메타 93짜리 게임을 했어요."라고 말해야 한단다. 그러면 "와! 갓겜!" 하고 소리를 지를 거야.

author: h8koN-
review: Late to the party again, however I would like to chime in on Red Dead Redemption 2, despite the plethora of good reviews already. This game is art. This game is a masterpiece. In every single conceivable way. I'm currently on my second playthrough - first I played on the XBOX - and enjoying it just as much. My favourite thing about RDD2 is that you can shape your own path and how you want to play... First time around I decided to play honourably, I helped out strangers, I spared those whom I could spare, etc. This time around however I play dishonourably, I'm a menace, I kill whoever I can, I rob, I loot,  I exploit, basically everything bad, I do; and I'm having one hell of a time doing it. Performance wise this game runs excellently on my RTX 3060 and i5-11400 CPU on ultra settings - so no complaints from me there either.

author: Gedget
review: I got around to finishing the game I will say the story is amazing. It made me enjoy watching the group at the beginning and see how happy they are and how the interact..and then it slowly falls as story progresses. Now we have Dutch shouting at Arthur's ear going, "ONE MOAR SCORE!" and "WE NEEED DEH MONIAH"My god Dutch how far you fallen down by having that stinkin' earwig weasel its way into your ear and lay lies.Now I will say the game has a bit of issues as for me and that was game crashes. I would just randomly have my game just crash out of nowhere. I did notice a lot of mixed reviews and I understand where they are coming from but putting them aside I can say that the game is fully worth purchasing as it has the most interesting story progression so far for me. It got me hooked since I started playing and I couldn't put it down.10/10

author: Abocs
review: Don't buy this game.This is why:After loging in for a third time the game decided to not let me play at all cause and i quote:"Verifying game ownership failed and your offline activation data could not be loaded when launching Red Dead Redemption 2 on PC"To fix that problem yo have to:1. Start the Rockstar Games Launcher2. Select Settings3. Select Account Information4. Select Delete Local ProfileSource: rockStar Tech Support websiteBut! There is a catch!Try to log in? Nope... Social Club Error Code: 3000.108Again tech support:1. Go to the search box on the taskbar2. Enter in Command prompt3. Right-click Command prompt4. Click Run as administrator5. Click Yes6. Enter in the following commands in the order listed below:7. netsh winsock reset8. netsh int ip reset9. ipconfig /release10. ipconfig /renew11. ipconfig /flushdns12. Restart your PC13. Check to see if the issue is resolvedResults... It's not being solved...So. I didnt buy the game to play tech support... I bought the game to play it.Stay away from this Developer like the plague, and those  who managed to play it. Congratz!

author: itwillsit
review: WARNING: steam automatically assigns the game to an EA/Rockstar account without asking you.I created an account using an  email address because I didn't want to give my PII to EA.Rockstar banned my email address.Now I can't log into Rockstar to play the game, and I can't open a ticket with them to fix the issue, because the account's email uses a domain they blacklisted.Again, Steam automatically assigned the game to an account with a blacklisted email. There is no way to change the account.I've opened more than 5 tickets with Steam to resolve this issue, and they close the tickets. Apparently, the launcher was open for 20 hours, and they see this as "playtime". That's ridiculous, because I was never able to log in.I'm going to have to sue them to get my money back. I highly recommend NOT buying this game through Steam. Their customer support is horrible, bordering on criminal. If others have experienced this issue, please message me. I want to start a class action lawsuit. I'm also filing complaints with the BBB, State Attorneys General Office, and the CFPB.

author: bobatron
review: I am a 54 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him in the online mode. loaded into the game, made my character  and started playing but I was stuck on what you were supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he helped me. Loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and I cant wait to make future memories with my son.Thank you <3

author: medeni57
review: Rarely posting reviews but this one i just have to.Single player is amazing and i don't have any issues with it, as always the story mode in R* games, every little detail 10/10 really.What i have problem with is online part of the game..It just feels frustrating, the error messages, camp disappearing and not being able to set it up again if you don't try couple of more times or change session but when you try to change session like half of the time you need to restart the game because it doesn't load at all. Also moonshine shack sometimes is buggy and you can't get in and i got moonshiner like couple of days ago and already had to switch sessions because of that bug at least 3-4 times.That are few examples i had problems with and still have.I did all the port forwarding, tried playing with net cable connected and still getting error messages.Other aspects of online well its good if your connection is stable enough for you to be able to actually enjoy it.It is grindy and don't expect to get rich instantly (if you don't want to spend money on gold), but that's the fun part of the game.So yea, if you want amazing single player story def recommended, if you want online aspect of the game well, pray to god your internet is stable otherwise its going to be a very annoying experience most of the time.

Ask for a full price, even though the game is on sale and heavily discounted on other platforms6. Put it on sale after 1 week7. Profit!

author: svodnik
review: Shame on Rockstar games. Yet another launcher that ruins a game. I've fought to get this game running and finally gave up in frustration. Why the heavy-handed push in recent years for "always online" games or games with additional launchers, accounts, etc?I don't WANT to have to play online, and don't care about multiplayer features. If a game is explicitly a multiplayer online game, that's one thing. However, I only buy single player games. If a game has an online OPTION as a bonus, that's fine, but I'm only interested in the single player adventure mode of the game.Origin launcher, Ubisoft's launcher, Rockstar's launcher, along with the Rockstar's additional social share account. Ugh. Horrible. Cut it out guys. I won't be buying games from these publishers again till they ease off the ham handed push for always/only online.How about this? Woo me. Seduce me. Don't put your (figurative) hand down my pants and try to take it. Give me the option, and a reason to want it. What about people with bad internet, no internet, or limited data plans?Anyway, rant over. No, I do not recommend this game.

author: |VIP-S| Agr
review: RDR2 is a near masterpiece of a story driven game, and RDO is a deeply flawed but enjoyable experience.There are a lot of complaints I could make, mostly about the online mode, but I've played over 1000 hours and anything too harsh would ring hollow.There are a few things you still need to know, and the short version is this:Both Red Dead Online and GTA Online have a huge problem with hackers. If you find yourself in a server with one in RDO, they can siphon away your character's money, they can teleport you into the sky, they can blow you up repeatedly, they can trap you in cages, they can fly, they can set you on fire, and I could go on.In addition, the Online community just got over a 7 month content drought, and many of us had given up on receiving any more updates. The update happened right when the community was reaching a point of mass protest, and it turns out that Rockstar has plans for at least one more update around Halloween.The game is worth its price tag for the single player alone, and I've personally clocked much more time online than I have in the Story mode. Even with all its warts, Red Dead Online is a lot of fun. Just know what you're getting into.

author: ph!l
review: By far the best game I have ever played, nothing has even come close. The attention to detail is ridiculous.This review is based on the full story game, not the online only version.Online has always been a bit of a mess...

author: Acidmeadow
review: I'll change my review when all of these problems change.Never was good at this so I'm going to keep it brief and blunt.No ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ here, I've spent the first two hours of my time with this game trying to get it to actually work, which almost completely nullified my ability to refund this stuff because of how many times I'd try to launch it with every possible configuration under the sun. Imagine having bought the Ultimate Edition like a gullible idiot (hi that's me) because you're excited to support a port of a really good game, and by extension other projects an otherwise great developer is working on.Absolutely not. Not right now.It's clearly poorly optimized, it's clearly very buggy, it's clearly just not ready for Steam.Which brings me to my next part. What the hell is the point of making us wait for a Steam release if we still have to use the Godawful, troublesome, completely unnecessary Rockstar Games Launcher to begin with exactly? What's the point of it? Completely back asswards, if you ask me. Superfluous as ♥♥♥♥. The ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ launcher doesn't even recognize that yes, I've already bought the game and yes, it is clearly installed on my system. And the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ launcher in question is telling me I still need to buy the game. ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. It's just totally pointless.I've done everything from running Steam as an administrator when before I never had to, to upgrading my BIOS, to upgrading my OS even, to upgrading a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ l i t a n y of drivers, to unplugging my controller when I first boot up the game, to sitting through a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ clickable chorus of "Red Dead Redemption 2 has exited unexpectedly," to furrowing my brow at "The Rockstar Games Launcher is already running," gritting my teeth at Steam still thinking RDR2 is running after it has clearly long since crashed out thus pushing my playtime further closer to the two hour mark of no return when it comes to Steam's refund process, ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ around with the .xml file for the settings to even make it run smooth when I finally do get the game running only to be met with getting kicked in the face with ERR_GFX_STATE.So after every fix imaginable, every tweak, every last thing I can think of, I turn to Rockstar Support.Also a pretty horrible experience. Expect the recipient of your support ticket to rummage through the entire Amateur IT and Comp Sci Starter Pack with such classic hits as "have you tried restarting your computer?" and "obvious things you've already tried by Googling them five hours ago." Fat lot of help that was.So by now you're probably wondering hey where's the review of the actual game.You see, I'd be able to tell you if I were actually able to play it beyond a few minutes at a time.It has taken me up to my current playtime (that's 5.1 f u c k i n g hours of crashing, restarting, and all other manner of crazy things) to get . By the time another element of gameplay meets me, I'm crashing out again and either am having to reload a save that's far away from that particular point or auto-save has bailed my ass out.So it's hard to actually talk about the gameplay and story and all that.But I'll leave you with this. What I've actually been able to experience has been .The gun play is satisfying, the music score is fantastic (even heard a rendition of Leo Delibes at the first camp, that's just tasteful), the characters all seem very interesting and the environments are gorgeous and .So when the game runs, you're treated to a great experience. When it runs, it runs .But when it SUCKS, it .Don't buy this title until Rockstar bothers to iron out the kinks, and there are a metric ton of them so a lot of work still needs to be done. There's a lot of crashing, there are a lot of errors and pop-ups and launcher problems that still persist, and this launch (while financially successful) seems to echo a lot of the sentiment here in this review.That actually getting it to run is a total slog fest. It's just miserable.But when this all blows over and they DO get this thing off the ground in a smoother way, absolutely.

author: ScTiger
review: The game itself is great and I'm enjoying it alot, but the Rockstar Launcher makes me feel incredibly cynical and cold every time I'm reminded of its existence. I miss games you could just start up and not see what feels like pop up ads for the new DLC for the monetized online mode. This game takes over 3 minutes just to load into the singleplayer even though it's installed on my SSD because it has to authenticate with Rockstar Online Services and do some cloud sync stuff that's really buggy and takes forever. I miss when games were just games. It's a shame such a beautiful game made by a team of passionate and talented devs can't just live out its existence unblemished by greedy fingerprints. I will continue to play the game with massive respect for the developers and the gorgeous world they've created, but every time I open this game, I wish I was playing a pirated version instead, and it has nothing to with the cost of the game. I can only hope the Rockstar Social Club goes the way of the Bethesda Launcher in the near future.

author: approximate sphere
review: Red Dead Redemption 2 is hands down, one of the most beautiful and gripping games to come out of Rockstar. I have not played Read Dead 1, but that was no detriment to the story, in my mind it almost enhanced it, as I couldn't fully predict how the story would twist, turn and eventually end. A slightly dodgy port is eclipsed by the masterful story telling and cinematic missions that far outshines GTA V, another Rockstar game in recent memory. Online mode is a stinking pile of garbage, not surprising honestly, but story mode has more than enough to justify a purchase at AAA price for a gold standard of a game.

author: DisableBore
review: Two years late to the party but still glad I got around this one.While Manhunt will still be my guilty pleasure, RDR2 is probably a top favorite from Rockstar Games.RDR2 tells the downfall the infamous Van der Linde gang before the first game, from the perspective of Arthur Morgan, the top gunman. His entire arc is the things of beauty, and to say doubting I’d like him as much as John was foolish of me. He is a character full of likable traits who can stand proudly among my favorites. Robert Clarke deserved every single praise he received alongside the rest of the cast, with especially Benjamin Davis stealing every single scene he shows up.Now, RDR was almost entirely a love letter to the Italian Western, with mostly deserted and dry locations-and people. However 2 goes beyond to cover more classic takes too. If you have enjoyed any of the tales of the western genre, you will absolutely be satisfied in some way. From small to large heists, insane shoot outs in towns and bar fights, mountains to deserts, forests to dirty swamps, every single activity in the savage times you could like from the West is here. The soft harmonic guitars, gospel chanting, gorgeous visuals and beautiful vistas just deserve that you to take your time and enjoy a slow horseback ride.Everything you do in the world comes to bite your bottom eventually. Being a carcass to people will not result in kindness, the lawmen are ruthless to hunt you down, meanwhile bounty hunters and rival gangs seek to ambush you at any turn. Exploring the environment, paying attention to the surroundings, and finding side missions and quests always benefits you, from some good looting, rare materials to sell or craft, maybe simply amusing characters that go about their antics. The hours I spent just taking a break to go about my leisure is probably half my playtime. Hunting alone is a good example of how much you can go by, hunt to eat in a makeshift camp, donate to the gang, sell for profit, use to craft. There is almost nothing you do that can be considered a waste, and letting loose to invest yourself in the people (and especially your trusted horse) will always be worth it.I'll be straightforward, however: This is a slow game. So slow, that I wouldn't blame you for getting tired of it by the first hours. In game play terms, we have a similar mannerism to Max Payne 3, the shooting mechanics being deliciously brutal, and combat as a whole feels impactful, as it should. You must keep your body well with some light rpg style mechanics and the game will not be afraid to pull a rabbit with a gun if you do not watch your back. Being able to gunfight in first person is a neat addition, not too good for the rest.As a whole, I cant deny I am biased for adoring the genre this game pays so much homage and respect to- but in it's own it's a fantastic story of it's own that does everything to immerse you in.If you liked Clint Eastwood or John Wayne's movies (if you don't please get out of my sight and leave your testicles by the door), you enjoy a slower approach to open world, and can put up mildly annoying design choices for sake of a plot, I can absolutely recommend RDR2 even at full price, and on sale it's damn worth the price.

author: ℣ĭŉćعŉ†_℣éǥẵ
review: Red Dead Redemption 2 stands shoulder-to-shoulder with Grand Theft Auto V as one of the greatest games of the modern age. It’s a gorgeous depiction of an ugly period that’s patient, polished, and a huge amount of fun to play, and it’s combined with Rockstar’s best storytelling to date. This is a game of rare quality; a meticulously polished open world ode to the outlaw era. Looking for one of this generation’s very best single player action experiences? Here’s your huckleberry.

author: A Harmless Cat
review: Red Dead Redemption 2 is an action-adventure game following the end of the 19th century, the end of the Wild West. The prequel follows the story of Dutch van der Linde's gang of outlaws, fiercely fighting to escape the inevitable faith in store for them, the new "modern" world. The second game presents us with a brand new protagonist, Arthur Morgan. Just like the original's protagonist John Marston, he is also an outlaw - Dutch van der Linde's most trusted associate. Honorable at heart, but at the same time stuck on a crossroad between what's right and what he believes is right. Taken on a massive rollercoaster ride through the ~50h campaign, our main protagonist evolves so much when his world views get taken apart.+ A massive open-world that feels like a living and breathing creature, filled with breathtaking views. From the gorgeous snowy mountains to the giant muddy streets of Saint Denis, all the way back west to the deserted town of Armadillo. The world "talks" and responds to you and your actions.+ The most detailed animal wildlife featured in any video game so far. Incredibly extensive list of different animal species that act just like they would in real life.+ Technologically astounding weather system, most probably the best weather system of any video game so far as well. You will "feel" when it's hot outside or when a massive storm approaches.+ Rich AI behaviour for all NPCs, they remember the player's actions! Whether he robs a store or helps someone in need, everything reflects on those around him. They also have daily routines - eating, sleeping, doing some work, etc. Rockstar nailed this part here compared to GTA V.+ Incredible story, full of twists and turns, pinnacle of what video games have to offer. Rockstar made us care so much for some characters on our screens. Thanks to incredibly mature writing and the phenomenal delivery of the actors who portrayed them, those characters feel so alive and real. As if they are right in front of us. The protagonist is the main focus, but the side cast in this game is also staggering and adds so much to the whole experience.+ Huge emphasis on realism in this game, even more than GTA IV or even the original RDR. The stamina, health, and deadeye cores drain over time, there is a need to eat and sleep in the game to replenish them. They drain quicker if the player is poisoned or has a sickness. Weapons also have to be picked up from the horse, we can't carry all of them on our back like in GTA. This is not to everyone's liking, but it's important to note that this game is artistic, and art is often not appreciated by all.+ Incredible cast of actors that poured their heart and soul into these characters, possibly the best ensemble in any video game.+ Great and extensive customization options - Arthur's hair and beard grow over time. There are loads of different clothing, beard and hairstyle options. Same applies to weapon and horse customization.+ Astonishing soundtrack that deserves to be heard at least once, by everyone. Absolutely vital part of the whole experience this game presents.I am almost at loss, but there are minor things that could have been better in this overall masterpiece.- A lot of emphasis on animal hunting and plant collecting. This applies to people who want to 100% the game, of course. If you plan to start this journey be warned, you are bound to get fed up by the amount of hunting and picking you have to do.- Gambler Challenge 8 (Soul Draining!!)- The missions are a lot slower and "calm" compared to GTA V, for example. This is necessary, as it goes hand in hand with the heavy narrative-driven experience. I am absolutely fine with this and can appreciate the decision. You need to be aware, however, if you are primarily a GTA fan or don't have patience to take this game slow, like it should be taken.- Not exactly a negative, but I will put it here anyway. The game requires QUITE a powerful computer in order to run smoothly on high settings.Red Dead Redemption 2 is true art. If the original was a masterpiece among video games, this one is a masterpiece in all of entertainment. Elegantly and masterfully crafted, even after 4 years, this is the best example of games being on par with movies and books. Featuring one of the vastest and most detailed open-worlds, arguably the best story in video game history and the most detailed wildlife in gaming. All this brought to life by an astonishing cast of talented actors makes RDR 2 a concrete !  Game of the decade and one of the best pieces of entertainment of all time. Thank you for reading this lengthy review. A small point to mention is that the score and everything mentioned concerns only RDR 2 and not its Online mode. I know how poorly Rockstar treated the online for this game, but I've never really cared for it so it does not bother me personally.For anyone interested in doing 100%, I have a great guide you can follow, which features optimal strategies and routes!

author: isapicobella
review: Red Dead Redemption 2 is my favorite game of all time and an absolute MUST play if you're into immersive and realistic gameplay mechanics, like to sit back and unwind, and are looking for something to invest hundreds of hours in while never truly running out of things to do and ways to entertain yourself. The world of RDR2 is enormous, and as someone who is very picky and values rewarding and intriguing exploration that does not hold your hand I can wholeheartedly confirm this game  it. All of this is accompanied by a fantastic protagonist and moving story which continues to blow me away with every playthrough. The acting, storytelling and character development is top-notch.While no game is perfect, and Red Dead Redemption 2 being no exception, I still have very little to complain about. However, the in-game bounty system would be my biggest issue. It's often illogical, unpredictable and annoyingly punishing. You'll have to keep up with it and adjust yourself, as the system itself makes little sense. My second complaint would be the tracking down and hunting of Legendary Animals. There is zero challenge involved, unlike the tracking down and hunting of regular animals in the game, and will get stale quickly. Lastly, with a game this big, you are bound to run into bugs and glitches sooner or later. I have dealt with my fair share of annoyances over the course of 3 playthroughs and while I've been lucky to not run into anything game breaking there have definitely been plenty of frustrating moments that required me to reload an earlier savegame more than once. I recommend saving regularly, preferably after every mission­—just in case.Moving on to the PC port of this game, the 3 playthroughs I mentioned were completed on console. I am currently in the middle of my 4th playthrough, but first PC playthrough. I was skeptical about how the game would perform with the numerous complaints going around but the game, to my surprise, has been running well so far and performance seems to be exactly as it should be with my hardware. I have experienced a couple of crashes only when booting up the game after having changed settings or when changing settings on the in-game title screen. The game, at least on my end, seems to be sensitive to that. Once it loads into Story Mode, however, all is well and I haven't run into any issues thus far.There has only been one limiting factor regarding my setup which I'd like to mention briefly for anyone in the same situation and that is my GPU's small amount of VRAM. As the owner of a GTX 1060 3GB, Ultra texture quality in this game is out of the question during regular gameplay as that can take up 4 to 6 GBs of VRAM. I use Vulkan, which is more VRAM hungry than DX12 but also performs twice as well as DX12 so I stick with it. As a result, however, I'm experiencing frequent and at times severe pop-in of textures in big cities, small towns and even out in the wilderness with Texture quality set to High. I'm talking about entire buildings, mountains and roads popping in. Switching to DX12 eliminates the issue, but the drop in performance is even worse. I have experimented with dropping down textures further to Medium quality on Vulkan and while doing so significantly lessens the pop-in, it's  not fully eliminated.Unfortunately, the downgrade from Ultra textures to anything below that has a  impact on the overall look of the game. High texture quality is jarring, and Medium simply looks awful. It  makes me favor the console version of the game in terms of graphics despite having the majority of my other settings set to High, which far exceeds what you'll see on any current gen console. It's still not enough to make up for it, in my opinion.In conclusion? I do not recommend the PC version of the game if you've got less than 4GB of VRAM, at the very ,  especially if you've already played through the game once. Anything below Ultra texture quality will not look good, regardless of the rest of your settings.

author: ApexCity
review: I wanted to write a review just saying "ERR_GFX_STATE" but I decided to try and be more helpful to prospective buyers instead of making other frustrated owners like myself get a laugh from it.Unfortunately a very old bug in the game has been back since the naturalist update. (around 3 months before this review)Keep in mind before you read that this is a 80 ish hour singleplayer experience.The bug I am referencing is one that will crash the game in a seemingly random amount of time, could be 5 minutes or maybe an hour and a half  when you are lucky. I have experienced the issue on 2 different PC's. One bone stock laptop and 2 fresh installs on a high end custom build. Pretty soon I'm sure it will happen on a new build and will update when I put it together. I am running top percentile hardware specs on my main and maintain my systems meticulously. If you check the steam forums or reddit and sort by recent with a search for crash you will see that the exact same issue is affecting a large amount of people. I am very experienced with troubleshooting anything PC related, I have not been able to fix it even after spending a ridiculous amount of time trying literally 2 dozen or so fixes in multiple combinations. I would say that about 90% of the time I am able to fix a bugged game or put a bandaid on it with a significantly lower amount of time spent troubleshooting.Hours instead of days. Rockstar knows about this issue and fixed it before. They even have a special launch parameter that helped mitigate the issue back when it first popped up. I really hope they will fix it again but its been almost 3 months and I'm sure they are getting a large amount of support tickets regarding this error. Rockstar, you have done such an amazing job on this game and I would like to be able to reccommend it to my friends switching to PC from consoles this year. For those of us that already own it, please don't become  developer. Your number one priority is profit right which is fine, I can tell you that if you become  developer you will lose good will along with some of that profit you love next time you release a game on PC. I would say you made me waste more of my time writing this negative review, but if I help even one person then im fine with it.I will also update the review if and when its fixed and show people instead why its in my top 5.

author: Nisverah
review: Rockstar is showing off their greed yet again with the latest update, nerfing gold gains while most content is locked behind multiple gold paywalls.The current Outlaw Pass (battle pass) even requires you to fork over gold to unlock actual gameplay advantages and QoL improvements that are locked to an exclusive timed pass. If you can't grind the 40 gold to unlock it (which from stranger missions you can at best farm a little over 1 gold per hour doing) within the first week, then you will only get 30 gold back instead of the full 40.If you can't buy the pass at all within the time the pass is up, then you lose the ability to cook multiple food at once, fast travelling from your wilderness camp, and increased ammo storage capacity. Just a little extra here is my calculations for how much gold I could make from stranger missions (since I was greedy for the exclusive halloween event I spent my 15 gold I earned from the start on that and don't have any of the roles that cost 15 gold unlocked)-To maximize gold gains, every 3 minutes in the mission the gold you earn goes up by .08, optimally stopping at 12 minutes for .32 (after 12 minutes it goes up by .04)-suppose you can complete a mission for the .32 gold every 15 minutes (3 minutes of downtime for easier numbers, 4 minutes is more realistic)-then you can get .32 gold 4 times an hour, for 1.28 gold/h-to get 40 gold for the pass is 31 hours and 15 minutes of nonstop grind(I believe bounty hunting is the same numbers for gold, except maybe the downtime will be lower between missions)Each roll costs 15 gold (bounty hunter now technically 25 since they lowered base price to 10 and the extended license is 15) The pass costs 40Bounty hunter, Naturalist, Trader Collector, and the Outlaw Pass is 100 goldSo if you go 31.25 hours/40 gold = 78%, then 78% * 100 gold = 78 hours of grind to unlock it all.Or you can spend $40 on 2 of the $20 gold packs for 55 gold bars each to unlock all the current online$9.99   25   gold$19.99 55   gold$49.99 150 gold

author: G00N3R
review: Red Dead Redemption 2 is an open world game set in the late 1800’s, where player character Arthur Morgan and a gang of outlaws are on the run after a botched robbery.RDR2 originally released 5 years ago so I’m sure most players are already familiar with the game, but maybe this review will still be useful as a comparison to newer games. This was the first RDR game I’ve played (and I’ve never played GTA so I think this is also my first Rockstar game).•	You can switch between first person and third person perspective whenever you want. First person helps with aiming guns and is very immersive while wandering around towns and talking to NPCs, whereas third person provides a better view of the environment while horse riding.•	The open world features a stunning environment to explore, with small towns and a big city full of people, surrounded by fields, trees, rivers and snowy mountains populated by lots of varied wildlife including deer, birds, rabbits, horses, bears, wolves, alligators and more.•	Side quests have their own mini-stories. There’s not many examples of the repetitive copy/pasted mission types that you usually find in open world games. Even bounty hunting missions where you can capture or kill outlaws and bring them back to a town sheriff for a reward, have some unique dialogue.•	As you’re riding around the map you’ll encounter other people who might ask for your help. Maybe their horse died and they need a ride back to town, or they’ve suffered a serious injury and need to be taken to a doctor, while other people are being attacked by dangerous animals. However, sometimes a cry for help will be luring you into an ambush.•	Story has great writing, high quality cinematic cutscenes, and excellent voice acting.•	Sometimes stories about criminals can make us root for them on some level, depending on the nature of their crimes. I didn’t feel that way about Arthur Morgan and his gang. I didn’t agree with most of their actions and I didn’t like most of the important characters. However, the second half of the story clearly showed the negative side of that lifestyle, which at least made the story interesting.•	The lengthy epilogue, which is focused on a couple of characters that I actually did like, has a much more positive tone, and was by far my favourite part of the story.•	Graphics still look fantastic compared to newer games. I had no problems with framerate, bugs or crashes.•	There’s lots of content. It took me 62 hours to complete the main story and most side quests.•	The weapon loadout system drives me crazy, and often made the combat less enjoyable than it could have been. You have 2 slots for pistols and 2 slots for rifles, shotguns, or a bow, however the game constantly unequips weapons from those last 2 slots, forcing you to re-equip them from your horse. I’m not sure exactly how it works, it seems to happen after cutscenes or when you return to camp, but I lost count of the number of times I was in the middle of a story mission and I suddenly realised all I’ve got is my pistols. And of course by that point I couldn’t return to my horse without restarting the mission.•	Sometimes even when I’d remembered to check my loadout, the game decided to change it anyway because I guess you’re supposed to use specific weapons for some missions. On more than one occasion I had to fight several enemies at long range, but the game took away my sniper rifle that I’d bought for exactly this purpose, forcing me to use a crappy lever action rifle with no zoom scope instead.Red Dead Redemption 2 isn’t quite the masterpiece that its hyped up to be, but its still very good and I recommend playing it for the fantastic open world and cinematic story.

author: iRhuel
review: This review is specifically for the online component, there are plenty of reviews for the SP portion of the game.TL;DR - Red Dead Online is a tragic tale of a game that COULD have been great, but has been incrementally ruined on almost every level by a development strategy that prioritizes one and only one thing: getting players to spend more real world money. It's seen in every aspect of the game, and means it's generally not worth investing the time in to get to the worthwhile parts.---The game has several core problems, outlined below, but know that the game has 2 currencies - $RDO (ingame currency) and Gold (RMT currency, earnable ingame as well). Almost everything can be purchased with Gold, and some things can ONLY be purchased with Gold.Especially for new players. The only money making tool available to new players are daily challenges (which force you to do things you may or may not actually enjoy, like fishing, pvp, racing, photography, hunting, or visiting a random location with no other value), and stranger missions which generally involve going from A to B while fending off NPCs.All other moneymaking methods worth considering (bounty hunting, trading, moonshining, and rare item collecting) are locked behind Gold purchases.Almost all of the major moneymaking methods are time gatedAlmost every type of mission has some arbitrary time limit placed on it, which in the case of Strangers and BH, is completely independent of and always shorter than the hidden reward timer, requiring players to "game the system" in order to achieve the best reward.All of this points to a design philosophy of artificially extending playtime, seemingly without regard to players' time or enjoyment. It's as if Rockstar only measures engagement by time played, and the more they have of that, the more likely players will buy more Gold.The game has a plethora of bugs ranging from relatively minor to literally gamebreaking. Most of these have been in the game for quite a while (evidenced by the yr+ old reddit threads of people having the exact same issues), so it is clear that fixing them is not a priority for Rockstar. Here's a list of some off the top of my head:There are currently several hacks available for the game, ranging from teleportation of yourself and others, to autoaim, to invulnerability, to spawning invulnerable hostile NPCs, to instantly killing other PCs, to following other PCs between lobbies, to preventing other hackers from joining your lobby. I cannot tell you how many missions have been ruined because some hacker teleported me to a roof with everyone else in the lobby, across the map from where I'm supposed to turn in, making it impossible and causing the mission to fail.Some of these hackers are fairly benign, while others will target you to ruin your day for no reason at all. It's gotten to the point where some people in the discord communities have purchased hacks JUST to defend from these other hackers.At time of writing, Rockstar seemingly refuses to do anything about this other than a onetime ban wave some time ago. I assume this is because dealing with hacking doesn't directly make them any money.As mentioned earlier, Rockstar's development strategy is one focused on maximizing the time required to actually play the game, as evidence by a few features:The game is chock full of small taxes on your time. Every single action has an associated animation. This is initially immersive, but quickly becomes annoying when, for instance, it takes ~10 seconds to craft a single item and you're trying to craft dozens of items. The UI has more layers than a katyusha doll, and there's a transition animation between every single one of them. Most actually useful information is buried several layers deep.The Naturalist role has players sedating and collecting samples from animals in the RDO world and turning them over for a (pathetic) xp and $RDO reward. Unfortunately, this directly conflicts with the trader role which requires you to kill animals to fill your goods. The Naturalist NPC will refuse to interact with you for a set time after killing animals, making it impossible to sell your samples. What. Even.Despite being a multiplayer game, there are several impediments to playing together; most of them have to do with limiting moneymaking while in a party.There are currently NO train robberies, bank heists, or stage coach robberies. The game is generally missing banditry of any kind, in a game about cowboys and bandits.At this stage, it is fairly clear that RDO is in maintenance/money-wringing mode. The last two content updates (Naturalist at 25 Gold and Prestigious Bounty Hunter upgrade at another 15 Gold) were generally poorly received by the community for being either sparse or poorly thought out additions to the game. The majority of other updates have not been bug fixes or content refinements, but Gold-only cosmetics that are becoming increasingly cartoonish and immersion breaking, from straw beards to voodoo outfits to emotes and furry belt buckles. I'm honestly not sure who this was targeted at, but I have met no one yet who actually likes them.I would be (pleasantly) surprised if there was a major update with more and better content than the last drop... but it's looking unlikely.---The prevailing strategy seems to be to annoy players into buying Gold, but it ends up just annoying them into quitting the game. All in all, while there ARE enjoyable aspects to the game, they're buried under so much annoyance and bulls**t that I can't in good conscience recommend it to anyone.
