review: Played for about 177 hours, Rockstar does an update, cannot launch game anymore. Rockstar wants to blame my PC even though it played normally less than 24 hours before the update and scores of other people are having same issue. It's been almost 2 weeks and still no solution from Rockstar. Prior to the total meltdown, the game was interesting and fun but very buggy. Lots of hackers and grievers. Over all, don't waste your money and if you do, don't count on any support from Rockstar.

author: Ubisuccle
review: Great story spoiled by the worst multiplayer experience that I have had in a long ass time. Allow me to elaborate.They pushed the same gameplay model as GTAV (Get money, buy things and get more money). This would be fine except they force you to purchase useless ♥♥♥♥ and lock professions behind a 10-15 gold transaction. This is not to mention everything is insanely overpriced which I assume is an attempt to pad the sparse gameplay. They also made it so the "survival" mechanics from singleplayer are present in the multiplayer portion. An asinine decision however it is what it is. All of this would be forgiveable if not for a handful of the combat mechanics. First of all, if you play on controller, even on PC, the aim assist is insane. On mouse and keyboard you are at a massive disadvantage unless it is a free aim lobby. Secondly there is a new pseudo passive mode called "Defensive mode". This makes it harder for other players to attack you, however it still allows you to attack people who are not in that mode extremely easily. It also disables any form of aim assist and ability to tackle when fighting someone in defensive mode. All in all the story is great, unforgiving at times, but great. It is worth the buy if that is what you are looking for. The multiplayer is the single worst experience that I have had in a very long time. If i could give it negative stars I would run out of negative numbers.Edit as of 11/29/2020:Second verse same as the first, the story is great and the multiplayer is ass. I'm only updating this post for a badge lol.

author: King Bradley
review: RDR2 was really something new for me. If you have never played RDR1 like I didn't when you first start the game, you will probably wonder why the pace is so slow, and what's the hype all about, but if you are patient, and stick with the journey, you will see that this is truly a wonderful game, well worth your time and my top 2 favorite games of all time.Story is this game starts a bit slow and that was off-putting for quite some time until I understood that this game is like a long book. It takes some time for you to get to know characters, so for a long time nothing actually happens, but when it starts happening, you will actually care way more if something good or bad happens, because you will know characters very well. You play as Arthur Morgan, outlaw who is part of the gang led by Dutch Van Der Linde, charismatic leader, loved by everyone. Arthur is like a son to Dutch, he was adopted by the gang when he was only the kid, and he has been living this gang life since then. There are around 20 people in the gang. So what is story about? Gang has been killing, robbing for ages, and they are wanted men for a long time, however this time, they screwed up some job in Blackwater, and Pinkertons, federal agency almost captured them and they had to escape Blackwater and hide somewhere. Traveling through harsh snowy mountains, hopefully nobody will find them there, gang needs to settle down and start getting money and food so they survive these harsh times. So for quite such time, nothing is really happening, and you are just killing, robbing, hunting, trying to help the gang, trying to survive. It's like real life, well real life of the outlaw. Eventually things start getting intense. Without spoiling much anymore, I will just say that the story is amazing, possibly the best written story out there imo, it's a pretty real and emotional story that features wonderful journey and great characters, that you will really care about, and that's what makes this game so great, this wonderful journey. Gameplay in this game is complex enough. Combat is simple, you just shoot folks, and most of the time it's a pretty easy game. You just hide behind rocks, walls, trees and shoot, if you get shot you can just drink some medicine that you probably have a lot, because money is easily made in this game. First of all you don't even need to rob people outside of main story, because you will earn more than enough money just playing missions. I was being good guy, bad with boys, pure sweetheart on my own, not breaking any laws and I always had a lot of money. I would go to store and buy everything I need, food, drinks, medicine, ammo, and all that is so cheap, that you don't have to worry about side looting. One important technique to mention, and the only combat ability in this game it's Dead Eye, it's basically like something you have seen in Max Payne games, time slows down and and you can shoot people easily, only difference is that Arthur is not as nearly agile as the Max. This Dead Eye has it's own meter, so you gotta fill it up when it depletes, but it also increases on it's own when you kill people. So all in all, combat is really simple and most of the time you won't have any issues beating the tasks. Aside from combat important thing to mention is that Arthur is traveling on his horse, and you can change horse any time, by buying new horse, or taming wild one, however in first missions you get some new horse and I stayed loyal to him, even though they were better horses. Traveling through lands on your horse is extremly relaxing, music is so chill, and the world is beautiful. You can hunt or go fishing if you like these things and there are legendary animals to get caught, but these things didn't really pick my interest. You can rob anyone you want, however there is honor meter and if you do bad things it will go down and this will affect the personallity, he won't be caring person (for an outlaw at least) if you are doing bad things. It's kinda like paragon and renegade meters  in Mass Effect series. It also affects store prices and most importantly, the story. What's unique about Red Dead games is that there are random encounters in the world, you will be going through world, and white dot on the map will start blinking or you will hear voices and bunch of random things will happen. Strangers will ask for your help, for example snake bit them, and you can help them, or someone is taking bounty on their horse, and by bounty  I mean wanted people and you can help them, or not, if you do help some strangers your honor will increase a bit, but however sometimes helping them is not a good thing. I am not really gonna go into details how your honor meter increases, cause everything is explained in details in the game, but pretty much helping random strangers, saying hello to random strangers, helping gang in the camp by doing daily chores are some of the things that will increase that meter. Aside from random encounters, there are also stranger missions, and these are missions that will appear on the map when you are walking close to them. These are basically side quests in this game, and most of the time these side quests are divided into few parts. Once you are done with one part, next part will appear after some time. In that situation if you want to continue quests, just set up camp in the wilds, and sleep till the mission shows up, or you can continue doing something else and mission will pop up eventually. There are also few optional missions from the gang members. Aside from that bounty hunts are worth mentioning, you can go to local sheriff and start your bounty quests, and money will be paid to you once you bring back target dead or alive, based on your request. There are also a bunch of side activites in this game, like poker, robbing stagecoaches, houses, etc. I mentioned before that you can make a camp in the wild, and basically whenever you are not in the city or in the gang camp, you can set up the camp, and you can sleep, cook food there or fast travel (Money Lending mission, after you acquire ledger, you can purchase that ability). Overall pretty good gameplay.Atmosphere is amazing, like I already mentioned. It's so relaxing, so chill, it's one of the most relaxing games I've ever played, if not the most relaxing one. Performance wise this game ran pretty good on my configuration, I was getting 60 fps most of the time on high-ultra settings at 1080p. Fps does goes down in one city, but if you lower lightings it will definitelly help a lot. It's not the best optimized game out there, but it worked pretty well for myself. Game is around 70-80 hours long, if you do most of side quests in the game, minus hunting and fishing, but it's an open world game, so there is no limit, as you know. I didn't try online at all, because I wasn't really interested in that, so I can't say anything on that topic. - Amazing beautiful open world, with so many things happening, like random encounters- Writting and the story are one of the best I've ever seen, if not the best- Journey is wonderful- Beautiful atmosphere, maybe the most relaxing game I've ever played- Gameplay is pretty good- Performance wise it's not the best optimized game out there Wonderful relaxing game with beautiful world, story and the characters. I would recommend this game even at full price, it's my top 2 favorite games of all time along with Dark Souls, and in my opinion the masterpiece, because I don't see any flaws in this game, it's totally complete game and the story is so detailed.

author: Rendon
review: In my short 12 hours, I've had a pretty great time. Graphics are great, runs around a solid 50-60fps most of the time for me. A little buggy, but not nearly as bad as it was at launch. Mostly just visual bugs. Solid 8/10 in its current state, with potential to grow.

author: SandMan
review: Edited review:Last time i bought the game it didnt launch, This time it did so my original none recomendation is no longer valid. The game itself feels weird. The game feels like it is trying to reimagine GTA IV in the end of the wild west era. But at the same time trying to make the game as cinematic as possible like GTA V. But this creates a slight clash of ideoligies. The missions are now much easier and seem to have no "direct but suboptimal results vs smart with better results" options. The game seems to want to feel like its dynamic and reacting to you, but it can only happen in the less scripted open world, and there it feels amazing.Original: Game does not launch.When trying to boot straight from exe tells me that the soucial club does not have rights for this product.When starting from steam, crashes when trying to launch, unexpected error.Worth buying on a maybe when the rockstar launcher has been completly removed from the launch process.Not worth my time and money if it doesnt even tell me whats wrong and it isnt fixed 2 months after launch.

author: Dwight Schrute
review: Red Dead Redemption 2 is one of the greatest video gaming experience i've had, this game is so ahead of its time especially in terms of realism and attention to detail that it will take probably a decade for another video game to even get closer to it. I absolutely loved its campaign it's a prequel to previous game of franchise which is very well executed, the story felt very cinematic and every bit of it was solid, i thoroughly enjoyed it. Open World is very immersive and it feels hand-crafted as you explore and encounter its elements and there are certain activities to do like hunting, fishing etc. i'd also like to acknowledge the great soundtracks this game offers, songs like American Venom, that's the way it is are some of my favourites, overall the music is punched and gutted right through its moments and you'll feel it. Combat is highly enjoyable and it feels great through-ought the game.

I'm 84% the way, just side quests to do now and other stranger missions. 10/10 Game. LITERALLY A PERFECT GAME

author: krishtian
review: The legendary game from legendary developers finally released on PC in its most perfect form. I did not play before in the first part, and as I understand it, this is a prequel, so PC players who did not play the original now even won.The game takes place in North America in the late 19th and early 20th centuries, where we play as Arthur Morgan, a man of new progressive views, stuck in a gang of thieves, killers and liars. On his apth the protagonist saw a lot of blood, participated in more than a dozen skirmishes. The story of how blindly following friends leave their lives, their future for the short-sighted and selfish plans of the leader of the detachment Van der Linde.The game evokes different feelings, but most of all it makes you empathize with the main character, because he is true to his word, his friends, but at the same time wants a better life for his loved ones. At the same time, he is forced to go to the "last" deal in order to raise money and realize the so-called American dream.Graphically, this is a new word in the gaming industry. The game squeezes all the juices from any PC configuration. Here you have support for 4K with HDR, support for ultrawide monitors and an unlimited number of FPS, just requires the hardware, which is still under development.Fascinating landscapes, changing the time of day, weather and seasons, simply fascinate and force you to take screenshots with incredible beauty every now and then.For all this you have to pay a lot, you need to find a balance between a beautiful picture, but at the same time not to lose in the number of frames. This game is very voracious.The music in this game deserves special praise. Dramatic notes during intense scenes are replaced by cheerful and perky melodies in bars and taverns.The voice acting is beyond praise, it seems that the bandits you draw in your head look exactly like that, and the voice actors have done their best.This is not just GTA V in the wild west, there are much more activities, customization and just a huge number of random encounters that will lead to something unexpected.For the first time, fishing in the game looks like I want to do it. Hunting animals is made not just as a source of food, but also as an art in finding legendary animals from which legendary artifacts can be obtained.A huge variety of missions: from robberies to building your house, from fishing with friends to creating the first iron man. Separate praise is the best “drunken” mission in the bar with Leni - tons of ​​humor are guaranteed.I want to say that this is another masterpiece in the Rockstar piggy bank, but this is a masterpiece in the whole gaming industry, even the entire entertainment industry. A deep and sad story with its sparks of hope for a better life ...- A heartbreaking story, lasting more than 150 hours (including the search for all animals)- Fascinating secondary quests with unusual development of further events- A new word in visual and graphic terms (and this is without raytracing)- Memorable music and voices of the main characters- A wide variety of activities (from playing dominoes to hunting animals)- Dull multiplayer with a lot of hackers spoiling the impression of the gameЛегендарная игра от легендарных разработчиков наконец-то заглянула на ПК в ее самом совершенном виде. Не играл я до этого в первую часть и так понимаю, что это приквел, так что ПК игроки, не игравшие в оригинал теперь даже выиграли.Действия игры разворачиваются в Северной Америке конца 19 - начала 20 века, где мы играем за Артура Моргана, человека новых прогрессивных взглядов, застрявшего в банде воров, убийц и лжецов. На своем пути главный герой повидал немало крови, поучаствовал не в одном десятке перепалок. История о том, как слепо следующие друзья оставляют свои жизни, свое будущее за недальновидные и корыстные планы главаря отряда Ван Дер Линда.Игра вызывает разные чувства, но больше всего она заставляет сопереживать главному герою, ведь он верен своему слову, своим друзьям, но в то же время хочет лучшей жизни для своих близких. При этом вынужден отправляться на "последнее" дело, дабы собрать денег и осуществить так называемую американскую мечту.Графически - это новое слово в игровой индустрии. Игра выжимает все соки из любой конфигурации ПК. Здесь тебе и поддержка 4к с HDR, поддержка ultrawide мониторов и неограниченное число FPS, только подавай железо, которое находится еще в разработке. Завораживающие пейзажи, смена времени суток, погоды и сезонов, просто завораживают и заставляют то и дело снимать скриншоты с невероятной красотой.За все это приходится платить очень дорого, необходимо найти баланс между красивой картинкой, но при этом не потерять в количестве кадров. Эта игра очень прожорлива.Музыка в этой игре заслуживает отдельной похвалы. Драматические ноты во время напряженных сцен сменяются веселыми и задорными мелодиями в барах и кабаках.Озвучка выше всяких похвал, кажется что именно так и выглядят бандиты, которых ты рисуешь себе в голове, а актеры озвучки постарались на славу.Это не просто GTA V в диком западе, здесь гораздо больше активностей, кастомизации и просто огромное количество случайных встреч, которые приведут к чему-то неожиданному.Впервые рыбалка в игре выглядит так, что хочется этим заниматься. Охота на животных сделана не просто как источник пищи, а так же как искусство в поиске легендарных животных из которых можно получить легендарные артефакты.Громаднейшее разнообразие миссий: от ограблений до постройки своего дома, от ловли рыбы с друзьями до создания первого железного человека. Отдельной похвалы стоит самая лучшая "пьяная" миссия в баре с Лени - море юмора обеспечено. Хочется сказать, что это очередной шедевр в копилку Rockstar, но это шедевр всей игровой индустрии, даже всей индустрии развлечений. Глубокая и грустная история с ее искорками надежды о лучшей жизни...- Душераздирающая история, длительностью в более 150 часов (с учетом поиска всех животных)- Увлекательные второстепенные квесты с необычными развитием дальнейших событий- Новое слово в визуальном и графическом плане (и это без лучей)- Запоминающаяся музыка и голоса главных героев- Большое разнообразие активностей (от игры в домино до охоты на животных)- Унылый мультиплеер с большим количеством хакеров, портящих впечатление об игре

author: N J Ø R D
review: My english is not very good but i want to write this review in English. At the moment i write this review i only played 23.4 hours of the game. I played not that much to write this review but there are still lots of things i want to share about this game. This game is like wild west life simulation with immersive environment, it is very nice to wander around the map, doing activities like hunting, stowing animals you killed on the horse, riding and doing random encounters.   The game is  reminds me of childhood because i grew up watching western movies with my family on every sunday. You know cowboys, outlaws and sheriff stuff. (also fighting with natives). Of course, there are also things i did not like while playing the game; like shooting without using slow motion not so funny, therefore i am always using slow motion to headshot enemies. Also missions with doing daily stuff sometimes could be boring like driving coach to town to buy supplies, but i said the game is like wild west times life simulation.   Do i suggest this game? I would say you must play the game with best headphones you can afford to let yourself lose in immersivity of the nature and I cannot tell you anything about story because i'm still playing the game. John Wayne

author: Tenpenny
review: This game is fantastic. This is actually my second time buying it, and I am not having as fun of a time as I was on PS4. Unfortunately, this port is pretty lazy and there are a whole lot of technical problems that have resulted from it. I've only had the game crash twice, but it generally runs like ♥♥♥♥, which is sad considering I am running it on a RTX 2070. Framerate drops, graphical issues, and harsh stutters are very common. From trying online, I can say that the community is by far this game's best feature. Other players, 9 out of 10 times will drop whatever they're doing to help you if you need it. It genuinely blew me away when I first started playing this game, and honestly it still does to this day, considering Rockstar Game's other titles' communities and how godawful they are. There are occasional hackers online, but I can't think of a time where they were genuinely obnoxious. Most of the time they just spawn a bunch of bears or something. The last gripe I have about the online mode is the general lack of love and attention it gets from Rockstar. I would describe the experience as "barebones" - while it has a great setting and atmosphere and gameplay, its absolutely lacking in content or just general things to do. The online scene is dying because Rockstar refuses to add anything to it, seeing as it doesn't make nearly as much money as GTAO does for the same amount of work.TLDR: Rockstar has a great game here, but it is plagued by a generally embarrassing amount of technical issues.

review: Rockstar knows how to create a vast world teeming with life. Beautiful story, astonishing open world, good gameplay and one of the best protagonists in a video game. Try to play it slowly dont rush it ;-)10/10PS: please Rockstar make a RD1 remake :)

author: Floorstain Gaming
review: I just want to preface this by saying a majority of my playtime in this game was on ps4/ps5.  The technical aspects of this game are some of the most brilliantly realized I've ever seen in an interactive medium.  The visuals,  animations, and voice acting are all the level of quality you've come to expect from a rockstar release.  With that said, it's without a doubt, the most BORING game I've ever played in my life.  The mission structure is such that it basically plays itself and has you go from point A to point B with the game telling you exactly where to go/what to do and god forbid you go off-script.  The missions make sure to throw in some braindead easy shooting galleries every now and again to ensure you stay engaged but it simply wasn't enough to keep me interested.  I don't really have much to say about the open-world, it's fine I guess.  On the merits of it's technical aspects and story it's a 10/10.  In terms of the gameplay experience, I'd have to give it a 3/10.  I don't think I've ever tried to hard to enjoy something so beloved by many and just been completely unable to.  I realize I'm in the VAST minority here but that was just my experience sadly.

author: Mara
review: I am so disappointed. I have wanted this game for ages, and really looked forward to it. Unfortunately, as soon as we made it through the initial quest and grouped up in the first town, hackers found us. Not the "aim so well you are suspicious and frustrated" hackers, but the kind that explode you over and over, catch you on fire, teleport you across the map, teleport you into the sky, spawn dangerous mobs on you, kill your horse, spawn multiple replicas of your character which then attack you type hackers. I have never had anything like this happen in a game before. I ended up stuck in a loop being exploded to death over and over before I could access the menu to quit out of the game or try to load into a different realm. I had to alt f4 to exit the game. We have all asked for our money back, this is the most we have ever spent on a game and the fact that hackers have this level of control unchecked with no way of even seeing their names to report them is insane. A cursory google shows that we are not alone, this is a huge problem that is not being addressed.

author: Svirt
review: Red Dead Redemption 2 takes place on the brink of the 20th century and is a great depiction of Wild West just like in western movies or country music. But not only you get to know the west, you also visit American south and even one of the big southern cities with all modern features of that time. The environment and depth of the game is breathtaking and just riding around on your horse can be just as fascinating as shooting gangs, which you will get to do a lot here. The level of detail and scale of random events happening to you or just around you makes it feel like you were really there. This is something I was overwhelmed by. Now about the main story plot. You are typical gunslinger in one of many outlaw gangs roaming the west pursued by the law. All your gang care about is how to get more and more money in every possible way and you can see how gang leader Dutch Van Der Linde is just more and more obsessed with that and even though your character does not like that, he follows, because he is just a gun. Yes, this is some character development, but overall this is something I just didn’t like even though characters develop it does not affect their actions. The story is simple in my opinion, very straightforward, with little to no choice whatsoever and most importantly very predictable. ✪   ✪   ✪   and their enhancement choices✪   ✪   ✪   ✪   – after great beginning it goes downhill✪   –annoying a lot✪   ✪   – always online even in singleplayerOverall rating

author: AmyRose88
review: 🔵To fix Fullscreen issue:- Lunch game, wait for title screen to load, press left stick down to open settings- Open "Graphics", scroll down to "Advanced Graphics", set "Advanced Settings" to Unlocked, set "Graphics API" to DirectX 12, Apply Changes- Close the game, lunch it again, go to Graphics settings, set "Screen Type" to Fullscreen, set desired resolution, Apply ChangesTested on: OnexPlayer Mini Pro 6800U

author: Dalton
review: As much as I want to recommend this title I just can't do it. So, let's talk about that.First I would like to go over the pros:1) Graphics are excellent and optimization is good2) Stories are fantastic with very interesting characters3) It will take a LONG LONG time to run out of things to do in this game, whether it's online or offline. After 101 hours I am still nowhere near running out of fun things to do.Now, let's get to the main cons and the reasons I can't recommend the game:1) Controls. They're bad. Real bad. It's exceedingly difficult to do precision movement whether on foot or horse due to the unresponsive and clunky controls. Not to mention a lot of times your mount will just veer off the direction you're heading and run you into a tree, rock, fence, building, etc. even when you're not pushing any directional keys. Trust me, the controls are infuriating.2) Online bugs and glitches. I have had entire shipments that I have spent hours putting together just vanish on turn in with no rewards. The shipments (trader and moonshine roles) do not get reset back to your camp or moonshine shack, they're just gone. This is the most egregious of the glitches so far, but there are also a lot of glitches involving movement that are frustrating.3) Hackers online. Oh so so so many hackers. These people can drain your money, print their own, god mode, aim bots, downpours of dynamite, invisibility, etc. etc. The worst part of this is that even if the hacker does not target you the hacks will break the lobby causing NPCs to be unresponsive along with... well.... everything else.4) Micro-transaction shop. Had I realized there was one in the game I would have never purchased it. These shops, every single one of them in ANY game, are nothing but scams. The developers purposely make things a grind (though in RDR2 it's not as bad as others) so that you will feed them money just out of frustration due to lack of progress even though you just paid for a full price game. Every single game with one of these shops is designed this way, some are just more subtle than others.    So, this review is long enough as it is, but I could keep going. However, I feel I have hit the most important points as to why I can not recommend this game. Maybe if it ever goes on sale for 20$, but I can't state enough that it's just not worth more than that due to the glaring issues, ESPECIALLY if you're looking to play online. As long as people keep feeding devs that practice shady tactics and ignore glaring issues (because, hell, they already have your money so they will just pretend they're working on fixes, but never actually fix the problems).    I will probably continue playing it because I am one of the dimwits that sprang for the ultimate version, so I already have a lot of money in the game, but had I known what I know now before purchase I would have never even paid the basic 60$. The online play especially is too broken with the CONSTANT harassment from hackers.    So, in conclusion, I would recommend you do not dump any more than a 20$ bill for this broken mess. And since that isn't likely to happen any time soon, I highly recommend you just pass this by completely.

author: Skays
review: It's definitely Game of the year, but...Maybe I approached it with incorrect attitude but honor machanics are pretty confusing for example until chapter 4/5 game just didn't let me to be good guy. Main character Arthur is messed up guy with a lot of personal issues and this what kept me confusing about these Honor mechanics it was very hard to keep it on high(est) level. Don't get me wrong I loved main character (and his horse), I loved story but I felt that Honor mechanics are not needed and they sometimes pissed me off, for example why looting some guy's body who obviously died ten years earlier in the middle of a desert decreases honor? I still cannot tell especially when there is content in it (letters, valuable items or diary entry). In one sentence? It's hard to be a good guy on wild west even if you try hard.Next thing I have to mention are horses. Oh my... these are made beautifully not even by design but all of these have a soul and are so natural that when you meet some in the wild you know that you want to have him or her. There are a lot of things to do which if I would like to decribe It would take ma a lot of time. But discovery new places, hunting, a lot of sidequests. It took me 250h to achieve 100% completion and even though I'm sure that there are places that I haven't discovered.Probably I will add something in the future but for now that's it.Its worth every penny. "You sir are a fish"9.5/10 Masterpiece

author: VIDA
review: Red Dead Redemption 2:  An open-world characteristic story and the online virtual game contains an unbelievable story component that draws all onlookers' attention towards this virtual game. In this game there are two components, the first essence is known as story mode, the sequence is referred to online (multiplayer). Although online may seem debatable to some players, it overall gives a more positive output compared to GTA online (Grand Theft Auto). Story mode is considered one of the most heartfelt and captivating narrative components of a video game ever.Story (10/10):  In the Story mode component of this virtual game, the story consists of a low life cowboy named Arthur Morgan. Seen throughout the story as you progress, Mr Morgan is trying to find a way out of this life that he has brought himself into. There are exclusive features and details that vary among the story anticipated on your honor ranking. High honor will receive a contrasting ending that will gratify players' minds and captivate their hearts. But a differing sequence occurs when a player will receive low honor, the ending sequence of this virtual game is rather substandard and undesirable leaving players regretting the negative choices they had established throughout the story component. Overall this virtual game has a formidable story component that is highly ranked by all onlookers.Online (7/10):Online consists of an immensely inexpedient quantity of labor, consisting of a high amount of hours spent on playtime. Although GTA online (Grand Theft Auto) Consists of many players who decrepit and withdraw the satisfaction of playing. Rockstar Games had made sure those issues wouldn't arise again. Instead, leaving us with a correspondence that is genuine and pleasant. But the labor that has to be put into this sequence is over the top and leaves onlookers feeling purposeless. Therefore reducing a prohibitive amount of attention drawn towards the online sequence. Overall online is good but will take an excessive amount of time that is unwanted to most onlookers.

author: NotASpy
review: Red Dead Redemption 2 is such an extraordinary game that it deserves more than just walls of text covering random topics like other reviews I made in the past. As quality of a game as Red Dead 2 is, I will try and make an equally informative and quality review of it. I will cover 3 main points that I think are important to what makes a game, this includes its story/characterization, gameplay, and visuals/sound.Many people see a game such as Red Dead Redemption and think about the gunslinging, the robbing, the violence but it is much deeper than what meets the eye. The story revolves around the main protagonist Arthur Morgan, it explains the origins of Dutch’s gang and the steps they need to go through in order to reach their goal of getting out of the U.S. and off to exotic lands to escape their tragic lives. The story is full of exciting missions and events that mostly revolve around the one last big score the gang needs to get the money they need to escape. Many twists and turns happen throughout which cause division amongst the gang and some drastically halt progress to getting the money they need. I am trying to keep it as vague as possible as it’s best to experience the game unspoiled, like I said it’s much bigger than a robbing simulator, it’s a story of redemption. You need to sit back and think of the world that the gang once knew is still a viable way of living. You think about your actions, and think if the harm you cause to others throughout is right. The cast in this game is outstanding, you can go from looking up to, to feeling sorry for, to hating, to feeling sorry for just one character of the many you get close to. This way of life takes a toll on people, and there is no honor in this life and you will find it out first handedly. How the people you grow close to change into people they once despised, how people react to certain events, how their lives can be taken at any instant and you wonder if Arthur Morgan is doing the right things for the people he cares about.While Red Dead Redemption 2 is a near perfect game in all other ways to measure a games worth, here is where you can see some of its faults. The game revolves around such realistic and beautiful animations, that it sometimes bleeds into lowering the quality of controlling Arthur. Not on many occasions but maybe a handful of times, I clicked buttons that didn’t register properly which lead to the game doing something I didn't want. For example, trying to mount your horse in a city and Arthur brutally tackles a random civilian which leads to me having every police officer in the city shooting at me even though it was not sevre and an accident. This made me have to mount up and escape from the law for about 2 minutes before I can return to the story mission I was on my way to. The gunplay leaves dissatisfied and you wanting something that feels a little more impactful. The shooting in this game just feels frustrating and unrewarding, which had me abuse deadeye which was fine but turned later missions in the game to me stuffing tobacco down Arthurs throat and point and clicking until I got to a cutscene. The stiff controls and poor shooting mechanics are really my only two gripes with this game, it may put some people off but I feel pushing through these issues are worth it for getting to play the almost masterpiece that Red Dead Redemption 2 is. The game tries its hardest to be realistic, and with that comes certain sim elements. Which has you naturally get immersed in the game that it is. You need to stop at stores to stock up for long journeys to keep arthurs weight up, you need to sleep to keep deadeye up and stay awake. Which has you every once in a while making trips to shops getting to know the shop owner and stocking supplies for you, crafting, horses, and more. It isn’t too in your face, it almost feels refreshing and natural to keep these things in mind throughout the game. The missions in this game are typically Rock* activities but set in 1899. You can go from robbing a bank, taking out rival gangs, helping out fellow gang members, to riding a hot air balloon. The mission diversity is amazing and has you wanting to pull 5+ hour sessions regularly. Besides the main story, this open world isn’t barren like other games . There are tons of strangers to meet that can have you escorting a cameraman to get the perfect shots, helping a newly widowed women survive on her own, tear bounty posters for escaped inmates, help a stranger on the side of the road who just got bitten by a venomous snake, and so much more. I am not usually a fan of side content, as it usually is subpar compared to main story quests. But the side content here is on par if not better than most main missions. They are full of interesting characters, twists and turns of their own that it feels great to just see a small story on its own. You can hunt various legendary animals or any old deer to get materials to craft new upgrades for your camp or upgrades to Arthurs equipment. This is hands down the single greatest visual and sound in a video game you can experience as of today. There are no other games that compete with the beauty of the world and no one can tell me otherwise. I was playing this game on near ultra @1440p with my Gtx 1080ti at a smooth 60fps . And at no point in this game did I stop getting stunned by the visual quality. The shadows are outstanding and reflect the time of day, on every blade of grass. The textures are top notch, everything is incredibly detailed from the horse’s balls to Arthurs buttons on his coat. But what really takes over here is the lighting quality, from the dust shining from the light coming through the windows, to the reflecting light of the swamps. I feel in this review I was able to thoroughly explain each of my points well, but in the case of Red Dead Redemption's 2 graphics I don’t think I am up to that task. Just take a look at my screenshots to see for yourself. This whole game immerses you with its dialogue, sim elements, but what ties it all together is the better than real life views. The forest can make you feel the dread of what's to come, the foggy and darkness of the swamp has you ride for your life in fear of the monsters lurking, the snowy mountains have you bundle Arthur to keep him from getting frozen solid. If there is one thing to take away from this review is that, this game seriously looks better than real life at times it will have you stop and take a screenshot to remember the time you had. Another key to the visual quality in this game are it’s animations and physics. Arthur moves around the world in beautiful fashion, the people smoking a cigar during a poker game are all realistic. It really has you believe that this is a real living world with how amazingly the people interact with the world itself. The sound design is also key to the delivery of the game, everything from rain hitting trees, to the distant gunshots, are all realistic and have you fully in love with the design of Red Dead Redemption 2. Not only are the sounds amazing, but the music and the timing of it is equally as impressive. The only other game that has comparable music is Nier Automata and we all know how amazingly the game weaves gameplay with its soundtrack. Here the music also perfectly matches with what you are doing, slow paced music while you are setting up a heist, and when ♥♥♥♥ hits the fan the music reacts appropriately.The few real life songs that actually play, play at emotionally impactful moments.

author: bcpeery
review: I purchased this game because i loved all of the Red Dead games i have played in the past.  And I am sure this one may have been just as great and wonderful.   BUT, there is just one minor annoyance that has prevented me from enjoying this game.  wait did I say one minor annoyance? I meant a CATASTROPHIC FAILING IN BASIC FUNCTIONALITY. Any one who has tried to play this game on pc will know what I'm talking about.  The fact that it requires yet another launcher is not even the worst part, what is is the fact that you cannot play this game while offline.  You have to be connected to the internet for the entire time you are playing this game.  for some this is not a problem.  for me though, I travel a lot for work.  And not everywhere has access to the internet.  and some places that do, it is unreliable at the best of times.  so playing a game that boots you from playing just because of a hiccup in the connection is problematic at the best of times.  I would like to think that this isn't going to be the new normal for games in the future.  However, i have a feeling that this (just like i said about micro-transactions) is going to RUIN several games and franchises for many of their loyal fanbases.

author: Strzelec®
review: I could say many positive words about this game, about beautiful graphics, very interesting and engaging storyline, perfectly written characters but I think the best review will be the number of hours I spent in Red Dead Redemption 2.It took me just over 55h to complete the story and almost all the side missions (excluding some of the collector threads).  of amazing adventure with brilliant characters and interesting dialogues, dynamic missions in perfect graphic and audio setting. A ton of possible choices that affect our honor plus a heartwarming but extremely satisfying ending.The Wild West atmosphere is further enhanced by countless side activities such as playing cards, hunting, racing with strangers, fishing, etc. After completing the story, you and your friends can enter the online world and keep having fun. After a short introduction we are thrown into the game world and we can turn into: a skin trader, a moonshiner, a bounty hunter, a naturalist or a collector of unique items. Plus season passes that offer discounts on selected items and limited outfits or skins. I spent like 1000h online and I don't regret a minute of it. Red Dead Online is the perfect environment for long conversations with friends.

review: Graphics: HighEndPCStory: ''We’re Thieves, In A World That Don’t Want Us No More''Multiplayer: Microtransactions...I give 9/10 with a pain on my heart:Red Dead Redemtion 2 is one of the most simbolic examples of what outlaws are supposed to be.Arthur Morgan is the first guy that we are greeted with.This games deliveres us a bunch of details related to the actual world that we live in,and the graphics are just outstanding for the technology we have on the tip of our finger.The variety of weapons is just beyond the roof and one of the most detailed category of combat which just puts on pieces of a large puzzle that finally resemblance a masterpiece.The interactions beatween the player and your horse(which you'll spend most of your time riding)resemblance reality in a way that we've never actually have been expecting.From the types of horses,to the types of weapons combined with the amazing story(for both online an story mode)makes the interactions with you actually feeling like you need to do what it has to be done to survive daily.Comes to the part where Red Dead Online feels like a totally different(which is the reason why personally give 9/10)because the developers actually charge you for skipping literally 40 hours or more(depending on how much you play)of grinding freeroam missions that don't give you jack s**t amount of gold.All and all,I'm sad that the online content stand with all the fun and enjoyment behind a somewhat relative massive paywall.To put an end for my review,I really love the game.Me and my friends are gonna have a blast in online,while obviously,we'll wait for new content to be added to online.This game is one of my FAVORITES :)

author: XOD14C
review: RED DEAD REDEMPTION 2 out of 1 through 5 this is a 20. How can I comprehend the masterpiece of this game and the amazing character development and the incredible voice acting and the outstanding soundtrack? And best of all sets up perfectly for the first Red Dead. Arthur Morgan Where do I start with him He is the perfect protagonist, in my opinion, the game sets him up as a simply hardened outlaw who lives to ride and kills to live with him and his gang but as you continue to play the story you get deeper and deeper into who he really is and it's not only him it's also with Dutch, and John, and Micah, and Javier, Bill (all these names are your gang members) we all see their true selves at the end of the game. But Arthur changed the most because back then he was a ruthless man who gave no mercy or pity to others (if you choose to) But as you play as him he suddenly changes and shows that he really is a good man (again if you choose to have high or low honor for Arthur). As you continue to get higher honor you see his character development as he helps his gang and other important characters like Rains fall and Eagle flies they played a huge part in showing his true self. And Tuberculosis also played a major part in changing his life, and not only that but John and his family, Tilly, Ms. Grimshaw, Mr. Pearson, Mary-Beth, Even Uncle. Arthur redeemed himself by trying to save as many as he could and get justice to those who deserved it. His passing was one of the most heartbreaking moments for gamers and It gets even better when you then Play as John Marston Arthurs Good friend and brotherly figure, Together with his former gang members Charles and Sadie who the game will introduce you to as the game progresses through the story. They hunt and avenge for their good friend and get the retribution he deserved and cuts into the sequel to red dead redemption the entire story is amazing from beginning to first.

It challenges you to be prepared for anything, and make the right decisions when your choices matter most. Arthur Morgan is the lead, but the world takes center stage to pull you in. author: Glades
review: This game took my heart and stole it twice over. A perfect exhibition of the fallacy that was the American Dream. A beautiful tragedy of an idea so many have hopelessly held onto only for the optimist to lose their hope, the idealist to turn cynic, and the dreamer to wake from their dream and into a nightmare. The beauty was in the fight for it. That's what this game is. Dreamers fighting for a world in which they can still dream. Sadly the world in which they truly live doesn't want them anymore, they are 'more ghosts than people'. The dawn of a new century means the death of the last one and thus modernity kills mysticism. The tale of Arthur Morgan and the Dutch Van Der Linde gang in all its richness is the tale of those last few who held onto, fought for, and believed in the myth of the West. A particularly poignant song on the game's soundtrack contains one lyric in particular that translates this sentiment best: 'the building of a shrine only just to burn'. They gave themselves to an idea that could not give back. But who's to say they fought in vain? In the end, if not for an idea, we can fight for each other. That's the only thing worth fighting for. I know it's just a game and everything but I found a lot of truth in my time with it. So yes, I would recommend this game.

author: Theoran
review: I never played Red Dead Redemption 1 but knew of it, so I was so excited to have a chance to play RDR2 when it came to PC. I jumped into the game not knowing anything and quickly realized this was going to be a slow burn of a game. The opening chapter is pretty slow paced as the game introduces you to the many characters and the mechanics of the game. I cannot stress this enough; the rest of the game is nothing like Chapter 1. So don’t give up on the game early on, there is so much more to come. Chapter 2 opens most of the world and you can finally explore the land at your own pace. This is where the game really shines. Exploring, hunting, and random encounters really make the world feel alive.Take your time and explore the world. Enjoy the scenery, bond with your horse, hunt animals, complete honor quests and side quests, and even do the main quest when you want. It all is so extremely rewarding. Obviously, you could only do the main quest and finish the game over the weekend, but you will miss so much about what makes this game great. The more you put into the game, the more you get out of it.In the early game, I did not know how I felt about Arthur. I just didn’t connect with him, and I certainly did not like him at all during the Leopold Strauss missions. As time passed in game, my feeling for Arthur began to change and you get to start seeing small changes in Arthur as well. You get to see the honorable, caring, and loyal friend he is, and I fell in love with him. By Chapter 6, I wanted nothing more than to protect Sadie Adler, Charles Smith, Abigail Roberts, and my horse, and save the gang and live happily ever after.I got lucky and was able to get Biscuit, my grey dappled Missouri Fox Trotter, seven quests into Chapter 2 and I kept Biscuit to the very end and without even realizing it, I had formed an emotional bond with her. I love this horse. I fed her; brushed her; took her to the stables for treats! It is an odd thing to realize how attached you have become to a video game character and as much as Arthur meant to me, Biscuit meant just as much.As Chapter 6 ends and the music plays, I am an emotional wreck. As the scene faded to black, I just sat there, staring at my screen. I had spent 500 hours in game at this point and I was drained. I had become so emotionally connected to all these characters that I did not want this the be the end, but it was. It was a satisfying, gripping, emotional story that left me filled with feelings of elation, despair, happiness, and sadness.The story of Booker and Elizabeth from Bioshock Infinite is the only other game I have played that had so completely pulled me in to the world and built connections with characters in the game so much so that I teared up at the end. This game delivered and the journey this game took me on trumps any glitches, bugs, or error codes that happened along the way.To say that RDR2 put a spell on me is an understatement. I own the RDR2 Official Guide, the original soundtrack, and the original score. This game consumed me as I worked my way to 100% completing the game.  I love this game, flaws, and all....even the ridiculous gambler challenges.The online game is what it is. I played RDO for 30 straight days and pretty much hated almost everything about it. It felt empty, soulless, and boring. There was no one to play with and for the most part I simply grinded the same area for cougars and plants. Ultimately, I got to a certain point where I asked myself, “Why are you even playing this?” At that point, I stopped playing and have not gone back even after RDO updates.

author: Matt
review: #2020.12 - came back to playing recently, and whereas prior to december patch game was in a pretty good shape and I was considering finally giving it an overall positive review, after that patch I can with a clean conscience keep it negative - technically game is broken again, with infinite loading screens, bugged audio, and xp / cash rewards not being awarded for completed missions.Daily streaks were nerfed, and gold rewards reduced, while prices got increased, prestigeous bounty hunter is a joke, just like new W&R club rewards.Long story short - with latest patch R* gave us a finger ....again.  #2020.04.15 - When I wrote my initial review I've been after spending ~100h in online mode of the game.Since then I spent another 140h focusing mainly on the story mode, and whereas I sincerely enjoyed it, and I'm confident it's one of the best games i played in recent years, with memorable characters, incredible world, great story etc, I know that online component of the game is still broken, most of the bugs that were there in December 2019 are still here in April 2020, and R* is postponing release of new content other than cosmetic items. That being said, seeing that half of the game is still in a bad shape and little is being done about it I see no way but to keep my recommendation negative. ****************2020.01.24 - After playing over 100h, and most of that on-line I can tell that game instead of getting better is rolling downhill, and fast - old bugs that were there in december when game was launching on steam are still there, and new ones are poping-up almost on a daily basis -  shopkeepers and questgivers becoming unresponsive, daily challenges not getting counted properly, world events and animals respawning at terrible rate. On top of that servers are performing like sh*t, and all R* seems to be caring about is new premium currency content, which i wouldnt mind if the game was working fine, but it's not.This game has TONS of potential to be great, and I'd love to recommend it, but in current state RDO is unplayable.******That being said i love single player part of the game, which is awesome so far I recommend it with my whole heart.

author: Physicsman
review: Red Dead Redemption 2 is a masterpiece game of Rockstar Games. The game has more physics details, than other games. About the story. Main character is Arthur Morgan. This man is very very charismatic, memorable and handsome. Always in my heart. About the graphics. Graphics are wonderful and very good, i just each watch on sky and my eyes get awesome beauty. Soundtrack and ambient music is perfect.Red Dead Online is good multuplayer about the Wild West. There are 5 roles (Bounty Hunter, Collector, Moonshiner, Naturalist and Trader). If you play with friends, then the game become more interesting. But, you can play solo, It won't be boring. Multiplayer has clothes, horses and guns, according to your taste.My rating is 10/10 - I recommended to buy!

author: SS PigeonShit
review: I've played hundreds, if not a few thousand games in my life. Of all those games, this is most assuredly one of my absolute favorites. I went into this game with no expectations, all I had heard was this was supposed to be a very very good game. The first several hours I spent starting and restarting, learning the mechanics and what does what and all of that and eventually it clicked and when it did, an adventure began the likes of which I've never experienced before. I am happy I waited until I had a beefy PC to play this game at max settings in all its glory too. My only real critiques are that I wish the map was just a tad bigger and the physics were a little less buggy. Beyond that, this game and its story are near flawless. A life changing game I would suggest any gamer play at least once. Thank you for the memories Arthur, enjoy Tahiti <3UPDATE: after finally sinking significant time into RDO, I feel like I can give an honest and fair review.It's a money-grubbing grind fest similar to GTA online and if you don't want to grind, you can gladly pay to get ahead. The story missions aren't bad, but most others are just radiant fetch missions or your standard guard this/take that/steal this jobs. What's more, in order to access more missions and features in the game, you actually have to pay a significant amount to buy "kits" that'll allow you to partake, and then in some instances (Blood Money) you have to pay just to do missions. If you're OK with grinding mostly for cosmetics, or want to RP, this might be up your alley. Otherwise, spend your money elsewhere. I would gladly pay $200+ for the RDR2 story. And I'd gladly pay $20+ to forget RDO exists.

author: Psycho (龍)
review: Red Dead Redemption II - It's a Masterpiece!"When you play RDR2, you don’t play a game, you just open a world." "Non gamers don't know what they're missing out on, it saddens me to know a lot of people still think video games are still in that pac man or donkey kong phase where it's just a fun time waster for kids; but games have evolved into a broad medium of storytelling and world building in ways movies or books wish they could make their audience connect to." - Comment from Youtube video.I like to review games based on MANY reasons but I mostly prefer to point to 3 main reasons that have a big impact on my experience:Very realistic. This is by far, the best and mostly will be even on the future the most realistic and graphical game I have played to date, aswell the whole physics which are breath taking and how well done they are, every single small detail is put into the game for one to experience the real west times! It also has it's own weather and it's another surreal part of the game. Snow, rain, sun, thunderstorm, sandstorm.. The map is one giant open-world with a lot of different biomes and also having a change of time for day and night, which already increases drastically the way a player view the game at. Not only that but the combat, the guns and the blood are super good! If you have played the game or at least seen a video or two, you know this game is no joke, but at same time it is very optimized as I played mostly on 90-120 fps on max settings for 1080p, considering the perfect graphics. Wow! Not only has the most thrilling western songs out there, aswell the sounds from ambience and everything are just in shape. Travelling by the forest, earing the owls at night while riding the horse listening to it's walking, and Arthur/John breathing. Or walking into the snowy mountains with your steps in and with eagles above birding loud, probably looking for a prey to catch. The rain or the wind on a top mountain... Simply outstanding!Also walking by the cities, specially the crowded ones and listening to the trains, the people chatting and all... it's a very different feeling than any other game, maybe because it's complemented with the graphics making it feel so real? Yet I think it's amazing what the creators have done with the sound in RDR2, as most of the games aren't this much detailed at all, to the most small point.The story is HUGE and very well writen, one of the best I have played so far. There are a lot of characters and cities, aswell a lot of missions and things to do. Nothing more to say, only playing is the best way to tell.Adding another extra part as the game includes a Online version but I really despise it and my hate goes all here since it needed to play it in order to complete the game's full achievements. Reaching rank 50 required me to buy a 10€ pack to collect easy but grindy XP that took me around 20 hours, not so fun. The PVP was crazy bad and really didn't liked it.Take a look at these two videos, just an amazing experience!  -

author: Blarghalt
review: You wouldn't find yourself alone on the internet today if you went around saying that despite Rockstar's cash cow with the Grand Theft Auto series, Rockstar was truly at their best when they made Red Dead Redemption. A game with unforgettable characters, amazing gunplay, and the occasional horse glitching through a boulder. A game that, to this day, I've never found someone that thought poorly of it. And now, here we are. Ten years later, with a prequel of even grander ambition than the first.The only true way I can describe this game is that it  the embodiment of everything good about the "Triple AAA" games. Red Dead Redemption 2 is a game that oozes with care and attention to detail in a way you usually only see in a Metal Gear Solid game. A cast of characters you genuinely come to care for, and an open world that feels truly . As Arthur Morgan, a member of Dutch's gang, most of the game world is open to you from the start, but the way the game is structured, your journey across it tends to unfold organically as you follow the main story. As a member of Dutch's gang, your main goal is to make money, and how you go about this can range from simple robbery to more theatrical methods of plunder.And this is where the core gameplay loop of RDR2 comes in: go out and explore the world, and experience its splendor. I haven't felt a sense of a game world being this huge since Skyrim, and in the same way, you tend to stumble upon quests as you reach around every rock and stick to see what the game world has in store. It's an immensely satisfying way to have quests structured, and that's not even getting into the gameplay.In my entire life of playing video games, I don't think  has even come close to how fun the gunplay is in RDR2. Nearly every single firearm is just plain  to shoot, and there's a lot of times I'd just ride through the game world shooting my gun into the air because it just felt right. And then, when you get into combat, you have a pretty bog-standard cover shooter, but with the element of the satisfying guns put into the mix, pretty much every gunfight is a blast to go through. It's almost decadent how full this game feels, and how much is packed in. This game could be double the price it is, and still be worth every penny. And I've only talked about the singleplayer experience; there's an entire and well-made online portion than can keep you entertained well after you've beaten the singleplayer portion. This is a game I hold on nearly the same level of Undertale or Chrono Trigger; you owe it to yourself to play it at least once. Cannot recommend enough.

author: NB
review: This is an in depth review of Red Dead Redemption 2.I have over 300 hrs ( on pc ) in the game so i basically know the game inside out and also have all the achievements for the campaign mode.Now a lot of people are reluctant to buy rdr2 because of the launch issues it faced in its pc port and i totally agree it was buggy at launch but things have changed now , rockstar has fixed almost all the issues that the game had so there's no point in holding back your purchase for this reason.Now the game isn't for everyone its a very slow paced game,the game takes its time to show u the magnificent world that rockstar have created and its an experience that u need to take in slowly. MUSICNow music is on the top of list because this game has one of the best soundtracks out there. OPEN WORLDThe world of rdr2 is something that every gamer must experience.Its a beautiful world but don't be fooled danger lurks in every corner of this game from random gang encounters to you being hunted down by predators like a panther or a pack of wolves, you cant trust anyone in the wild .I had an encounter with a man who called out for help and said he lost his way, so naturally i went to give him a ride back to his town but he pulled me down and stole my horse, this is one of the many encounters that i had in the open and each one plays out differently. Its filled with a level of detail that is unmatched. There are treasure maps to be found ,dinosaur bones to be discovered, animals to be hunted and skinned etc ,i can go on and on about this but i will stop and give you a few numbers.The game has 178 animals all of them with distinct movements just like their real life counter parts ,around 30 types of fishes ,19 horse type each with their own unique skill set.There are around 60 weapons ,43 types of plants,60 types of items.GAMEPLAYIts a typical rockstar game so it uses a physics based engine which still creates hilarious moments ,Arthur (the main protagonist) moves like a real person and does actions at his own pace, for stats he has a stamina bar, health bar and a dead eye meter .All the mechanics from the first game have been implemented and improved in rdr2 with additional new ones. Hogtieing a npc and placing them on the train tracks just to see them run over is still fun to do.There are occasional glitches but not a deal breaker.The weather system is top notch with sand and rain storms being highlights.Gun gameplay is still clunky like all other rockstar games ,cover system is okish, first person mode of the game is the best way to make the gunplay interesting if u are having difficulties in the shooting areas of the game.For me the campaign was not at all challenging but it had some amazing moment which i am not gonna spoil for you. Even though the game has many weapons you can pretty much use a carbine repeater through the whole game with no issues ,which is one of the problems i had with the game.Looting an enemy or an area takes a lot of time because Arthur manually has to do loot each single area and can be frustrating some times.Horse gamplay is fantastic, the movements are just like real life and for the most part they can be controlled easily with a few cases where i had my horse going on its own, now i don't know if rockstar did this to make it more realistic or its just a bug.Horses have stamina and health bar.Bonding is a new mechanic in which it increases depending on how you treat your horse for instance cleaning them, feeding etc.As the bonding level increase the stamina and health of the horse is also increased in addition it can perform skids and side movements.Another new introduction is the camp area where all the gang members hangout and go about their lives.Arthur can talk to each member and can do small fetch quests for them.The gang reacts to how you behave to them.The camp has an upgradation mechanic where you can use in game money to upgrade the camp abilities like unlocking fast travel, better food for the members etc.There are mini games like poker,dominos, five finger fillet and black jack 21 all of which are fun to play.*Dead eye is still in the game and is still lovely and honor system also returns*STORYStory wise rdr2 takes place before the first once where you play as Arthur Morgan a member of the Dutch van der lined gang and shows how the age of civilization afted their lives. The game has hands down the best writing in the video game industry, Arthur is such a well written character that you actually start t care about him as the game progresses.Every piece of dialogue is masterfully written and executed ,each charecter feels unique and have different back stories. Side missions are also of excellent quality. The missions are fun to play there is humor and charm to the character which all in all adds to the experience.The only down side is the story starts to drag towards the end creating some missions which were not necessary.ONLINERdro is still new and is improving as of now i havent played much but its still a good aditional package that you are getting.It is not as good as gtao considering is fairly new whereas gtao has been around since 2013.From what i have played its very good ,the missions are fun do with friends and has a lot of side activities to keep you invested.There is room for improvement.Yes server issues still exists.VERDICTThe game is an absolute must play and i  highly recommend it.I have a lot of screenshots uploaded on my profile for rdr2 so if u want to see how the game looks you can check them out.Thank you.

author: Soloccidens
review: I decided to give RDR2 a try because of the protagonist's ability to pet horses and, honestly, to pass my time before the release of Cyberpunk 2077. Now that I played it upon release, I felt like I should come back and say something about RDR2.Boy was I never this wrong in my expectations. Maybe this is due to the fact that I never played a Rockstar game before, but I really didn't have many ideas on how this will unfold besides shooting bandits and stealing their horses. But the game was a hell of a ride.The story is extremely well-written and beautiful, the main character is probably my favourite protagonist so far: his actions are all making sense, there is little to no dissonance between his established personality and the world it lives in, and his development doesn't feel unjustified, rushed or faked, which is something I quite often experience in video game media. His voice acting is top quality and in general, I found Arthur a charming main hero, flawed and imperfect, but totally alive. In the beginning, I was worried about quite a big amount of supporting characters in Arthur's journey. I kept mixing Bill and John, Charles and Lenny, Hosea and reverend Swanson (!) and pretty much all female characters in their posse thinking they will be a minor decorum in our journey. And they ended up none of this, every minor character is great and their interactions are a treasure, and the amount of work put into their camp banter, responses, mimics and writing much be insane to feel this satisfying, From horses (I love my good girls!) to hunting, playing poker, chasing serial killers, antagonizing Micah in the camp or fishing in the frozen lakes of Grizzlies — this game does its job brilliantly and delivers an incredibly immersive and believable picture of living in America on the turn of the XIX century.I know this game is not a hidden gem in need of more recommendations, but if you are doubting and somehow reading this — make sure to give it a try. It is not cheap, but definitely worth the price. Albeit slow-passed and sometimes sluggish, it is a great story of Arthur Morgan, Dutch van der Linde (I would give this guy an Academy Award if this was a film!) and his gang which for me pushed the boundaries of open-world gaming and made it into a Coen brother meeting Faulker tale of a people trying to find their place in the world passing by.10/10 if only for the mission "Blood Feuds, Ancient and Modern", this is the best crafted scene in the video games I have ever seen.

author: Ary
review: Rockstar, they did it again. Gave us a game worth every penny. The compelling story which is more close to reality (of human nature), the excellent writing, amazing set of characters and a beautiful open-world that is alive this game has it all. And the protagonist? Mr. Arthur Morgan. The character development in this game makes you feel for him. How he realizes the truth behind things he otherwise followed blindly as the game progresses is done with no rush. Playing with High honor is the best way to play this game., although I wasn't a fan of this honor system at the beginning, it just adds that little touch of 'Realization' that Arthur goes through in the game. Took my time with the game and it was well worth it. This journey my friends, was an amazing one.
