author: jnbek
review: Disclaimer: I have not played the Online Mode, the 229 hours you see logged are for the Story Mode only. I am one of those pedantic players who prefers to open the map, play all the side missions as they come available and wander around checking out everything in my path, I also have not played this before on any other platform, so I can not offer any comparisons with the original platform release. I will start with the Story itself, the writing is top notch, there are very few holes in the story, each event has a purpose and serves to move the whole thing along. You're given the opportunity to shape your character's personality and will find yourself getting really attached to your characters and a number or the NPCs. I really like how well thought out the story lines were put together. I want to avoid spoiling anything but I really appreciate the zero tolerance for certain ways of thinking and how the consequences vary depending on the ideology of the NPC involved. Certain actions will be ignored if the NPCs ideology is repulsive, but if the NPC is forward thinking or well liked, the exact same actions will place you in a pretty difficult situation that will prove hard to escape from. I became very attached to my character and was very invested in how things turned out. Next is overall gameplay. I found the controls very intuitive and responsive using the keyboard and mouse. The older technology in the weaponry did pose some challenges initially, these are not GTA weapons with high fire rates, they reflect the technology of the day and you're required to work with these limitations accordingly. I was impressed with the attention to detail with the weaponry, how the horses and wagons handled, and the need to properly care for your horse as well as yourself. I did get somewhat annoyed with the idea that the temperature was 42F and I go and got my ass bitten by a snake, beings as a snake is mostly unable to move at those temperatures, but this was a minor annoyance. Some of the AI for the other wildlife was also a bit weird, but made for some rather humorous interactions. Overall the controls and the feel is very comfortable and easy to work with.The graphics are beautiful, again the attention to detail is remarkable. I ended up playing at a lower setting, for those with powerhouse graphics cards, the possibilities are endless. But even on the lower settings, every blade of grass has it's own unique movement depending on weather conditions, movement of animals, NPCs, etc... you can actually see the grass react when a snake is 20-30 feet off moving away from you. The clouds were natural, the rain was great, I got caught in a thunderstorm and I was legitimately blown away by the level of detail, the heavy rain affected long distance views even more so than a normal shower and the lightning effect blew my mind. Overall performance, 95% of the time, I had no problems with performance, there were occasional times when jumping on a horse and attempting to leave town in any kind of hurry, there were occasional 'blips'. I did have issues with crashes that a number of other reviewers have mentioned. I made no effort to try to fix anything, but almost on queue, after about 3.5 hours of playing, the game would crash. I did notice that it tended to be more common when using the Steam Overlay, or if a Steam Notification popped up particularly when attempting the above getting on a horse to leave town behavior. Once I stopped using the Steam Overlay, the occurrences of crashes were reduced significantly, there were a few days where I played 8-10 hours and did not have any crashes at all, only for the next day to have it crash an hour in. I was pretty annoyed by these crashes, but it is worth noting that never did I have the game crash when on a mission and I'm a pedantic saver, so I had no issues of losing any progress. I never went as far as disabling the Steam Overlay to see if that corrected the crashes, but I'm convinced that this is where the core problem lies.IMO this is the best game story wise that Rockstar has ever made to date. Rockstar never disappoints when it comes to graphics and detail in their games either, they push whatever hardware they develop to the max and make a beautiful presentation with a story you can get invested in. You will find plenty of easter eggs, mysteries and some things that will make you kinda sad and other things that will make you go "Oh wow!!" scattered all over the map, if you just go looking for them. Overall this is a 10/10 game, but the crashing force me to give it an 8.5/10.

author: Ebomb3210
review: ---{Graphics}---☐ You forget what reality is☑ Beautiful☐ Good☐ Decent☐ Bad☐ Don‘t look too long at it☐ MS-DOSThe Graphics in this game are some of the best I have ever seen. The environments are lush and the long draw distances make the game look gorgeous. I have fooled people before that screenshots from this game are real photos, that's how real it looks in some instances. While the shadows and reflections aren't quite as good as some of the new RTX titles, they still look amazing. The only place where the graphics fall short is the textures. They often looked blurry and I installed a mod that allowed me to apply a sharpness filter to fix this. ---{Gameplay}---☐ Very good☑ Good☐ It‘s just gameplay☐ Mehh☐ Watch paint dry instead☐ Just don'tDespite some wacky controls and mildly irritating small glitches, I really enjoyed the gameplay aspects of this game. Gunplay was fun and the missions had a lot of variety. The variety of the missions was great as you didn't expect the same exact thing with each missions. This was an especially good thing after recently playing a Ubisoft game. Some of the controls, specifically the horse controls, were mildly annoying. Sometimes my horse would just go in random directions and I failed missions as as result. I guess this is realistic, but not something I want when playing a video game. And because of the similarity of some controls, I sometimes found myself accidentally shooting or strangling someone instead of getting on my horse or initiating dialogue. The cover system was also bad, but not quite GTA V levels of bad. Another thing that may not be for everyone is the extreme level of realism in the game. There are several mechanics such as you character's and horse's weight, whether your character was hot or cold, and your horse's mood that could be mildly tedious at times to manage. While this may be a good thing for some as it can help with immersion, when I am playing a game I just don't want to worry about these things. In addition, Rockstar is kind of encouraging eating disorders with the ability for your character to lose weight by simply not eating or gain weight by spamming down an ungodly amount of snacks. Again. this mechanic isn't entirely bad, it just wasn't for me.  ---{Audio}---☑ Eargasm☐ Very good☐ Good☐ Not too bad☐ Bad☐ I'm now deafI was very pleasantly surprised by the music in this game. I have never played a western before this, and I was expecting more twangy country style music (narrow minded, I know). Instead, I got some of the best music I have ever heard in any digital work. There was unique music for each of the major missions that was uniquely fitting for that mission and the tone of the game. I found myself humming the songs even after I stopped playing the game. My favorite song in the game was "Unshaken," which Rockstar got D'Angelo to perform specifically for this game. The scenes with this song were some of the most beautiful scenes I have ever seen in gaming. In addition to the music, the ambient sounds, sound effects, and voice acting were all convincing and added to the game. ---{Audience}---☐ Kids☑ Teens☑ Adults☐ AllM rating is accurate. Plenty of violence, foul language, and heavy content to ensure that the game is not suitable for children. ---{PC Requirements}---☐ Check if you can run paint☐ Potato☐ Decent☐ Fast☑ Rich boi☐ Ask NASA if they have a spare computerWhile much better than what I read it was like at launch, this game still has some optimization issues and doesn't perform as I would like on my PC hardware. Combine this with the game being overall very demanding and you get mediocre framerates on all except the best hardware. I was playing at 4K on a combination of ultra, high, and medium settings and got anywhere from 55-80 FPS depending on the situation. I have an RTX 3090 and 3900XT, so my PC is a beast. Not bad performance and totally playable, but I would've liked a consistent 70+. Also got some random stutters, which was odd and mildly annoying. ---{Difficulity}---☐ Just press 'W'☑ Easy☐ Significant brain usage☐ Easy to learn / Hard to master☐ Difficult☐ Dark SoulsI didn't have trouble with this game at all. The abilities such as deadeye and dual wielding made it much easier and more fun. ---{Grind}---☐ Nothing to grind☐ Only if u care about leaderboards/ranks☑ Isn't necessary to progress☐ Average grind level☐ Too much grind☐ You‘ll need a second life for grindingFor the main story, there is no need to grind, as you get plenty of money from just the main story missions. In fact, I consistently found myself with too much money with nothing to spend it on. The only scenario I could see the need for grinding is if one was trying to collect every single item in the game, or just kept spamming down so many snacks that you'd buy out every single general store on the map. ---{Story}---☐ No Story☐ Some lore☐ Average☐ Good☑ Lovely☐ It‘ll replace your lifeThe story is by far the best part of this game. While a little slow at the beginning, it is absolutely worth getting through it as the middle and end of the story is phenomenal. The story is very emotional and can make you laugh and cry all withing the same mission. The characters are amazing, and I can easily see why some say that Arthur Morgan is the best video game protagonist ever made. His story arc along with the other characters' is beautifully written. It is extremely difficult to put into words just how beautiful the story of this game is. The main story consists of 6 chapters and 2 epilogue chapters. The epilogue, while good, felt like it was drawn out and was a bit of a letdown after the phenomenal main story. It was filled with somewhat mundane missions that involved scooping horse sh*t to constructing a house that could have easily been made into cut-scenes. However, from what I've read, the epilogue does an excellent job of setting up RDR1 if you plan on playing that (Sadly I won't play it unless Rockstar makes a PC port remaster as it is a last gen console exclusive, and I only have a PC). Mostly I feel that the epilogue could have been condenced into something around half to two thirds of the length that it was. All this said, I would consider this game a masterpiece, and the story is why. ---{Game Time}---☐ Long enough for a cup of coffee☐ Short☐ Average☑ Long☐ To infinity and beyondTook me 55 hours to beat the main story and epilogue with very few side missions (I honestly wish I had played a few more). ---{Price}---☐ It’s free!☑ Worth the price☐ If u have some spare money left☐ Not recommended☐ You could also just burn your moneyEasily worth the price for this masterpiece. Despite the fact that I got this game as a gift, I would easily pay full price for it knowing how amazing it is. ---{Bugs}---☐ Never heard of☑ Minor bugs☐ Can get annoying☐ ARK: Survival Evolved☐ The game itself is a big terrarium for bugsOnly a few mildly annoying bugs such as my horse always being irritated and the audio being extraordinarily quiet (easily remedied by simply turning up the volume), but nothing game breaking. ---{Verdict}---I am a die-hard science fiction fan. When I got this game as a gift from my friend I was genuinely not expecting to enjoy it as much as I did. Despite this being the polar opposite of the games I usually play, I enjoyed it equally as much if not more than any science fiction game. If I can get as much enjoyment from this game as I did, I genuinely believe that anyone can. There are very few games that I would be comfortable calling masterpieces, and this is one of them.

author: Zefyr
review: I purchased this game to play online with friends. The servers are unstable. We all get kicked multiple times a day and sometimes can't rejoin. Sometimes can't get your camp to spawn, even after switching lobbies. Have run into invincible animals that just kill us on multiple occasions. Sometimes can't mount any of my own horses. TONS OF CHEATERS! I've been in lobbies where every player there gets teleported to a single spot repeatedly and get bombed, set on fire, or had tons of bears spawned in one spot. It's a shame that this game is in this state, you can have a really great time when it works, but it seems to work less and less as time goes on.

author: [SK] Kaldaien
review: A game so good I own 4 copies. PS4 (muddy as all hell - don't buy), Xbox One X (okay, but has HDR issues), Rockstar Store (unwanted launcher), Steam (unwanted launcher, but with easier to see achievements).Game prefers CPUs with more cores due to file I/O thread design; lower core CPUs (especially CPUs without HyperThreading) will hitch during asset streaming. Ryzen CPUs are especially good at avoiding sharp 1% low events, but not so good at achieving maximum framerate. Given the game's absurd GPU taxing quality presets, the distinction between Intel and AMD's strengths largely don't matter. Just get a CPU with SMT (HyperThreading) and you'll avoid wild framerate fluctuations.The rest falls entirely on your GPU. My RTX 2080 Ti does 4K HDR @50 FPS with negligible variation at mostly high settings (2.2 GHz GPU, 7.4 GHz Memory). Expect to spend some quality time fiddling with settings until you get volumetric effects (you want these!) looking good and performance stable.Special K has limited support for this game. Threading, and SteamAPI features work, but the overlay (and framerate limiter) only works on NVIDIA hardware and only with the game running in HDR mode. No ETA on when Vulkan support will be complete for non-HDR / AMD configurations. If you do have an NVIDIA HDR setup, SK will take care of tonemapping screenshots for import into Steam.

author: SandNibbaSnake
review: A MASTERPIECE WITH AN AWFUL PC PORT. STAY AWAY UNTIL IT'S FIXED.PLAY IT FOR THE SINGLE-PLAYER NOT THE MULTI-PLAYER(10/10)PROS+Arthur Morgan is one of the best characters in ANY form of media, not just video-games. I  honestly cannot stress how incredible of a character he is.+A masterpiece of a story and one of the best stories ever told in ANY form of media. Seriously, it will leave you emotionally wrecked (in a fantastic way).  +Best open world so far with a ton of stuff to do (Cyberpunk may overtake it but who knows).+Beautiful soundtrack (Especially House building theme, Unshaken and That's the way it is).+Tense missions such as the train robbery missions.+Gorgeous visuals.+Incredible performances from all the cast.+Tahiti.+Great sound effects.+Incredible animations.+Extremely detailed and lifelike (Arthur’s pupils dilate, horses have shrinking balls, your gun performance changes on whether it is clean or dirty).CONS-Can feel clunky and over slow (I understand the game is MEANT to be slow but sometimes it can be a little too time consuming, especially for those of us who have jobs/school).-Guarma was cool but felt a little out of place (On a side-note Rockstar NEEDS to make a pirate game).-Bad optimization and performance-Game design is outdated and most missions end the same way.-Intro feels like one large tutorial but at least it serves as a good introduction to the characters and story. Don't skip it.-Despite the animations being the best we have seen in a video game, they can be a little too long and slow (Modders will probably resolve this).-No single-player DLC so far nor is any being planned (I am still hoping Rockstar surprises us).-Online is getting better but still lacks variety and can get stale after a while.Overall score:10/10- It may have flaws but it is still a true masterpiece.BUY FULL PRICE!

author: Yogo
review: Once again a huge AAA title with good graphics and attention to detail, but disappointing in every other aspect.I will try to keep it the review as slim as possible, so let's dig into the pros of the game first. Don't worry, they aren't many.+ Great attention to detail (as I said in the beginning). The world is full of wildlife, the vegetation is diverse. The cities are bustling with life,the people are always doing something - they broom their property, talk to each other, smoke, drink, play cards; there are small animals like cats and dogs,it's just so nice and comfy.+ The scenery is very beautiful. What I really appreciate is that each area you go through feels completely different and has a unique atmosphere,attached to it. Jungles, forests, snowy mountains, beaches, you have it all.+ Amazing voice-acting on Arthur Morgan. The main character is pretty decent, to be honest.+ You can grow a huge beard and have a cool hat.Well... To be honest I was expecting the pros to be a little more than that, but truly I don't see anything else that would classify as a 'pro'.Let's see what's up with the cons.- Incredibly slow and mundane gameplay. I understand that the game is meant to be enjoyed slowly, but it's too much. I thought Red Dead was a game, where you are supposed to robtrains and banks and cause chaos. However, most of the missions are just a long-ass stroll with a bit of gunnin' here and there. The looting animations are soooooooooooooslow, too - it takes ages looting a pile of bodies or skinning an animal.- Pretty much a non-existent story. Basically, you're a part of a gang and do errand-boy stuff, so you can get your boss a nice new home on an exotic island.- Way too many characters. I don't know the names of 75% of Red Dead's characters, because they appear like 2 times in the whole game. Not only that,but they are so badly made - they are either very bland and completely lacking any kind of personality or they are so stupidly stereotypical, thattheir way of acting feels forced as hell. I didn't get emotionally attached to any of them- Every single gun feels absolutely the same. There is literally no reason for you to own more than 1 repeater, they all shoot at the same speed and have similar damage. Even if they didn't, you're always aiming for the head, right? Why would you even care what damage they have if you always 1-tap your enemy. The revolvers are cool, but they are useless. The customization options are terrible as well.- Nobody, except for blacks, say 'niġger'. When it comes to that word, it's always substituted with 'blackie' or 'darkie'. Now I understand that the slavery is over, butdo you REALLY think that after it was abolished and everyone magically started acting like they've always known it was wrong and are totally against it? I don't think so.- Karma system... Are you for real? ... This is a game, where you are the BAD guy, a villain, a robber and a murderer and you put a KARMA system??? I remember RDR1 also having such system,which pissed me off back then as well. So basically - I go to a town, rob a bank, kill 250 police officers and then I go into another town, greet 5 people and my Karma goes up? K.If there was a respect system - that would have been a different story.- Atrocious horse physics. Your horse tips over the tiniest little pebble on the road which can result into it breaking its neck.- Boring missions as a whole.- Dull soundtrack.- The legendary animal clothing is the ugliest abomination in the world.- The inventory management sucks. Too many items doing the exact same thing. Keep these things simple! Why would I need 100 different kinds of food that restore the same stat?- Failed core system.- Glitches, bugs, crashes, launching issues and horrible optimization.- Terrible Ultimate edition items and addons for a stupidly high price.Well, there we go. I'm sorry if you don't agree with me, but that's how I really feel.Everyone has the right to have an opinion and just know that I genuinely feel happy for you, if you are enjoying the game, although I sure as heck didn't!Also.....SOMEBODY ONCE TOLD ME THE WORLD WAS GONNA HANG MEI AIN'T THE SHARPEST OUTLAW AROUNDTHEY WERE LOOKIN KINDA DUMBWITH THEIR SEMI-AUTO GUNSAND THE PINKERTON BADGE ON THEIR JACKETSWELLWE WON'T STOP RUNNINAND WE CAN'T STOP RUNNINBACK TO THE PLANAND I HIT THE TRAIN GUNNINDIDN'T MAKE SENSE NOT TO LIVE FOR CASHYOUR PLAN GOES WRONGAND YOUR FRIENDS DIE FASTSO MUCH TO STEALA GANG TO FEEDSO WHAT'S WRONG WITH A BANK ROBBERYIF YOU DOUBT ME YOU'RE NEVER SAFEYOU'LL NEVER MAKE IT IF YOU LOSE FAITHHEY NOW, YOU'RE AN OUTLAWPUT YOUR MASK ONGET PAIDHEY NOW, YOU'RE IN MY GANGFOLLOW MY PLANHAVE FAITHBUT ALL THAT WILD WEST IS GONEONLY THE ISLANDS HAVE MY MANGOES

author: 1MantisPhoenix
review: I want to give this a superior recommendation on multiple fronts. See my stream on RDR2 Below; Hot air balloons, Horses, Prison Breaks, Bank robberies, tuberculosis, family feuds, snitches, Dutch's orders, ramblings, and keeper of his insanity. Buying this, you are in for an extremely amazing journey, more than 60 hours GUARANTEED STORY MODE, and travelling. Also up to you to prioritize, but travel = fast = your horse, or the horses you find, etc.This is 'My Little Pony' For adults. 99% of your RDR2 life is with your horse. You are nothing without your horse. Life in 1899 revolved around you having horsepower. Ain't no outlaw without horsepower.This game is marketed as 3rd Person Cowboy simulator:: BUT: :You can play first person cowboy!There is fast travel and this is how: It also becomes a very beautiful screensaver. You mark on the map where you want to travel, so you have the red mark, and then you hold V, enter cinematic mode, in the world, so that your horse navigates to the end mark with automation. You can hold shift to sprint, or tap it, etc. but otherwise, you can sip a drink, chill, relax, listen to the ambient sounds of the game. Escapism at its finest.The bugs noticed: 3rd person on   a horse, Arthur keeps putting a gun away that you are not holding, as it's holstered, and he keeps doing the animation as though he's putting it away when holding shift, and turning around corner, to the right, sucks, but doesn't break the game.Game breaking bug: played up until like 38% - Vulkan. I searched for 22 dinosaur bones, then the next day, the game will NOT start. Not safe mode, not altered settings. Only changing vulkan to DX12 fixed it. Now the game has longer loading times, etc. DX12 is a pain. Vulkan had that one bug. Loading into Chapter 3/ near the end, was not possible.You play Arthur Morgan, there will be lassoing of people -taking hostages, hunting animals in the wild, bows and arrows, guns, headshots, missions rankings- upon completions/bronze/silver/gold/R* ranks.You have three stats affecting you and the horse, which is health points and energy points, and you the gunslinger has a dead eye, where you squint for the best shots. The guns are cool, expensive back in the day, and very customizable. The mission types feels almost endless. I played block domino's, went bounty hunting, story witness searching to confirm something really happened and of the first  4, 2 were not crazy enough to mess with Arthur. The time of this era, feels like community building where everyone works together. There's so many letters to find, with small details. Or a location of where something is going wrong, and you are there to help fix it. Things go wrong. It's super fun. And that's just the way life is.  It's incredibly deep <Story Mode> You're on the run - I didnt play RDR 1 - so I dont know if it's connecting to Blackwater that way.. :/0 crashes in vulkan once all the settings are optimized, played for 5 hours straight last night. <28~29 December 2019> and used only like 1kwh. Fans required for gpu 45% as its definitely had the most impact on it. This goes hotter than pubg if I don't put fans on 45 instead of say 35, it can easily stay at 70^cFirstly - the Vulkan. It's smooth sailing. <latest Nvidia Drivers are smoother than 412...or something there> <plays better>It's running like a dreamNext, the Rust programming language- which comprises of vulkan ensures secure coding on the system it runs on. It can't even be malicious for you, unless R* permitted that release, This is one of the most beautiful looking games.  Correction. THIS IS THE DEFINTION OF THE NEXT GENERATION OF GAMING> AGAIN!> Always Rockstar doing this amazing kind of work.The way the horses legs move  in and through snow is awe inspiring. Jaw dropping. The snow on the surfaces are also delicious. Character faces, textures of clothing, furs, cottons, so much tree-tessellating, it's just beautiful everywhere you look.The Faces, The expressions, the snow, the terrain, the backdrops, the sky around you, - Although it's quickly changing, it will constantly make familiar places seem foreign as you see it in a different light. It's exquisite, and with High Tessellation <Not Ultra-  but capable> - I still prefer FXAA Off, as the jagged-ness feels cheapened, where as no AA== Western, hardcore, everything. The Textures on High or Ultra -- Or even medium- to low - if your PC_ is capable of Vulkan rendering. You Require AT LEAST 4GB Free Video RAM - to let the game run without crashes. Borderless Windowed <Default::VULKAN> _ Change to FullScreen - For Issues - With Alt-Tabbing. It's not recommended for this game anyway.Even with it installed on a SSD, there's a lot of content. <BUG> Loading- into Menu - Game - Whether you choose Q || E - if you cancel and say you do not wish to quit, after a R* Game, Service - Cannot connect error - you are stuck in an Infinite Loop - of loading- the Gun Barrel -If you say not to quit the game, you need to do it through task manager, or taskbar, right click, or on the cross, of your Alt+Tab Menu's Either way- This is meaning you need to be online to play - even story mode <--- Unfair. I paid the price R* _ i desire to play the game in the 15000Hour comfort of my life Not On The Internet. Connections Aside:REDDEADREDEMPTION_GAME ENGINE:IF This is the engine that will present GTA VI to us, I am dedicated until the end.  For the first time, I supported a developer shortly after release <20% Off>. It's rare that I ever buy a game so early, but I raised the money to go and do it. VISUALS<The way your eyes adjust when you walk into or outside of buildings is already a game-changer. The negatives are a high price, and the minimum GPU's Requirements are going to be a pain. This Game will probably cause you to upgrade your PC< but when you can play it, the success and joy of playing is going to be beyond you.You also cannot alt-tab around- or leave the game idle for like 10 minutes.VULKAN Is the way forward - May Vulkan API outwit and secure everything in the battle Versus DX12 ->  It's way better mechanically speaking :D  <360FPS constant - Vulkan - GTX1070 - Zotac - Amp Extreme - -Best for your power bill too, because vulkan knows everything about overheads management.I7 6700 - DDR3 16GB RAM, and the game runs like a dream. Recommended purely out of the many joy's of being a cowboy. You are going to be riding your horse and coming over hills, and seeing fog in the swamp below, and it will take your breath away.There are soooo many places,. author: Saryn
review: Honestly one of the best games ever made, I first got this game in 2018 for the Xbox One and completed the story. It can change you personally if you make the right choices in game. I got it again for PC in late 2020 and it's just great fun to play the story over again. This is easily one of Rockstar's greatest achievements and I'm glad it won two Steam awards for 2020. I will recommend this game to anyone who loves playing story more than online. The music, the gameplay, the characters....there is a lot that can make you really immersed with this game.10/10 You deserve it, Rockstar.

author: '.The Sev.'
review: Pros: Beautiful, era-accurate, immersiveCons: Game runs like absolute garbage on high-end PCs, I can't even imagine how it runs on lower end ones. Numerous community 'optimization guides' prove just how badly this game runs, as half of the graphics settings have inane and arbitrary performance hits. I can't stress enough how suffocating this game's performance has a tendency to be. Narrative pacing is so slow it is almost unbearable. Numerous major online bugs still haven't been fixed after half a year, and continuous server issues have plagued the game since release, even on consoles. It almost seems like Rockstar put forth an obligatory, cursory effort to port this game to PC and then moved on.I personally feel that Rockstar screwed the pooch on this. Joke's on me though, I didn't ask for a refund within the 2 hours of 'gameplay' it took for me to adjust the graphics settings just to get the game to run at a quasi-stable 60fps.

author: Kraut
review: Red Dead Redemption 2 is a fun game no matter what mode you play, story or online (or both). I originally bought this game because I love cowboys and westerns and it did not fail me. The story is amazing, many touching moments and the freedom of choice is something I adore about this game. You can either be known as a terrible man or a very honorable one. The characters are acted very well and you can see them as almost real individuals. Arthur Morgan is great, that's all I need to say. There is never a dull moment in the story and you can play it however you like! Online is fun, yet there are many downsides. Hackers, Modders, very grindy, glitches, etc. If you want to play online, do so with a friend or a group. I stayed up countless nights messing around with my friend(s) and having the time of my life. If you have none of those or like to be a lone wolf, online is a great time waster and I have found myself spending hours listening to music and hunting.  The game goes on sale often so I'd say wait for the sale, but if you really want to, it is worth the full price. 10/10 love this game and I bet you will to.

author: Gregg
review: First off don't make the mistake to simply judge a rating based on time played. We can discuss the finer details of the foolishness of such an assumption in the comments if you want to.This game is like being in an abusive relationship. There are some good qualities to it but man... does it get ugly.I won't deny that the SP content is fantastic but from a technical point of view RDR2 is a mess. RDO is even worse.We get loading screens that won't stop, flickering screens that require a restart, inventory is inconsistent, base camp won't show up or disappear mid game, pelts disappear fresh after skinning, inability to mercy kill an animal after a fumbled shot without reducing carcass quality (which is strange since it exists in SP though), despawning corpses over a ridiculously small range, broken towns where for some reason you can't use their services anymore, randomly killed bounties (they were fine a second ago, I turn around... DEAD... Red Dead I guess), completed missions that won't get registered, stuck animations that break the game (particularly entering the moonshine shack), inability to pick up bounties therefore not being able to finish the mission, inability to start new missions because "You have done a job too recently." which was half an hour ago, slow transaction of trades when selling a lot of items (Processing Transaction...), slow crafting (similar to the Processing Transaction bug), and a couple of visual glitches.To my surprise that became quite the list and I have only written down the common issues I've encountered on a regular basis the last couple of weeks. Now one could argue that some of those issues might get fixed over the course of the next couple of decades. Given how quickly Rockstar deals with exploits to dupe items or gold it is painfully obvious that gameplay issues aren't a priority.Then there are some questionable or disappointing gameplay design decisions. A big chunk of content is locked behind the premium currency, namely the 4 roles. It's 15 gold per role, 25 for the moonshiner. That's a lot for a full price title. There are ways to get gold through gameplay, even if slowly.Bounty missions (once purchased) provide gold, based on how long it takes you to finish it. The longer it takes you, the more gold you get... wow... just, wow.If you thought you could play RDO to play a co-op PvE version of the game... well... no. PvP is definitely the focus and you're part of it whether you like it or not. Setting yourself up for defensive play does next to nothing to protect you from other players. The idea is that they can't lock on to you (gamepad controls), do significantly less damage and can't crit. It still only takes about two shots to get killed. Granted, thankfully you don't lose anything when dying aside from being respawned somewhere in the rough vicinity, which can easily cause you to fail missions though. Really, all "Defensive Mode" does is exclude you from missions that have a PvP element in them, which is the vast majority. Story missions set you to offensive play but conveniently don't put you back.Is there any way to protect you from griefers and trolls you might wonder?Well, we have the parley mechanic which protects you from getting shot by that player for a limited time. Why on earth this isn't default for defensive play is beyond me. After the timer expires you're free to be harassed again.The other option is to press charges which gives the offender a whoppin' 50 cents bounty and increases his hostility level for a limited time. The latter means his radar blip is visible from further away and at high hostility he gets to be attacked by anyone without repercussions. I'm not sure how that is punishment for someone who clearly wants PvP, yet does not want to play one of the many particular game modes that exist for that exact purpose.Out of 10 player interactions 8 are bad experiences. You might say that the devs are not responsible for player actions, which is true but they do provide the ground rules and environment. Hate the game not the player is quite an apropriate saying in this case.The player issues could be easily resolved by having private sessions/servers which isn't possible. While I understand there are reasons for it, people who just don't want to play with randos are simply out of luck.You can't even start the story missions without having to get on the matchmaking queue. I understand that it should be an option but I can't even attempt to solo the missions? Actually, you can if the game feels like it but you still have to wait in matchmaking limbo for a few minutes and I'm not sure if it even works for missions that have a 2-4 player recommendation. After being stuck in matchmaking for 10 minutes I gave up.Alright, I'm done for now. People probably won't even read all this anyway...

author: ForzaNostra
review: I love the game, its refreshing, its a great game and the open world is probably one of the best out there for PC...That being said get used to seeing the "Activation Error"  window popup repeatedly every time you try and launch this game, you literally have to try and launch the game several times from the Rockstar Games Launcher. also, here's something that I find bothersome, you cannot play this game offline, because you are required to sign up to Rockstar's online "social club" unless you are logged in, you cannot access the game, now I'd understand this restriction if you wanted to access the multiplayer game mode, but this also applies to single player. Don't get me wrong, if I didn't have to deal with the whole Rockstar Games Launcher, and I didn't have to deal with the Activation error window, which literally takes you back to the desktop, I would certainly recommend this... but as things stand, maybe test your luck, some people may not find this too frustrating, others may not have any problems at all. hopefully Rockstar gives us the chance to play the single player game mode while being offline and not have to worry about Rockstar's online interface. --------------------------------------updateAfter several months after purchase Rockstar has not made any improvements to the initial problems I had with this game. It has gotten worse actually, now the game won't launch, verifying the game's files and re-installing the rockstar launcher, the game itself does not fix the issue, the game fails to launch consistently at every step... DO NOT BUY THIS GAME, Rockstar does not support their PC ports.------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------3rd Update... After trying several times to get a hold of costumer support, which was painful, the contact by email feature is the only one that works (some times), the direct chat and the call feature for how to get in touch with Rockstar customer support DO NOT WORK. I was replied on my email that I have to delete every single rockstar related folder on the C-Drive, delete my Steam Folder, delete any other rockstar games, they even gave me the file directories for what to delete...deleting your steam folder also deletes every other steam game you have installed, so good luck with that... ♥♥♥♥ THIS COMPANY your launcher does not work, you make it impossible to play these games' singleplayer mode offline, and provide worst customer support than EA?!? I know its popular to Trash EA games for their recent fumbles, but they have better customer support than this trash

The picturesque Old West landscape features breathtaking cities, vistas, mountains, and rivers, teeming with wildlife and people alike, with graphics and visuals incomparable to competitors. The sound design and score are worth their weight in gold, flawless, be it your first playthrough or your twentieth.The story is easily the game's pièce de résistance, if there can be one. The genre-defining narrative is a tribute to one of America's greatest time periods. The level of depth and attention to detail is phenomenal. While it may seem simple enough on the surface, an outlaw's tale in a dog eat dog world, the true somber nature of friendship, loyalty, and betrayal are told bittersweet irony by bittersweet irony. This meticulously handcrafted masterpiece isn't just a game of the decade, it's

author: Parzalai
review: Simply put, this game excels in an insane amount of aspects - Visuals, Animations, Sounds, Activities and most importantly, Story.I've completed the game on release on my PS4 and I'm in the process of replaying it on PC. The game at first had enamoured me in 2018. Before playing this game, I never really thought of video games as Art Forms, just some fun stuff to do when you're bored.After completing the game, I was left contemplating it for a full week, I seriously had this stuck in my mind, especially the ending of the story. Below is a basic summary.- Bad gameplay loop, controls can be sluggish and annoying to use, missions are usually shoot shoot and very linear, like every single other R* game.- #SAVEREDDEADONLINE : The Online mode has major potential but is infested with unfair and stupid ass Micro - Transactions and the promised, advertised major DLCs ended up being MONTH LONG DOUBLE EXP.... Online grind is hit or miss fun, with friends it's great.- Performance, could be improved, DLSS does a good bit but even on a 3070, ultra @ 1080p can drop to 30fps and sometimes the game enters a weird broken loop where I'm playing on 2 - 20 fps.- The number one highlight of this game, . To sum it up, the story is beautiful, heartbreaking, action-packed, daunting, and just revering. I speak fully about the story at the end of this review.- Gwafiks, game look near photo-realistic, the sky is favourite of mine, it looks so real. . On a serious note though, the way snow crushes under your foot, the you see your horses muscles flex in their running, the astutely detailed gore and death animations with a GTA IV - esque ragdoll. The way water refracts and reflects, sculpting itself to your movements, simply great.- Animations, the type of thing that you never notice, but adds so much to gameplay, the horses, feel like horses, the tackle animation is lifelike asf, the way your character stabs someone is gruelling, just an insane amount of detail to idle animations, eating, fishing and so much more.- Mechanics, mainly coming from RDR1, the Dead Eye system is amazing and really fits the cowboy shoot off theme, additionally, R* increases the immersion by having a health system, eat to much, phat boi, eat nothing, skinny twig. There's a hair growth system, your hair grows with time. There are 3 cores, Health - Stamina - Dead Eye + The same for your horse exc Dead Eye. You keep these cores 100% by eating food and the more you uses it, the higher your capacity is for these cores.- Voice Acting (Actors/ress') / Sounds, are eloquent, they are masterfully made, from the snow crushing, mud crushing, to the daunting voice of Angry Dutch, all the actors were perfectly casted and R* did a great job sourcing out the sounds for every minute detail.- Open World / Activities are insane, there's so much to do from the hunting, fishing, general shops and games to the stranger missions and collectable hunts the game offers, this will keep you on the game for hours I cannot wait to 100% this game. The Online also offers additional content such as the story mode and train heists, but your fun will end if you finish all the mission, being left to do GTA Online grinding (Cargo, so on...). Mods also offer a good bit, such as purchasable properties and more, but these are not supported by R(*)ckstar so you will get banned if you play online whilst having these installed.You play as Arthur Morgan, in the Van Der Linde Gang of which RDR1s John Marston was also in. The times are comin, American Civilisation and Law is conquering Native America and Outlaws / Gangs are slowly dying, The Van Der Linde Gang is of the little remaining gangs being hunted down by the Pinkertons (Lawmen / Police).You go through the journey of violence and tranquillity, maturing and realising the wrongs of your own and people around you. The devs used music, cinematography and voice acting to absolutely pull the player into the life of Arthur Morgan, putting you beyond any other media form - This isn't a movie, you don't  the story, you  the story, you decide what type of person you want to be, adding to the replayability.The story has strong portrayals of mental health and intra-personal conflicts, confronting fears and worries, accepting them and overcoming them. The story sort of puts you through a philosophical awakening of material living over faithful living, letting you live a Machiavellian life or move like a true Stoic in trying times. Rockstar is very known for their comedic and satirical portrayal of modern America and the flaws around it, most notable GTA V - facing the flaws of the government system and corrupt officials, as well as commercial submission and the TikTok life. But in RDR2 R* take a rightfully need turn darker to an early 1900s America, facing the stark truth of how Native America was snatched, aggressively and forcefully by colonisers. The story faces issues of racism, sexism and colonialism in its Main and Side Missions. The USA, the one that was the Great One, is the enemy, it rears its ugly head of capitalism and technological dominance in Saint Denis, the hub of America and "Civilisation". Rockstar and it's directors do a great job in being the one out of a hundred that go the way that usually doesn't get done out of sheer fear of backlash.Simply put; For me, Red Dead Redemption 2s Story is single-handedly the best story I've ever played, this may be different for you - I mean, I haven't played every game, there may be another masterpiece out there - But, currently for me, the Story is amazing and memorising, it's a must-have.

author: Nathan Brighwood
review: The campaign is fantastic, but the bigger part of the multiplayer is atrocious and easily has one of the worst currency systems ever built. If you don't grind day and night or become a hacker, it's impossible to make enough money and gold. You need to eat like a pig to keep your stats from falling, horses are extremely needy, which would be fantastic for the campaign part, but in a multiplayer you have to keep hunting and spend your hard-earned money on ammunition just to keep you alive. So your savings would be almost nothing.It's nothing like many other MMOs out there after a few hours of play online it gets extremely repetitive and annoying to continue there are many other games that have better ECO systems

author: SupremeLagger
review: I own the ultimate edition and have completed the story, all stranger missions and 90% overall.By far the best single player story game I have ever played. So much to explore, hunt, rob, etc. The horse mechanics are simply amazing. The map is simply the largest one I have ever seen.Rockstar Games really did it and I really want to play Red Dead Redemption Remastered on PC before they release another game say, RDR3 or GTA6.Compared to GTA5 this game is infinitely better in terms of story mode, but the online mode of RDR is probably not as well established as GTA Online.As for RDR online, the experience is amazing. Some aspects in online are actually better than story. However the servers are not working half the time. I wish they made it better.To play this game you will need a strong PC though, and atleast a large SSD since this game is 120GB. That said I really want everyone to experience this masterpiece atleast once.

author: matty
review: I don't really write reviews for games, because who ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ cares about what I have to say, but Red Dead Redemption was one of my favorite games when I still played on consoles. I pre-ordered and played it as soon as it was listed on Steam, and then released. No shame in that, it's hard to say no to a single player Rockstar game, but...This game is essentially, in my eyes, Rockstar's swan song. They're not as interested in single player content anymore, with this game and Grand Theft Auto 5 having ample opportunity for more content through DLC. However, their eyes are now dead set on multiplayer, which is a shame because their games are absolute powerhouses for single player. This is further cemented by the fact the last strong arm talent, Dan Houser, left the company last year.Beforehand, the "Rockstar Launcher" is absolute hot garbage. Pirate the game if you bought it already, it's a better experience.The story is a prequel, and it's so ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ good. It has so much damn content, I've been on a single chapter for almost a week because I'm trying to collect everything before moving on for a 100% playthrough that I'm doing more recently, which really says how much there is to do, before you even realize there are 6 chapters PLUS an epilogue. If you're not trying to 100% and collect everything that could be missed, you could probably finish the story in a day or two, but you really shouldn't try speed running it because you may slow down later in the chapters kinda confused after you skipped all the story dialogue. This isn't a Pokemon game, so, don't treat it like one.When you get over the story and want something else to do, it's basically a "wild" west sandbox. Shoot someone? you can do that. Shoot near someone? Definitely. Shoot the ground? The ground doesn't care. Shoot someone while they're shooting you shooting them? Yeah. You get the idea. Hunt animals to shoot someone with? Why not. This is a Rockstar game, so you can have some mods to improve the enjoyment of the sandbox. Look at Rampage trainer with a decent spawner system, or Lenny's Simple Trainer for a simple trainer. The hint is in the name.The graphics are pretty good for how I play, a mix of Medium-Low, with Ultra textures on. It doesn't look amazing, but I really favor higher framerates instead of looks. I've had issues with grainy shadows but they've mostly gone away, save for some specific instances. You can turn that off by turning Soft Shadows to Low, or Shadows on High with MSAA off.Multiplayer. I ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ hate it. Coming from someone who played Hour 1 Grand Theft Auto Online. I hate both of them. Grand Theft Auto Online and Red Dead Online are not games, they're literally why Rockstar doesn't care about single player anymore. Why make investing stories when you can just create an online mode with microtransactions to make simple money? I don't want to believe it's Rockstar who decided on this, and my rose-tinted glasses wants to blame Take-Two, but I don't want to deal with either of them. I'm going to add my Grand Theft Auto Online experience here, too, since it'll help to add understanding to my reasoning.I'll be honest, I cheated online in both of them. It's so commonplace, and it's the only way to make both of them a fun experience, otherwise you have to grind and grind. Grand Theft Auto 4's online was fun because you can just hop on in, and boom you can have fun. There was no grinding or anything, it was (for pc players, can't say the same for console) a fun online sandbox. When Grand Theft Auto 5 online came out, I was doing the first race the same minute it was released on Xbox 360. I played it a bunch, grinding that Martin mission to get a high-end apartment. It was alright, until they nerfed the ever-living ♥♥♥♥ out of the rewards from that mission and Gerald's mission. When it came out for PC, it was an alright experience, their promised heist experience that was met with questionable response not really rewarding much was finally out at that point, and playing around with some friends was humorous at first. It finally hit the "fun" status when I cheated in hundreds of millions of dollars to afford any kind of enjoyment that their games usually came with, and subsequently banned for it.But when Red Dead Online came out, same problem. Grinding stupid ♥♥♥♥. A friend and I just cheated a few hundred gold bars just to do any kind of fun activity when the major stuff like Collector, Trader, Bounty Hunter, and Moonshiner were available. There's a fifth one, but I just can't be arsed go back on to play it. After we got to do stuff like that together, the actual game became more fun, nudging to the fact that you can bypass the "treasure hunting gold nugget" grind by buying their... gold bars for real money. How fun. I'd rather be permanently banned from online. Rockstar's games aren't really meant to be grindy online experiences, that's already reserved for Runescape and other RPGs like Destiny 2.They've also added a battle pass system, for some godforsaken reason. Battle passes are annoying, and just add to the disdain I have for online. I got the husky for my camp, and Arthur's hat a few passes ago, and I basically dipped. Huskies are my favorite dog breed.The last nail in the coffin for both of these online modes is... the exclusives. Both of them suffer from exclusive online items. Grand Theft Auto Online has cars, weapons, and Benny's. Red Dead has some weapons, horses, and saddles. You can get them in single player, but they have some issues when it comes to saving. An example would be . There's so much content that they already have in the game that they could just make available in single player, but they are absolutely content on preventing any of it being available for the single player sandbox. That is absolutely infuriating, and to see it happen twice is already a break of integrity to their next games. Why play them if you can't enjoy everything there without needing to use mods to just be able to access it? Why do you need mods in the first place?Let's not hide the fact that Take-Two (and maybe Rockstar) tried killing OpenIV a few years ago, and more recently DCMAing mods that add maps from previous games. How long until the Nuevo Paraiso mods for Red Dead Redemption 2 get DCMA'd by them because it added content from the first Red Dead Redemption? I can't be the judge of if it's fair use or not, I'm just some guy.Mods. Rockstar games are more known for their mods. Red Dead Redemption 2 has some mods, like ones that improve the gun metal, and there's an upscale mod for engravings and woods on guns to make them look better. There's the two trainers I pointed to earlier as well, and the like. This game, however, just doesn't really have a major modding scene yet. It's still a bit early to tell, and it doesn't help that OpenIV still hasn't been able to fully decode the game files yet. A bunch of them are still named in hash when trying to view the files. It can't be fully decked out, yet, but hopefully soon. There are some stuff there, though. I also have the Basically, Red Dead Redemption 2 is a great prequel. I recommend you play it for the single player, only. Do not play multiplayer, it's not worth the grind nor the time. I guess I can finally stop hoping for Bully 2 now, as well.

author: CBiscuit456
review: What a journey... This game will absolutely blow your mind. Not only is it incredibly detailed down to the blades of individual grass and swing of trees on a stormy afternoon, but really well thought out and researched through and through down to tobacco spittin and whiskey. Rockstar has yet again proven themselves as a worthy Game developer and publisher as well as a true knack for the arts as they take you to the wild wild west! The story is well written and takes you through  without the need to rush nor does it ever make you feel the need to press on. Six full chapters and an incredible two-part Epilogue that will take you on  a ride through the main protagonist eyes, Mr Arthur Morgan, A true Western "cowboy" if you will. A detailed story full of laughter, crime and decisions that will not only change your honour, but will make you question your actions as you progress! It truly is a story you will want to experience more than once with consecutive plays not only to discover all the game has to offer, but to really get to know the world Rockstar has created! Sit, relax and enjoy the ride.I take personal offence when people tell me that Red Dead Redemption 2 is too hard to get into because my only reply is “Alright, well, you’re missing out on one of the greatest stories ever told, but you do you.”Much of Red Dead 2’s strength lies in its incredibly realised characters, especially Arthur Morgan who might be my favourite fictional character to ever exist. Another theme present here that I’ve mentioned  is that the story, writing, and characterisation succeeds due to its subtlety.Arthur is relatively reserved, he doesn’t want to be mixed up in the drama of the rest of the Van der Linde gang and almost everything in the story just happens to or around him and he’s forced to deal with it. The fact that Red Dead Redemption is already a masterclass in video game writing and we just added gorgeous graphics and a new fantastic character means Rockstar were set up for success and they continued to prove themselves.There’s a deep pathos and empathy you feel for Arthur throughout his journey and experiences meaning you’re unlikely to forget Red Dead 2’s story any time soon.The open world is available as your playground but returning regularly to the linear story at the heart of the branching sub missions and activities is essential to carrying you toward the story’s grand conclusion. The story is riddled with tension as allegiances evolve and crumble, plans fall apart, and Arthur discovers there are some things that can’t be resolved with a gun or any amount of money.Your deep connection with Arthur is what winds you into every plot point and NPC interaction. You’ll be cheering at every win and have your heart aching at every loss and it’s just fantastic.1) The graphics (OMG)2) The Animations (Incredibly detailed and life-like) 3) The story (mouthwatering) 4) The Characters (Some you love, some you hate, but they work) 5) Exploration (Huge map packed with detail)6) Hunting (Requires giving a ♥♥♥♥ and implementing strategies) 7) Horses (Realism, training and companionship) 1) You need to take your time to fully enjoy what RDR2 has to offer.ex: DON'T fast travel! You WILL miss a lot! 2) Some mechanics can be tedious but rewarding. (Does make it truly realistic though) ex: Picking up ammo and shopping per item. 3) Wanted system can be dodgy at times.ex: Riding into someone by accident can cause a small bounty.  1) For full immersion a decent CPU and GPU are needed. ex: Playing on a RTX2080 Super with a Core I5 9700KF OC Avg frames 50-70 Ultra Quality  RDR2 is a game you will never forget. It pays such great homage to the first game and will immerse you in a world that is full of life! The story really gets to you emotionally and you will often find yourself getting lost in. I have spent hours crafting and looking for the perfect animal pelt and because it is so realistic with its planning and strategies. I have also really enjoyed all the activities from the gambling to bounty hunting and even horse training!!! Get ready for the western experience you have been waiting for.... Just buy it. It's truly worth it even at full price!

author: The_GarlicBread
review: I NEVER THOUGHT I CAN HATE SOMEONE SOOOOO MUCH...!!THEN I MET ROCKSTAR LAUNCHER.. IT"S THE WORST THING EVER CREATED.Makes Me wait nearly a complete minute before it loads... only then game will load and YOU MUST ALWAYS BE ONLINE.. while High Seas Version WORKS OFFLINE and.. just double click and LAUNCHED..!!ALSO.. PIRATED VERSION CAN BE MODDED TO CONTROL DLSS SHARPNESS and EXPOSURE which btw the developers has just cranked up to highest level in this stupid DRM VERSION...!!MOREOVER... PIRATED VERSION HAS LESSER RAM AND VRAM UTILISATION THAN THIS VERSION..and GIVES SAME FPS...!! GIVING BETTER TEMPERATURES AND STABILITY. ( LESSER FPS SPIKES )then I switched to DX12 from VULKAN as Vulkan was blurry and soft compared to DX12 which was Crisp and fine image... BUT BUT SOOOOO MANY BUTS....ERROR_GFX_STATE Comes randomly while using DX12...Tried _ignorepipelinecache... new drivers... clean install...everything... nothing happened...THEN I CONTACTED ROCKSTAR SUPPORT and guess what... THEY TOLD ME TO UNISTALL ROCKSTAR LAUNCHER... I did but the Live chat crashed while uninstalling that stupid launcher and now it says click on START CHAT BUTTON bUT THERE IS NO SUCH BUTTON.. YOU BUTTNING BUTOONS LOCKSTAR.I HATE ROCKSTAR NOW. DLSS FIXUse DLSS Swapper from Microsoft Store to update DLSS Version to 2.3.9.. it gives best image quality.Use DLSS Exposure tool from reddit.. fixes DLSS Stupid Exposure.. BUT HAVE TO BE RUN EVERYTIME ALONGSIDE the Game due to FLARKING DRM.Use NVIDIA Freestyle to set Sharpening to around 25% and Set Ignore Film Grain to Zero.HDR FIXOpen the game and enable HDR, if it's not enabled already.Open the in game HDR calibration menu.Set the HDR mode to "Cinematic" (default) and Paper white to "80" (minimum).Open NVIDIA Freestyle (Game filter) with its shortcut key (Alt+F3 by default).Select one of the "Styles" boxes from the sidebar overlay that appears (e.g. 1).Select the "Brightness/Contrast" filter from the "Add Filter" button.Set all the sliders to 0% to achieve a baseline.Increase the "Exposure" to your liking. Good values are usually between 9% and 55%, depending on your monitor max nits.Also.. Increase Shadows as per your Liking.Looking at the clouds is a good way to make sure you don't lose any highlight details.

author: ptt.frmr
review: To play this SINGLEPLAYER game, I had to:- Install a Rockstar Launcher, some Rockstar DRM, and the "Rockstar Games Social Club", neither of which were optional- Create a profile for the "Social Club", submitting personal stuff such as my email and birthdate- Complete 2 CAPTCHAs, picking the animal figure that's right-side-up- Check my email to discover the validation mail didn't arrive- Go back to the launcher and re-send the mail- Go back to my email, finally receive the validation mail, and click it- Go back to the launcher and fill out a million incomprehensible privacy options about my "Feed" and my "Wall" and other things. I have no idea where to find these or what they do.I paid 60 EUR for this game. Can I please just play it?

author: goggiolialessandro
review: Amici si tratta di un capolavoro assoluto. La trama è fantastica, i personaggi, le quest, l'ambientazione tutto perfetto e totalmente immersivo. Si tratta di un gioco lento, che si lascia scoprire e gustare lentamente, con un mondo di gioco, complesso, variegato che non viene mai a noi ma anzi è esaltante, scoprendo sempre qualcosa di nuovo. Non ci si può limitare nel giocarlo a fare le sole missioni della trama principale: fa fatto tutto, al 100% per godere appieno della meraviglia di Rockstar. Unico consiglio: non è adatto a chi ama i giochi veloci che durano poco con tanta azione. E' un gioco pensato e realizzato appositamente per essere lento, con molti tempi dedicati alle sfide, all'improvement del personaggio, la ricerca di tesori e animali leggendari e anche solo, perché no, per girovagare nel bellissimo ambiente di gioco. Un must, da avere a tutti i costi.

author: DANTE
review: I pre ordered the ultimate edition on ps4 and again i pre ordered the ultimate edition on steam (No i am not a rich kid). Why? well Game released 24 hours ago and my gameplay time is already 17 hours....anything else you wanna know? :/ oh yah we pc ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ are lucky to get a game like thisTLDR: Story: 10/10Graphics: 10/10Gameplay: 7/10Over All: 10/10Now a proper reviewOptimization: Yah i know everyone is complaining about the graphics or how unoptimized it is, its just rockstar set the bar high. its just way high. you seriously need a mid range to high end pc to play the game properly, by properly i didnt meant "ULTRA  HIGH" By that i meant everything looks decent with 50-60 fps. another thing is even if the fps goes low once in a while but still its so buttery smooth at least for me,Graphics: Graphics is absolute stunning not gonna say much about that it looks same what we so on the trailers.Gameplay: i wouldnt say the gameplay is really good, its just average nothing fancy there. cant complain much about that cause of the next section of the review where the game really shines. and thats why didnt bothered much about the gameplay.Story: I am 28 years old and i am a gamer since i my childhood. i played countless masterpiece but this game is beyond masterpiece. when i finished the game on ps4 at the end of the game i was just holding the controller watching whats happening on my screen and my tears was coming down Automatically down my cheeks.... The way the game starts the way world reacts around your behavior, the way every gang members talk with you i have never seen anything like this ever before. for few people it might seems the story starts kinda slow but thats cause of the story. game wants you to know everyone and slowly introducing every character so that you started to care about them like they really exist. That effects big time in endgame. Rockstar really nailed it big time.Music: another great part of this game. u will get a pure western feel and at the end when u were overwhelmed by emotion there will be some great songs to give you goosebumps multiple times. so yah hands down again !!!!Online: Nothing fancy here tbh. Almost  Every game is fun if you play with your friends. Rockstar will add so many contents in next couple of years that’s for sure (if you are a GTA Online Player you would trust them about that too) But still I wouldn’t recommended the game if only you want to play this game for online. At least not at the current online state of the game.Final Words: We are lucky enough we live in a generation where we get to play a game like THIS. buy the game already guys dont think twice. Rockstar really deserve this

author: Dr. Feelgood
review: ...My partner and I played through the main story together (), and aside from some technical hiccups/poor performance ()/crashes, we both absolutely adored Red Dead Redemption 2. ~120 Story Missions and every single one of them felt unique. Graphically, it was a technical achievement, and the level of detail in the world is just like nothing I've ever seen in a game before. We absolutely got lost in it for the entirety of our Christmas holidays () when it came out on Steam. It's easily one of the best games I've ever played, and right up there with CoJ: Gunslinger and Gun in terms of the all-time best Western games....Red Dead Online, is where it falls apart. It's only enjoyable with friends, and a dull grind for anything worthwhile. We both got to Level 120+, but it wasn't anywhere near fun for most of that. We dropped it as we were just logging in for Daily Challenges for Gold Bars to keep that Daily Streak up, like some sort of job. We definitely got suckered into the grind - it played on people's impatience, and taking full advantage of their FOMO. Everything was set up in a way for you to not make money/have money taken away from you. Even mini-games and activities that were in SP were taken out of MP, purely because it would be a way to earn money. The economy didn't even make sense, compared to the period-correct-ish of singleplayer. We had our fun bits with it, but it honestly dampened and tarnished the outstanding singleplayer experience - we poured so much time into it hoping it would open up to what we played in the SP, but it just never did. The boardroom was definitely thinking about people's wallets rather than people's enjoyment when RDO was half-baked and strapped to the main game. It really could've been great, and it's sad that it was ruined out of typical GaaS greed.: Since we've stopped playing, Rockstar released Red Dead Online as a standalone release, cutting monetary and Gold Bar rewards even further to the experience I've outlined above. , don't buy Gold Bars and support this greed - play something else that respects you as a player and isn't solely after your wallet.

author: Endo
review: Good game, but i would say there is some optimization issues for example whenever i tab out of the game to check something out on google or steam then go back into the game my screen ends up being completely white except for the game overlays (left-corner map, health, and pause menu). Aside from that i have only had one "disconnected from game due to Rockstar issues" incidents.The game is very good, but i did really only purchase it for the online I do believe the story is just as good if not better due to it being by Rockstar and their past releases all being great.That being said i do believe there is work that can and most likely will be done soon to improve the connection and optimization issues that are currently going on with the game. i have a gtx950 video card and amd fx(tm) eight core possessor.When i say good i mean great, fantastic, stimulating, and so on.

author: Sir Lunchalot
review: * Crash Update: " GFX STATE ERROR " *  You need to run a full benchmark run and the game wont crash while loading campaign* Crash Update: 30.12. *  Did have my first crashes, updating my Nvidia Drivers solved the probleme for me * Update after finishing the Main Story ( 100h and 85% ) : * The story alone is 10/10 and, in my opinion, worth the 60€ I throw on it. Some of the few games that actually gave me goosebumps. In addition I have experienced the most authentic Wild West world I have ever encountered.  Remarkable! You will get lost in this world, it really feels alive and It's definitely worth  exploring! - a feeling I didnt have since my Witcher 3 playthrough. Nevertheless it is a real shame that an international brand like Rockstar Games doesnt care  about a sloppy PC-port. There are a lot of different crashes, ffs some people cant even start  the game at all, which should not be a thing in 2020 - and most of all, not a thing from a triple  A gaming company.  I updated my crash fixes on top. I got very lucky and only had these two incidents( the benchmark thing still exists to this day )  I have not tried the online part. I have only bought it for the singleplayer experience.---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------NO REVIEW BOMBING !!- did not encounter any starting problems, nor crashes ( Did have problems with GTA V when they forced you to use their launcher, but worked perfectly fine with RDR2 ) - 20% off is a bummer, I agree nevertheless it is still a very good and detailed game and Im talking about Witcher 3 level of detail. Textures could be sharper, but the in-depth gameplay is truly amazing.Unfortunately it is extraordinarily demanding: Playing in 1440p. with 1080 Ti + i7 on mixed settings (optimized settings from Youtube) getting around 60 - ~40 FPS (worst case) which is still playable due to the  " slow / relaxed gameplay-pace "

review: Turbo review:Pros: Game is GOOOOOOOOOOOD!! VERY VERY GOOD!!Cons: Rockstar Games Launcher and account required and link to STEAM. I almost considered refunding the game when I saw that sh..! author: BirdOfPray
review: I decided to change my review to positive despite red dead online's ongoing problems. There are still disconnects and missing camps but It's more playable now than what was before. But I wanted change it to positive after completing story without any optimization problems or crashes. It was smooth, fun and has a really great story. It's more like reading a book than playing a game. It's just great. Definetly worth it.Singleplayer solely worths the full price. I'd like to think multiplayer as a bonus, where you can test gameplay mechanics with friends. Some sort of a sandbox. I played multiplayer first and left singleplayer for a time that I can play freely. Quarantine allowed me to play story and I'm happy and a little sad that I've finally finished it.There are minor problems on gameplay like game constantly switching your weapons and ammo after you start mission. Which can make you mad time to time. But it's an acceptable problem when you consider how smooth and fun the gameplay is.For me pros were:+ Awesome story+ Details on literally everything+ Choices+ Smooth western gunplay (especially fanning the hammer)+ Melee fights+ Memorable characters+ Random events+ Alive environment+ Beautiful graphics+ No fps drops, + No gamebreaking bugs + No serious crashes+ Fun hunting+ Awesome voice acting+ Smooth animations...+ and many more that I forgot.Cons:- Online issues- Forced weapon changes on missions- Annoying (but ignorable) tasks while doing missionsAs a result, I think this game is a masterpiece and you should go for it. For any price it's just worth it.Red dead redemption is GTA in 1899. It's fun and has a suspenseful story.I gave negative because rdr online is kicking me out from the multiplayer sessions with an error on their side. I'll keep it until they fix their game.SOLUTION:

author: Doombox
review: I do like the story, it's great overall and (largely) has all the usual Rockstar polish. There's just so many ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ and issues, there's some really painful grinding to be done for pristine animals and some very easy mistakes you can make that would rob you of a 100% run forcing a completely new game from scratch to achieve, not to mention the performance issues, bugs, crashes and all the usual technical faults present in a lazy port.As for Read Dead Online... Well it's a buggy, empty, hollow, cheater-filled excuse to hunt whales. The entire thing is a ridiculous grind designed purely to sell you gold bars - and by you I mean the 1% of players who generate 99% of Rockstar's annual revenue. Oh and if you use mouse and keyboard and don't want to play against controller aimbots (and would rather just play against regular cheater aimbots, but that's a different issue) then you can change an obscure option in the controller settings, but be prepared to meet very few other players because of it.It's so close to the perfect game that it genuinely makes me feel sad, if Rockstar's primary concern wasn't generating insane quarterly earnings figures for their parent company, it'd only need about a week of balance and economy changes and a few months of polish to be an absolute classic in terms of single and multiplayer, however money talks and the whales have spoken loud and clear when it comes to multiplayer, obviously to the detriment of the single player experience. At the price they're asking for it, I honestly cannot recommend it because there are games with far fewer issues for a quarter of the price that won't make you feel guilty for spending your hard earned money.

author: Blaine
review: When people warned that this game was buggy and unstable on PC, they sure weren't kidding.At the moment, there's a known bug that's been around for months: The RDR2 executable sets its own app-specific volume slider in the Windows sound mixer extremely low. You therefore have to adjust the RDR2 volume slider up every single time you launch the game, unless you want to hear everything as a faint whisper.Personally I have a G-Sync monitor and my games run far better in exclusive fullscreen mode. So, every single time I launch RDR2, I must navigate to the game settings, switch to windowed mode, increase the RDR2 volume mixer slider, then switch back to exclusive fullscreen mode.Unfortunately, there is another known bug/instability issue that's been around for months: Changing graphics settings can cause the game to crash, or even BSOD. I've had two BSODs just from changing RDR2's graphics settings... the only two I've ever had on this rig. And I have no choice but to change them every time I launch the game due to the aforementioned volume slider bug.My rig is more than powerful enough to run the game. When not crashing or otherwise bugging out, the game runs very smoothly and at 80-90 FPS for me on a mix of high/ultra settings. GPU and CPU temps and voltages stay within normal ranges.I've refunded this game because if the developers are too incompetent to fix something as fundamental as CHANGING GRAPHICS SETTINGS without BSODing the computer, then despite how great the game itself is supposed to be, I'm not willing to risk throwing my money away on something that is borderline unplayable. Nor am I willing to spend dozens of hours trying tweaks, fixes, and .xml file edits to fix the game that may or may not actually help.

author: Cherry
review: Animal Interactivity Review!tl;dr - Horses take the spotlight, as expected, but many other animals await and watching them can be very rewarding.  The inability to pet cats remains a major disappointment.Horses:+ Riding, saddling, hitching, obviously.+ A wide variety of breeds, and rare horses to find.+ Can stable horses for riding later, or sell them and break their hearts.+ Taming wild horses is possible, but I haven't done it yet. (27 hours)+ Can pet, brush, hand feed, and lavish verbal affection upon your mount.  "Yer alright, girl."+ Horses become spooked around predators, and require soothing.+ Can calm panicked horses, and help return bolted horses to their owners.+ Herds of wild horses are beautiful and free.+ Each gang member has a named horse that they like more than they like you.  This is understandable as you are a grumpy jerk.+ Your bonded horse will come when you whistle, if close enough to hear you, and will follow you wherever you go, even when mounted or driving.+ Horse does not get jealous when you ride another horse.+ Can get your pony's hair braided.- Cannot braid your pony's hair yourself.  And no ribbons.- No hoof cleaning, although I did see a guy attempting to remove a thorn or a stone get kicked in the face and die, so maybe it's for the best.- Limited space for stabling horses.- Horse will wear a saddle every day forever, and doesn't require much care, apart from a light brushing to her neck.- Cannot pet stranger's horses.- Cannot interact with teams whatsoever, not even to tell them they're being good boys when you're driving.- Cannot bring in more than one horse, no lead ropes while riding, and no pack ponies, your main mount faithfully following behind when you ride some strange horse notwithstanding.Dogs:+ Can praise!+ Can pet!+ Several breeds to good boy.- Cannot own.- Petting very limited.Cats:+ Can praise!  Or scold.  You monster.+ Glowing yellow eyes in a bush scared me worse than anything else in the game so far.- Cannot pet- Cannot own- Cannot pspspspsps- Only the one breed: cat.Birds:+ So many+ Bird Watching Simulator 2018+ I kicked a turkey to death.- I kicked a turkey to death, and felt awful.- No Disney Princess mode.? I saw an owl take out a rabbit and fly off into the moonlight and spooky fog but was so enraptured I forgot to take a picture.Others:+ Many, many wild animals to record in your journal, view through binoculars and hunt.+ Hunting can require patience and tracking.+ Elk are majestic and sound like dying trumpets.+ I trampled a squirrel to death, and was left with a pitiful corpse and pelt.+ Herbs can be used to make the turkey I kicked to death more delicious, but cannot cover the taste of guilt.+ Abandoned corpses will attract scavengers.+ Skinning fairly realistic.- Skinning fairly realistic.  And gross.- I am pretty sure the game knows when I'm looking for a particular animal and stops it from spawning entirely.  Seriously, there were like forty rabbits here last time and now I can't find one?!People:+ A one-armed homeless man hugged me and it was super awkward.

author: Ethan348
review: The game is fun to play and I don't think I wasted my money on this. However the servers aren't that great and I really hope that Rock Star fixes it soon. I know it's only been a few weeks but we fellas didn't spend our money for nothing.*Update, March 23 2020*I finally completed the main story after putting total 160 hours into it. Well the story isn't 160 hours long but I took time completing the side missions and getting immersed into the lively environment of the game.The Epilogue is totally great and there are so many hilarious moments. I still have a bit of Epilogue to complete but I know the rest of the hours that I'd spend on this game will be totally worth it.Multiplayer has gotten comparatively better than what I played on the day when I first played this game. It's really rare for me (someone who plays on Cellular Data) to disconnect from servers. The community sure does tend to get toxic but it is bearable (I happen to be the saltiest XD). I have made many friends in past few weeks who have been hanging out with me most of the time in the game itself.10/10Would buy it again if I were rich enough :P
