author: berps
review: OK, I am still playing this game but I'm now on Chapter 5 and I have sufficiently frothed myself up enough to write a review of this thing. This is long and I know this is a loved game but here are my thoughts.*Spoilers Ahead*1. This game has been a stressful experience ever since I realized that the game AUTOSAVED whenever I died and WROTE OVER my manual saves with the new autosaves. Excuse me but isn't the point of a manual save so I can go back and try again without losing money every time I died for some dumb reason? So I turned off autosaves and now have to manually save pretty much constantly. So already I'm annoyed at the game and we didn't really start off on a good note. Let that be known.2. Probably about half the time, the reason I died was because the game bugged out somehow and wouldn't let me aim/shoot in the middle of a shootout. The game is about as glitchy as I'd expect from a game of this magnitude, but it was annoying when it happened during Key Moments. Other things happened too that I guess were intentional, although they really killed the immersion and came off as bugs anyway. Like when I killed a bunch of bounty hunters or whatever, if I strayed just a *little* too far to recollect whatever pelt they knocked off my horse, all the bodies have disappeared. I get the concept of garbage collection, but can you just *wait* like 10 seconds before erasing them from the area?? 3. The "realistic" aspect. Yeah there's realism but it's...misplaced. Yes my horse poops often and as much as I love to watch it, it would be nice if they had put at least a fraction of that effort into the freaking cursed *Wanted System*. Like how is it realistic when I accidentally bump into someone in Saint Denis, and suddenly 20 cops are shooting at me? Wouldn't it be more realistic if people in my group actually did something besides sending me out to do everything? Or if they actually shot enemies instead of just yelling at ME to do it? Or if people in my camp ever donated more than 37 cents while I donated half my income? 4. Let me paint you a scene of something that happened in a mission. I was walking Charles the artist to his boat (in Chapter 5 I think) when suddenly these dudes came over and started punching me?? I tried to walk away but I couldn't, and the game gave me the prompt to "defeat the attackers" so I did, and Charles got on his boat, and not 10 seconds later, I'm wanted for murdering these two attackers, and I'm chased for like ten minutes throughout the city and I get a $650 bounty, and eventually I perish. When I reemerge, my horse is DEAD (RIP Roach #3 the Horse), and as I'm trying to mourn and bring the saddle to my new horse, some GUY just comes up to me on his horse and is like, "DO YOU WANT TO DIE TODAY?" and starts shooting me, so I try to run away because I know self-defense isn't a known concept to the RDR police force, so he's like "YEAH I THOUGHT SO" and rides off, CIRCLES BACK AROUND, and starts shooting me again, so I shoot him back to get him away from me, and of course immediately cops are after me and I'm wanted again. Like *this is not fun. This does not make the game more fun*. Why is there no "please get away from me" or "idk what I did, but I didn't mean it, leave me alone now" option?5. This game does NOT want you to experiment. These missions are so scripted that if you're just a little off, you'll fail. I hear that's a Rockstar design thing. Like for one mission, I had to follow a stagecoach, first I failed because I was too far away. Then I failed because I was too close. It's like you're set up to fail for a lot of these missions. I felt like I was fighting the game for most of the time, not knowing exactly how they wanted me to do it. (I admit I am spoiled by The Witcher 3, where you can just run away and come back and it doesn't automatically fail you.) I never was allowed to forget that I was playing a game. I couldn't really get into the story because I was too stressed out about just getting past the checkpoints before I failed for some arbitrary reason. And all the side missions to slowly walk some person to the nearest town or whatever, I DREAD those and I feel like you're not supposed to literally dread those question marks that pop up in the game...6. The game encourages you to do things and then punishes you for it. For example, it REALLY wants you to rob a train and tells you the first time you're stopped at a moving passenger train. And you have the Bandit Challenges for things like "drag someone 3300 feet with a lasso!" But then it has the audacity to throw in an honor system and makes you lose honor for doing what the game itself was egging you on to do. And then it gives you this huge guilt trip about it, like after five chapters of robbing trains and whatnot it starts to add in these "Do you accept payment?" choice prompts which are just dumb. Like for one mission, I had to collect a debt, and then the guy's pregnant wife walks over, and there's a prompt where you can choose to "forgive the debt" and I'm like wtf no?? I'm sorry? When did you suddenly get so honorable? You just robbed a store and then lassoed a witness and then killed a witness to that witness then someone witnessed that so you killed that witness too so don't EVEN7. I don't understand what we are supposed to think of Arthur as a character. When he's collecting debts for Strauss he's super gruff and mean and threatening but then there's the nun and other characters being like "ah, you're a good person, I can just feel it!" And the game keeps trying to make you feel connected to Arthur by suddenly making him all philosophical after Guarma, and Dutch suddenly becomes diabolical, and it feels like there's no reason for it really, so now all of a sudden Arthur is being all judgmental towards Dutch for "killing for no reason" when Arthur has literally spent the entire game killing for no reason and draggin people 3300 feet with a lasso?? Wtf game? And it's all like "oh, he's DYING, aren't you sad? Look at this cut scene and here's some vocal music because now you know he's DYING, and don't you want to turn on cinematic mode now and ride your horse after you leave Guarma for five minutes with cinematic mode on? Doesn't this make you sad? btw he's DYING, did you know?" It was a bit pushy, I don't like when games tell me exactly what I'm supposed to be feeling all the time, and this game was pretty shameless about that. It really wanted to be "epic" but of course the terrible game design and controls kind of ruined that for me (see points 3 and 5). 8. I never really cared about the people at my camp either. I wasn't sad when any of them was killed and I didn't really go out of my way to decorate the camp or whatever. The game didn't do much to make me feel that connected to anyone, I guess. Also, what's the point of some of them even being in the gang? Like what did Mary Beth ever do? Why is she there? Also, they wonder why they're always getting spotted but even when they have a huge house to hide in, they're all camped outside so you can see them from like 100 miles away. TLDR: All the little annoying things about the game killed the realism and immersion that they tried so hard to curate. Also, the Wanted System is CURSED and punishes you for doing what the game itself encourages you to do.Anyway yeah it's fine but idk, I definitely won't be playing through it again. And I personally don't really get the excitement over this game, but I guess lassoing people was pretty fun.PS There is a guy on youtube with a video called "Rockstar's Game Design is Outdated" which has a pretty good summary of my beef about this game if you're interested

author: Neviriah
review: I have been playing the game on PS4 already, last year. Just the story and side content and such.However, now on the PC I only play the online portion of Red Dead and I gotta say: It's amazing. If your PC can take it, the game is absolutely stunning. However it is much more fun with friends, obviously.There isn't much story in the online mode of RDR2, but the content that is there, is very enjoyable. All of my 80+ hours so far have been spent in RDO, no story mode at all. Few downsides though:- You can not just jump in now and play the new content (Moonshine) as you do have to grind the existing /older Roles to unlock your own speak-easy etc. - Grinding Gold /Nuggets in the game is very slow and works best with Bounty Hunter (which you can do with a friend who has the role for example),- but its clearly making you feel like you should just buy it for real money. (It's not required ofc, but it is grindy)- There is no real matchmaking. If you get into a showdown you may be headshot immediately. Could be good players, could be Dead-Eye. We will never know lolNow the good stuff:- ALL. THE. REST! ^_^Even if you just go play the game to feel like a Cowboy or to embrace the graphics, it's definitely worth it. For the amount of hours you will spend on it. And that this review doesn't even include the story mode which in itself is worth it already! <3

author: Purpleetea
review: This game reminded me once more how much I love western theme. This is like watching best western movie and controling your destiny in it. The Good, the Bad, and the Evil, 3:10 To Yuma, Godless (tv mini series) mostly reminded me of this game. To this moment I still can't believe what I just experienced. Im still in shock how good this game is. Was very skeptical that Rockstar can pull this off after Red dead Redemption first one. Oh boy how was I wrong in many ways. Cant say any weak part of this game. the story the world the gameplay are just breathtaking. Sure it has some mini annoying flaws like slow looting system, horse can bump into tree with no reason if you are not careful (The witcher 3 somehow managed to pull this off) and there is one big problem that needs to be adressed. This game needs good optimization cause at this state you need monster PC to play this game. I didnt had any crashes or bugs but man I wish I had opportunity to play on highest settings. Sadly had to lower down some effects to enjoy stable 60 FPS. You play as Arthur Morgan...an outlaw...and friend...a husband or maybe a killer. So many things this game shows you and you experience many emotions. Honestly I liked him more than John Marston. I know its strange. But thats what happens when you develop amazing character. You can play as evil or as decent human beying. Thou there are a lot of killing in this game. The world felt to alive. For me I didnt played this game I lived in it. It was so real. Map is so big and vast. Riding with your horsie is the best feeling you experience in this wild west. Please dont use fast travel cause you gonna miss alot. Its mindblowing how much can you do and see and explore and find. How detailed and beautiful it is. You just need to see with your eyes. Everything you see on horizon you almost can go there. Wild life is dangerous and gorgeous at the same time. Better be prepared for some suprises cause one wrong step and you can face cougar. Oh boy if you dont have shotgun on yourself she will destroy you almost in one hit. Thats what I loved as I said it felt so alive this world. So many animals to find. You can kill them for pelts but I didnt find that amusing and didnt do that. I love nature so I left it to rest. You also can collect plants or go fishing. The towns and people living there are so real. Thou I love smaller towns not the biggest one. I dont like big cities :) You can go to bar, play poker, dominoes, black jack. I spend one hour just playing poker. That is how good this feel. there are also other duties like bounty hunting. The story is the strongest part also. Even to this moment I cant believe Rockstar pulled this off. Arthur Morgan feels like true human. You starting to like him an at the end of a game you feel like you grow bond with him. He is trully like your brother that you care for him. There are also other likable characters like strong Abigail Roberts and Sadie Adler-she is the best. I like her alot. Charles Smith is also cool. He gives you I think tomahawk one of the coolest weapons in the game ;) And there are also devils like Andrew Milton, Micah Bell and most hated satan Dutch. This guy is...well I just dont want to cross path with this guy. You also can help them do side missions which is what I like the most. They felt so good. The other game I maxed out and did every side mission was Witcher 3. You can find so many them in the world also. Meet some strangers. At the end what can I say. Red dead Redemtion 2 is one of those game that you 110% can trully call Masterpiece. Arthur Morgan became my friend at the  the end he was my brother.  RDR 2 ending where true man cries. This is wild west and You my friend will ride to the sunset forever as cowboy. 10/10 Masterpiece

author: seilez
review: This is the game that gives unforgettable emotions throughout the story. Going through this game, I got those emotions that I didn't get in other games . The world in this game is a pleasant surprise, he lives his life in spite of you, you can do a lot in this world, for example: search for treasures, hunt ( the game is full of different animals and birds) or fish ( in reservoirs full of different fish) and all that stuff. Almost every additional quest is made qualitatively and worked out. Multiplayer in the game is also good, but after a certain time you will get tired of it. This game has become one of my favorites , and Arthur Morgan is one of my favorite game characters. 10/10

author: Dece1ve_
review: Never have I ever played a game that I could truly get lost in. That changed when I played Red Dead Redemption 2.Characters were written and performed so genuinely. The well-being of each individual, and actions I took towards them, even NPCs insignificant to the story, weighed heavily on my shoulders. Each person you encounter throughout the game seemed like they lived an existence of their own, had their own families, problems, and realities that they lived in. That, coupled with the most vast, detailed, and believable open-world that I've experienced made it impossible not to be completely immersed in its world. The game is able to capture and showcase the beauty of nature and its inhabitants like no other game has before it; wide sprawling landscapes that'll take your breath away as you struggle to remind yourself it isn't real. Cities, towns, and the people in them feel intimate and real. Compared to Rockstar Games' previous works, nothing compares to the impression RDR2 gives you of a living, breathing community. With a story that can be both heartwarming and heart-wrenching, the amount of emotion I've invested into each and every character, each and every moment, cannot be overstated, keeping me at the edge of my seat in genuine suspense, worry, or joy. Red Dead Redemption 2.The only game that could make me forget about the real world for a moment, bringing me into its own.I doubt I'll ever play another game like this one in my lifetime. Truly one of a kind.

author: Dr. Dank
review: Red Dead Redemption 2.some will hate it, others will love it. i among my friends am known for never being able to stick to one game for a long time. but let me tell you that red dead redemption's story is by far THE best story i have experienced to date, so when a game can hook me in for as long as red dead has now, its bound to be good.now many people hate on the rdr2's online for many reasons, 2 of the reasons being the hackers and the lack of things to do. but rdr2 online allows for experiences to be created for yourself, rather than following a linear story, so when playing rdr2 online make sure to have friends to create these experiences with.in conclusion rdr2's story is a solid 9/10 with its online counterpart being a 7.5/10

author: NICK ALTMAN
review: RDR 2 is one of the best games ever made. The size of the world is stunning and the the way everyone react inside is just amazing. It is one of the few games where you don't want to use fast travel because you never know what will you find along your travels. Maybe you want to enjoy the scenery or maybe you want to do some hunting or you will find a new adventure that is not marked as a mission on the map. The level of detail is so great that each item picked up from the world is hand-held and stored in the bag. I finished the game on PS4 but I decided to get it on PC also so I can enjoy it again. This is an adventure you don't want to miss out and I know Arthur will grow close to your hart as you play the game. Playing on single play on PC after PS4 made me appriciate the game even more.

author: Tre
review: This was an amazingly written and produced game. Despite the initial hiccups with porting this game to PC I would highly recommend purchasing this game. The game can be picked up and put down at your own discretion. The main quests are exciting and eventful and easy to follow along. RDR2 is aesthetically pleasing and well worth the money in terms of length of the campaign. (pretty lengthy). This game is perfect for summer vacation or any stretch of leisure time that you may have.

author: Pain
review: Can't even write in words how brilliant this game was. Might write a better review later on once I try out the online mode. This was simply the best single-player game on PC that I've ever played so far. Period. Some important points - - Insanely beautiful open world.- Phenomenal attention to detail.- Great gameplay mechanics - from stealth kills to hitting headshots with guns they were spot on with that.- Superb story, was totally indulged into the characters and their tragic storylines :(- Sooo much to discover in the wild - herbs, fishes, birds, reptiles etc which can be used for crafting.The game ran smooth for me, had a crash once or twice in total other than that no performance issues happened on a GTX 1060 6GB with an i5 4460. Definitely recommend this game. First two chapters might be very slow, but trust me, it's worth your time.

author: kertel1991
review: Παιχνιδι σταθμος στη ζωη ενος gamer και σιγουρα στα τοπ 5 παιχνιδια της δεκαετιας που μας περασε. Prequel του RDR 1 ακολουθουμε την επιβιωση της συμμοριας μας με αρχηγο τον Dutch van der Linde με το χαρακτηρα μας Arthur Morgan να προσπαθει για το καλυτερο για τη ζωη καθε μελους της ομαδας μας. Βρισκομαστε στο 1899 στην παρακμη της Αγριας Δυσης με τις πολεις να ειναι στο απογειο τους λογου του πετρελαιου αλλα στα χωρια και στη φυση επικρατει χαος με πολλες συμμοριες να προσπαθουν να ληστεψουν οτι μπορουν απο τους περαστικους. Θα βρεθουμε αντιμετωποι με καθε λογεις εχθρους απο την τελευταια συμμορια αγριων μεχρι δημαρχους και μεγιστανες πετρελαιου που προσπαθουν να ελεγξουν τον κοσμο. Ο στοχος μας? Ενα καλυτερο αυριο για μας και την ομαδα μας καπου μακρια απο ολα αυτα. Και τι χρειαζομαστε για αυτο? Χρηματα πολλα χρηματα ωστε να φυγουμε απο ολο αυτο το βουρκο.Η rockstar ολα τα παραπανω στα δινει σιγα σιγα με αριστοτεχνικο τροπο μεσα απο μια εξαιρετικη ιστορια λυτρωσης θα περασουμε απο χιλια σταδια με καθε λογης συναισθηματα. Το δεσιμο με σχεδον καθε χαρακτηρα που αλλον μπορει να το μισουμε αλλον να τον αγαπαμε αλλον να τον λυπομαστε ειναι κατι πρωτογνωρο για ενα παιχνιδι τετοιου βεληνεκους. Για την ιστορια καλυτερα να μην γραψω κατι παραπανω μιας και πρεπει ο καθε gamer να την ζησει χωρις να ξερει τιποτα.Στα του gameplay προσπαθησαν και καταφεραν για μενα να ακολουθησουν πιστα την ατμοσφαιρα και την ιστορια το εκαναν οσο αργο επρεπε ωστε να ειναι απολυτα ρεαλιστικο βλεπω καποιους του ξινιζει αυτο αλλα το παιχνιδι ετσι ακριβως πρεπει να ειναι. Η ζηστε το η καλυτερα μην το παιξετε ποτε δεν υπαρχει κατι ενδιαμεσο. Και οχι μονο στο οτι ειναι αργο αλλα και το να κανετε μονο τις αποστολες για να δειτε την ιστορια θα εχετε χασει το μισο παιχνιδι που ακομα και η πιο ασημαντη αποστολη καποιου ξενου ειναι δημιουργικη και οχι μονοτονη οπως και οι διαλογοι οι κινησεις ολα ειναι εξαιρετικα μονο η rockstar θα μπορουσε να κανει κατι τετοιο σε ενα παιχνιδι 200 ωρων.Συντροφια θα εχουμε μονιμα το αλογο μας το οποιο προφανως μπορουμε να βρουμε πολλα ακομα στη φυση να τα ηρεμησουμε και να δεθουμε μαζι τους με την παροδο του χρονου. Οσο πιο μεγαλο το δεσιμο τοσο πιο πολυ εμπιστοσυνη θα δειξουν σε μια μεγαλη αναποδια η μαχη. Στο ταξιδι μας θα συναντησουμε ξενους που χρειαζονται τη βοηθεια μας. Δωστε μισο λεπτο και δωστε την θα σας ανταμειψει αργοτερα το παιχνιδι.Αν θελετε να πατε για 100% το παιχνιδι εχει απειρα πραγματα να κανετε. Απο το να μαζεψετε κοκαλα απο δεινοσαυρο μεχρι να πιασετε θρυλικα ζωα ψαρια αλλα και να βρειτε μυστηρια αναγλυφα σε βραχους. Χρονοβορο ολο το παραπανω το μονο σιγουρο αλλα σε ανταμειβει η καθε ιστορια. Γενικα τα μυστηρια του τεραστιου κοσμου του παιχνιδιου ειναι ατελειωτα και ολα μαζι φτιαχνουν εναν οσο περισσοτερο αληθινο κοσμο γινεται προς τον παιχτη που μονο αγγαρεια δεν ειναι η ανακαλυψη καθε σπιθαμης του.Παμε και στα γραφικα. Το παιχνιδι βγηκε το 2018 και μεχρι σημερα νομιζω παραμενει ενα απο τα πιο ομορφα παιχνιδια που θα παιξετε ειδικα με καλο συστημα. Υπεροχος φωτισμος ειδικα το βραδυ στις μεγαλεις πολεις ειναι αριστουργημα καθεσε το χαζευεις αλλα και η φυση με κατι υπεροχες λιμνες για να ψαρεψετε οπως και στο βορειο κομματι με τους παγους και τα χιονια αλλα και προς το τελος που ανοιγει και η ερημος απο το πρωτο παιχνιδι ειναι οπτικα πανεμορφο.Συνολικα εκανα 4 μηνες να τελειωσω το παιχνιδι το ειχα πιασει αρχες του χρονου επαιξα 50 ωρες και μετα λογο ελλειψης χρονου το αφησα και το ξανα επιασα πριν λιγους μηνες μεχρι σημερα που μετα απο πολυ καψιμο και 205 ωρες τερματιστηκε στο 100% κανοντας τα παντα που εχει να προσφερει το παιχνιδι. Τρομερη εμπειρια η οποια αν εχετε χρονο ειναι το παιχνιδι που πρεπει να πιασετε αμεσα και να το ζησετε και να του δωσετε οσο χρονο χρειαζεται μονο καλα θα παρετε. Μπραβο στη rockstar φαινεται το μερακι τους και νομιζω ειναι το καλυτερο τους παιχνιδι μεχρι σημερα. Ελπιζω σε ενα Red Dead Redemption 1 Remake μελλοντικα. 10/10

author: -Le0n-
review: DO NOT LET THE MIX REVIEWS STOP YOU FROM BUYING THIS.STORY MODE ------This is by far the Best Game I have played after The Witcher 3. Now I can say this is my 2nd fav game ever. Never felt such a bond with a protagonist. The story, the characters, the dialogues, everything is just perfect.Arthur Morgan is the Best character rockstar ever made. Just love how the game builds up such emotional ride throughout the gameplay. The hornor mechanics helps a lot. The gameplay is slow and peaceful, not like every other running and shooting types. Even then you will never feel like doing nothing, there is always something to do. Best rockstar game IMO. Each and every character made me feel something, such good Unforgettable characters. About performance.... Yea It was a bad launch on PC when It came out on Rockstar launcher and others but Since I got it on steam after 1 month exclusive terms, I have never got any crash or bug till now. I play it on Ultra-High and gives me good playable 50-60 FPS avg. And if you follow the YT famous graphical breakdown video guide, you can get 60+ FPS easy. Don't regret buying it for full price after all the drama happened. Love this game. Go for it blindly. It's worth your time and money and an amazing experience you'll get for a lifetime.ONLINE MODE -------If you read everything above, you have to read this too because the Online mode is nothing but trash. at this time there is nothing in the game you can do once you complete some 10-12 missions. Animal spawns f**ked up so you have to spend a whole day to find animals, kill them, dontae to cripps and then wait for 2-3 hours to earn 500$$. In bounty hunter missions even if you catch the target in time and you want to deliever him/her to prison, you have to wait for last 30 sec timer to get the most out of it or else it doesn't even give good reward. Collector role is simple and fun so far. Moonshine role is trash. There is nothing to do in the whole massive world other than these things which you will get bored of. You do same things as a LVL 20 or LVL 200... only difference is higher rank players have GOLDEN WEAPONS and GOOD CLOTHES. The GOLD BARS system r* started in this game is absolute sh*t cashgrab ( PAY TO WIN ). This game is fun only if you have some friends to play with. The big open world with so much potential is wasted somehow. I don't recommend playing online mode if you hate grinding. Online mode makes you grind whole day to unlock a piece of cloth. That says it all. If they add something more meaningful and fun stuff that players actually enjoy, I might change the review but for now Online mode is 2/10.

author: Matuzka
review: Amazing game but bad optimization, menu is buggy and has low frames for some reason when going in or back.Needs patches and optimization definitely.I rate it 6/10 and can't really recommend it. After this game gets better patches and actual optimization I will give it better rating and maybe even also recommend it.EDIT: It seems that FPS has gone better when I have few settings on high and medium, game runs 40-50 FPS most of the time and sometimes 30 FPS but it's fine, now it's playable and I can enjoy it finally.

author: sunf7ower
review: This game is truly a masterpiece. While no game being really "perfect", RDR2 is quite close to it.The graphics is magneficent. Voice acting is phenomenal, never thought I would stop and enjoy hearing the NPCs' dialogues. The world is massive and there is always something new to discover or some details that I might have missed because the attention to detail in this game is unprecedented. Being able to grow out Arthur's Beard and hair, and even styling it at given length is incredible!The story telling is also a big part of it. It is truly a sad story with excellent writing, though I understand the story being strictly scripted and there is always one outcome. There are also tons of content like side missions which I equally enjoyed.My most memorable immersive experience was to sit by the campfire with the gang and a bottle of Whiskey in my hand. Everyone was jolly singing together for a hot minute. And then there was Javier who played with his amazing guitar. It was quiet, peaceful, I took my time and appreciate the moment. This is a slow-paced game that not a minute I ever regret spending.No such game has made me so attached to a fictional character like RDR2. It showed me to appreciate the moments with those who are with you, because you will never know when they could be taken away. Why did you have to do this to me, Rockstar…

author: David
review: Highly recommended, even for those who aren't a fan of Western-themed games or those who haven't played the first game (I fall into both categories and loved it). Here's a short pro/con list:+Absolutely fantastic storyline (with multiple endings available), as well as several interesting secondary storyline plots and one-off quest storylines+Graphics are stunning. The world is beautiful and diverse and the cities are vibrant and full of character+Quests are extremely varied, very few fetch quests and some of the more monotonous activities like fishing are entirely optional to partake in+Well written characters that all feel like they are distinct personalities, and great dialogue between them all+Lots of dynamic interactions away from cities, makes the world seem alive even in rural places+The game does a really good job of making it feel like everyone’s at your throat+Photo mode, cool for taking screenshots-A few bugs: mainly the occasional graphic glitch such as trees flickering and people sitting down into thin air, but a few treasure hunts and horse interactions can bug out from time to time too-Subtitles confuse “your” and “you’re” on multiple occasions-Rockstar Social Club: the fact that this is mandatory for offline play is equal parts baffling and infuriatingI didn't play the much bemoaned multiplayer component that this game has to offer, but purely based on how incredibly fun (and lengthy - I got 88 hours of gameplay out of one playthrough) the singleplayer campaign is, I'd have a hard time giving this game anything but a high recommendation. 9.5/10.

author: fluffsnake
review: Before I start, if you're only here to find out whether you should get the game or not - the answer is an absolute YES. Just, before you rush headfirst into things, make sure your machine can run it decently enough. The game is absolutely gorgeous and it'd be a shame not to experience it as best as you possibly can.Now, for my actual review:I must admit that I hadn't played RDR1 before, only watched the walkthrough on YouTube and found it rather boring and repetitive. When it comes to whether you should play RDR1 before RDR2 or not, it's more a matter of personal preference. It does give you a bit of an understanding of the gang and some character backstory, but you can probably do without that, too. I know people got really attached to Marston - I couldn't, and that's that.On the other hand, RDR2 introduces you to a new protagonist: Arthur Morgan. As a character of moral ambiguity, you get to shape him up into the person you want him to be through the actions you take in-game. Not only that, but your choices also shape up the world around you. Albeit limited by the story, I really appreciated that degree of freedom and the amount of detail that brought the game's world to life. I don't believe I ever felt so immersed in a game - it truly makes you realize what a powerful storytelling medium a game can be, when done right.The story is amazing and the characters compelling. The music, along with the excellent pacing of the game, turns every mission into a memorable experience. Do yourself a favor and don't just rush through the story - as tempting as that may be. Take your time to explore, and just enjoy Arthur's little sketches in his journal :) the game world has a lot to offer: hundreds of hours later and you'll still find some little detail that you hadn't known about.The whole game was filled with pros for me. As for cons, I had little to no technical difficulties, thankfully. This review is solely for the single-player aspect of the game, I can't really speak much about the online version. The weight behind your character's movement adds a LOT to the immersion, I must say, but can sometimes make movement an absolute pain. Probably feels a lot better on console, I don't know. I just think they could've done a better job on the PC port. Sometimes the weapons you were using get replaced when you start a mission and that's quite annoying, hopefully they'll fix it. Other than that, I have little, next to nothing to complain about and I can only hope that your experience will be a pleasant one as well. I have yet to see a flawless game, and RDR2 is definitely worth playing no matter what. As for the gameplay itself, things are kept rather simple and obvious. Not sure how I feel about that, but it fits in well with the story and pacing so you'll definitely find it gets your blood pumping well enough.Anything else you'll have to see for yourself. What're you waiting for? Go get yourself the game and buckle up, 'cause you're in for a ride!

author: Beasticles
review: Do not give Rockstar Games one more dollar until they respond to their customer's complaints, and fix their modder/hacker problem. I love this game, I love the details, the open west, the gameplay... BUT!  I REFUSE to let them get one more cent from new players looking to buy this game. The amount of exploits Rockstar Games has allowed these modders/ hackers get away with is unacceptable. I'm not just talking about " aimbot " or one of those typical complaints. I'm talking about entering a private session, only to be invaded, and have invisible dynamite blow me up to the point of me putting my controller down and watching my character get blown up over and over... Then, you try to report it, and the hackers can change their name, and unbeknownst to you, while you are in the menu trying to figure out who it is, how to report, or even how to leave the session, YOUR HARD EARN CASH IS BEING DRAINED RAPIDLY! These hackers even go to the point of  increasing your campkeep price, and changing the upkeep to be taken out EVERY SECOND, instead of every day. It's the most frustrating/heartbreaking thing to experience... ♥♥♥♥ you Rockstar... For not even addressing this issue and continually take money for your greedy pockets.

author: Machine
review: This is a recommendation, not a review, there are plenty of those for RDR2. To frame all this, I've never been a fan of westerns, Red Dead has changed that.One of the finest games I've ever played, enjoyed the story, the game play, visuals are superb, ran at a decent 59 FPS average for my playthrough - I got better results on vulkan than DX12 which memory leaked after some time playing.Took me 100 hours to finish right to the end, 87% completion but I can see me picking this up again and starting over. You can feel rockstar spared nothing in making this almost artwork, it's a masterpiece of a game, beautifully crafted, every corner of the map, the dialog, the voices, honestly a joy to go through.Bad points, the controls are a little janky, akin to GTA where your character sometimes just won't do what you want them to do, the rockstar intergration can be flakey, a couple of times I had to restart the game to make rockstar believe I owned it, neither of the two particularly impacted my enjoyment, I'm just being critical.If you want a game to sink yourself into, properly, then pick this up, it's in my top games of all time. I hope they do more.

author: Tantal
review: Seen a lot of people talk like "my computer is amazing and its doesn't work well, I want a refund" etc.. In short for me I just got a new computer recently so everything is working well, had a slight fps/lag during a mission near a river but it went away after a while. All in all RDR2 is fantastic, I've not done much story wise yet and still finding my feet. Looking to convince people I know to join me for multiplayer or will look for a posse. I much prefer this sort of setting when compared to GTA for an online aspect.Downside appears to be if you buy the deluxe editions you will have an unfair advantage however I dont think that should put anyone off too much.

author: edzone
review: Alright so after a few hours I can say that this game runs pretty well. It has some areas where the frames drop down to minimum 40, but then goes up to 50-60. Highest FPS I have been getting is 70 I think and thats with High/Ultra settings. I run with a 2070 super, so yeah. Will the 2070 super run games like Cyberpunk 2077 smoothly? I'd say yes. This game is great, it has one of the best story modes I have ever played. Wouldn't want to spoil anything, but buy it. As for the gameplay, Rockstar has focused a lot on realism, which can be frustrating sometimes. Should have better fast travel system. Yes the game is slow paced, and yes they have focused on realism a lot and that may not be for everyone. If you like Story-Rich games, this one is a MUST have.Online trash though

author: Sayori
review: So between when I got this game and now, it has been just over a year. 250 hours of said year later I finally beat the main campaign after doing everything this game had to offer.My god there is so much to do.I can get lost just looking at the environment. I don't mean to flex but 4k with basically max settings takes an already amazing looking game to god levels of beauty that walking around in is a treat. Not to mention all the side quests, collectables, secrets and more. And that's on top of probably the only video game story outside of DDLC that made me cry.Everything in this game is beyond phenomenal, besides occasional bugs here and there. But lets be real, no game can escape bugs. Everything from animation to dialogue to npcs makes the world feel alive, you know it took me 250 hours before I found out I could hitch a ride from an npc in a cart to take me to the nearest town if I found myself stranded without a horse? Small things like that blow my mind as R* really thought of everything.This was worth waiting 8 years (+1 month for pc users who don't go epic) for without a doubt.This game alone shows game making is not a production of a product, its a craft of an art.Objectively speaking, this is one of the greatest games of this generation, and it still continues to blow my mind.11/10

author: _inu
review: Red Dead Redemption 2 is a story of sacrifice without the illusion of a true good or a definite choice. This portrayal of the life of an outlaw gang in the wild west does a great job at teaching you that no matter what you do, which path you choose or which choice you make - They all lead to suffering and sacrifice, but whether that sacrifice be worth it is a choice even the roughest gunslinger and train robber can make.I would say this game is more of a character portrait of a real person with real consequence rather than your average bad guy / hero fairy tale that will somehow work out in the end. There are many decisions to be made but not an abundance of opportunity to change your path, thus making your shaping of Arthur Morgan really feel important and persistent to the vast and beautiful game world.As a protagonist Arthur Morgan is stunningly dynamic, with great facial animations and a very moody and atmospheric voice over, which really lets you perceive his journey through his eyes and perhaps walk a path you did not initially think would be the way you wanted to play this game.It is as much a story of gun-slinging and amassing riches as it is about heartbreak and the fragility of it all with a huge strong point on the player being able to shape the protagonist, the story and ultimately the world based on simple concepts such as greed, compassion, kindness, determination and most importantly - Loyalty.Are you a good man, Arthur Morgan?

author: lizbean
review: Amazing graphics and attention to detail but if you want good gameplay and fluid controls, you probably won't like this.This has the best graphics I've ever seen in a game and it doesn't run tooo badly with that in mind. A mix of ultra and medium settings I get 70 to 110 fps on 1440p with a RTX 2080. Sound design is great (although there is a lack of audio settings), user interface is terrible if you want to use your mouse as well as the map at least in my opinion has a lot to be desired.Controls and movement, just like in GTA V, only worse, are incredibly clunky and annoying to use. You will constantly get stuck, jump onto things you walk near, walk too far or walk too slowly.This game may be great if you can over all the incredibly annoying things about this game but I would not recommend it, especially at full price. (Also only buy the standard edition)

author: woozyevo
review: I just wanna start this review off by saying, i paid about 30 bucks for this game, every penny was worth it. This is by far the best story driven game I've ever played. I played this game knowing a lot of the major events as I only beat the campaign a couple days ago and yet the game still gave me so many surprises. At some points I completely forget the game was even a game, it felt like I was watching one of those interactive movies you get on netflix. The cinematic style stays consistent through to the end of the epilogue. The game constantly pushes to look like a classic western movie and it works so well. You'll notice a lot of the long tasks you get given are shortened down by transitioning to a cutscene half way to keep you entertained and invested in whats happening. The story is amazing, the greatest told in a video game in my opinion. You play as Arthur Morgan while running from the law with the rest of your gang. As an outlaw, Arthur is introduced as a man with no more than his loyalty and a code. He'll kill and rob anyone deserving as long as he gets paid and Dutch is happy. But eventually Arthurs character develops into a more heroic figure rather than rebellious. You see him start doing more honourable things (no matter what honour level you are). I don't want to talk too much more about the story as it will spoil, but the level of depth in these characters is amazing. The attention to detail in this game is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ crazy. Even more so than breath of the wild. When you go to play this just stop and actually take a look around the world, you will 100% see some ♥♥♥♥ you wouldn't have noticed that looks realistic as ♥♥♥♥. The graphics are amazing, in fact so amazing that I'm pretty sure my 2060 starts dying every time I boot this game up. Even on low graphics the game looks really good, unless you actually stop and look at them then they won't as much lol. A lot of people criticise the guarma section of the game, and I really don't see why. The section is extremely short and the main criticism thrown at it was that 'it's just a long shooting mission with a lot of shooting and nothing else.' This isn't true, at least not entirely. Yes you do shoot a lot more than you do anything else, however, the change of environment is very nice and while you're progressing through the missions it really is refreshing taking in the exotic sights of the tropic. Personally, I loved going through this game and just looking at all the environments, it was amazing. And guarma was by far the best place for this. Another thing to mention is that the story is still there. Some people say the story falls off from here, but I completely disagree. It doesn't get better or worse it simply continues being as good as it was. Anyways that's all im gonna write (there are some other things i could talk about that also made the game great but this review is getting long enough so I'll cut it here). This has easily become my 2nd favourite game ever (just behind breath of the wild) and I highly recommend this game to absolutely everyone.5/5 - woozy points

author: warbeatenhero
review: This game is a great single player experience for maybe 1-2hrs at a time.  This is because that's how long you get to play before the game crashes and you have to reload and restart the mission you are on or loose the random encounter you just found.  This is the only game I have ever owned that this happens with and I would expect more.  If you don't have patience for restarting then stay away.  Other than that story is good and game play is fun.  Wrote this review after the 100th crash, just frustrated.

author: E q u a m e n t a L
review: Plenty amount of well-written dialogues and detailed animations drag you into the unique Wild West world. author: Langovskyy
review: RDR2 is a really great masterpiece.It's a story about outlasw running away from stuff they done, but getting end up bringing even more on themselves.The game looks absolutely stunning, and music is really great.So, let's just get straight to gameplay review.The game is (obviously) an open world tps.It's really well polished, has a countless amount of great detail in all game mechanics (npc's remembering what you've done, guns/horses getting dirtier, beard growing, etc.) and really well done missions.Gunplay is really updated and smooth, comparing to GTA V.Horses were made extremely well done, comparing to Witcher 3 or AC Odyssey, they don't feel like generic mount, but your actual Friend you bond with in this adventure.The characters of the story are well-written and so the story itself, including side missions.Game has hours of just dialogues you will miss in a camp, but it's there, even though rockstar knew 80% of people will miss them.There is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ of bonus stuff you can do (bounties, stagecoach/train robbing, herbs gattering, poker, hunting for camp/clothing upgrades.)So, is game any bad?For me? No.But I know some things that certain people (like my one friend) would hate.1. Incredibly long mission intros.Well, this one is a rockstar certified Classic:After mission cutscene, you have to get to point B from A, with some guy tigether, while you both talk.But the thing is, every single person in this game has a horse.They will not sit on yours, they will just ride along with you AT THEIR OWN PACE.You can't speed them up, you're basically FORCED to slowly gallop with them and listen to them.Now, idc tbh. I like to listen to them, but many ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ are unpatient af and gonna straight up negative review because they lose 3 mins of their life they'd spend playing this game anyways, which also ties to 2nd possibly negative reason.2.Game is incredibly slow.With point 1 and overall fact you don't have cars in WIld West, game feels a lot slower.Looting enemies is slow, skinning animals is slow, mission onbjectives are slow.They make you take your time, which again, IDC, but some people would just hate on that.3.Game is holding your hand.And that's one thing I kinda can agree on.As we know, linearity of open world missions in Rockstar's game is a classic.Red Dead is no different.Unlike idk, MGSV... The game will not let you do another aproach that the game wants to.You wanna rush in on a stealth job? Mission Failed, you alerted them.You wanna go from different angle? Mission Failed, you ran away from the objective.You wanna loot some corspes when your other friends cover you? Mission Failed, npc got killed because you didn't kept shooting at enemies.Again, Ik that they're linear because the mission have to feel cinematic, unlike MGSV where every job felt boring and barely had any story.4.Optimization.Game's runs like ass.Crashes, freezes, has problems loading textures on time.Rockstar never did any good console port, so I ain't telling the game is ♥♥♥♥ becvause of it.Although this game was unlaunchable on release!Now, for me the game is awesome, I kinda don't understand how God OF War won against it, and you should honestly buy it.I ain't refering to Online Multiplayer in this.You ain't payed for that thing and I will not write extra lines about cancerous cash grab putted in such great game.

author: Jalopeura
review: I waited a bit before buying this since people in this section seemed to have problems with crashing. However, I never had any problems with the game crashing. After around 70 hours of gameplay I had a problem with the game crashing upon loading back to the game, but simply switching the game's API from the default Vulcan to DX12 fixed the issue.I didn't want to write a review until I've finished the game, just to see if I can get to the end without any technical difficulties and also because I wanted to know how I truly felt about it. I don't usually write reviews of any sort, but this game is an absolute masterpiece and deserves the recognition. The world, characters and story are all amazing. Gameplay is fun and engaging. I would 100% recommend this. It is one of those games that can truly make a difference in someone's life no matter the hardships they are facing. Give it a chance!

author: gourmet_roadkill
review: So the game overall, I think, is an outstanding piece of art and a medocre gameplay experience. But the thing that is stopping me playing this game is Rockstar. Turns out even though it's on Steam you are still forced to use Rockstar's broken launcher even for the singleplayer story mode. So you might be thinking, "that's fine idc about downloading another laucher..." because that's what I thought. Unfortunately what it actually means if for some reason the Rockstar Game Laucher thinks you're offline your game is essentially bricked. My PC is wired to the router but and I've gotten about half way through the game but I can't even load up the game anymore because the Rockstar laucher seems to be broken and even though I've tried to troubleshoot it there doesn't seem to be a fix for me.If you love to troubleshoot why software won't run for you then this is the game for you. If you don't then a pirated version of this game would be heaven

author: King of Diamonds
review: The most frustrating game I've ever tried to play.Game crashes on startup? update computer. Still doesn't work? Try updating nvidia.didn't work? reinstall nvidia.Still didn't work? Reinstall windows.Working now? okay lets deal with the game settings.Want to change controller settings? must restart afterwards!Want to mess with display? must restart game to apply it!Want to change graphics so you can play the game at 30 fps? Ha! Good look with that because we locked it with your video memory being too high despite going to graphics settings for that very reason!!!!!!!What's worse, even after figuring out how to change all this and restarting the game, you still can't play it because there is a black screen with sound of the game in the background. Great game rockstar! Great game!

author: Markux
review: This game is amazing and I am in love with it. It's a very polished game with an engaging story, interesting characters, memorable moments, and an amazing soundtrack. Arthur Morgan for me definitely became one of the best protagonists of all time. A well-written character with a tragic story who becomes more than just an outlaw.But the game also has some problems... The wanted system is hit or miss, broken economy but for me biggest disappointing thing was the game design. Rockstar created this huge open-world game with a ton of things to do like hunting, fishing, exploring, robbing, and killing, but when it comes to story missions it's super linear aka follow the yellow line. You can't approach a mission differently, you always need to do what the game says you to do and if you do anything other than what the mission said you to do, the mission failed. Approach the enemy from another angle? Mission failed. Take a different route? Mission failed. Mount your horse, go there, kill everybody and repeat over and over. I loved the story in this game, but some exciting story missions for me were outweighed by this repetitiveness and lack of freedom.It's definitely worth its price and I highly recommend this game for everyone who loves exploring and slow-paced games.
Wouldn't launch, updated gpu and BIOS drivers, launched as admin, followed all the steps from any guide I could find. Guess they REALLY want you to buy it from them directly.

author: Rei
review: If it was for the Game itself, I'd say; Get it, it's awesome and a great experience with a lot of fun to get out of.However I can't recommend it because of Rockstars ♥♥♥♥♥♥ launcher integration.About 2 weeks ago my PCs Motherboard died, so I had to get a new one. As a result, I had to reinstall windows and format my SSD, which had the local RDR2 save files.Edit: The saves were on my HDD, now it makes even less sense that Rockstar doesn't have them and they apparently overwrites the saves when reinstalling the game But no biggie I thought, the Rockstar launcher asked me, when I first started the Game up, if I wanted to have Cloud saves enabled, and I said Yea, enable them.So, when my Windows was reinstalled, as well as Red Dead, and I started the Game, I was first glad it asked me to turn Cloud Saves on again, and even said logged in as *MyRockstarTag*.So I started the Story and...It starts from the beginning?I skipped the first sequence, went to the menu and tried to Load a Save file; "No save files available"...So yea, if Rockstar wouldn't be these self-indulgent ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ and just allowed Steam to make Cloud Saves, I could easily just get my save back from the Steam Cloud Save web-page ( But no, they purposely disabled that Steam feature and didn't allow Steam to make Cloud saves of your progress.So, I've got save files from my, I think over a decade old, session of Portal, but not the RDR2 Save file I had 2 weeks ago?Seriously, ♥♥♥♥ Rockstar.Update like 2 weeks later:I got into contact with Rockstar support and they tried to "save" my save file and get it back to me. And they restored a save file... The empty save file which they used to overwrite my original, lost save file.After I pointed that out, they said; "We'll look into it and get back to you shortly"That was a week ago

author: Sovereign Dark
review: I am leaving a negative review only because of the piss poor management of the online portion of this game. The newest update, if you can call it that, had players waiting months for new content only to completely spit in the face of fans and completely disrespect time spent in the game. Nerfing Gold (Premium currency purchased with real money) gains from daily challenges is completely unwarranted and purely greed driven. It is honestly an incredibly scummy thing to have done. If you don't have gold to get the new pass (that doesn't reward gold back as they used too) you best bust out the wallet because it will take weeks of boring grinds to earn the gold to purchase them. Then once you do actually buy the pass and bounty hunter upgrade, yes they charge 15 gold bars to get the BH "expansion." They are littered with garbage. The only thing good in these purchases are some QOL changes like cooking more meat and holding more ammo. Changes that should not be knotted to a premium pass I might add. Forcing players to buy gold for QOL changes that have been asked for for two years is absolutely ridiculous.These are just a few of the issues with this absolute ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ of an update. DO NOT PURCHASE THIS GAME FOR ONLINE. Story mode is a different story and one of my favorite games of all time, but with Rockstars handling of their "GTA:O Successor" and their insatiable greed I cannot even recommend you give Rockstar your money.I usually don't bother making bad reviews but Rockstar needs a wakeup call. People need to brigade the negative reviews like they did when Rockstar tried to stop modding of online.

author: ConsistentS
review: Red Dead Redemption 2 is a game telling you about the story of Arthur Morgan and the Dutch gang, along with John Marston in the epilogue. The game revolves around you - as Arthur Morgan, help the Van der Linde get money so that they can get money and travel far away. But each chapter you progress through, instead of the gang succeeding to get enough money and move away far, the gang will start to tear apart. With each chapter, there will be some gang member dying. Until the end of the chapter on Arthur's side, you will see that the gang is no longer considered as a gang. With mostly everyone leaving Dutch behind, Arthur's fate has long been decided when you do Leopold Strauss's mission once you enter Valentine. If you play as honorary Arthur, you will be given a choice to lay aside watching the sunset on the mountains as Arthur's soul, or take revenge on Micah Bell. The game overall is fantastic, the graphics are gorgeous as hell and along with the amount of activities you can do, watch the environment around you, gambling, doing robberies, fishing, hunting, doing bounty hunting,.. all that kind of stuff. You can really get a lot of amazing moments when you play this game. The NPCs are also a great part of the game as they provide you with some interesting and/or very fun moments to encounter. They make you feel bad at times when you do something horrible at times, or just make you laugh out of the comedy you can get just messing around with them. Rockstar really captured the essence of open-world to this game.It is amazing, so amazing to the point where my laptop couldn't even handle the game, like seriously. I played this game in 360p and 8 FPS (I'm not even lying to you, you can check my screenshots if you want to). Even in 360p, I still felt the game was beautiful on it's own comparing to other games, that's not even mentioning the fact that what the game looks like in 4K.Overall, I think that this game needs and I will repeat, NEEDS to be played if you haven't already. You're missing out precious amounts of time if you're not doing anything. I would give this game a 10/10 or even an 11/10 just because of how good it is, I even consider it to be a masterpiece, even in 2021 (or 2022 as of writing this review). If someone says this game is bad, they haven't tried out this game yet, yes the Rockstar Launcher is very much hot garbage but if you set that aside, I would highly or strongly recommend you to try out the game, even if the Rockstar Launcher is the sole purpose that you didn't buy the game.(Editor's note: I hope that you can get some ideas on if you want to buy this game or not in my short review, it's not a really good review since I'm not that good at writing essays or anything at all relating to long text, that's all and I hope you can enjoy this game once you do buy it.)

author: Lucky-Senpai
review: i gotta say, rockstar really did a number here... single player? fine. perfectly fine. gameplay is just fine, all the mechanics are great and i cant complain about single player in the slightest.now to the important bit: Online. don't play it. you thought GTAO was riddled with grief-hackers and morons that are just there to make your experience in the game bad? well look no further than the nuclear waste mess that is "Red Dead Online", a game that FORCES you to play public, FORCES you to matchmake in missions and takes all the terrible player base of GTAO, then multiplies it by any number higher than five that you want. you want a horse? you get one in the first set of missions, great. you want to buy a good gun? yeah, good luck getting past the ridiculous level-lock system that R* is absolutely orgasming over in every online experience, further displaying their support for ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ who either cheat or make everyone else's experience unplayable. you want to make money? sure, go for it. hit up the missions that you have to go into town for and get shot by a posse of other players camping the town in the sole effort to stop you from reaching the mission. okay, try hunting. yeah, people still camping the towns where you can sell your goods. trying to do anything?? sorry, can't do that, you have to go into town eventually. oh, and if that stuff isn't enough, enjoy a fresh helping of hackers spawning bears and mountain cats on your head in droves, all trying to kill you. "just use your guns" you might think. think again, they spawn enough bears and animals that you cant even kill 1, because your heads already been eaten.final word: dont play online at all. just play single player and never play it again.

author: Draino
review: Edit 1/2021: Playing this game on a 3080 @1440p and it looks stunning. While averaging 55-75fps with almost maxed out settings this game is by far one of the prettiest games ever. In my opinion this is definitely a game that can only be fully appreciated on the latest hardware. I highly recommend Hardware Unboxed's RDR2 Optimization videos to help optimize this game.To start off, the story is great. Some of the characters are very likable and funny while others are easy to dislike. Without going into too much detail, this story is very good and is probably one of the best of the decade. Arthur Morgan is a great character, and his voice actor did an incredible job. The game world itself not only feels alive but it also feels lived in, Rockstar added in the smallest of details to the game and I have had many moments where I say to myself wow I didn't expect something like that. From game mechanics like eating/drinking, bathing, buying individual items off of store shelves, caring for your horse, hair cutting and beard trimming, right down to the clothing and gun options, this game leaves very view stones unturned. The only part that really upsets me is Rockstar's old ways of mission design. The missions for the most part are very linear and hardly allow players to experiment or try to approach the missions from different ways. Its one of the games few major letdowns and it really unfortunate that they messed up one of the biggest parts of the game. They can easily fix some of these issues by reworking mission restrictions but I doubt they will.Besides the main story there is plenty to do in game. You can be a good guy and do camp chores, help countless numbers of strangers, and spend hours and hours hunting and fishing. If you want to be on the other side of the law you can rob stagecoaches, stores, people, horses, trains and any other living thing you chose to interact with. There is always the option of going on a rampage, however the wanted system in this game is a double edged sword, and in my opinion another let down of the game. You start a fight with an NPC? Wanted. You accidentally press the wrong button and try to rob a store? Wanted. You are out in the middle of nowhere and you kill a person? WITNESS. Its got a lot of flaws. Not to mention the NPCs who beat the crap out of you right next to a lawman, while he stands there and watches - but once you put a finger on the NPC, you guessed it. WANTED. Its not completely broken, as sometimes the system works decently, but like most Rockstar games with a wanted system its pretty artificial and only spawns enemies around you as you try to escape.It is important to remember that this game has many complex, intertwined systems, and these systems work pretty well most of the time, and Rockstar deserves all the praise they get for the Single Player portion of the game. As for Red Dead Online it can be fun but as a solo player you will encounter a lot of other players and posses come after you whenever you are doing your own thing. Its definitely a grind and the pricing of items is designed to make you think about buying gold bars. The story serves as a basic plot and of course your character is a mute. If you enjoy endlessly doing the same things over and over again to unlock a new shirt or horse, only to find out it costs 10 times more then you have in your wallet, this is for you. RDO needs a lot more content to be a great experience, and most will find GTA Online to be more fun, but RDO is still worth it for a few hours at least. In 2021, RDO still does not have anywhere near as much content as GTAO and it is rather obvious that it is not Rockstar's top priority.Overall this game is nearly perfect, and it will take a lot of effort for anyone other than Rockstar to top this absolute gem of a game. This is a game everyone should play, and everyone should hold it in high regard. All video game devs and publishers should strive to create masterpieces like Red Dead Redemption 2, and I am super excited to see how the next GTA game turns out, especially if they use a lot of what they did in RDR2.This boah is a 9.5/10, and I highly recommend it to anyone who can match its hefty performance requirements.

author: root
review: This game saved my life.I am 41.My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiralling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

author: SHASTA
review: Red Dead Online is amazing. Really, really cool and fun in my opinion....But it doesn't work. There are so many bugs and glitches... SO many... Old ones too that have never been fixed. Obviously we know that the game itself, the singleplayer, is great... but coming from GTA Online to this - there is no comparison. Rockstar love GTA much much more than this game, but they are still willing to ask full price + micro transactions for RDO. .... We got an update coming and I hope they fix at least the connection issues, but I'm not holding my breath. Chances are, if you watch gameplay and think RDO would be fun, you will LOVE it... until Day 3 and you can't join the servers, keep getting booted out of them, get weird crashes that come from no where, camp doesn't spawn, missions won't start, your friends bug out and appear not to be playing when they are, NPCs become invincible, etc etc. This game is SO GOOD RDO IS SOOOO AWESOME HOW? HOW CAN IT BE ALLOWED to be SOLD in this busted state!!! "Double XP for Trader and Moonshiner" CAN'T EVEN PLAY! "Due to a fault with Rockstar Services" - your own ERRORS rat you out, it's Rockstar's fault! ... Bonus XP for Trader DUDE, MY CAMP WON'T SPAWN! MISSIONS WON'T START like.... what planet are these people from, honestly. It's a sad damn shame to see such a great online mode left unfinished and broken. Utterly broken.

You have so many interactions on a way to a mission. I could talk about this game for hours but i would recomend you buy it.

author: The Black Death
review: Now that I've gotten to play this game finally after months of waiting, I have to say I am impressed, as soon as I started playing(started with Red Dead Online), no crashes, no serious graphical issues that couldn't be fixed, no disconnections from online, and besides the medium-low fps for my computer this game runs rather well for my old PC that I just recently had upgraded and it'll run even better once I get further upgrades for my rig.Bye Bye PS4 Red Dead!I'm proud to say that this sequel is one of those examples of sequels that surpasses the original.

author: Landeyx
review: I have been writing and writing and writing on this review but there is just too much in the singleplayer alone that makes this game one of the best experiences I've ever had. A great story, beautiful graphics, touching moments, immersive world, host of activities and lots of fun make this game just too hard to review. There are thousands of small details like horse balls shrinking, pointing guns at blind men making them react or not if they're a fricking liar or not and so much more that I can't all put in this review. No amount of words can do this game justice.The hunting, amount of clothing in singleplayer and online, strangers, Arthur's beautiful journal, touching and badass moments in the story, voice acting, animation, mocap that the va's themselves did. The sheer amount of detail and work put into the singleplayer is astonishing and I'm happy I could finally exeperience it on PC.This game is praised by many and it's having backlash on PC because of people having issues with performance, either because of outdated drivers, Rockstar's launcher not working or turning their settings too high but all those problems are so small compared to the experience I've had with this game. I love it. Even the Online that many people hate is slowly improving, and is pretty clear of griefers and hackers despite what people say. Go to GTA today and you will have more modders and griefers on your ass than here. There are several little moments that I've captured and recorded of me helping out a player in online and parting with a wave, or finding some secret in the singleplayer and uncovering a story. There's just too much to write down here, I can only tell you that you absolutely should buy this game. You can buy the standard edition if you don't care for the extras that come with the special and ultimate editions.Red Dead Redemption 2 is amazing!

review: ❤ Audience ❤☐ Beginner☐ Casual Gamer☑ Normal Gamer☐ Expert☼ Graphics ☼☐ Bad☐ Alright☐ Good☐ Beautiful☑ Fantastic♬ Music ♬☐ Bad☐ Alright☑ Good☐ Beautiful☐ Fantastic☠ Difficulty ☠☐ Easy☑ Average☐ Easy to learn / Hard to master☐ Hard☐ Unfair§ Bugs §☐ Bugs destroy the game☐ Lots of bugs☐ Few Bugs☐ You can use them for speedrun☑ Nothing encountered☯ Story ☯☐ There is none☐ Bad☐ Alright☐ Good☑ Fantastic⚔ Gameplay ⚔☐ Frustrating☐ Sleepy☐ Boring☑ Fun☐ Challenging۞ Game time / Length ۞☐ Really short (0 - 3 hours)☐ Short (4 - 8 hours)☐ Few hours (10 - 20 hours) ☑ Long (40-60 hours)  [Just the main game, very long if maxing out]☐ Very Long (61-100 hours)☐ Extremely Long (101+ hours)$ Price / Quality $☑ Full price [you can also wait for a sale, but its worth full price]☐ Wait for Sale☐ Don't buy☐ Refund it if you canRecommend ☑This game almost made me cry. The story is amazing, I'll try not to spoil anything, the character relationships, the finally, the betrayals, the romance, the honor and loyalty. Its just so well designed, I would play this game for the story alone. The graphics are also absolutely beautiful, you can enjoy your time simply riding around the map, looking at the nature and animals. The actual gameplay mechanics are okay, I didn't see anything too special there. I'm not trying to say its bad, not at all, but many good games have done similar gameplay mechanics. Anyway, my favorite was the story, I recommend this game at normal price or sale price, doesn't matter. It's really good even if you don't like wild west theme.

author: Amxzy
review: I have to say, for me to buy this game twice, it's pretty damn amazing. I finished this on PS4 a few months ago and I couldn't stop playing it. Upon release, I kept saying that I'm not a huge fan of the "western" and "cowboy" type of games, but I'm extremely glad I gave this a chance. Besides looking absolutely beautiful on good hardware, the story line keeps you wanting to play more, and you'll end up wondering where all the time went as you're so captivated in it. I love that you can also give yourself a break from the main story to meet some interesting characters, and even go out hunting and collecting for the many things that the world has to offer. You'll never have a dull moment as everywhere you go, there's new sights to see and new people to meet.I know for a fact I will be taking my time to enjoy everything this amazing game has to offer for a second time, which sure as hell is worth it.

author: LVKEKEVINWVLKER.
review: An absolute masterpiece.One of the best games I've played since The Witcher 3.The story is fantastic, well written and Arthur Morgan is a great protagonist.The graphics are beautiful and they really set the tone for the theme of the game.I've not had any problems at all running the game or had any problems with the Rockstar launcher.Overall, I love this game and I think the story alone is worth the price, let alone online. 100% recommended.10/10.

author: darthaegis
review: Red Dead Redemption 2 is a western open-world shooter set in 1899, in the last days of the wild, untamed West as civilization slowly creeps in from East. You play as Arthur Morgan, a member in a gang of outlaws.This is a Rockstar game, which entails open world sandbox where you can go around shooting people and doing missions for a large cast of characters, but it feels very different. RDR2 is very slow paced: animations are lengthy, where Arthur sure takes his damn time picking things up, skinning animals, or looting, and just moving around feels like you're controlling a very heavy person. This doesn't make it feel exactly real (it probably doesn't take just 10 seconds to skin an animal in real life), but it feels less grounded and... "gamey" than most other games. This isn't a game where you go around doing missions or just shooting people, it wants you to take things slow. After a mission, I usually go hunting, get new clothes, shave, customize my weapons. Depending on the chapter I tried different styles of facial hair and clothing just for the fun of it. Riding around you usually find strangers with smaller side missions, or just random characters that may need help (they sadly repeat and I saw the same man asking me to suck the venom out of his snake bite twice, but even in such a high budget there is always a limit to how much content you see before things start repeating). Just... going around, hunting, talking with the people on your camp, taking in the atmosphere, it's a big part of why the game is enjoyable for me. This isn't something you wanna just turn on for 10 minutes, it's a slow burn that's very enjoyable for longer sessions. The immense detail and beauty of the virtual world Rockstar has created here is a step above everything else you'll play, even if the gameplay itself is nothing special.The missions are mostly the usual Rockstar fare: you get on your car... I mean, horse, you ride around for 5 minutes while your characters talk, and then you shoot a ridiculous amount of people. Divert in any way from what you're supposed to do and you get a Mission Failed screen (this is especially in "stealth" missions where the stealth just involves following a character and doing what he tells you to do). What elevates the story is... everything else, really. As scripted as the missions are, the writing is really ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ good, showing Rockstar's talent when they're not just doing caricatures in their GTA games. As scripted as the missions are, in many of them it feels like they were made to play in this way and this way only. The writing, soundtrack, even the way the camera zooms out when you're with your whole posse, it heightens what is essentially a playable movie with little interaction into... a very good playable movie with little interaction. However, only the best missions feel like this. Many of them feel unnecessarily scripted as aforementioned "stealth" missions, or some where I can't even rush enemies with a shotgun because the game thinks I abandoned my companion. The story is absolutely amazing nonetheless (barring - slightly spoilery - ), Arthur Morgan being one of the best characters ever written for a game.I usually can't stand highly scripted games such as Uncharted, and get eventually sick of GTA missions, but RDR2's atmosphere and detail make it a joy to be in 1899 America, and the story is absolutely outstanding. Its slow pace and often questionable design decisions (♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ hell game, stop switching my ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ guns around whenever you want to) may turn off some, but I think it's still very worth playing. Curiously, for such a high budget game it doesn't feel like a design-by-committee mess; it kinda feels like some guy said "you know, let's make a very slow and autistically detailed western game with a huge map" and then overworked thousands of people and spent millions to get his vision across. It's a very interesting (and very good!) game.
