author: A Tomato
review: is Rockstar Games and Take Two Interactive's 2018 blockbuster open world action game. This prequel to 2010's Red Dead Redemption tells the story of the Dutch Van der Linde gang's fight for survival and eventual downfall, in the increasingly civilized frontier of 1899's United States. this review only covers the singleplayer aspect of the game. Also,  - you have been warned.Starting off with the visuals, it is an absolutely gorgeous looking game, and remains remarkably presentable even with the majority of graphics options turned down*. Given its scope and scale, it understandably is taxing when run on the highest settings, yet remains comfortably playable when tweaked moderately. The visual atmosphere is fantastic, owing to very frequent use of volumetric effects and lighting - mornings and evenings in forests, especially, look extraordinary. The remaining technical aspects are high class as well, as every conceivable thing in the game world is pleasingly detailed and smoothly animated.*Most options can be reduced or disabled without compromising the graphics quality of the game,  It's in your best interest to keep this one at the very least on High.The voice acting in RDR2 is fantastic and varied, and given the extensive focus on storytelling and character development, this is most welcome. The majority of sound effects are also high quality and generally fitting. Music is where things turn somewhat mixed, sadly. The actual lyrical tracks, which play at pivotal moments in the story, are excellent and even emotional, and the freeroam ambience is nice, but most missions use something of a layered composed soundtrack, which unfortunately quickly ends up repetitive.The story gets special attention in this title, possibly being Rockstar's most ambitious and relatable tale yet. It's easily the main attraction of the game: experiencing being a member of the Van der Linde gang, even as it slowly falls apart. All the cast you encounter and interact with in the game, especially your gang members, are colourful and likeable, and your own protagonist are merely humans who wish they could do something else. The actual gameplay is immediately familiar to people who have played previous GTA titles, or indeed RDR: group of outlaws, criminals and/or outcasts perform deeds ranging from morally dubious to downright criminal, in order to make ends meet. The world is packed with opportunities for side activities, including poker, five finger fillet, hunting, horse breaking, robberies, as well as assorted challenges like performing a feat under certain conditions. A set of light survival and maintenance elements exist, as your basic health, stamina and Dead Eye (bullet time) stats should be maintained with occasional food and other provisions (and the same applies to your horse), but can generally be ignored at the cost of reduced regen and lower buffer for damage.Rockstar has gone all in on the immersive presentation of the game: almost every action done in the game world comes with its own little animation. This is a double edged sword, however: to pick up something, your character must stand in the industry regulated position to do so, and cannot set aside an object if need be, unless it's in its own designated spot. These take up a few seconds on their own, but can quickly add up over the course of the story, and further slow down the game's pacing - not to mention being, ironically, immersion breaking on their own just because of how  the game is in performing these actions.Gunplay isn't significantly different in execution from other Rockstar outings: a standard third person over-the-shoulder shooter. They attempted to add another layer of complexity/immersion/??? with manual weapon cocking, which in practice just needs another click or trigger pull to fire. Hardly enriches the gameplay, but instead makes it more tedious. Most long arms and alternate weapons are stored in your horse's satchel, and you can't carry your entire arsenal on your person all the time, which is fair game... but the game doesn't like you being certain of the weapons you've  set up for use while near the horse, which means you must double check your assigned weapons, lest you leave for battle with just two revolvers. This is actually annoying, which doesn't help how the regular combat is only "alright" at best.What really makes the game less fun to play through is that  in stark contrast to the open world mechanics and random encounters. Despite being where all the juicy action takes place, you cannot deviate from the path or go too far behind or ahead of your allies, otherwise you risk failing the mission. In fact, you generally can't try nonstandard solutions, like hogtying a person instead of going on a scripted cinematic chase, or intimidating someone over their late payments instead of beating them up; the main missions only give a tiny, at worst just one path to take. On top of this, nearly every story mission (and a good chunk of optional missions) involve you riding or walking with someone else for several minutes at a time while they do exposition. I guess it's nice worldbuilding, but at some point one just wants to get to the good bits.The game has multiple interaction functions and prompts for everything the player can and must do, and many of them aren't consistent with one another. Actual movement feels laborious and somewhat delayed, a consequence of realistic animation and attempts to implement more lifelike movement instead of direct control - again, this ends up feeling less immersive than otherwise.The basic story can last at least 40 hours to complete. Performing tasks around camp, exploring the game world for random encounters or goodies, and doing side activities and optional missions, can easily double or even triple the playtime just within the singleplayer. However, the draw of the game is the story, and I personally don't find the gameplay engaging enough for continuous play. is a fantastically polished experience telling a riveting story about human characters facing ever worse odds. While it requires high patience and tolerance to be able to enjoy the actual gameplay, I've not regretted my time playing it.

author: Waswar
review: The economy of the online component is dreadfully paced. If you do not enjoy grinding the same content again and again, it's absolutely nightmarish. Even the purchases that seem fine are not so. A red chestnut is decently priced for an early game player considering its stats, even with the additional hit for getting a stable slot for it. Then you pay its price in insurance and realize you spent 150% more for it than you were expecting, and get to enjoy an unbonded horse that for the next little while will be inferior to the starting horse. One of the memes early into the release of the game is that a can of beans (which will mildly restore your cores) costs more than a gold ring (which you would pawn to a fence). This is an excellent representation of the multiplayer economy: The game is positively miserly in doling out any money and gold bars alike, whilst making sure you're spending $60 on a burlap sack shirt, let alone something you would want to actually wear. People recommend hunting to make money. If making less than $28 every tedious trip after investing in the right weapons to get perfect pelts and then circling around 100 ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ times to look for three star animals is a good way of making money, I would recommend that the best part of this game is getting hit and killed by a parked stagecoach. Bounty Hunting seems to be far superior time-wise, but the task is so repetitive to do again and again, I simply find it unfathomable that the game expects us to endlessly grind like that.Thankfully, if you happen to find a rare golden-pelted bear, Gus will offer you $50 for this one-of-a-kind pelt, a considerable step towards the $950 for the golden-pelted coat! You see, the presence of good clothing is very limited, due to Rockstar discontinuing clothing pieces for whatever reason. Unlike GTA Online where you can have well over 60 pieces in a category that can all be mixed and matched, Red Dead Online offers intense variety such as 10 pairs of pants or 8 skirts, but don't worry, there's 62 kinds of similar-looking hats that will end up knocked off your head every 5 minutes!The game insists on throwing out contrived nonsense at you to continue to drain your income. An hour of gameplay leave your gun unclean and nigh-irreparable, wholly unsuitable for combat as specks of dirt make it inaccurate and less able to cause damage: And heaven forbid your gun (which look visually pristine) be considered "dirty", or gunsmiths will find themselves unable to place cloth wraps on them! Worry not: For the price of $10, your whole arsenal can be cleaned - every hour or so!In one of the missions, your posse will perform several setup missions and rob a bank. Story missions, at least proportionately, are excellent ways for new characters to make money. What does 1/2 the cut of an intricate bank robbery including stealing money from a vault and bonds from a managerial desk receive you? A ground-shattering $86, or a mind-boggling 143% of the dirty shirt mentioned earlier! Thankfully, when you're sitting in poverty, the game has several checks to make sure you do not become mildly less impoverished: If you shoot-out with the police as combat is one of the enjoyable portions of the game but too seldom given as everything insists you ride around on an unruly, slow horse for 30 years or spend far-too-much on loading screens to skip the tedium of travel, your honor will be so low, you will be unable to continue the story! I hope you enjoy running around the map performing menial tasks at $7 bucks a task to slightly nudge your honor up for you to continue the reality-shattering storyline that Rockstar has meticulously handcrafted for you.

author: Riviera Kid
review: One of the best games I've ever played.Graphics and animations are superb, with lovely details like foot and hoof prints, mud and slime which sticks to you and horse balls. The great weather graphics are lovely, I found myself just looking at sunsets while atop ma horses (The Riviera Kid or Dangerous Dan McGrew) just watching the sun go down.Story is good and I got really involved in it, the character you play is awesome. One of the few games I didn't skip a single cut scene because they were actually interesting and plot building also the dialog wasn't boring or overly long. Just wandering about in this game doing what you like is so much fun. Fishing, hunting, bounty hunting, robbing folk, robbing stage coaches, getting new horse, helping random people - there is so much to do, I spent hours just playing Domino.There are some truly awesome and hilarious characters to discover and interact with, the writing and voice acting is very good.Only way I could of got more out of it (like GTA should) was if you could random start as your own character and build your own personality, as when I completed the game I don't really see any replay value at least for a while. (I presume they just want you to play online mode)I tried online mode, but couldn't find anyone to interact with so never really got into it, and I'm not a online fan so never bothered going back.Amazing game 9/10

author: Gamboh
review: - Zero crashes or engine malfunctions after 37 hours. - Adjust the graphics settings, and it'll run pretty well on modern hardware.My review is going to focus on a specific complaint that I don't feel gets much attention. I do still enjoy the game.*Restricting the player's movements* has been a staple of the series since GTA 4, but Red Dead 2 really takes the cake. There are so many missions where you'll spend at least ten minutes locked into a walk-and-talk that it really started to feel like I was just along for the ride. It's boring, frustrating and more than a little insulting. In the car-based GTAs you can at least drive how you like, but in Red Dead all of those traveling conversations have your movements locked down. You cannot choose where or how to ride.Every time you want to pick up an item, Arthur needs to align his body to the object, move to it, bend over and interact with it, stand back up, place the item in his vest, and mutter a dry one-liner. Every time you loot a corpse, you need to painstakingly bend down, pick the body up, rummage through their pockets and then drop it. Switching weapons is clumsy, accessing horse inventory is cumbersome. Hunting and skinning animals is such a chore that I only did it a few times. The same goes for fishing. There are no carts to load skins, birds or fish on. You've only got a horse that can carry one carcass and a handful of other items. Thus, hunting is restricted to more of a curious side-activity than a method of generating money. Cooking meat you harvest yourself provides powerful healing items, but just like most of the other features, doing so is EXTREMELY slow. You need to hold down the button for a solid ten seconds for each individual piece of meat when cooking. Your inventory is small, so storing lots of food for later is not an option.Missions will arbitrarily switch your favorite weapons out for worse ones totally at random. Cut scenes are often boring, the story really isn't very compelling, and the controls do a great job of making me feel like I'm playing Resident Evil, not Red Dead.Visiting Dutch's camp is a snore-fest. The random interactions with other NPCs are interesting, but Arthur's walk speed is locked down to an inexcusably slow crawl when moving through the area. Returning to the base doesn't feel like coming home. I don't feel welcome in the camp. It feels as though I've stepped into a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ swamp. It's slow, and aside from dispensing missions the camp itself provides little value.I still feel like RDR 2 is worth the buy, because it presents a beautiful world to explore. When this game mercifully allows the player a little agency to act how they please, it can be very immersive. A few of the side-quests are indeed pretty interesting. Hunting an albino wildcat with a doomed debtor was pretty neat, and listening to the anxious concerns of our black comrades when we started to get close to the Mississippi river felt realistic and endearing. I just wish that my horse would go where I want, and that Arthur would stop running in the opposite direction when I hold down a move key.

author: Minsh
review: I bought this game just yesterday because i thought it would be okay after 6 months, but i still couldn't get it to work. Tried all the things everybody recommends, and ended up spending 3-4 hours (according to steam) in menu's and loading screens. Later i even noticed that steam said the game was still running when it crashed like 30 minutes ago, and there was no way of knowing since i hadn't looked at steam for a while. Now that was just more time spent in-game, even though it didn't seem to be running at all. When i start the story it'll just crash after max 2 minutes, or it wont start at al. Tried to request a refund because i can't ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ use the product i just bought for 60 euro, but steam just says they won't because you spent 2+ hours in the game. No way to appeal the decision. This is such a big go ♥♥♥♥ yourself to the consumer i despise steam and rockstar for it.

author: CarVeR
review: Original review after 29 hours:This game is absolutely fantastic. I bought this game with some slight hesitation, since the price was high even on sale, and people were complaining of bugs and crashes galore; however I am so very glad I bought it.I have had one crash since playing this game (29 hours) and I would admit it was probably due to me pushing my system too hard for what it could handle, as the frames simply slowed down until it froze, and then crashed to desktop. Not an issue in my opinion, it's happened once and I have had much worse issues with other games.The amount of detail in this game is incredible. There is so much to do, so many conversations to have with characters. I have been completely drawn into the world of Arthur and his gang, there's some wonderful storytelling.The graphical detail in Red Dead is absolutely breathtaking, so much so that I actually upgraded my graphics card especially so I could run this game on Ultra textures, and boy was it worth it.I haven't felt this immersed in a world since the first Red Dead Redemption. It has been a long wait for us PC gamers and I can quite honestly say that the wait has been more than worth it for me.If there are bugs in this game, I can't say I've come across them yet. I haven't played Online as that's not really my thing, but I will give it a go once I've finished the story.I can't comment on any of the bugs people have experienced, but I have changed my hardware especially for this game and have still yet to encounter any major issues despite playing with two different hardware setups on the same save. Don't let the discussion comments put you off, this is an absolute joy to play and I've poured in 29 hours so far, with only a third of the story complete.Update after 135 hours:This is the greatest single player experience I have ever had the privilege of playing. After 135 hours I have finally completed the main story and most of the side quests, and I have thoroughly enjoyed every moment. I can't express how brilliant this game is and how you should buy it and experience it for yourself. I can't wait to attain 100% completion and give online a go.

author: Xontaro
review: Very disappointed, the DRM already denied me access to red dead way too often for my taste, either claiming I'm logged out of SocialClub (which isn't the case) or when acknowledging that I'm logged in, claiming that I don't own the game.And even if the game boots up successfully its plagued with poor performance on hardware which should be considered mid to high-end at the time of writing this review (R7 3700X, 1080ti, 32GB RAM, running of a SSD). In addition to that, the game also has a control scheme which was clearly designed without the PC in mind.

author: Willpower
review: Wow, what a masterpiece this is. And wow, what a cluster♥♥♥♥ of a port this is. On a 970 Evo Plus, with a OC'd 1600 and a 1060 together with 16GB of 3200MHz RAM it's still barely functional. My first time with the game went rather decent, sure I locked it to 30 at about medium settings but hey, it worked. Then I decided alright let's take Digital Foundries optimized settings and try that out which is basically Xbox One X settings and see if performance will get better. Still pretty low but looks beautiful, better than consoles, and should only be slightly lower than my current settings but much better FPS meaning I can see where it goes frame rate wise unlocked. LMAO NOPE CRASH TO DESKTOP AT LAUNCH After trying all kinds of random troubleshooting, together with safe mode, it wouldn't work after like 10 attempts in which finally it did work. Okay phew maybe it's fine now.  GET LASERED HOMIE 10FPS. So I lowered the settings, alright, let's get that right: lowered the settings: and it's running worse. Lower quality = lower fps? But I noticed once I got back from the benchmark that it magically shrank my VRAM?? So now I can't run the game with ultra textures, so I'm like alright let's try high. Don't. Just don't. "High" settings literally look like unloaded PS2 textures. So I go in game then to mess around with some settings, lower settings due to the magically shrank VRAM so I can get the bare minimum Ultra textures (seriously anything below is unplayable and the game doesn't let you choose whether or not to adhere to the games VRAM limit) aaaaaaaaaaaaaand lmao the Vulkan renderer dies and the entire game starts corrupting. You might think my GPU is at fault here, right? Nope, I tried other demanding games and maxed them out and nowhere else does anything even faintly similar happen. So instead I try DX12, and lmao nice pop in goes on for like 30 seconds, not just texture pop in mind you: everything. The world, the characters, horses, decals, textures etc. etc. To put it simply if you wanna watch your PC slowly commit suicide with the help of a terrible PC port then oh boy is this the game for you. There's countless of issues, an infinite amount of issues that others are having and that you'll find immediately with a google search. All issues without any logical reason nor solution. It just is the way it is. It's a shame too because a great number of PC specific features are here making you think that oh the optimization is probably on par and . But nope, it just literally doesn't work. Even for PCs that can get it to work, it's obviously running worse than it should. A 2080ti is miles above the Xbox One X, at minimum quadruple the performance. Yet it only gets double the FPS. Yes, it looks beautiful, like absolutely stunning. But if it can look and perform so great on a console that's the equivalent of a mid range PC (even with console specific optimization), why can't a PC that's the price of a nice car run it not just a little better, but much better? And to top all this off: yeah, Rockstar support is just as bad as they've always been. Tbh even if the game was running perfectly for you, have fun getting wrongfully banned by Rockstar because of some troll/griefer/hacker at absolutely no fault on your own with Rockstar completely dismissing and ignoring you, sounds like GTA V all over again really. Yeaaaah ♥♥♥♥ this I'm gonna go play Halo now

author: Jamedog
review: Rockstar Games are back with another epic (no, I don’t mean that Epic), as Red Dead Redemption 2 serves as a prequel to its predecessor – a title which will unfortunately almost certainly never see a release on PC.Let me start by saying that there are clear technical issues with this release/port (I have doubts this is a port, as Grand Theft Auto V technically wasn’t, but that would make this situation worse) as I have experienced three issues: A crash instantly the very first time I launched the game on Steam, some occasional stuttering for a few seconds each, and audio crackling at times. These are issues with shouldn’t happen with a major release like this, so there really isn’t an excuse for it, especially as Grand Theft Auto V’s PC release was fine. After updating to the recommend drivers and tweaking with things, at this stage my game is running very well with no issues.Despite the problems on the technical side, I have really, really enjoyed coming back to Red Dead Redemption 2, doing so in the most definitive way possible. Let me tell you that in a title like this, going from a locked 30 FPS on console to even 60 FPS is an incredible difference. As you would expect, the game is beautiful, and I’d say at times it is mesmerizing. It looks so good I think you’d actually have to put in the effort to make the game look bad. The amount of graphical options is a plus - though the effort some of them have is negligible - which is Rockstar future-proofing.There are instances where I just want to come to a halt and stare into the wilderness, such is the sheer beauty of the world. Whilst first person on console was tedious, on PC it's a completely different story. Both first and third-person perspectives have their advantages and disadvantages, and both seem like two completely different experiences, but first-person feels the best way to experience single-player.The controls are adequate. Mainly it’s movement I have problems with. Characters feel heavy and have lots of momentum, though I am sure that’s the purpose. Also, when riding, because your horse moves relative to your mouse position, pressing A or D can cause your horse to change direction suddenly at 90 degrees if your cursor isn’t centered, though this is fixed with the “Horse Relative” setting under controls. All of this is perhaps more “controlled” with a controller, but for me, I prefer the freedom of keyboard and shooting with a mouse.The open-world is sprawling and immersive, with a myriad of activities and hobbies to undertake outside of the story missions. You can really lose yourself with how much there is to do and see.Now for the story. What can I say? Straight out of a Hollywood film, it’s as western as you can get. It’s dark, gripping, intricate, engrossing, and magnificent. No spoilers here, but it’s genuinely one of the most interesting and fulfilling narratives I’ve seen out of a video game, or any sort of fiction in general. No stone has been left unturned. Quickly, about the soundtrack/score - you should just experience it for yourself. A perfect companion to the narrative and world you live in.As for Red Dead Online? It's fine. It's very much Grand Theft Auto Online set in a different era and not as ridiculous... just yet anyway. It's certainly not the reason I bought the game, but it is a bonus.So, I guess what it comes down to is if I recommend Red Dead Redemption 2 or not. Well, I’d say there is a little bias here as I am absolutely a fan of anything Rockstar Games produces, but provided you can run it OK and this title is on your radar, I would tentatively recommend it at this stage. The asking price is already steep, and the technical issues are glaring, but there is so much to do here and so much to be impressed about.This is Rockstar’s opus magnum, though they will look to better it with their next title, as they always do.

author: Freakshow
review: If you bought the game for the multiplayer, boy are you going to be pissed. -Matchmaking is complete garbage. As a level 9 character I had to face level 145's in the free roam events. Zero chance against their upgraded abilities and high-end weapons. You want to pay to win? Fine. put those players on a different tier than the average joe.-Pay to win/micro transactions. Hunting, fishing, and side missions will earn you gold and money, but you will be grinding for hours just to buy a pair of pants, let alone a better gun. Of course there is a handy dandy market where you can spend more of your real hard-earned money on virtual gold. Of course there is.-Where did my camp go? This is a known bug, where either your camp moves, or disappears completely. Moving isn't really a big deal, but when your camp is gone you have to pay AGAIN to have it set up. And for as stingy as they are with currency, this bug really hurts the game.-Transported to seemingly random places, and left there after events. I did a horse race in Blackwater, which is close to my camp, but when the race was over I was left in Tumbleweed, one third of the map away from my base. This has happened to me a dozen times in 20 hours of gameplay. You either spend hard-earned game dollars to transport back to your camp, or take a long and time consuming walk. HOW ABOUT PUT ME BACK WHERE I STARTED?!?I'm frustrated, really. I want to like this game. It's very pretty, even with medium graphic settings. There's lots to see and do for you and your posse. But the balance just isn't there, and I doubt anything will change for the better.

author: Omaeka
review: (1440p @ 144hz)Lower the settings were, the worse the FPS was. The game overall runs okay (GTX 1070 9900k) on moderate/high settings.Switching to DirectX 12 over Vulcan disables controller functions and removes the Steam overlay, which is a shame as DirectX 12 is far superior especially on Nvidia hardware. Overall the game is great, runs 'alright' and looks nice, it's just got quite a few bizarre issues on PC. Literal textbook dictionary definition of 'bizarre'. I've never seen games do what this one likes to do on PC before, it's almost like it has a mind of it's own and it's a giant troll.

author: 超天才美少女夕立
review: 《荒野大镖客2》在一开始给我的印象就是西部版的GTA，你可以完全体验到西部世界的荒芜美，策马夕阳下，卧枕山涧旁，可以在酒馆里夜夜笙歌，赌桌上大展拳脚（物理），小道旁蒙面抢劫，深林里打猎捕鱼。但是一直玩下去，随着游戏的进行，我关于这部游戏的认知和感受也随着改变，也逐渐明白了救赎二字的含义。在通关之后，我可以说，RPD2是当前最好的西部游戏，是更加深刻而真实的时代末期绘卷。    RPD2的画面，尤其是光影方面，在我看来是非常精美的，我的截图大部分都在夜里，因为在月光普照下的西部世界非常的真实迷人。而游戏的水物理做的非常的真实，水的贴图即使只有一半也保持着很高的水平，草地和树木的细节也是如此。遗憾的是我的1060完全无法驾驭这部游戏，在经过很多次调试之后，也只能维持在40帧左右。其实这对于游戏体验来说是有一部分扣分的，当然这是我自身的问题，不过当年玩GTA5的时候，也是感觉R星虽然追求材质、光影的细节，但是却没有顾及到优化，如果有更加好的分级会更出色。    RPD2的系统很多，包括但不仅限于荣誉系统、马匹系统、人物属性系统、枪械改造系统、打猎捕鱼系统以及多分支的任务系统。     荣誉系统在我看来，貌似只对结局有所影响，然后就是在游戏中的梦境或者幻觉中，决定你看到的是鹿还是狼。本身R星的想法是好的，让玩家决定自己想做一个什么样的人，但是没有积极的反馈，导致你可以在游戏前期大杀特杀无恶不作，后期在圣丹尼斯hello大法狂刷荣誉，并且路人的反馈也属实呆若木鸡，没法让人觉得伤害他们有愧于良心。更别提你前面做好好先生，一个剧情任务或者骑马蹭到人就让你回到解放前。       马匹的好感等级增加可以解锁马匹的 各 种 姿 势，同时也能增加马匹属性。       人物属性系统，我在玩的时候根本就没有核心低于一半过，而我本身也没怎么吃东西，而体重。。。貌似没有什么特别的副作用。      枪械的改造除了镜子以外并没有对枪本身的性能有太大的影响。     打猎跟捕鱼一言难尽，喜欢的很喜欢，讨厌的也很讨厌，个人觉得如果是刷成就得花费一点时间。      任务系统，对于我来说做的非常好，包括在路上遇到的随机事件，有很多都是有后续的，在后期收到自己帮助过的人的回报或者感谢信，让自己挺有成就感的。    剧情方面，我相信是可以吹爆的。前期节奏平缓，中期开始出现戏剧性的爆发点，后期节奏紧凑不拖泥带水，整体走完对于游戏本身想要传达的意思都能一目了然。游戏里电影模式的分镜处理跟BGM的插入做的非常的到位，让人很有代入感。    人物方面，RPD2塑造的人物非常多，包括亚瑟，主线的达奇、迈卡、约翰、兰尼、哈维尔、何西阿、查尔斯、莎迪等，其他的NPC包括但不限于老兵米奇。浣熊帽乔恩、疯狂传教士、盲人卡西迪等。很多人物的个性是比较鲜明而有趣的，但是就我个人来说，反而主线营地里的人塑造还不够，尽管有各种脚本对话加持，但仍然不够深入人心。比如约翰在前六章里面戏份比较少，其实可以增加一点篇幅表现约翰本人的内心想法，来增强最后第六章结局他与亚瑟分开时的表现力，当然也有可能是官方觉得1代加2代后面2章说的够多了。。。    这个游戏槽点很多，首先的启动流程就让人槽点满满，R星自家的启动器能不能好点做啊？游戏里的恶性bug也非常的恶心人，比如黑先生白先生那里，撕了所有的海报之后后续任务一直不刷新，坐马车到圣丹尼斯之后马车突然起飞人物暴毙，刚从抢劫瓦伦汀银行的任务出来瞬间被枪毙等等。同时游戏的保存啊，我真的没话说，9102年了还不能即时保存即时读取我真的日了狗了。还有极其繁琐的捕猎系统，完美毛皮真的让收集癖抓狂，更别提我好不容易杀了个完美的鹿（毒箭），它走了几步到了水边，我没法剥皮，我真的。。。包括游戏很多的赶路time，以及更换营地时的“流程化套路”，真的让人无聊。哦对了，还有终极无敌搜刮癌患者的心痛，我知道你给我时间搜刮，特意让我选择是跟人一起走还是自己有别的事情做，贴心的不刷新战场，但是一个一个搜刮还有动画真的让人头疼。更别提那个蛋疼的射击手感，射一枪之后还要再点一下才会上膛下一颗子弹而不是自动的，这就导致下一发会延迟射击，非常的屎。    这些缺点真的让人有点烦躁，个人评分，涉及剧透    亚瑟·摩根是游戏史上塑造的非常成功的角色之一。他是一个充满矛盾的人物，正是这些矛盾使得他更加得鲜活而立体。 亚瑟曾经自嘲自己竟然被这个女人玩弄于股掌之间，前面我曾经怀疑过亚瑟是否真的对于玛丽有所厌恶，但是后来在亚瑟与落雨的谈话中我得知亚瑟是有过妻儿的，可能是妻儿的遭遇让亚瑟没法再去跟玛丽有所故事。而亚瑟寻求救赎的心态变化也是出于这两个女人。达奇给我的印象一开始是比较不错的，在他的领导下帮派有凝聚力，做事有道德底线，关心帮派成员。然而到了后期，此人变得狼子野心，心狠手辣，嘴上大义凛然背后心地黑暗，为达目的不择手段。正如亚瑟所说，“可能只是日子久了，一个人的内心才会真正暴露出来”。而亚瑟则一直守住了自己的原则跟底线，大概这就是他本人所有的黄金精神，亚瑟最后仍然是忠诚的，在我看来他所忠诚的是自己的底线和帮派的戒律，而不是达奇本人，达奇在最后更像是一个暴力冷血的独裁者，而这也是后期他与达奇的主要矛盾所在。在游戏后期任务中，很多帮派成员嘲讽道，”亚瑟，你是真的老了。“然而玩家明白，实际上是亚瑟随着游戏的进行变得更加善良，在亚瑟帮助别人之后，别人总是说，”亚瑟先生，你是个好人“，而亚瑟总是这样回复：”先生/小姐，如果你了解我的过去，你一定不会这么说。“后来的亚瑟内心就如同玛丽最后寄来的信所说，亚瑟心中有两个人在打架，最后那个巨人赢了。而玛丽不知道的是，最后是亚瑟心中的善完全战胜了恶。而这一路，都是玩家陪伴亚瑟的救赎之路。如同那位修女说的一般，     常言身后罪孽沉，难觉心中善意深，野兽是你，蔷薇也是你。再见，亚瑟·摩根。P.S. 1 我只想吸一口气，然后大声的喊——“Gavin！！！！！Anyone see my friend Gavin？？？？”P.S. 2 天国的生还者2，能好好学学吗？看看你自己粪一样的剧情，能爬开吗？

author: arrieBiceps
review: Worth the disk space.

author: EleKumama
review: It's a good time if you want to be a cowboy. I like the story and I like the characters and I like shooting people. Overall, good cowboy time. There's not much I dislike about the game, I'd say there's a few awkward moments in the textures, but it can be overlooked in my opinion.

author: JackieBalaclava
review: This game has made me laugh, made me cry and it has made me boiling in anger. A wild ride that has left me with a hole in my heart that i never will be able to fill again. Its like i want to wine back the time just to be able to experience the story once more.Ive learned to love some of the characters that ive hated, and ive come to hate some that i loved. The choices ive had to make are choices that made me think about the consequences. Every good story should make choices feel like are doing something. Something to the world, the people around you. To There is not alot of games that leave me with the feeling that i really care about the characters. About Arthur, the gang and my sweet white arabian horse Troja III. She rode with me for the majority of the game all the way until the end. Completing the game makes me feel like ive lost friends and pets, and thats how a well written story should make you feel. Red dead redemtion 2 tops the spot on all counts of how to make a good story. I wanted to take my time and enjoy the world and not rush the story, doing some side missions here and there. Meeting people that actually felt alive and living in the world i currently was a visitor in. But i always wondered what would happen next in the story. I always found myself back in camp donating food or just fooling around with the other members of the gang just to be able to say Well more nights than others, that bedtime never really came. The story of RDR2 has had me hooked like no other. And i just want more. I dont want it to be completed. I want the fresh experience of not knowing what will come next, what will happen if i did this, or what will happen on the way to my next destination. The world of RDR2 is soo full of life that goes on even without you, to stumble upon old acquaintances and hearing whats been going on since we last met, you somehow forget how this is a game. There is so much to say about this game, that it is leaving me speechless. It is like psychedelics, its one of those things that you just have to experience for yourself to fully understand. I will probably revisit this review a couple times as i find words to describeUntil then:

author: Ryu_Tsume
review: So far, I've only played the online version of this. I own it on both PS4 and PC.Love the heck out of it, truly. I find it exceedingly enjoyable both solo and with a group of friends.I was a huge fan of RDR, and what little I have played of the main story in RDR2; I'll enjoy it just as much.The controls are smooth, the game is absolutely gorgeous, and it's so easy to just relax with all the hunting, fishing, and various trades to rank up online.However: The online experience from a technical standpoint on PC has been... less than stellar. Rockstar seems to habitually disconnect; and if it doesn't the game crashes in a consistently anyway. I've tried many a fix suggested by the RDR2 community, but I still get errors that cause me to disconnect from Rockstar servers, or the game will just crash.(These connection issues are not nearly as prevalent on the PS4, and I have yet to have the game crash on that platform either.)If Rockstar can fix whatever these issues are: This game is a must buy.

author: HugeJerk
review: Something about gameplay of GTAV and RDR2 just click with me. The game never leaves me bored, even when free roaming for hours at a time there's always something to encounter that you don't expect. There are little unique details all over the map that tell a story without the need for any dialog or text. This can be a very long game if you decide to try to see everything.

author: House16
review: I have 17 hours at the time of this review and boy if you don't have any issues with the launcher and all that stuff other reviewers are saying then this is easily a must buy for people who love open world games that are not always about rushing to the next objective and more like enjoying your time in the open country. If you can launch the game but have some rough performance than I highly suggest following a guide that you can find online that goes over what all the advanced settings are and how they effect performance. following one of these allowed me to play the game with ultra textures and effects just by changing water quality graphics for negligible looks for much more performance.For me this was a great buy and I would do it again anytime.

author: The Troubled Peon
review: Best damn story I have played for years. It was such an immersive gaming experience for me.  I did not run in to any PC bugs throughout my time as a wild west gunslinger. I was hesitant to buy at first due to the many negative comments about it constantly crashing on PC.  I quickly became Arthur Morgan, I just loved his dry humour and husky voice. I would walk around the house saying.. That's a good girl * Youu alllright girrrl :D constantly to the point that my GF said I was crazy.Now don't even get me started on the horses in this game. - I freakin love my damn horse. "roach" ;p now after completing the story mode I feel empty and life will never be the same :P I have just created my online profile but haven't played RDO yet. I don't even know if I will. If I can after this.  Do yourself a favour if you are new to RDR2. Don't read any spoilers. Don't research anything just play the damn thing and let it take the time it takes. Don't rush just be the cowboy you were born to be.

author: hackles
review: I have mixed feelings about this game. I'm 73 hours in and the game is expertly crafted... mostly. There are a few "what the hell was the developer thinking?!" aspects to the game. For example the button to talk to someone is the same button to point your weapon at them if you have your weapon equipped. So I've ruined a few encounters that I can't go back to because I accidentally threatened people. Also many aspects to the game are not intuitive. So for a lot of things you don't really get the joy of figuring things out because you have to find so many walkthroughs online in order to get by. You just get used to looking things up, which generally just makes you tempted to read walkthroughs with spoilers. I think my biggest beef with the game is that it doesn't feel like you're accomplishing anything. It just feels like you're grinding out achievements. So while I'm compelled to get them finished, I'm not really enjoying the experience.

author: Scarecrow
review: Rockstar's greatest masterpiece yet. Do I need to say something else?

author: Venom
review: Great game with a rich story line!

author: Elinbarrage
review: we wont be able to see such strong campaign for ages...but i gotta say:rockstar kiram to behine sazit ridi ba in behine sazit

author: Rog
review: This is Rockstar at its finest.  The attention to detail in this title is at the pinnacle of all video games.  There are countless small elements to this game, that do very well to bring you in to the environment completely.  From the lighting & scenery, to the ambient sound & atmosphere in all the various settings across the map, you feel immersed in your location, as if you were presently standing there yourself.  Bravo to the artists, writers, developers, and actors that worked on this project, you have set the bar to a higher level.  This game is a masterpiece.

author: Horse
review: Single player is alright I guess. Am about 25% through.Multiplayer is super disappointing. To do anything fun (eg bounty hunter etc) you need to acquire 15 gold bars. You can do this by running boring AF repetitive missions for 15 hours (this is on average how long it would take to get 15 gold), or you can spend money to buy said in game gold. To me this is pay to play, and hidden fairly well, it wasn't until after my refund period had finished I realised this. after having spent money on the game already this feels super scummy. will not support rockstar games any further while they employ this model.

author: Sir Noob Wulf
review: I want to make something very very clear.This is a Horrible port of an Excellent game. If you can get it working this is a game worth playing.It looks stunning.But this is 2019 and we are about to step into 2020 so this level of quality is almost a given these days.I can't comment much on the story,I have barely begun but what i can say is that the characters so far are excellent.They have realistic motivations.They are somewhat relatable. And honestly I cannot say that about most games that have released on PC this year.As far as gameplay goes ,This is not a Grand Theft Auto or something fast paced like Fortnite.So If you are the kind of player who wants fast paced action in their games,Steer well clear of this.There are long segments where you will just be riding your horse.Now obviously that is not an issue for me but i can see how some might find that boring.Don't get me wrong, there is definitely Action here,It is not as over the top as in GTA.This game overall is a masterpiece and proves that not every ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ game needs to be an RPG in order for it to be a good game.Kudos to Rockstar for having that sense when companies like Ubisoft simply do not.As far as the performance is concerned it is a right mess,There is no two ways about it.It crashes randomly(It has crashed 4-5 times in the 11 hours i played) It is littered with bugs, Using Vulcan may give you a few more frames but it breaks the game as it induces Audio issues Stuttering etc.If you want to play use DX12,That is my advice.Since Steam doesn't have any other rating than a recommend or not it is very hard to rate this game.That being said I would recommend this broken mess because when it works it is fantastic. And sure it takes a bit of effort to get the damn thing running smoothly but it is still worth it.If i had to give it a score I will split it into 4 partsStory and Characters(Thus far): 10/10Gameplay: 10/10Music: 9/10 (It's great but I've heard better)Performance: 2/10

author: Tralion
review: game won’t launch. it says activation is required, and that i’m offline. i’m not offline, and i already own the game, so i should be able to play it.update: after over two hours of setup, i was finally able to play the game. it is fun enough that it was actually definitely worth the two hours of setup.

author: Patney
review: The problem with this game is that they spent so much time putting details into everything *but* the gameplay. So many missions just consist of you walking, very slowly, for several minutes. The exciting missions all play out the same (escape an area while you shoot down dozens of people). Plus everything feels extremely clunky for the sake of realism. You eventually stop doing stuff like hunting and looting because nearly everything has to feel like a mini-cutscene. I want to like this game because there are elements I love in there but too often I find myself bored with the bad gameplay decisions Rockstar made.For what it's worth, I think the story is great, the graphics are obviously phenomenal, and if you just want a slow paced immersive game with decent writing then RDR2 is good. But for me when a game is this massive it shouldn't have gameplay this slow, clunky and uninspired.

author: Mobius1
review: A near perfect world, atmosphere, and detail...but complete chore to get through the story.Out of 50 hrs, 48 of those are watching cut scenes, quick time events, or pressing 'A' to follow your crew on horseback. Of the almost unlimited things to do in this perfectly crafted map, nearly none of it matters, and offers no progression other than cosmetic. It always feels like its just about to get better right around the corner, then never does.The characters, and the premise of the story are excellent, however the pacing is dead slow and contradictory at times. All of the missions are on rails and the player has no real control over any event in the game. This disconnects the player from all immersion and emotional investment in the game, when there should be so much drawing you in. It's all in there, but fails to deliver. IMO this game is terribly over-rated. All of the components are there to be a near perfect masterpiece. A mile wide, but an inch deep.

author: Skrubenz | TTV
review: Currently cannot open the game because of the Rockstar Game Launcher and how God awful it is. Also somehow telling me that I played the game for nearly 4 hours when I played it for less than two, so at some point it must have been running in the background without my knowledge or consent.EDIT: After playing the game for quite a while, it is a great game, but unfortunately I will still be recommending against it due to Rockstar's greed and incompetence. The game is plagued by constant bugs and glitches that take the experience to a 10/10 to an 8/10 at best and I'm not sure if those are exclusive to the PC version or not, but what I can tell that is exclusive to this version of the game, is the fact that it's a God awful port that runs terribly, crashes frequently and requires the Rockstar launcher that always seems to break and prevent you from playing the game. All of this for a port of an year old game that they are still charging full price for. Absolutely unacceptable.

author: socco
review: TL;DR The story is great but linear, the actual gameplay is kinda lacking.I haven't bothered with RDR Online, this is only a review for the singleplayerThe actual game itself is great. It's a huge open world with a lot of care and detail put into each character. Unfortunately it is pretty linear, you don't have a lot of choice, and you basically can't really do anything if you go to an area earlier than you're supposed to, but despite that the story itself is pretty great. A lot of the quests feel very cinematic.Unfortunately this game suffers from your standard console port symptoms though. It's not very well optimised (albeit not the worst I've ever seen), and the controls are pretty awful and nonstandard. You do get used to them eventually, but it can be really clunky at times. The UI is pretty bad too, everything is buried under it's own little tab. It doesn't sound that bad, but when the game is constantly unequipping your weapons and you have to tab through a list of 15 guns while you're being shot at, it gets pretty annoying. Movement in general is also pretty slow clunky at times, it can be hard to do anything precise, and it's annoying to die just because your character got caught on a little piece of geometry or won't stop spinning around when you're trying to go through a door. There's also Rockstar's launcher too as an added bonusThere's also the survival mechanics. You have your usual health/stamina/etc meters and ones for your horse as well, but also more unique ones like wearing warm clothing or brushing your house. Ik some people like survival mechanics, but all of them are really easy to deal with here, food is very plentiful, you literally carry a brush for your horse with you at all times, etc. So dealing with them is never something you actually have to worry about, it just means you have to pause what you're doing every so often to click on a button in your inventory. It only takes a few seconds, but waiting for Arthur to slurp down a can of beans for the 100th time so you can get back to playing isn't really my favourite. To me it just felt like more of a hassle than anything elseThe game also tries to stuff you into a lot of hunting/fishing/etc type activities. Thankfully most of them are optional, but you do miss out on a lot of crafting if you choose not to go around grinding for pelts, since there's no real alternative to it. Some people might not mind, but it's something to be aware ofAll and all it's a great game, even despite a lot of it's flaws I'm still enjoying the vast majority of my time with it, and I definitely recommend it. I've seen a lot of people say this is the best game ever and an absolute 10/10 masterpiece, and while you could definitely make a case for the story alone, the rest of the game still has plenty of issues for me.If all you care about is the story, definitely get it. If you're looking for a great gameplay experience with great shooting, maybe wait for a good sale

author: Merlin
review: I don't know if it is even worth writing this. The game itself doesn't need reviews and mine isn't going to be heard. I just feel like writing a review atm. (You probably already stopped reading)The game is about being a cowboy. You are in a gang of other cowboys and complete robberies and missions to help each other out and gain money for the amazing future.The game has one of the best storylines I have ever seen in a game. This is the best storyline from all the games I own. The game has a lot of cutscenes. All of them can be skipped. I wouldn't recommend it but it is possible. You can skip the cutscenes and still understand the point of the game. This is mostly happening while you're on your way with a teammate, riding to the location of the mission. You will start talking with the teammate so you still understand the goal of the mission you're about to do.The game asks a lot of your pc. My friend had issues at first setting it up. He had a black screen with sound. I told him to google it (he isn't very good at that, might be the reason why it took him 2 days LOL). He eventually found it and fixed the problem. He was able to play the game like everyone else. The game can require a lot from your pc and this makes it one of the most beautiful games I have ever seen. The sunrise and down are beautiful. The scenery, the animals, the grass, it is all there.Let's get back to the missions. The missions in the game are easy and guided. The NPC's that are on your side will most likely tell you what to do. There are A LOT of missions. In the Chapters 1 to 6 you get a lot of "Side Missions" as well. These are marked white. I recommend doing the most important ones and the ones that are somehow linked to you and your gang. This is due to the fact that you might not be able to do these missions in the epilogues. (these come after the Chapters 1 to 6. (There are 2 epilogues))The game includes hunting, stealth, love, animals (and taking care of them), and robberies.Let's talk about the robberies now.You and your gang will earn the most money by the robberies they commit. I really enjoyed the robberies. Sadly, when you've finished the game, you won't really be able to do those robberies as you're used to. For example, you can't really do robberies in Online. At least, I couldn't find a way to when I tried this. The robberies (like every other mission) are filled with choices. You can choose to blow something up, or you can choose to just try and crack the code. The game is filled with these choices. You can help someone, or not.The game also contains a lot of violence. There is more blood then we're used to. You can shoot a leg, arm, head off. I wrote to much that I don't know what I wrote at this point.I will just say what I think about the game and give one last opinion. For me, the game felt like a movie. I turned on subtitles to make it easier to remember and understand what the characters were saying. When looking back at the game. I remember everything so well. I really enjoyed it. The storyline (as said before) is the best one I've ever seen! The scenery and overall looks of the game are amazing! I can name a lot more things. The game is worth the money. The gameplay feels so big and huge that you just know that it was worth it. I recommend this game to everybody. This is something you don't want to miss.(oh yeah, the online feature, it's really bad, I don't know what, but it just misses a lot. When you first complete the story mode, you're used to a lot more violence and robberies for example. Then when going online, it isn't possible there. You then sort off bored.) I am just going to end this 1023012371283129321912309 characters long review here. hahaCya, pls comment on what you think of my review. I'd like to hear what I missed and if you're curious about how and what...~Merlin

author: planescaped
review: Singleplayer is a masterpeice. No more need be said.Red Dead Online, just like GTA Online, is a cancerous growth on the ass of the gaming industry, a beacon of all that is wrong with modern gaming. A sandbox designed solely to get the player to spend more money, a "free" multiplayer with all the fun of a malware popup. >_>Fortunately they're separated, unfortunately the garbage multiplayer gets all the preference for post release content, so no story DLC, new weapons or outfits or horses or gameplay added to the part of the game that is worth playing...Still, the base game is great despite Take Two being Take Two.*addendum and mild spoilers: after having played it for 200h now, and gotten to Chapter 6... I hate to say that while it started off super strong, the game is really starting to lose me now.RDR2 unfortunately seems to suffer from a mild case of Game of Thrones/Walking Dead syndrome... meaning it is so bleak at times as to be genuinely unpleasant. Though it is no where near as crippling to its own narrative as those two. It's moreso that RDR1 is already a super tragic and bleak game, so with this being a prequel and me knowing where it is all going it just began to sap my will to keep playing over time. I dreaded it being a prequel going in but the game won me over, only to completely lose me and prove my fears right. I've never played a game that I loved so much, that I freely admit is worthy of all the acclaim, that I ended up being utterly apathetic about. Bleakness in a story needs to be paired with the right amount of hope, otherwise it can become just a miserable experience. RDR2 for me dipped into that by chapter 5.But I do still wholeheartedly recommend it! Especially if you're not as worn out by miserable stories as I am. And when I was enjoying it, it was great fun. I honestly do think the game would have been served better had it had a happier ending. It didn't need to be The Sound of Music, but when RDR1 ends how it does, having RDR2 go the way it does made me kind of just want to go play something else...

author: Amethyst
review: Great game. I was worried at first when I saw all these negative reviews about crashes, bad optimization, lags. From my experience on my Mid-Tier Rig. Im playing on a GeGorce 1060 3GB; Not a single crash yet, running on atleast 50 FPS. On Mid-Tier GPU's I recommend Textures including Decals, Fur etc to set on High and play around with Particles, shadow and Lightning, specially particles.

review: Amazing story, horrible multiplayer.

author: Arch
review: The game itself is good but I cant recommend a game that uses a launcher that won't even let you play an offline game without a connection to Rockstar's servers

author: jepcar
review: Even if you paid full price, this game looks better than real life lol..You can spend hundreds and hundreds of hours playing only Story Mode, you can do so much I can't even list everything (explore, story mode itself that has 40+ hours and the side missions about 60+, legendary animals and so much more).I spent even more time in Online, even tho it does not compare to its previous Online mode (GTA Online), it's still very good and actually way more peaceful. You don't have to grind as much and gameplay is much more relaxing.Edit: Of course this wonderful masterpiece gets forgotten and GTA Online gets constant big updates.. smh R*..

author: InstaCoffee
review: TLDR: if you wanna buy ONLY for single player - do it... If you wanna buy for Multiplayer - STAY AWAY (Massive hacking problems)I want to give it a thumbs up because the story truly is incredible as everyone else says. I have played it on PS4 and again here on PC. However I can not give it a thumbs up if you ever plan to play multiplayer. This game is plagued by hackers the same way that GTAV is. players will teleport to you, kill you, kill your horse, take all your items, drain all your money by spamming your camp fees, they will force you to fail missions.I changed servers 8 times and every time I was instantly targeted by hackers who would spam kill my horse and myself.For me personally, multiplayer is 100% unplayable. the second I finished the intro story of multiplayer is when I began getting hit by hackers.It is beyond me how after the massive success and revenue that GTA had, how rockstar could be so incompetent when it comes to their online games and community. the hacking in RDR2 is the same if not worse than GTAV and the hacking in GTA is the exact same reason why I never persisted with the multiplayer.its very annoying to deal with such rampant and unchecked hacking. it is not even worth the effort to try and play normally online. IDK how some people play for hours and hours and hours when hacking is so persistent.

author: Lukart
review: I wanna start off by saying that it's the best Western game I have played, And can recommend it to any fans of Westerns ever, I have spent almost 100 hours in the game I have had fun and had problems my biggest problem is that people can connect a controller and basically have aimbot which I find a huge problem to fight. So I don't recommend Player VS Player game modes, But a huge up is how beutiful the game is and how you have to actually think about what you do with cleaning weapons and less money if you kill someone with a bounty on them you get less money that a live bounty. I can really get lost in the game truly a master piece if I had to rate the game it would be a 8/10 mostly because of the controller and people hunting you for no reason until you find a new server. If they fix these small problems then I would place it at a strong 9/10Also wanna say I primarily played Multi-Player

review: I couldn't start the game. It required the Rockstar Launcher, which didn't work properly with any version of Proton I tried. author: Paroxetina 20
review: Best game I've ever played. I even do enjoy the online mode with all its "flaws".Arthur Morgan is the most human, relatable, enjoyable, badass character ever made.All the side characters are also the most endearing; you get to know them all with their unique things, and just like Arthur himself, you'll see the good and bad in each of them.You can replay this game as many times as you like, it's always different, and there are tons x tons of side missions, easter eggs, etc. plus 3 different endings that depend on your whole journey each time you play it.10/10

author: McGoldenblade
review: One of my favorite games of all time, easily in my top 3. I absolutely adore this game and all the effort Rockstar put into it. Now, despite me saying that, it's not perfect, and whether or not I recommend you buy this game comes down to many factors, so I'll just list the pros and cons and elaborate from there.PROS:-Huge immersive open world-Some of the most beautiful graphics I have ever seen (if you have a good enough PC, I'll get into that later)-Amazing soundtrack-Easily the best writing I have seen in any video game, and probably one of the best written stories in all of fiction period. The story is actually straight up that good.-Incredibly well-written cast of lovable (and hateable) characters-Loads of realistic and immersive details that make the world feel so incredibly real-Low-key has the best hunting and fishing in any game I've played-The Deadeye mechanic is ridiculously fun if used correctly-Great Horse MechanicsCONS:-Poor optimization, basically requires a NASA supercomputer to run without any fiddling with the settings. If you have an RTX graphics card I HIGHLY recommend you use DLSS, or else the game will run like ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥.-Very slow gameplay, specifically animations. Personally doesn't bother me, but it can and will bother a lot of people who prefer games with faster gameplay.-Controller support is finicky. If you play with a PS4 controller the interface will show Xbox controls for some reason. Not a huge deal breaker, but it can be annoying.-Lots of unskippable cutscenes and dialogue. Again, doesn't bother me, but will definitely bother a lot of people.-VERY linear story missions.Also, this isn't exactly a pro or a con, but it's very important to understand that this game is LONG. Just look at my play time at the time of writing this, that's how long it will take you to beat this game if you choose to do most of the things worth doing. I really only recommend this game if you plan on spending most of your free time playing this game for at least a month or two. It's a HUGE time investment, and is very much worth it if you're able to push through it. If you don't like spending a lot of time completing games, this game sadly isn't for you.Now, who would I recommend this to? If you love good stories in video games, are patient, and enjoy open world games, you'll fall in love with this game as I have. There is so much this game has to offer and is one of the best gaming experiences one can have. However, if you're impatient, don't like long games, or don't care about story, you might have a hard time enjoying this one. Also, you need to have the right specs and the right know-how to get this game working. I mentioned earlier how the game is absolutely beautiful on it's highest settings, but ONLY on it's highest settings. If you have the texture quality set to anything but Ultra, the game will look like ass. But if you don't have a monster of a PC, the game will run like ass if you run it on Ultra. It's a catch 22. I mostly blame the port for having awful optimization, as on other platforms you don't have to worry about graphics or framerate at all. So I recommend buying on other platforms if you don't mind being forced to play with a controller. However, I think keyboard and mouse is they best control scheme for this game (and this is coming from someone who played both on PC and on PS4). With all that being said, I still recommend buying this game regardless. It's incredible, and definitely worth playing.

author: flaskk_
review: So, I love this game. It's probably my favorite game ever made. I love the pace, the setting, the combat. I don't care that it is clunky and there are really stupid missions parameters that make you follow the story path. I think it's not well thought out but I love it regardless.This game is not optimized for PC...  I have one of the best set-ups you could possibly have for PC. GTX 1080 ti, 8700k i7, 32 gigs of DDR4 RAM. running it off of an SSD on top of that.The frames for this game jump all over the place. I've just played the beginning hours.... but i go from the foggy snowy beginning to the more regular grasslands and that ♥♥♥♥ it still the same FPS. I have been trying to keep everything at maximum, and I know those are not the appropriate settings since I don't have an RTX.  But I basically have the best PC you can buy prior to RTX...... and this game runs like ♥♥♥♥.I have toned it down to compensate.  But this game runs like ♥♥♥♥..... and I am pretty disappointed of Rockstar.... They also made us launch the game through them even if we bought it through steam.... whatever. Just make your ♥♥♥♥ work when its supposed to ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. I didn't need your launcher for GTAV so why do I need it now? ♥♥♥♥ you.This is a very barely thumbs up.  This game is great, no doubt, but the PC port has a lot to work on.Edit: I have now upgraded to an  RTX 2080ti and an i9 9900K. and this ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ game still doesnt run at 60fps. about 45 is the average. plz fix Rockstar.Edit 2: Online mode is awesome but it is plagued with connectivity issues:>go around killing a bunch of animals for skins and materials>go back to camp>camp disappeared and will not load>try to relocate camp>camp will not relocate>stuck in limbo>forced to reload>lose all progress>♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ sweet game

author: Ünzogi -B
review: Sit in front of your computer after a busy day. Start the game and ride your faithful horse. Then, start playing this amazing song at the bottom and go on a manhunt.- Soak up the deserts, nature, towns, and the Wild West.- Turn on your favorite cowboy song and duel with other cowboys.- Go to a guy camping and tie him up then burn him alive in a campfire.- Choose a place to camp and have a few sips of beer while enjoying the stunning scenery.- Start traveling in the open world, and someone will find you who will make you feel sad, happy, or angry.No game has excited me this much in a long time. I never rush to finish the game and unlike other games I try to do everything I see. Even a seemingly simple thing will surprise you so don't ignore anything. Because the world of this game is alive and does everything to make you feel in the wild west. I'm afraid the game is over and I don't play much to avoid consuming it fast. I don't understand how time goes by every time I open the game. If you haven't played this game yet, you will regret playing it late like me. Start playing the masterpiece right now and in a few hours you'll know what I mean. Remember what I said :) This game should be in the top 10 of your to-do list before you die.Fellas! It's time to start the cowboy fashion. Instead of imagining a mustang, I started imagining a purebred horse like in the wild west.  "You're gonna sleep with your chest open if you ain't careful boy.""Forgive me if I slip and stab you in the face.""We’re thieves in a world that don’t want us no more."AAAAAAA WAAAH WAHH WAHHH
Better than the other overrated brother game.

author: Ringi
review: I have played about 40% of the story so far and I would like to say it is one of the best games I have ever played. The gameplay and graphics are both amazing, optimalization is great too. Character writing is oscar-worthy, world is huge and there is no "lost" corner, there are AIs/NPCs everywhere giving you unique conversations or even tasks. Everything you do has consequences, you cant just go around and shoot people, and even if you win a fight against cops and run far away, you will still need to pay bounty in the city or fight cops again. It is just amazing, how they make players regret every bad thing they do. Also, doing crimes or saying something bad to strangers is lowering your honor which leads to people hating you randomly on street or cops wanting to follow you. Game is slow-paced, but you will never get bored and there is always something to do even when you dont fight, shoot, rob, live outlaw life.10/10, would recommend to everyone.

author: Keijo
review: Difficulty: 3/10Story/narrative: 11/10Graphics/artstyle:11/10Gameplay:7/10Pacing:5/10Setting/world: 10/10Soundtrack:9.8/10Boss fights: noneSide quests: 10/10Pros:-amazing graphics and attention to detail-the story is maybe the best story in any videogame -the characters are very likable and interesting-the hunting mechanics and fishing are very good, there are propably like 50+ animals and fish-very good soundtrack-arthur morgan is amazing-side quests have very interesting stories inside them-main quests have great setpieces. Neutral:-some people dont like the first chapter, but i liked it it sets the story up well. -epilogue was ok but it just made the game longer. Cons:-the camp idea had a lot of potential but it doesnt really matter-very poor pacing and the game is way too long. -shooting feels stiff and it get boring after 30-40 hours.-games economy is broken, you could hunt a legendary animal for 45 mins and sell it for 80 dollars, then you play one main mission and get 800 dollars like what! -the witness system is pretty broken too-and guarma chapter was pretty pointless it didnt progress the story at allOverall:9.7

author: SmokinBlitz
review: Finally achieved 100% and completed all the story mode related achievements :) If you want to complete all aspects of the game you'll mostly likely spend 170-180 hours, it took me 200+ hours as I did almost everything(which are not required for 100%) this game has to offer completed all stranger missions/events, full compendium, all POI all around the map, crafted all trapper sets.This game is out of this world but the game requires lot of patience as it is more realistic than any other game. The story and the gameplay is exceptional and very well written one of the greatest stories out there, even the side/stranger quest have great story too.In the start everything seem to be great and going according to plan but by the end its all depressing, emotional and heart broken.This is a very detailed game i've ever seen, there are total 178 different animals and species that make this game so alive and up to the mark of realism. You can even see hawks/eagles killing and flying away with their preys, wolves playing, Fishes falling from the waterfalls, bears scratching their backs against the tree and doing some random things and there is much more if you take your time completing this game.

author: A Daewoo Lanos
review: Sauntering through the bayou with my horse in tow. Early morning light breaks through the vine covered trunks of seasoned trees. A gentle mist blankets the vicinity rendering vision almost useless, leaving only a deafening symphony of amphibians and insects igniting with the morning sun. The mood for the upcoming day is set and it's nothing more than serene and beautiful. Echoing from within the bushes a familiar sound arises... gobblegobblegobblegobble... the last thing I hear before getting jumped and chased by knife-wielding swamp hillbillies and eaten by an alligator.10/10 would saunter again.

author: RAYRAYRAYRAYARAY
review: If you have not played this game, you deserve to get your entire bloodline deadeyed before your eyes by Arthur Morgan. Rockstar has once again showed us that the entire video game industry is doing everything wrong. This game has the most immersive world and characters graced by media, there are more animations for a horse in this game than the average main protagonist in any other game. The story was written by literal god fable tellers that have descended from the divines to pleasure my brain for an over 100+ hour story mode that has themes everyone could take a note of. The gameplay has me dodging in real life with the weight of the guns in this game, when I shoot my Schofield revolver I get kicked back in my gamer chair from the vibration that comes out of my controller, I see bullets breaking holes in the wooden barrel I take cover behind, smoke and gunpowder flying around the gunfight like its the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ civil war again. The hunting in this game made me feel like I could go into a forest right now, and probably catch enough food for a starving family of five. The graphics and scenery in this game made me feel like our world was black and white in comparison, the beautiful landscapes of America before it was covered in smog and grime, unexplored paths and forests that cover entire mountains. The music score in this game has such a powerful affect on the immersion of each and every task you undergo, from building a house with your new family, to bloodthirsty war against the military, the score just drives all of your serotonin to kick some ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ ass and yell yee haw at the top of your ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ American lungs. 5/5, Rockstar deserves to be memorialized for eternity in a museum for this actual masterpiece of a video game, NO NOT A VIDEO GAME ACTUALLY, THIS ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ PIECE OF ART. PLAY IT NOW

author: 𝐃𝐚𝐢 ⁧⁧☁
review: The best game in the history of the sector regardless of the genre we are talking about, it is a masterpiece from beginning to end. When you play it you know and notice perfectly the 8 years of development, because this work simply has no rival at all levels it covers. A game set in the western, in the year 1899 in the interior of America, is the time of the decline of the old west, and I love this.  Technical design, graphics, physics, masterful soundtrack, setting, narrative, characters from the entire campaign with their own character and a wonderful independent charisma, very top artificial intelligence, a crazy fauna, a world totally alive and with limitless exploration, it does not lack mystery, gameplay and outstanding entertainment. The Spanish dubbing would have been cool but when you play it you understand perfectly why it is better if it is not translated into any language, the level of care and pampering that this game has is excessively demanding, and dubbing the title in a certain way does not go with the narration of the title. Everything that is said about Red Dead Redemption 2 is little, you don't really play it, you live it when you play it, you get excited and you always want to be Arthur, you don't want to abandon him, you empathize so much with him that it makes you angry to leave him.  A true simulator of being a cowboy in a totally alive world and realism in its purest form. It is not a matter of personal taste to say that it is the best game in history to date, it is objectivity, preference is one thing and being objective is another, and objectively there is no title that unfortunately casts a shadow on it.

author: Xandur
review: A huge game with insane amounts of content and attention to detail. Game has a beautiful open world, large amounts of customization available for your character and weapons, a ♥♥♥♥-ton of side quests, a variety of fun historically accurate weapons to use, and most importantly a long and great story. It's hard to get bored in this game, and it's gonna take you a long time to run out of things to do in it. Also pretty well optimized. Even if you have an older machine, you can lower your graphics settings and the game will still look beautiful (as long as you keep textures at ultra). The AI is also very well made and immersive, minor NPCs in towns have an entire schedule they go through throughout the day. Overall an extremely fun game with a great story, well written characters, countless things to do, lots to explore, and amazing graphics. Highly recommend.

author: TJ
review: I usually only write reviews for smaller/indie games that actually benefit from it but I've set a goal to review each title I finish this year so here goes. I've always loved Rockstar, ever since I was crazy over Vice City as a young lad and Read Redemption was easily one of my fav Ps3 games, still got it right next to me. It was hard being patient enough to not only wait and play this on PC and not just PS4 but to also wait until I upgraded my rig to do it justice. Gotta say it was so worth it! Perfect choice to break in my 3080 what a exceptionally beautiful game, I took a million screenshots. I love the characters and story so much, even tear'd up once or twice just wow what a ride this game was, I won't be forgetting this experience. I could gush over nearly every aspect of this game but i'll just say that this is my new fav title from Rockstar Games and easily one of the best open-world games in existence and is worth every penny. Gavin! Gavin! Gav? Where are you?! 9.6/10

author: UberDAHnooB
review: 101 hours on story mode and I still have yet to find everything.  Great story, great acting, amazing graphics and atmosphere.All the rest of my time has been spent online.  I also HATE playing games online.  I have always been a single player guy(for the most part).  It is a bit of a grind but I have been able to enjoy myself and pretty much relax and play cowboy.  The paid for currency (gold) is not very hard to acquire as you gain more roles.  Gaining more roles and leveling them gives you more opportunities on the daily challenges(which you can and probably will become a slave to).  As you continue doing daily challenges and keep your streak going, you will get a multiplier.  I think at day one I would get .2 per challenge but now I am at .5 so I can normally get a few gold bars a day without doing anything too difficult or time consuming.  You can use the gold to make in game purchases that you don't have enough cash for(it is gold or cash though, not a bit of both), but it is better to save it until you get all the roles first.  They are all worth getting as well since they grant you new skills to use.As far as multiplayer issues, I only ran into a couple griefers, 2 hackers, and had very low connectivity issues, but I also was only getting sessions with maybe 4-5 players at a time.  Now every session I get into has what I can only assume to be full lobbies and more griefers and hackers.  This would be because of the Halloween patch.  I also rarely had any connectivity issues, but have been losing connection and having trouble gaining one lately.  Usually a couple attempts at connecting though, so not a huge deal.This is one of the few games I have purchased in the last couple years that I did not immediately refund so it was highly worth it to me so I would certainly recommend it to everyone else.
