author: SmarOneNine
review: So I know I only have roughly 3 hours of playtime during the time of this review but playing it on console first with around 60-70 hours of playtime I'm more then qualified to give an honest review..... Starting with the Story Mode part of the game which is my favorite part  , The graphics are just stunning! The overall detail of the game is beautiful I find myself alot just staring at the scenery rather then actually playing the game lol , But when I do buckle down and focus on the Story it tells one of the best Story's I've ever played in any game across any platform and that's saying alot , Its just a Very well told story with very connectable characters.As far as the Online part of the game I do really enjoy it as well and you still get those same amazing graphics/detail , With easy/responsive controls and lots of tasks/missions/and game modes to keep you wanting more , I really enjoy hunting/fishing but also find myself playing around with the lasso alot with the locals , Quite Fun lol.So Yes I Highly recommend this game to anyone.

author: SpecialD3
review: Red Dead Redemption 2 is a game that I truly consider as one of the best games I have ever played. However, it sure has a lot of things that make the game boring and repetitive.Firstable, I will talk about the graphics, world design and character models. Rockstar once again achieved a quality in these aspects that are stunning. I just enjoy slowly riding the horse through fields or just leading it in swamps without using the map. Even the animals and the movements of the NPCS seem realistic. That way, I truly felt immersed and delighted by this (Graphics quality and others- 10/10).In terms of gameplay, Rockstar actually disappointed me. The controls are clunky, the combat system with guns is repetitive. Nonetheless, I actually really enjoyed the melee options when using fists or other melee weapons against enemies (besides the clunky controls in it, obviously). Gameplay- 8,5/10.Now I will talk about the missions. This is worst aspect in the game. Rockstar used this missions syetem in many games: Start in point A, go to B, follow NPC, hear NPC talking, kill NPCS and finally, the most boring aspect, DO ALL THIS BY FOLLOWING ONLY THE GAME'S INSTRUCTIONS. The missions really pissed me off, since Rockstar doesn't let you choose your own path in a normal mission. They all have these rules, repeating each rule in almost every single mission (Missions system- 5/10).Regarding the main story, this is what really shines the most in the game as well as the graphics. I will not spoil anyhing, but when you reach the end of chapter 4, you will be amazed by the whole rest. If you look carefully in the map, you will find a lot of side missions, (some remarkable, others just boring due to the lame tasks the NPCS tell you to do) as well as secrets, letters, strange places and NPCS, easter eggs and loads of entertaining random encounters ( story- 10/10).The sound effects in the game are a great aspect. The voice acting is incredible. The actors had great accents and really did well trying to show the emotions and feelings the game characters were feeling in certain part. The fact that every sounds like a real animal, the footsteps while walking,  the different sounds in the many environments, the horse when riding and patting are just some of the amazing sounds you will find. Besides, it is really well done the many ways you can interact with NPCS by defusing, greeting, antagonizing or even helping them (Sound quality- 10/10).The final point is the online mode. The online mode takes everything I find interesting nd innovative in the story mode. It takes you the option to talk, the story is just unnecessary and the realism is all gone. The only cool and new things in the online mode is the amount of clothing, weapons, and the roles you can get. Oh, I didn't forget the economy. The ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ economy! You know, the fact that everything useful in online cost a lot and you must earn damn GOLD BARS to get roles or other good stuff are just Rockstar's ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ interest in money. Online mode is just a reskinn of GTA5 but in the wild west. Besides, you can't even rob a store, bank or a random NPC which you could do in story mode. However, I played online for a little more than 30 hours and after I learned everything to earn money and be rich, it just turns quite easy to earn gold bars and have loads of good stuff. In my case, I did not pay for the ultimate or special editions and I already am a bounty hunter and a collector. Final Verdict:Story Mode- 9,5/10Online Mode- 5.5/10I hope you liked this review. It took me some time to write it, but it was worth it after more than 250 hours in this game.Edit: This game deserves the best story award. Vote for Red Dead Redemption 2. It has the best game story I have ever seen.NOTE: Online mode is bad if comparing it with the story mode. It can still be preety fun.

author: Pufferfish
review: Your next game is not necessarily a game.RDR 2, in my opinion, is an excellent interactive film, is currently the best Western role-playing  game, concentrated in the late 19th century American society changes, love, responsibility, gang rivalry, gun battles, cowboys and other elements in the game in the most vivid embodiment.Arthur was a tough guy, but he knew responsibility, loyalty to his gang, how to protect, to love his family,Every member of his gang is portrayed with flesh and blood: Javier, Sean, and so on, a strong sense of entry makes me feel sad about the death of the gang members in the course of playing, and he is Arthur Morgan himself, as if he were the dead cowboy who galloped through the Western world. Betrayal of gang members is painful and angry, and even wants to kill Micah him own.The first time I wrote such a long review, I gave the game 10/10,which satisfied my dream as a cowboy, let me enjoy all kinds of beautiful scenery ,intriguing narrative t, each plot has a unique animation and tasks makes game so fascinating.One last wordRaging happiness often foreshadows violent endings, that happy moment, like fire and gunpowder, a kiss is fleeting. author: Distance Of Shadows
review: Heartbreaking Masterpiece, fallen in love with the world and the characters. The story hits way harder in the feels than any other game I played.The single player campaign is amazing, the attention to detail is awesome and make the world feel real.The world in indescribably beautiful and very realistic. It's easy to get lost living and breathing in the game, extremely immersive. I love my horse and hunting, love shopping for clothing even though despite being female, I don't like shopping clothes in real life and also attached to one specific outfit I'm wearing in the game. Extremely easy to get attached to people and took care of them, then feeling like you've taken a shotgun to the heart each time something really bad happens in the story. Hogtying or lassoing and dragging people behind you while riding your horse is fun, getting into brawls is really fun to and there's just so much I love about the game and random events and encounters and side quests as well as the mechanics.Haven't tried RDR2 Online and the save/load menu is Esc > Story > Save/Load. Also feels really good with a ps4 controller (has ps4 prompts as well).

author: Jafar
review: This review is solely for the single-player portion of the game, as online is too much of a grindy half-baked cash-grab for me to even bother writing about.The game is one of the best open-world games I've ever played. It's a very immersive world with tons of content, marked and unmarked alike, a massive bestiary, plenty of weapon and clothing customization, as well as a nice but not overboard sense of reality to it. Combat, while relatively slow, is very enjoyable. You can almost feel the impact of every shot you land, or thrown fist you connect. With things like detailed bullet woulds, bruises, scratches, stab wounds, and even full on dismemberment, combat can range from very clean altercations to gritty bloodbaths. As mentioned before, the bestiary is huge. With almost 200 animals in the game, there's always gonna be some new creature to discover in the course of your 60-80 hour playthrough. Hunting is also pretty satisfying, with a perfect kill and pelt system, as well as advanced tracking of your prey.Cons: Completionists are gonna have a hell of a time. There are 90 challenges total which must be completed in order to get 100%. Some of them are insanely grindy, and others rely on pure luck, which kind of defeats the purpose of a challenge. On top of that, you can't legitimately complete every challenge until reaching the post-game epilogue.Speaking of the epilogue, although it isn't horrible, it has its flaws. For starters, it way overstays it's welcome. All the content could be compressed into one two hour chapter, but instead the epilogue is split into two very drawn out (and at some points, pointless) parts, giving you a few solid missions, and about 5 or so hours of boring filler missions. This ultimately takes away from the emotional ending of the main portion of the game, and honestly feels like a different game after a while. That's everything though. RDR2 is a great, massive game that you should at least give a try, but just like every game, it isn't without its flaws.

author: sheogorath 2
review: This is going to be a story-oriented review since I'm not much of an online player.Long story short - buying RDR2 was one of the best decisions I made in 2020. It wasn't the cheapest, but it was money well spent.I don't think there was a single thing about this game I didn't enjoy. From the amazing graphics, animations and weather system to the depths of Arthur's story. I will agree that it is very slow paced - you feel almost compelled not to just focus on the story, but explore, go around hunting and just roaming the countryside (that's what I did most of the time lmao). All parts of the explorable map are meticulously designed to make you drawn into this exploration. And even though some areas are relatively similar, they never feel repetitive or boring. Plus, there are many chance encounters - some are funny, some sad - which makes them kinda realistic.Second thing - there is so much to do in this game. The numer of challenges to complete and collectable items to acquire provides a source of gameplay for so many hours it is amazing.Last but not least - the story. I'm not really good at reviews but let me just say this - when 'That's the way it is' started playing I was crying like a little child, and I'm not easily moved by this kind of thing. Last time I was that emotionally engaged in a videogame was I think when I played the witcher 3 for the 1st time. So it does say something. Especially if you take the time to understand the characters, their past, their motives, and actions. At the end of the game, the game really encourages you to think some stuff through, and I loved that. Arthur, John and the vast majority of characters encountered in RDR2 are not just characters, they feel genuine and relatable, like real folk you can run across. They are outlaws, killers and thieves but most of all, they are Sorry fot this chaotic review, tl;dr playing rdr2 was the best choice I made in a while!

author: Alegis
review: Masterpiece. Rockstar crafted a beautiful living world, with well written characters in a compelling story. Best game to come out since The Witcher 3.Even if you think you'll just follow THE PLAN of the main quests, you'll find yourself distracted pretty quickly hunting legendary animals, crafting satchel upgrades by tracking down 3-star badgers, complete challenges such as facing cougars with a bow, treasure hunting or fishing monstrosities out of the lakes.

author: Toan732
review: Story mode and its atmosphere is amazing. Game performance is a bit shoddy, but it's brilliant when it works. Online is, for the most part, good. Still plenty of bugs that sometimes force you to reopen the game. The gold bar unique online currency heavily encourages you into buying them as you need those to start the major content additions, but if you have the patience and time, you can do dailies in the game and not have to worry about gold as it gets easier if you stay consistent with the dailies. If not, you may need to grind at some parts.Great game, get it for the story mode as getting it for online might frustrate you with the abysmal support Rockstar gives to this compared to GTA Online (not that one deserves more support than the other). Special and Ultimate edition doesn't give you anything new besides making the initial grind in Red Dead Online a little easier and a few story mode side missions that's not very worth the extra $20. I'd suggest waiting for a sale as this game goes on sale often, but still a great game even without a sale.EDIT: Yes, there are plenty of horses to ride, incase you were wondering.

author: Col
review: Red Dead Redemption 2 can out to wide acclaim and applause from both players and professional reviewers. It is very much well deserved. I'm going to talk about this in two partsGameplayAlthough this game is not meant to be played on a keyboard, I believe the transition is smooth, and the controls are very enjoyable once you get used to it. There is very few bugs, with me only experiencing only one or two small graphical glitches through the main story. Gunplay is by far one of the highlights. In this game, you will never be bored. Strange, fun and rewarding missions, characters, and mini-games populate this world. The world is something straight from a western novel with romantic visions of the west combined with the looming sense of society approaching this beautiful yet forsaken land. The forests, swamps, mountains, and beaches feel alive. I truly cant put into words just how immersive this world is. Story** POTENTIAL SPOILERS**I came into this game expecting a bullet hell western, but my expectations were flipped. Although you are still a bad-ass cowboy outlaw, this world is full of battles from within the characters. Arthur Morgan is one of my favorite main characters of all time, and every member of the gang has a unique perspective and attitude. Your actions as Morgan have an impact on the world. The progression of the story is mesmerizing, and this is a true tale of humanity. ConclusionI truly believe that Red Dead Redemption 2 is one of the best Triple A games ever made. The amount of detail and care put into the world is truly astounding. This game is a beautiful and fun journey. Everyone should at least try it out.

author: Lusack
review: This game is a timeless masterpiece. It's portrayal of the American frontier is surreal and visually stunning, and I've never had more fun exploring rivers, valleys, forests and mountains in such an immersive environment. Coupled with a fantastic story and an amazing soundtrack to complement the feeling of the untamed wilderness made for the single best open world experience I have ever played.

author: The Invincible Soldier
review: Read dead redemption is probably one of the first games that I have played in quite some time that never gets boring after extended play time durations.It is a pleasure to play, and has lots of content to explore. The gameplay can be soothing at times in various ways... (the music, the scenery, the immersion...) This game can be what you want it to be. Wanna hunt and "take it all in, and go slow?   ...You can. You want it fast paced where you can Gallop full speed while leaping from your horse to a moving train and robbing all the occupants and then getting into giant shootout?... you can!  In this game, you get to make the decisions, you are in charge of the way that the story unfolds, and in so doing this game has a replayability factor that is second to none.  It's a nice change of pace compared to most FPS shooters out there.  It's a different breed.  With lots of subliminal messages about real life history and plant life and medicine making.  This is a game that you can play for hours and hours on end day after day and not get bored.  I highly recommend this game.It takes you away... for hours as you get lost in the beauty and explore america's roots.

author: Thoma$
review: I really wanted to love this game but ended up almost hating it. I was extremely hyped for this and played the first game a few months earlier on my sisters PS3 for the first time, a little late to the party but i still had hopes for a PC version. ;)RDR2 is an extremely immersive and realistic game with wonderful graphics and voice acting. But as a game it just falls flat most of the time, 95% of the missions end up in shootouts (even in stealth missions, whether you want it or not.) While the storytelling and the cutscenes are amazing, the story itself is just stupid (the plan is to make as much money as possible, yet every plan/heist just ends up in a disaster.) At some point i just wanted the more reasonable men like Arthur/John/Charles to take care of Dutch and take over the gang. He's a charismatic dude and i know this is a prequel but at some point you just have to stop following his stupid plans imo.The whole game is about money but at the same time money barely matters in the game world. I bought an elite horse once and thats about it. Can i improve my lame guns or buy hunting maps or something? Nope.I ended up investing 3000 bucks into the camp and had 1500 for myself at the end of the game. Side activites are generic and irrelevant because you don't really need the money. Fishing and hunting are incredibly tedious and frustrating, i don't understand how you can defend this. Sure, it's supposed to be realistic but this is just too much. I got all the perfect pelts, except for the panther which never spawned for me. I didn't even bother with all the legendary fish because it's too slow and annoying. (I wasted roughly 15 hours on hunting, fishing, and other stuff essentially.)The AI is one of the worst i've ever seen. If you commit a crime in a building, people magically can see through walls and know that you commited a crime and the lawmen are after you just because that's how the AI is programmed. You put on bandanas to hide your identity but the game takes it off during heists/story missions just to put a bounty on your head (i mean, just keep the bandana on?) Also, if i kill all witnesses there are no more witnesses so no one knows of the crime, right? At least, thats how it would work in my world...Rockstar wanted to make a super realistic game and added artificial slowness to the game which just ruins the gameplay for me most of the time. Call me old fashioned but i want to have a great time with a game and feel like an outlaw badass. I can't even count the times i wanted to loot dead bodies and my AI partners stormed the front and died. Why bother having RPG elements like looting if the game isn't built around it? Sure, i admit it's an OCD but i just love looting so please let me do it. (Especially when the game is about making money.)If i look back at my 100 hours of gameplay, i remember being toxic most of the time and cursing Rockstar frequently. I barely ever enjoyed anything in this game tbh. The missions lack variety and there are way too many enemies and scripted events happening. The "epic" story just doesn't make up for it. I also had like 15 crashes to desktop and annoying fps drops mostly in cities (with an RTX 2070). And while the epilogue is a cool idea and way better than the one in the first game, it's painfully long and dragged out with 5 hours.If you're looking for an immersive and realistic (Western) game and you are a patient person, go for it. Otherwise, wait for a sale and then give it a try. Those are my honest thoughts, and if i reduce the game to its core that's just what i felt. Maybe i expected more, i just don't know why it never clicked... If i had to rate the game, i'd probably give it a 7.5/10 or something but steam only has the two thumbs. Which just proves that ratings and numbers are overrated anyway.

author: diasandro
review: Red Dead Redemption 2 is a game about a band of outlaws living their life. The protagonist is an anti hero, you play him and decide whether you wanna be a good person, or a bad person.Being an open world game, you are given a vast world for you to explore. The world is big enough, for you to take a while travelling from one side to another side. The towns in this game are like rural areas, while there is one town that is already more civilized. Aside from that, it is all wilderness, plains and mountains and forest. Despite having to travel for awhile from a place to another place, you will occasionally met some NPCs with their horses or wagons along the way giving some life into the game. Also there are some random encounters and animals to hunt.However, the game will take a hard pull on your graphic card. Those with low end computers might have to lower their graphic options. Mind you however, the graphic of this game is so damn beautiful. There are lots of moments that I just stop awhile to cherish the moment since the world is beautifully created paired with a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ beautiful graphic. There will be fogs and some kinda a bit of dust, these will make your fps drops if you do not have an adequate hardware.Story wise, the game has a good story. If you enjoy previous titles by R*, this game would be a fun ride for you. Yes, there are emotional roller coaster here. Yes, there are choices that you have to make during gameplay, whether you wanna be evil or kind. You can dress up your character into more handsome man. Level up the abilities for better gameplay. However, I personally a bit pissed by the story as Crash? Yes it happened.The first time I bought this game during its first week release, I got it. but I refunded due to not able to start the game. I bought it again after being discounted and now I already finished the main story of the single player.During game, so far I get like 5 crashes. This is due to the graphic takes a lot of spaces to run and my laptop cannot handle it. Thus the crash.I put about 55 hours into the single player mode to finish the story. This is done by ignoring the side quests and encounters as I focus only in the story. Do I have fun during that time? Hell yes.What about online? I have not put much into the online gameplay as I rather get a lot of disconnects during game, which is annoying since I have to redo the quests that was supposed to be finished but the game decided to kick me out during save.is it worth it?If you enjoy single player stories and previous titles of R*, especially RDR 1, you will truly enjoy this one.If you are looking for online, anarchy game with mindless grinding, fingers crossed, this might be for you

author: se7en
review: There is a constant question as to whether or not games are art. Red Dead Redemption 2 is a game that is going to be used as evidence for that argument from here on out.The wild west is marvelous and full of interesting events. What's more, the interactive system makes a great progress and you can interact with nearly everyone in various ways. Where this particular game perhaps impresses most though is in its deeply involving, heart-filled story that lives with you long after the last bullet is fired.Pro:+ masterful storytelling+ believable surroundings+ interactions with nearly every NPC+ huge interesting and filled open-world+ atmospheric locations+ stunning graphics+ excellent gun fights+ Red Dead Online is great additionMixed:~ PC controls are a little bit weird~ hungry graphics that require you to have a top-notch PCContra:- for some action oriented people the pace might feel kind of slow- some people experience many serious technical issues

author: ImpostoR
review: This is a game that has so much detail and life that trying to describe it to someone who hasn't experienced it would take years and you still would not do it justice.It is a masterpiece in storytelling, tackling some very heavy subjects, yet leaving you fulfilled, like reading a good book, and asking for more.The realism goes hard, when you pick up beans you do it one can at a time, hunting, skinning animals, cooking, drinking and eating all takes time and is very enjoyable because it builds the world and immersion.Hunting is one of the activities than I lost countless hours in, it can be hard as it is satisfying, especially if you are hunting down a specific animal, that just so happens to be hunting you too.Your horse is not just means to get from A to B, you get the feeling this is a companion, it has weight and mass, you bond with it and get on crazy adventures where you keep whispering sweet nothings into your horses ear while climbing a particularly nasty mountain in hopes it will get you over the hill, and your horse protesting all the way decides to jump on this one small pebble rock right at the top, instantly tripping and giving you a bird like experience flying down the mountain. In the rare event you would survive this your first instinct would be running to that same horse and making sure his knee is okay, kissing it to get better.Small details that happen random, when you least expect it make your stay in this world enjoyable and fun, a world that is living breathing and not really caring about you, busy chasing that gold. There is something to do and see in each city, even interacting with random NPCs can create opportunities for work or money, items, secrets, it can lead to quests or brawls and shootouts. The wilderness is exactly that, no laws, no rules - get hailed by a shot woman asking for help only to get surrounded by 5 men ready to rob you, or find a man up a tree surrounded by wolves, save him and find out he is the heir of a rich family from a mansion nearby, making you a richer man. Someone really annoying you? Tie him up with your lasso, take him to the train tracks to catch a train or make a gator sleep better with a full stomach.It elevates open world games to that next level, bringing you an immersive story, graphically enhanced with lifelike animations paired with smart AI and a heavy dose of world building realism, but letting you decide how you want to play in it. Still has some dated Rockstar game mechanics, mostly tied to the story missions, but doesn't hurt the overall experience. It certainly isn't for everyone, long horse rides, lengthy conversations and slow progression is probably not something that an average player who comes from GTAV wants, but if you want a more chill experience losing yourself and hours in this world, this game is very rewarding at that.

author: [FTS]Fuyoc
review: Since it's so much positive reviews, I'll give the other side.It's a good experience, but an awful game. The first 30 hours are brilliant and interesting. The game world is incredible. The characters are interesting enough to save the boring story. The graphics are phenomenal.But after the initial enjoyment, it really fails as a computer game. The wanted system is awful, there's no reason or incentive to collect money. Everything is slow. All the hunting is the same thing over and over. The weapon variety is awful. The missions are samey and there's no creativity. The dead eye system is broken and makes shooting too easy, but the controls are still awful. The horses lack variety and the mini games are slow and useless. Don't play it if you want a game, but do play it if you want a story.

review: Good Singleplayer, Awesome graphics, but my god the online is bad. You spend two thirds of your time riding, you always meet a group of idiots as now there is no passive mode so you can just focus on the story, most of the missions are so far apart you either spend money and fast travel or ride the distance which can take 10+ minutes one way. author: Colonel Patrick Sanders
review: I never played Red Dead Redemption 1 as it never releases on PC, but when Red Dead Redemption 2 released, I just had to play it.Let's start with the story telling. You get sucked into the game from start to finish. Characters are well-made and interesting, voice acting is top-notch and everything emotions are displayed as they should. At the same time however, I miss a big overhauling objective to the story. It feels like you’re doing a bunch of random smaller chores. And although there is a reason as to why you’re doing most of them, it just misses a real important goal at times. And because of this, after a while the game starts to feel unnecessarily long. I do think it’s much better if you free roam more and do the campaign in between, but if you’re the type of player that just focuses on the main story first, you might feel the same as I did.Now this is not to say I didn’t have fun playing through the story. Missions are well done and fun to play, there is a lot of diversity and again, the storytelling / and character development is great, and you really do get sucked into this game. It grasps you and does not let you go until you see the credits scrolling by. It’s also great that you can choose which main quest you want to do yourself, instead of following a strict path.Now on to the world itself. It looks amazing, it feels amazing to travel through and the ambiance is like nothing I have ever seen before. It’s so immersive and alive. There is something to do in each small town, there are random encounters / side quests throughout the world and activities like hunting, fishing and playing games are really fun to do.Talking about gameplay, it’s great and makes the game feel like a movie sometimes. Cover shooting works good and interesting with NPC’s is perfect, but it has a classic Rockstar feeling to it as well. It’s a bit slow and clunky. You can’t react or shoot as fast as you want to and some things just feel like they’re being forced to look cinematic. Something all Rockstar games have if you ask me. The same goes for navigating menus & inventories. It just feels outdated.So should you buy RDR2? Hell yes. It’s one of the best games I have played in a long time. It has an amazing story, beautiful scenery, a great soundtrack and zero to no bugs. This together with a compelling story which is quite lengthy (it took me 46 hours to complete) makes for a great all around experience.

author: evangarmstrong
review: I would not recommend this game.It is gorgeous, the world feels alive, the story is great, and the way you interact with objects is spot on; it's like a movie.But... it's also like a movie. I feel like I have no agency. You spend a lot of time watching. And it's more than just the cut scenes. Every mission has only one way to be completed. There is no scouting out and deciding how to engage a fight in the missions... unless the game tells you to.Aside from riding your horse while people talk to you (a good portion of the missions), you can also do a number of seemingly fun side task and quests. I have not found a single one of these with any depth. Fishing looks great - but you basically do the same struggle-reel action on a set time interval. Have to catch a criminal? You walk up and initiate a cut scene, then press the right button really fast.The other huge failure is that 30 hours in, you have everything you could ever want or need and little motivation to do anything other than meander through the story.This game is amazing in many ways, but IMO it's missing the central things that make a game good.

author: mantequilla
review: Micah Bell III was born circa 1860 to Micah Bell Jr., a ruthless petty outlaw. When Micah was 17 in 1877, he and his father were on the run for the brutal double homicide of Roscoe and Jean Briggs, who were hung from the rafters with their throats slit. It can be assumed that he was his father's partner-in-crime throughout his upbringing, although evidence suggests that he also ran with his brother, Amos, for a time. Micah would later have a falling out with Amos, who, by 1899, is repentant of his actions and lives in California with his wife and daughters, whilst making it clear to Micah that he wants no contact with him and that he'll kill him if he's anywhere near himself and his family.Micah became acquainted with two outlaws named Cleet and Joe at some point during his criminal career, and also mentions being involved in a failed bank robbery down south with Norman. In 1898, Micah met Dutch van der Linde in a bar at Crenshaw Hill. Dutch tried to sell gold that his gang had recently stolen, but the deal went sour, leading to an altercation where Micah stepped in and saved his life.[3] As a result, Micah was accepted into the Van der Linde gang. Despite being an experienced outlaw who was respected for his skill in combat, Micah was generally disliked within the gang; in particular, Arthur and Hosea saw him as argumentative, reckless and hot-headed, with Dutch alone taking a liking to him.After five months, Micah set his sights on a ferry in Blackwater as a potential robbery. Although Arthur and Hosea had their own lead, Dutch instead chose Micah's option, which promised a bigger reward but also riskier. The heist turned out to be a complete disaster, however, and a huge gun battle with the Pinkertons ensued. Due to this, the gang was forced to flee and eventually managed to lose the law by entering a blizzard on the snowy mountains of Ambarino. The failed robbery notably caused the deaths of Jenny Kirk, Davey Callander and his brother Mac Callander.

author: PlasmaVoyage
review: An absolute masterpiece, honestly.The story is sort-of typical wild-west but the plot and characters really rocket this game skyhigh.I have never seen such amazing animations (especially facial), voice acting, and well written characters like in this game before.Top notch, love it._________________________________________________________The few criticisms I have about the game are:- The Quest design is confusing as hell. Especially towards the end of the chapters you notice the situation getting really tense and then you have several missions marked on your map and from the plot it feels like any one of those missions is going to carry you to the next chapter, because of how important they all seem. In the end you have to do all of them anyway, but I think Rockstar could make it clearer as to what you're getting yourself into and maybe only have one Main Mission up at a time and also give the player an overview of the plan of the mission. As soon as you approach the NPCs giving you the missions, it immediately starts. You have no option to go "Oh wait, I don't wanna do that right now." But maybe it's intended, who knows. I feel like it's confusing as hell.- The AI Behaviour is awful. I have lost so many ambient quests because I accidentally "bumped" (it wasn't even a bump) the NPC's horse with my own horse going slower than walking speed. And they immediately freak out and run away and the quest is failed.Same with NPCs in towns and cities. You cannot be mean to anyone because you will ALWAYS pull the short straw. An NPC talks ♥♥♥♥ at you unprovoked, you talk ♥♥♥♥ back to him, he immediately starts a fight or pulls out a knife. You knock him out and immediately some ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ runs to the sheriff to tell on you and you either run away or it escalates.Or that NPC straight up starts shooting at you in the middle of the town and if you shoot back, you're the wanted guy. The NPC that shot first, seemingly gets no punishment from it at all.- The Honor System. This one is not too important because it doesn't really do all too much and obviously, in a game like this, technically you are a mass murderer every time, no matter how honorable you try to be. And also the fact that you can just go and "Howdy-Pahdna" everyone in town and gain all of it back easily.But I think if Bounty Hunters come after me and they send bloodhounds that literally rip out my throat if I don't shoot them, I shouldn't get a honor penalty for doing that. I'm just trying to defend my life.And last but not least: There are some corpses to be found that have letters on them. You loot those corpses and all is fine. Other corpses don't have letters on them, you loot those (since you don't know whether they have anything or not) and you get an honor penalty. It should be made clear which corpses are "ok" to loot and which aren't.Again - not a big deal since you can just say Hello to every living creature and get your honor back but it feels like I'm being punished for exploring the game and trying to uncover its' secrets.And finally and most importantly:- The Technical Performance of the game. It's godawful on PC. Funny enough the first 30 or 40 hours went fine with just one crash to desktop. But suddenly after those hours, the game started acting up a lot. ERR_GFX_STATE is the one error I always got and it crashed the game to desktop and asked me to reboot my PC. Rebooting didn't help, starting the game in Safe Mode didn't help. Google'd some and deleted temporary Vulcan files in the Documents Folder and that didn't help either. The game immediately crashed after the loading screen.The way I managed to work around this was to delete only the temporary Vulcan File with the largest filesize, then boot up the game in Safe Mode, then change the graphics settings to my normal settings (Safe Mode starts the game with grahipcs settings set to super low) and then it worked again for a while.____________________________________________________________All in all: An absolutely masterwork of a game, loved every minute of it. If you're looking for a playable Tarantino or Eastwood movie, this is it.

author: Frost
review: If you liked the first Red Dead Redemption, RDR2 is everything that was right about the first one, with newer graphics and another fun and interesting character to play. Gun play still excellent, audio excellent, visual excellent, storytelling fun and amusing. The Poker and Blackjack mini-games aren't half-bad, either! Great place to spend some of your gaming time.

author: QWEAVE
review: i don't think you need someone to tell you about rdr2, but this game has solidly some of the best singleplayer story writing i have seen, does a bunch of interesting stuff with the western genre, contains a ton of extremely memorable characters, is overwhelmingly beautiful, has a fun gameplay loop in regards to side activities, there just isn't really anything i dislike about it. it also isn't terribly optimized, so that's cool!HOWEVER! rockstar's extreme focus on red dead online has lead to them creating a bunch of weird byproducts with online patches that have ♥♥♥♥♥♥ up or bugged the singleplayer in various little ways, so i'm a little bit worried about what the future of rdr2's singleplayer will be. obviously rockstar is never going to make sp dlc or anything, but currently, for several months, a ton of dialogue from your gang at camp has been replaced with them telling you that you look like you're really cold all the time. that's one pretty fun feature that's been significantly worsened due to careless online focused patches, and again, rockstar apparently cares so little about rdr2's singleplayer that it hasn't been addressed for months. i think it's entirely possible that more and more stuff like this will crop up as time goes on, and maybe in a year or two all the singleplayer dialogue will be replaced with npcs telling you that you look really cold or something. i'd say get and experience rdr2 while you can, because rockstar doesn't care about fixing new issues they introduce in the best portion of this game.

And the performance, seems it improve a lot compared to when it was first launch on the PC.Even my old potato pc with i7 2600k, gtx1070ti and 16gb ddr3 could run it on average 50-60 fps 1080p on mixed settings. Some are on ultra and mostly are on high to the lows.The only issue I have is for some reason after a few hours into the game, I can't use the steam overlay. It stopped functioning since then, right until now.I tried a bit the online mode, so far beside getting owned by higher level players, there's no issues whatsoever.Overall I give this game 9/10. And definitely 10/10 I will miss my horse. RIP boi.

I am so happy! I enjoy every second of it. I take my time with the main story, because I don't want the game to end too soon. Therefore I do a lot of side missions, pick up every random event and go out hunting or exploring. Rockstar Games is always a guarantor for flawless game experiences with story- and immersion deep entertainment. The last game that got me THAT entertained was The Witcher 3. This game is not shy of at least drawing level with W3, if not more. I don't know yet, I have to play it more, and I will! :D

author: Droog
review: Best western style game you'll find. Open world 3rd person adventure/shooter game that has more content then you know what to do with. From Fishing to robbing trains, this game has it all. This game has an Honor system which will decide how the game plays out, whether your a cold blooded killer, or a kind gentleman just trying to survive. Do small side quests with strangers and your honor will go up (as long as you do it the right way) I give this game a 10/10 because the game never dragged on and was full of twists and turns to keep me excited for whats next. It took me 56 hrs to complete.

There is no free will, that is just a lie set up by our corporate overlords. for a game about being an outlaw you really can't do anything other than what rockstar tells you. combat is about turning on your Witcher sense and headshotting 20 people in a second. but DAMN the story is GREAT. some of the best writing in video games period! the characters, the poetry, the style, the details are excellent. 4/5  the man with the silver tounge has nothing left to say. please stop awarding me the clown its kinda hurtful thanks.

author: Princess Badass
review: I don't usually write reviews, and I spent a while trying to figure out exactly what I wanted to say about this game because between xbox and PC, I have played it more times than I can count.The graphics are of course incredible, and the story takes you on a journey of hope, heartbreak, and redemption in the shoes of Arthur Morgan, a protagonist who is both realistically flawed and noble at the same time. And while I could write an essay about how the characters, story, and world drew me in, many other reviewers have already done that. Ultimately I decided that I could offer no better endorsement than the number of hours I have sunk into this masterpiece.So I guess the best advice I can give is: Remember to slow down and enjoy the ride. This game isn't meant to be "beaten." It is meant to be experienced.

author: RoltCain
review: Sometimes you've got to take a step back and ask yourself; Is Rockstar one of the last company capable of actually delivering a true to form AAA game nowadays? In my opinion this is, quite sadly, an unequivocal yes!   The amount of attention and care that went towards crafting a masterpiece like RDR2 is mind blowing, especially with all these bland and generic pseudo AAA titles by pseudo AAA studios. You see, what makes the difference really is all of these little details Rockstar seems to focus on. RDR2 is just a mastercrafted, fine tuned piece of art. A game that commit to its choices and vision brillantly. Finest game in the west pal !• Immersion is off the hook, everything makes sense, looks like it belongs.• Visuals are great, the world map is beautiful, a perfect condensed lil ol'america. • Great acting, some really interesting narrative choices.• Most characters are memorable, charismatic and will make you feel a certain about them. • Just the sheer amount of attention brought to flora and especially fauna is nuts.• Overall all these nuances, details, subtleties, wether it's from a narrative, gameplay, atmospheric, visual, or sound perspective, really are the perfect sauce that brings the dish together.  Aside from the main plot, RDR2 really is about moments I feel like. I still remember this one time, it was right after sundown, a crazy thunderstorm was tearing the skies. I was rushing through the rain on my loyal steed, trying to get back to town before the butcher closes shop in order to sell my pelts. When suddenly... I noticed a lone ominous horseman standing atop the hill a few dozen meters on my right. I Immediately thought to myself : "No sane man would let themselves get soaked like that, alone gazing into the storm". I was obviously curious, a few seconds after I passed him in the distance, I instantly decided to go back and investigate who the hell was that guy ! And you guessed it, in a matter of seconds, just like that he was gone with not a trace to hold on to. A week or so passed, never saw the guy again of course, but realized, while randomly looking through the same vicinity, that the horseman was overlooking some mangled body down the road, with some cryptic message the killer must have left on the dead fella, a message eluding to some sort serial killings. I started to think that horseman might have been the crazed murderer, and still wish I caught up to him that one gloomy night.  See, just roaming around hunting or exploring can bring the most intriguing scenes and moments. Who doesn't remember getting absolutely mauled by a panther coming out of nowhere or stumbling into those freaks in that cabin who try to lure you into a presumed incestual threesome !!! • ONLY CONS In my opinion:   1. The gameplay can be frustrating, movement considered clunky and on the heavy/"realistic" side. Although it suits the game's vibes and can even contribute to immersion, some will have difficulties getting used to it.   2. The weapon wheel is a nightmare and in a more general sense, weapon management is really annoying, for some reason you can't keep the same loadout, it keeps getting switched on you ! I love when I'm suddenly rocking a varmint rifle in the middle a of a shootout even though I meticulously grabbed my shotty before the cutscene...  3. The "ALWAYS ONLINE" stuff is just plain shameful, I mean this typically is the kind of games I'd like to dive back in when your internet goes down or whatever the case is...To sum up I'd rate Red Dead Redemption 2 an . I know some people will be annoyed by the pace and or sluggishness, but if you really get into it RDR2 is a pure treat. Anyhow, I loved this game, truely a cut above from the rest, no doubts. If you're still reading this, props to you.

author: m2ntaa
review: Decided to rewrite my review that I made when I first completed the main story (39.9 hours) and I was yet to complete the Epilogue aside from a few missions. I greatly rushed through the game, and didn't take time to appreciate the things around me. I never got to meet Hamish Sinclair, Find the crazed scientist Marko Dragic or teach Charlotte Balfour to survive in the wilderness. It didn't feel like I'd accomplished much. So i decided to start all over again and clock in a further 90 or so hours into the game.I can't guarantee this review won't be void of any spoilers, I'm making this up as I go along, truth be told, but major spoilers will be using a spoiler tag I'll start off with the story itself. Absolute masterpiece. There is no questioning it, that RDR2's story is, in my opinion, the greatest story I have ever completed (and I played the Lego Movie videogame so I know a damn good story when I see one.) As time progressed during my time playing, I dropped impulse actions of shooting and robbing everyone I met, and resonated with Arthur, I started to do things that I thought he would do himself, especially in Chapter 6. The gang members all felt unique in their own ways. I'll never forget drinking with Lenny, he's my favourite gang member. Even some of the more forgettable members, in my opinion, had their moments, like hunting for crabfish with Pearson or doing Strauss' stupid ass debt collector missions. Those missions are actually the most impactful for me, not for the obvious reason of  but actually because over time Arthur is more against them in Chapter 6 than he was in Chapter 2. It really shows his 'Redemption' The environment is also something to behold. The level of detail in the outside world is something I can't fault. It is more than a desolate wasteland, there's a true atmosphere to it. With little rabbits and squirrels running about, streams of water flowing or herbs and flowers to pick. The town's as well are also absolutely gorgeous, especially Strawberry to me. I love Strawberry the most. I love how the river flows right through it and the town is along two sides, built into the hills with very lovely bridges.I do have a few gripes to the game, which in my opinion are very minor:- The mission format isn't great, it normally has you hop on a horse, have small talk with another character, then complete the mission and split off, with a few exceptions of course.- Hand to hand combat is rather boring, it consists of spamming 'F' to hit and 'R' to block until the enemy gets knocked out, and there are a good few instances of these fights that do drag out for a long time like the bar fight with Tommy in Chapter 2- Skinning animals sometimes just doesn't have an animation, one second there's the skin and the next its gone and in Arthur or John's hand.- Looting is a pain, since theres an individual animation for every little thing you open, take and put away. It would be nice to have a 'Loot All' button- Online is a cashgrab, but you expected that I supposeBuy for the singleplayer, not for online. An absolute masterpiece of a game. In my initial review, I spoke of how there should be a Red Dead Redemption 3 in the 1860's at the peak of the Wild West era, but I think the Red Dead Redemption franchise should be retired, this game and RDR1 are all the 'Redemption' saga need, but another game under the 'Red Dead' name would be welcomed.9/10 because -1 point for ruining my social life and worsening my exam performance.

author: Syx Hundred
review: The Single Player is amazing, this review is indicative of Red Dead Online.As someone with over 2700 hours this is my final verdict.Oh boy! Bounty hunter! Posse gets hyped to do a bounty, ya'll show up, kill a solid 2-3 guys each, one ties em up, you're done. 12 minutes remaining. A few measly enemies following you. Posse member: "iF yOu SiT aNd wAiT tHe TiMeR oUt YoU gEt PaId MoRe". I don't want to wait, I want to do stuff and get paid to do it.Oh boy, bounty hunter again, everyone goes to the location, search for 5 minutes for a single guy taking a leak on a tree.Oh boy, steal a wagon from a convoy of guys. Bring it back to your camp, or your contractor for a measly couple bucks.Oh boy, do a free roam mission. Deliver the mail? Steal the wagon? RIVAL PLAYERS CAN STEAL YOUR MISSION. Get ready for anything. Realize the game put you in a solo session.Oh boy, Trader! Hunting is cool, hunt stuff, deliver stuff, run wagons and be ready for an attack, nothing, or steal a trader wagon from a player only for them to leave, yell at you for playing the game, then leave, or you actually fight them, thank goodness, Yay! Excitement! No real reward for stealing though. Get materials lol.Oh boy, Naturalist. go to harriet, get sprayed, leave, forget naturalist for a sec, kill some animals, remember naturalist, get sprayed.Oh boy, Moonshiner! Upfront cost is wild, tell yourself the return is worth it, run your moonshine, run over a pebble, break a bottle, 50% of value lost. Moonshiner revenue agent camps replace gang hideout spawns. Broken sabotage/poison the batch missions. Only 5 total moonshine story missions. 2 are broken. (Moonshine shack with your friends is cool though)Oh boy, King of the Castle! No one plays objective, or a Modder does.Oh boy, Dispatch Rider. Whole lobby leaves and stops trying, get $10 for winning.Oh boy, Railroad Baron. two good players actually fighting to get on the train, the rest of the lobby complaining in voice chat they're stuck in spawn when they're just staying in spawn, killing each otherOh boy, horseback kills challenge. Everyone is shooting each other. Kill a few players horses on accident. Get charged $16. Make only $10. Leave at a loss, even though you won.Oh boy, horse races, dead lobby.Oh boy, showdowns, dead lobby. (You can't host a match so no one ever searches at the same time)Oh boy, treasure maps, broken pickups.Oh boy, Blood money Capitale missions! ♥♥♥♥ yeah. Try to get capitale, Find no capitale, realize there really just isn't much at all in the missions, realize that capitale is just crapitale, finally save some crapitale, do 1 of only 3 repetitive "Opportunities" you can complete in literally 5 minutes if you wanted to, sit and farm it hoping to get a bunch of money, get less money than a 1 star legendary bounty.Oh boy, Story missions in Online? Sounds promising. Play them, realize it ends on an unfinished cliffhanger. Think to yourself the missions were kinda good though. Go to play them again. Make $13.Oh boy, collector, broken pickups, items missing, get to Madam Nazar, Processing Transaction...Oh boy, player bounty, accept it, nothing happens, "huh? guess it didn't start" It starts, 1:30 remaining.Oh boy, working player bounty, player stands there, player leaves.Oh boy, killing a bunch of cops and get a bounty! disruptive, discourages you from doing so with either starting a "Mission" to "Kill the bounty hunters" instead of it being like a wanted level, or having a bounty above $10 locks you out of most content.Oh boy, a new horse, his tail is gone, his mane is gone, his head is stuck sideways, realize this is a game breaking bug that's been in the game for a year.Oh boy, a vehicles section! I can buy and own my own wagon? Wagon customization? No. Bounty Wagon, Hunting Wagon, only usable on roads. Inconvenient.Oh boy, new outlaw pass! New outlaw pass?Oh boy, modders, modders everywhere. Peer to peer exploits, being able to literally close your game if they want to. Session following, teleporting, ruining PvP with invincibility and anything else they are around.Oh boy, mexico is literally in the game, you can see it, you can glitch out there and go to it, realize they're never adding mexico or updating the game again.Play single player, don't touch Online.

author: Jo
review: No doubt I will update this review upon completion of the main story but for now I'm just enjoying this as a slow-burner, immersive experience. First up, the graphics are probably the best I've experienced in any game I've played so far, sometimes more realistic than reality. As a horse lover, it ticks that box 110%. I'm playing Online as well as the main story. Combat and missions are fun, AI enemies pretty intuitive. Although I tend to play as a "Lone Ranger" type, joining a Posse briefly Online was hilariously fun. I'm only about a 1/4 way through the main story because I'm somewhat addicted to the Online at the moment. My impressions of Story mode though so far are pretty good. Arthur is a sympathetic character, not really the typical the outlaw I was expecting. Dialogue and voice acting excellent. Overall this masterpiece of a game is a real pleasure that I'm still savouring. 10/10.

author: Sasori Kigaru
review: So please note before reading, I am recommending the singleplayer aspect more than I am the online aspect of the game in this review. I also don't write reviews often so, don't expect perfection either. The story in this game is amazing, and the interactions between all the characters feels so natural and definitely has some entertaining moments whether it be in a story set piece or just the characters idly chatting to each other or you during the game. The main story missions are very engaging, and very fun to play so props to the guys that made them, and there are A LOT of them too so it'll take you awhile to finish. It will take you even longer if you spend time doing side missions too, some of which are random encounters that you find just by wandering around and exploring the wilderness or the towns in the various areas of the game. The side missions though can be missed however, so be sure to explore often if you want to make sure you don't miss any or look up a guide if needed. The characters in this game are extremely well written, and two of them in particular are my favorite because of just how well the actors handled the characters. The two I mention is Arthur Morgan and Micah Bell. Arthur is a great example of a character development, especially if you play low/middle honor at first and then high honor later on. You can see him grow, his experiences slowly shaping him more into what he wants to be rather than what he has been. Not once does he ever call himself a good guy either, cause he doesn't have to be. He is an outlaw, a goodhearted one for sure, one that has earned my respect.Micah on the other hand? Hate the guy, but thats what I love too. He is the kind of person you love to hate, because the way he treats the 'family' had always been with a sense of 'I'm only here till you aren't of any use to me anymore'. Always felt good to antagonize the guy, and for reasons I won't spoil that a good amount of you probably know already? He deserves every single moment of being antagonized. Seriously, props to the actor for playing a character so well that you hate him for who he is and not because of something stupid. Dutch always has a planFind Lenny The gameplay is very enjoyable, and the environments are beautiful and full of life. You can hunt, fish, or just mess around with random passerby's you come across whether they be on horseback or a random encounter. The gunplay is pretty good too,  though I can only really compare it to GTA V since I've only played that and haven't actually played the first RDR. Regardless, it IS fun but I wouldn't say its the best. There are some issues however when it comes to the button prompts. Those these issues are more so prevalent on the online portion of the game rather than the single player since they're okay when you're on your own and don't have to worry about other people.  This is personally a big plus for me because I love being able to take screenshots in game of beautiful environments and either keep them as is or edit them some till they look more like a painting. I've a few on my profile that I consider my favorite. Seriously their environmental detail is pretty damn high up there, though can be graphically intense so it varies depending on the specs you're running with.OnlineOkay so the online portion of this game is.. okay-ish? Its really fun at first, but I do have gripes with it that I'll now go over. I love being able to create a character in game, but the way they did it in this game while functional, is not very user friendly. I had a damn hard time figuring out how to make my character actually look good. Now to be fair, if I wanted to look like I was part of a certain bunch of inbred psychopaths then I'd be all set since thats what it appears to be great at doing. But if you want to make a character that actually looks good? Especially if its a female one? Be prepared to do a lot of trial and error or look up a video on youtube. Additionally, it'd be nice if you weren't limited to one character only, but maybe that'll change someday? Who knows. Aye, there is actually story! Problem is, its not all that engaging, you're literally a character that never speaks so conversations are one sided. The main problem I have with it though is how hard it is to actually do them. I don't mean difficulty either, I mean that unless you're trying at a specific time or there is some kind of monetary event regarding the story missions, you'll be having a hard time with matchmaking. This issue is gone if you play with friends, but personally there should be solo options. A lot of people including myself play that way, since playing with randoms while it can be fun? It can also be stressful especially when its hard to communicate with them. Now now, before you start setting me on fire, I know that you can use a mic to communicate and occasionally maybe I'll do so. But I shouldn't have to be forced to use it if I don't want to. I could be having mic troubles, not to mention the fact that some people just don't have them at all. Text chat is severely needed in this game, because the gestures you have in game are a bit hard to navigate to and you can't have many equipped at once. Only a select few, so trying to 'signal' what you're trying to accomplish is just about impossible. Perhaps its a console thing, which while understandable I don't see why they can't have the same option. Might be slower for them, but I still see no reason for it to be implemented. Now I play with a PC, and unless cross-play is a thing I don't even know if any of the people I'm playing with are on the console so that point may be redundant anyway. It is thankfully not GTA V levels of grind, at least not that I can see yet. Still, making money in this game is very grind heavy. You can supposedly get quite a bit to start out with if you do all the online story missions, but you've already read my bit about that so you can very likely see the issue there. I had to spend about two weeks or three of grinding stranger missions just to make enough gold in order to start up the trader role which while it pays nice its still a slow start. Additionally, in order to make the max amount from a stranger mission you HAVE to wait until the last 30 seconds. It actually pays you less, if you finish it quickly. I didn't like that. Still, you can use the extra time to do other things, just don't forget about the timer otherwise you'll fail the mission. Like GTA V, there are script kiddies in game that will more often than not, completely ruin your fun. Whether its during free roam or a random free roam mission, they will screw you over. Although I've only met one so far in my hours of play, there are multiple people in the forums complaining about the amount of them in the game. Your experience may differ, you might get lucky and never encounter one or you'll have the worst luck and find yourself surrounded.ConclusionTLDR: The single player aspect of this game is amazing and is definitely worth playing. DO NOT BUY THIS GAME IF, you are only interested in the online aspect. The online portion of the game needs a lot of improvement which it may or may not get. However, if you're mainly interested in the story? Then by all means, buy this game and enjoy yourself! I know I did.I also don't write many reviews so yeah, hopefully this has been helpful!

review: The best game I played in all of my life. The story is amazing with a lot of characters with different personalities  and characteristics. The graphics look amazing and the world feels realistic. The game makes you feel like It could live without the player inside of it, you can always get lost in the world and find something interesting to investigate.  There is much to do in Red dead 2, from hunting and fishing to antagonizing a stranger until he threatens to kill you to robbing a train. That's it for the story part.Now for the online part of the game, it sucks. Unless you like doing boring deliveries and collecting plants to get money to purchase upgrades and then do more of them. Sure you can do bounties, but even that gets repetitive and it doesn't even pay much. As of today Rockstar hasn't added what almost every Red dead player wish was in the game, heists. How come do you make the best Western shooter game with a story mode wich involves shooting good and bad guys and robbing everything that comes in your way, but when it comes to recreating the same thing but make it online, you only let them collect flowers and do boring deliveries?

author: Aidan
review: It's hard to properly express how much this game means to me. Ever since it came out back in October 2018, I have put it at the top of my favorite games list. To me, this game defines the word "masterpiece", it's honestly beyond the point of just being a *game*, this is my favorite piece of art by far. First off, the story and writing is unlike anything I have ever seen in any Movie, Game, TV Show, etc. The story means so much to me and has genuinely impacted the way I think. Arthur Morgan is the best character in any piece of fiction to date. I have yet to see a character written with as much realism and depth as Arthur Morgan. And then obviously there's Dutch Van Der Linde, the most compelling antagonist ever written. Everybody needs to play this story just to experience it, this kind of experience is truly once-in-a-lifetime. The graphics are obviously beautiful, everybody knows that, the voice acting is unmatched by any other video game, the sound design is beautiful, and I still listen to the soundtrack every single day nearly 4 years later. I am honestly unsure if there will ever be another piece of media that will even come close to how much this game means to me. It's not even fair to give this a ranking, so I'm just going to rank this Priceless/10. Please buy this if you haven't already.

author: Havinstroke
review: (Single Player Review)Like with the first game, RDR2 just about invalidates the need for any other western games to be made. Besides covering every aspect of the wild west fantasy, there's also a pretty great story to experience. However, this is NOT the typical story you might expect from Rockstar. The story is not going to be for everyone, because it's actually much slower, more serious, and more cozy than what they often make. But the sense of comradery you feel with the characters of this game is as good as it gets for a game that isn't an RPG. One of the best parts about the story is how much extra context you are given for the first game, to the point where you could play either game first. Moving on from the story, the next best part of this game is its sound design. Every single thing you hear in this game comes together to make one of the most noteworthy audio experiences I have ever heard. The timing of the soundtrack, the sound effects, and the voice acting are all absolutely perfect. ALL THAT BEING SAID, the one problem with this game is that it lacks innovation. I've played Rockstar games all my life, and yeah, their games are great, and if you haven't played one before then YOU ABSOLUTELY SHOULD, but...At the end of the day, it is mostly an experience I have had many times before. So while I can sit here and say that every aspect of this game is perfectly crafted, it just isn't done in such a way that inspires all that much excitement. At least from me. And I mean, the game still gets a [FINAL SCORE: 9/10]

review: The overall game itself is REALLY good! Graphics: Fantastic Gameplay: FUN Story: AmazingNow the big reason that you currently see mixed reviews is that the PC port is unfinished. author: G0D
review: This game is a masterpiece in every sense of the word. If you have ever wanted to really get the feel of being an outlaw in the wild west there is no way this game wont fulfill that and then some. I have no problem with calling this the best open world game I have ever played. Huge variety of areas to explore from musty swamplands, grassy plains, and even the snow capped mountains all of which are filled with a seemingly unlimited number of different species and subspecies of animals to hunt. There is no copy and pasting going on here. The various towns and cities in the game feel more than alive with NPC's that dont just feel like walking mannequins used to fill up space but instead like actual people going about their daily business. The story, oh my god the story. If I told you every thing that I enjoyed about that story this review would be as long as a Harry Potter book. To cut it short: its a breathtaking roller coaster of emotions with lovable (and not so lovable but in a good way) characters and a plot that digs deeper than your run of the mill shoot em' up cowboy game. To help you along your way you will also of course have access to a healthy array of western weaponry, keep it classic with a Colt revolver and Winchester rifle or maybe switch it up and bring a Lemat revolver and an elephant rifle and if you really want to go the extra mile make custom ammo like high velocity rounds or even explosive rifle rounds to really make sure they're dead, you will never run out of options when it comes to combat.My final conclusion for Red Dead Redemption 2 is its as close to a perfect game as I've gotten so far. If you enjoy having a huge breathing world to explore and a beautiful story to back it up there is no way you can go wrong with getting this. I would pay just about any price if it meant experiencing a game of this caliber for the first time again, its truly in a league of its own.   10/10

Exploiting the game. I live in japan currently and cant access any servers that dont contain a swarm of chinese people that are cheating, blowing you up repeatedly or just stealing your online money. Fun fun fun.Why cant rockstar address these issues? review: Its one of the best games to release in the last few years or of all time if you ask me,the story mode is amazing with nice side quests and fun random encounters that happen periodically if you explore much. the hunting and upgrading stuff is  a lot of fun if youre into that stuff ,weapon costumisation is quite nice for the fact its playing in late 19 century. theres lots of secrets and treasures to be found. as for the online mode wich i played about 10+ so far its beter than gta online in my oppinion but the ♥♥♥♥♥♥ monetization schemes go way to far dollars can be made quite easily but the gold is  a mad grind. i aquired about in my playtime 10 hours + is 8 gold bars and you need a lot just for example to unlock bounty hunter missions you need 15 gold bars, but itts fun to play with friends.gold is needed to buy a lot of stuff wich you cant buy with dollars weapons,clothing workbench etc. my rating for singleplayer 11/10 and for online a 5/10

author: Z$a$Zquatch
review: This is not a game, its an experience. There is a reason this won 2020 game of the year, very well deserved.I remember playing the first Grand Theft Auto game when I was in 3rd or 4th grade - cartoony graphics, birds eye view & no talking audio. To see how far Rockstar has come since then makes me feelA) OldB) Excited for their future games if they have set this decades bar with a game as good as RDR2The level of immersion in this game is hard to put into words, it's actually difficult to not feel like you are on the American frontier in the old west, the level of research gone into this game really does show.They ported it to PC pretty flawlessly, the only complaint I have is that occasionally there will be a lag time between mouse clicks and movement, but it hasn't hindered game play in any way.I could go on all day about single player and how awsome it is, but what really struck me as awsome is the lack of difference between single player and multiplayer. I've only played multiplayer for 2 days at this point, but it seems that you can do most of the same things in multiplayer as you can in single. I thought they would have had to strip away all the awsome elements of the game in order to make multiplayer work, but nope, I was glad to be wrong. There are even features in multiplayer that are unavailable in single player, and plus you get to make your own avatar. The character customisation is really in depth, from jaw bone and eye socket shape, to weather discolouration of the face, rashes and scars.If you're the type of gamer who has to rush through everything as quickly as possible in the name of progression, then you might miss a lot of the aspects that this game has to offer. A lot of the time, its your choice as to what you do & how you progress. But if you are just going to bee-line it from one point to another, you will probably miss out on the substance of the game.Take your time with it

author: CleverDuck
review: The sad thing is this game has so much potential, but it's like Rockstar is going out of their way to make it not fun.To start off with, I just have constant problems with their stupid launcher and getting signed in just so that I can play the stinking game.If I can actually get the game started up and running, the 'story mode'/single player is alright, but to be honest I don't care so much about playing their story. I would just rather have an open world to run around in and do what I want, rather than having areas like New Austin locked out until the Epilogue is reached, and other mechanics locked out. It would be nice to be able to have personal wagons and character customization that Red Dead Online has.The online mode is hot garbage. Everything is ten times more expensive than in story mode, and you earn about 25% of what you would in story mode. Most other players are a--holes and key mechanics and advancements are locked behind missions that require being a group, or disabled completely (like being able to capture and keep or sell wild horses). The Dead Eye mechanic is essentially useless in online, because there's no time dilation because you can't have that and have all of the players synced.Truth be told, I really don't even want to play online or with other people. The ideal game for me would be to have all of the open world/go anywhere, do anything capability and character customization of the online mode, but in a single player, offline game.

author: Sushi
review: This one is so ahead of it's time that i literally keep forgetting that it is  a game and not a window in time. Great graphics and one of a kind interaction with the world. The best open world game capable to stand the test of time 4 years from now. You can say what you want about Rockstar but they know how to make a proper next gen game. About online part of the game i can't say a word since i barely touched it. Great story, great game mechanics and Arthur Morgan is a legend.

author: FaizerLaser
review: This game is breathtaking. The graphics are amazing even on lower tier PC's, the map is so diverse with lots of places to explore. NPC interactions are so indepth and detailed. The story is fantastic and the missions are fun to complete. You can easily sink hours into the game just roaming around and robbing people or hunting down animals. Only cons are some missions early in the game are quite limiting. The first chapter is pretty linear and kinda boring imho but it acts as a tutorial. You can look up ways to skip the first chapter if you want but I would still play it. Some missions also force you to commit crimes which gives you bounties. Other than that would definitly recommend

author: wyzyrd
review: Keep in mind that I have only really played story mode so far, and that I do not have enough experience online to comment on it.This game is hands-down one of the best I have ever played. The story is intriguing and keeps you longing for the next chapter. It's also a lot more interactive than I expected with the ability to have a short conversation with pretty much any NPC. As for how it runs, I managed to usually get FPS in the low to mid 50s most of the time with some lag spikes here and there. Here are my specs for reference:Processor: Intel Core i5-6600K CPU @ 3.50GHzGPU: Radeon RX 480 8 GBRAM: 16 GB

author: MottonBunchie
review: Red Dead Redemption II is the very definition of a wild west story. With such amazing voice-acting talent, heartbeating soundtracks and high fidelity cinematics, it's easy to get hooked on this game. Personally I love variations in video games. If you need a break from the main story, go play poker! Or hunt and explore around the vast different majority of cities. There is always something to do in RDR2! Walking the streets of small town Valentine compared to big city Saint Denis really makes you scratch your head and wonder if you are still playing the same game. The terrain and cities have great variety.200 hours into the game I would say my favorite function in the game is the Cinematic Camera. Sitting around the campfire and listening to one of Hosea's crazy stories? Just hold [V] and it suddenly gives more life to the atmosphere around the story being told. Riding your horse to a boring destination? Well holding [V] is absolutely the way to go! After so many hours and almost finished with the main story, I already want to replay this game.10/10 recommended for adventure craving players!

author: Matilla
review: I cannot "recommend" this product as it currently is, even though the game runs very well for me. It's the Social Club garbage that crashes every other time it's loading something. The GAME.EXE error bs doesn't put me off playing but it's completely obsolete and unnecessary for the game to run. My disdain for the people that brainfarted this PoS into existence is unfathomable.My rig is an Ryzen 2700, GTX 1080, 32 GB RAM and NVME storage. I've simply copypasted Hardware Unboxed (HUB) option presets and the built-in benchmark is @1440p 28.0458 min; 61.2659max; 56.4213 avg It runs well and very smooth,  even when alt tabbing and doing some 'work' in the background. Only noticeble issues were random lags with texture loading. This game, when in runs, is an 11/10. Worldbuilding, gameplay, story are meticulously crafted and polished. I'm giddy and in awe riding through the prairie and scared ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ when some pack of wolfs jumps me at night in the mountains, and stopping for a robbery whenever some random stranger greets meAs of writing this "review" I've completed 52% of the story, I've not bothered with any of the gambling minigames or online features, I mostlikely won't anyway. I bought the "Special Edition" for 25% off, I suppose Kotick Bobby needs a bigger boat for the 4th quarter. So I've no hard feelings for the people that purchased it first day on steam or at Sweeny Tim's. This game is an incredible piece of art, hampered by corporate greed and exploitation of labour.

author: Cross
review: Single player? Fine. Multiplayer? Rockstar is one of the worst game publishers ever. They make good games that they treat like crap. Bugs, hacking, zero customer support, changing core game mechanics to screw over players and get them to pay more money. I spent MONTHS playing this game locked out of one of the core gameplay roles, with no help from support, ticket after ticket, because they botched up one of their twitch promotions. I can't go ONE session of playing this game without running into some game breaking bug or issue, and I NEVER have. The last straw is now they change the daily mission system they've had for years so that players get MUCH LESS rewards, in order to encourage us to buy more gold. RDO is the red headed stepchild that will always have more potential but will always be shoved into the dirt by Rockstar. One of the best wild west games I've ever played, but no matter how casually you play, you will be screwed over by the company that runs this game.
