author: Wilhelm II
review: So far I absolutely love this game. But. But but but. I find myself not being able to play it VERY OFTEN due to simple errors in the game that could have been fixed. Rockstar had ONE YEAR to fix this game and port it to pc. I genuinely think they didn't check anything as I have had to troubleshoot countless issues. As i am writing this MY GAME IS BROKEN. I get a black screen, and can't run it in fullscreen mode. This is even worse then GTA when it came out. Im so frustrated by this, because this game is so much fun. Sadly, Rockstar won't ever do anything about it because they are lazy pieces of poop. FIX YOUR GAME ROCKSTAR.Update: Okay, so got the issue resolved, but it took me all day to fix, which is not ok. A 60$ triple A title SHOULD NOT have these issues. Period. I don't understand why I'm having to troubleshoot my problems for a game that should be finished. The most frustrating thing though, Is that I was mad I couldn't play this amazing game. That is the main downfall, which is very Ironic. So I provided an update, but still don't recomend this game in its current state. It would be worth a buy if It was 40$ bucks thoughUPDATESo it's been awhile since I posted my review and my thoughts have changed (significantly). So first off, I have around 70 hours in this game, and I haven't even gone half way in the story progression. Also, the games attention to detail and graphics are astounding, and they amaze me every time I play the game. With that being said, i did have monumentous proformance issues with this game. But a few driver updates like I'm mostly seeing stable fps, including a new game update as well. But this game is FUN, both online and in story mode. However, I don't think that this game deserves to be 60$, since it took almost 2 months to have a stable game! So take that into consideration when purchasing this game, but overal I'm going to change my recomendation :)))

author: Zerotix
review: This game is flawless.I don't mean it's without quirks and bugs. I don't think there is a game out there that has zero glitches or bugs. When I say flawless, I mean Rockstar spared nothing when they built this world. There isn't a nook or cranny in this game that isn't interesting, save for facing a wall.Let me start by saying RDR2 is a 3rd (or 1st) person action western. It has hundreds of thousands of lines of dialogue from an amazing cast of actors that make up not only the game's protagonists, but every stranger you meet around the map as well. The game offers one of the best stories one could imagine in a western setting. Coupled with a variety of side activities to do like hunting, fishing, homestead robberies, stagecoach and train robberies; side games like poker or dominos, side missions, and random encounters throughout the world. The game is so detailed, one could spend an hour wondering what's left to do, only to run into several things at once that give a feeling of having too many things to do, wondering which direction to go and what the outcome will be.There is also an amazing consistency to this world that is unmatched. Help an old timer fixing a home up by getting lumber: you can give him money, go ask for supplies, or steal the lumber yourself. This may or may not lead to the supplier not speaking to you any more, or maybe just until he needs your help fighting wolves. The old man and his sons finish building the house and it stands empty. Later on, a stranger lives there and builds a garden. Meanwhile the timber company you've been visiting are just about to clear the rest of the forest and pack up to move somewhere else. The trees making up that forest are now gone, and you get paid for the job. Or you could go in and shoot everyone, the house never gets finished, and the trees stay. However, now you're a wanted man!There's not much I can say that hasn't already been said about this game, but know that it is indeed a masterpiece. Decades from now, this will be one of those games demanded onto the next generation of consoles - along with Skyrim.

author: Sigi09
review: Spend an hour hunting, wait for rockstar to disconnect you and delete all your loot and be happy you wasted money on a rockstar game.Edit 03.01.2020The game still isn't fixed and having unlocked the trader specialisation, the resource losing has only gotten worse.You have to pay or give your resources to the game so the game can process it and then turn it in to a delivery mission for you. If you happen to disconnect on a delivery mission, which for me seems to be a 50%-50% chance, you will lose those resources and the delivery mission will not be done, effectively making you fail and lose resources.Edit 13.01.2020Besides Rockstar being unable to fix their game and connection issues, the game is now full of hackers. Of all games played, roughly two-thirds are full of hackers that just teleport you around, spawn twenty bears around you or just insta-kill you with non existant bombs etc.

author: MikL
review: Rockstar took their sweet time developing this game, having the original Red Dead game come out mid 2010, and it was totally worth it.This game is incredible. The sheer size of the map makes it so that travelling from one corner to the other, full speed on your horse will still take you plenty of time, and taking the scenic route will last you for hours. The visual effects, including the lighting, textures, colours and more are so perfect and encapsulating the beautiful parts of the world, on top of the more nasty areas of the map for what they are.The characters are all amazingly written. The protagonist, Arthur Morgan, is one of the best protagonists in any video game ever, with his character arc being some of the best storytelling I've seen from the video game. Every character has their clear flaws and strengths, and every character has something that can relate them to the player.The only slight negative I would have to say about this game is that the game play mechanics could have used a little polish before full release. At times, you may get annoyed on camera angles or at the fact that your horse sometimes will decide to go off on its own path, while you are riding it.Other than that however, there is so much to explore in this world and without saying anything more, go and experience it for yourself and you'll see what I mean.9.99/10 :)

author: Psykopiano
review: Do not buy unless you want to have modder destroying your game play, Very obvious now that online version is a cash grab, especially the PC version cos modders is running wild, is rockstar doing anything to it? From the result I guess little effort, but can't blame them, after all they are doing biz which is making money.DO NOT BUY.Full of bugs.Below is for the Red dead redemption 2 online.Daily challenges some cannot be completed or maybe partial complete.Once in the game (loaded into the game world), go to menu to choose to spawn at other areas will give you infinite loading screen.Some missions buggy and cannot be completed.Some missions never reward you once completed.PC version full of hackers, just like GTA online.Even the game allow free roam killing, but I wonder what is the benefit as it let griefers destroy another person's experience.Take for example trader's role, going for long distant delivery, understand the risk reward thing, but imagine some players spends a few days (in real life time) to gather max 100/100 for delivery and gone in matter of seconds. This online is pure money grab, outrageous pricing of items, the game mechanics to generate money is you need to be online in the game for it to run.Tons of grinding if you like to grind endlessly repeating the same thing over and over.I enjoy some aspects of it, if the game is running flawlessly.The main problem is hackers in the game, they run god mode and or teleport to kill you over and over again.Is Rockstar doing anything to prevent it? I am not sure cos I am not their staffs, but it is truly disappointing.Recommendation: well with all the bugs and glitches if you can put up with it, you can try. Other than that I don't recommend it as the online is pure money grab and full of bugs, my friend was beside me when I played, he said" looks like the online mode is still in beta version", which I truly agreed even BETA version is already praising it, I feel like I am the internal tester LOL.If you are going for single player, well go for it, if you got the money to burn.Until they prevent hackers from ruining the game, and fixed most the bugs and glitches, I don't recommend buying this AAA game, which seems like a beta or worse version.

author: Siihorsu
review: One of the most beautiful games I have played, hands down. The story that was told from this game is something that I really love, and what I do miss when I played Grand Theft Auto 5; characters that I really care and love. Playing as the rootin' tootin' hunk of a man Arthur Morgan really makes me love the game, how human he is, how beautiful the man looks while wearing his usual outfit...Aside from my crush on Arthur, I do really enjoy the game a lot; even if I complain on it a lot during my playthrough. Gameplay wise, the story missions do felt like you're directed by some invisible director over the sky who has an auteur vision that he wants to be EXACTLY how he sees it, and the guns are satisfying....sort of; if you get headshots frequently which isn't exactly hard since you have Dead Eye Targeting, but if you don't the enemies are tankier than a M1A1 Abrahams tank; same goes to you as well, as Arthur's thicc body shrugs off bullets like its nothing.Story-wise, I'm thoroughly enjoy it. It is a story about a man's loyalty to his family that are slowly crumbling apart due to the times and the awful decisions that they end up taking. I love the characters in this story, I love Arthur, John, Charles, and especially Micah. I always have a joy looking at the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ and the most ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ one-dimensional villain you can make, and Micah hits that spot well. I love hating the bastard, and I always found laughing at him, especially at the penultimate mission with Arthur, where Micah gets his ass kicked by a sick and dying man. The characters in this story are someone you like, and someone you can care of. It does take literally forever to finish, but I can assure you; it's worth it.In technical aspect, I found little to no problems running it on my rig; but your mileage may vary with this sort of thing. My current spec can run this on High settings at around the range of 45-60 fps. The controls on this game are a hit or miss. I do like the gunplay with how heavy it is, but your movements on KB/M are like controlling a tank, or a very fat walrus. Your horse controls requires some time to get adjusted on, but once you get adjusted on it; you still feel like you have little control on what your steed will do. Sometimes, as you ride around the countryside; your horse ends up circling around the road and hit the nearest boulder, throwing you off the mount and go tumbling down to the nearest angry wolf or mildly irritated bear. In other times, your horse will panic and you have to calm it down; but when that happens hope to god you're not near a predator or else you're gonna get mauled or eaten.With that said, this game is an experience that you should have. If you have enough storage, or a good enough rig to run it. It's a good game with a really good story, and I do wish I can experience it again like I had the first time.

author: CPT KOREA
review: Fun game that has great graphics and a good story when it's playable, but I have to leave a negative review due to it being extremely buggy and unstable. In the time I've played the game I've seen more than 7 different ways for the game to crash or freeze on me. This combined with how absolutely atrocious the save system is in the game puts it on the verge of unplayable. You're not allowed to quick-save, you're not allowed to manual save at certain points (like during missions), and missions don't automatically save at certain points during the mission, in fact the auto save system that the game largely relies on saves very infrequently. I haven't had this much frustration losing progress and having to re-do things in a game since the early 2000s. I've probably spent 5-10 hours in this game just troubleshooting problems and re-doing lost progress. Some areas of the actual game play are good but could definitely stand to be improved, but if I were to rate this game based on the game itself I would recommend it, but I simply can't based on how much frustration I've had with simply trying to play the game. 7.5/10 when playable, 4/10 in my experience attempting to play the game.

author: Chad Thundercock
review: I loved the first Red Dead. I love most of Rockstar's products. That being said, this game has the worst PC controls I've ever experienced. The voice acting and graphics are amazing. However, this game is an absolute nightmare when it comes to intuitive character controls. Will never recommend.

author: Kaya
review: TL;DR: amazing game ruined by rockstar's greed, banning legit players, ignoring modders.while red dead 2 is an incredibly enjoyable and immersive game, i have immense issues with rockstar's handling of modders. every lobby i join into has at least one modder. i only play the online mode, and my entire character progress was wiped due to a modder spawning a lockbox that i opened, freezing my game and forcing me to take a large amount of gold at once. rockstar's inability to not only ban modders, theyre dime a dozen in this game and frequently reported, but suspend normal players for the actions of modders is absurd. if rockstar's policies were different, my review would be an immediate positive. until then, i cannot recommend people to sink their time into this otherwise great game, waiting for the illegitimate ban hammer to drop on them because of the actions of a modder that's never reprimanded.my enjoyment of this game has been ruined, despite it quickly becoming one of my favorite games. so, so much potential squandered. while the gameplay is immersive and fun, it will always be overshadowed by the aggressive microtransactions, intentionally difficult grind, and the absurd modding. the microtransactions can be ignored if you grind. the grind is mandatory, and while eventually obnoxious, can still be played through without much grief and rather overall enjoyable. the modders, and rockstars 'responses' to them, is where i must draw the line. if you can turn a blind eye to these three things, or just want to play the story, go right ahead and get it. if youre playing primarily/strictly online probably wait until it goes on sale if you can overlook said problems.

author: Drew
review: This review is for the ONLINE part of the game only.It has the potential to be amazing, however it falls short due to being a broken and buggy game. Let's kick it off by mentioning the hackers. Although they don't harass you all the time, they're there, and can ruin your session without a moments notice. I have seen them teleport all over the map and they'll kill you endlessly, with no hope of escape. Another problem for me which is an extremely annoying bug, is the mount issues. I leveled up my horse to max level, yet every time I join a friends game or load out of a cut scene, it gives me a level 1 horse, which results in me not being able to keep up with anyone. The horse get's tired in about 10 seconds of sprinting and I either have to slow down, or waste a ton of money on tonics and carrots to keep up. The whole situation is minor, but it's complete BS I shouldn't have to deal with. Above that, this game has a complete lack of anything to due after about 10-15 hours, which is pretty bad for a "sandbox" game. I have finished the story driven mission, now my only options for replayability is to hunt/fish (pretty boring), do stranger missions, (which are always broken), or start a profession (Could be fun?). Professions require 15 gold bars, which you guessed it, can be purchased through the online store for real money. Pretty much outside of that, you can spend endless time in the dressing room trying on new clothes you can't afford, which will change your characters appearance. After that you are pretty much left with running around harassing people, or getting into pointless fights with npc's, which has no story attached, you just kill them and loot 17 cents. Lastly let's not forget about the random crashes, disconnects, and failure to load that will happen at least a few times per session. All in all I don't fully regret buying this game, because i'm pretty sure the single player story mode is going to save the whole thing. However I would highly suggest waiting to catch it on sale, wait for an update, or just play it on PS4 if you have one.

author: Ozone
review: Amazing game! I played it first on a PlayStation 4 Pro so I can't say I was taken by complete surprise by the PC release, but having better image quality and more importantly, higher FPS, is  a bad thing. Now, regarding the more ... important part. The story and characters are phenomenal. Rockstar proves they are not capable of doing only over the top open world shooters, but they can take a step back and produce an experience much more realistic and grounded in reality. Yes, it does have downsides, annoying details which detract from the game, however these are only minor. For example, the main character will automatically store your equipped weapons after a bit of horseback riding. Things like this. Just about everything else is unforgettable. From the exceptionally written dialogue (which you can, as a player, initiate in different ways during both gameplay and missions), to the beautiful soundtrack that fits perfectly with high tension, or relaxing situations, the American western frontier atmosphere, it all adds up to a game you won't soon forget. The gameplay is, as expected, on par with the aspects described above, most of the time. Aside from the annoyances mentioned earlier, I do believe that shooing does get a bit repetitive even for a game like this, and the rules of the "Wanted" system are at best confusing and at worst, completely broken. From a technical point of view, the game is also a marvel. It sets the bar so high, I highly doubt other developers will be able to reach it, until well into the next console generation. Every (non playable) character plays their own role in the open world, they react realistically to your actions, they have their own personality and even unique dialogue lines you can initiate, or ignore. The wildlife plays so many roles in the game, everything from killing the player, helping with the survival aspects (hunger, stamina, deadeye) to playing a role in the overall economy. The physics are also, unmatched as of yet, as they can, and will, lead to interesting and downright stunning moments. There is a lot more to say. You can literally spend days and weeks forging your own adventures around the world of Red Dead Redemption 2, while ignoring the story which intentionally starts up slow and gradually building up to a spectacular, wonderful, tragic ending the fans of the series anticipated.

author: Fëanor
review: Straight up masterpiece in modern storytelling.  The only criticism I have is of the systems intended to inject "realism" into the game, such as the health and stamina cores that require you to occasional consume food and other items, upgrading ammunition one bullet at a time, the long animations involved with things like looting, skinning, etc.  The movement itself can also seem rather slow and clunky, and that's by design.But if you can get passed those annoyances, the game really is in a league of its own.  Compelling characters with a fantastic journey.  Highly recommended.

review: Ah....After a long time of gameplay (and still havent finished all achievements) i could say this game is pretty good heartbreaking, it made me cry in alot of scense hehe .I like the idea how they made the story before RDR 1 , (it made me feel like movies this days that they tells story backwards instead of forward haha )You dont need to play RDR1 first to understand or anything, you can play any RDR and enjoy it for the fullest.This game really makes you play for alot of fun hours!Of course as we all know, RDOnline is alittle screwed with hackers and stuff, but dont let em get your hopes down! still its a great way to enjoy another type of story. Also if your just looking for achievements hunter, just get em and then forget the online (just like i diid XD still i enjoyed it alot)Please enjoy yourself, happy gaming and god bless you all!!

author: deathberry✿
review: A truly marvelous game. On my PS4 I have about 100 hours playing RDR2 and then got it on PC as well after finally getting an RTX card and a 1440p monitor. This is a game you can play both aggressively and if you are tired after a long day's work and want to kick back, play something relaxing. The story really takes you in, despite being on the wrong side of the law we fall in love with Arthur, an outlaw with flaws, yet still tries to do the right thing. This is my second playthrough and I will definitely be playing a 3rd time to explore more. You can get the rumoured Online only RDR2 for much cheaper (again, rumoured), but trust me, you wanna save up and get the story mode version. Few games will come close to providing a similar fulfilling experience.

author: ☠ Asasin ☠
review: 90% of my "play time" has been trying to fix the ridiculous controls and graphical issues I keep experiencing. If you try to play with a controller and already launch the game, and want to invert the Y-axis... the game tells you it has to restart. And then it doesn't save the change.I'm getting ridiculous flashing from all sorts of stuff - sometimes it's the shadows, sometimes it's the sky, sometimes it's the snow. As I try to figure out how to fix this and navigate the graphics options to make adjustments, the game continues to crash. Stay away for now unless you've got a very high end computer or are a masochist. Somehow this is literally less optimized than AC Odyssey; it looks and runs a million times worse than GTA 5. I just don't know what they were doing.

author: godoftoast1992
review: When I first launched this travesty on my PC, game was looking crispy and when they started showing the dialogue. Ohhh boy, sounded like I was in the Rockstar Studio doing a mic test with the voice actors/actresses. Barely fixed this audio issue by changing my output speakers to NVIDIA High Definition Audio instead of my speakers. Then comes the stupid launcher it forces you to use, don't know why it is needed when it does nothing with my game. I played for 3hrs after fixing few of the issues with no queries but, now when I try to launch the game, it screws over my graphics card (NVIDIA GTX1060 6GB). I hadn't touched the settings of the graphics at all during my time and all of a sudden it 'lacks the memory' to play it. Even turning down the graphics and resolution, can see pixels dying; probably beating my graphics card senselessly. I can't even request a refund because I managed to play it 3hrs (past 2hr mark) before it started to break itself. If you just google "Red Dead Redemption 2 PC issues''. comes with endless users having issues launching, audio or even this bullcrap graphics memory. Thanks Rockstar 11/10 Game. At least in the 3hrs I managed to play, when the game finally decided to work, got really hooked into the gameplay and story. That aside cannot recommend buying this ♥♥♥♥ now until it's fixed.

author: Daware
review: When this game works RDO is a massive improvement over what it was when it was released on consoles. But i spend most of my time dealing with infinite loading screens, broken Posse systems, performance instabilities, and I have to use a VPN just to play online or else I experience error codes. Its a mess right now.Edit: Rockstar continues to do XP bonuses, and add new clothing Etc. to the game while continuing to ignore the glaring problems the online has. 3 Months in and still Error codes galore, infinite loading screens, Broken missions, and a broken posse system. This port is a joke. Seriously stay FAR AWAY. Rockstar does not deserve  your money.Edit 2: So after not playing for around a year. Coming back the game seems mostly bug free, but It feels like they have abandoned it content wise. The amount of things to do seems almost the same, barely any new clothing, basically no new weapons. ANd they have the audacity to extend the bounty hunter class level range but charge another 15 gold bars for it? Like Really?

review: Man what can I say that hasn't been already said. Buy this game and enjoy this work of art. author: Stuker
review: Edit: After 6 or more hours, in which the resolution bug reappeared and the game crashed for no reason other times and hopelessly waiting for a hotfix, I'm giving up on the title.Troubleshooting simulator 2020 - wait for future patches and a sale.Game launched at wrong resolution and you can't change them outside the game, resolution change options are locked until you change video adapter for some reason. Game crashed three times while lowering resolution trying to fix it. Fullscreen has issues, recommend borderless. I could somewhat easily fix all this due to a lot of users having the same issues on forums, some date from almost a year ago. Great first impression.Game itself is pretty good so far, but for the asking price you're expecting something that works a lot better. author: justAweeb
review: This right here,is a masterpiece. Rockstar is back at it again with another open world and story rich game. When I first started the game,I though "This silly cowboy game seems pretty chill" ,and by the end of it I was weeping tears while being stunned over this wonderful experience. Everything is beautiful in this game,from characters that are so charismatic that you actually feel for them,to landscapes that are so beautiful that I actually paused my missions just to have a look around. The gameplay encourages the player to use the Dead eye witch is very satisfying rapid shooter ability,making you feel like a bad ass every time using it. The music in this game is literally perfect and heartwarming,fitting the atmosphere on every occasion. With all of this attributes combined, and the story being one of the most enjoyable stories I've ever experienced, this is one of the only games that legit made me cry. I'm still looking forward to discover different secrets in the story mode and to replay it,making different choices.I 100% recommend this game to anyone who: seeks a story game with one of the best written characters in fiction,is looking for an unforgettable experience shooting rival outlaws and exploring the beautiful world of New Hanover and New Austin, and for anyone who is ready to ride along with the Van der Linde gang during the year of 1899 seeking for redemption as an outlaw.10/10.

author: DarkBunny
review: I've spent a fair amount of time playing this game, and in my opinion, it's the best game I have ever played.Being an exclusively PC gamer thus far, I never played the first game, and I was always sad about that. When the news broke that RDR2 is coming to PC, I was ecstatic, and boy, RockStar did not disappoint.The sheer amount of detail that has gone into the game, the world, the characters, is amazing. Graphically the world is stunning, the narrative and direction in the game is brilliant, and it's really fantastic to have a game that is not just about rushing through and getting to the end as quickly as possible.RDR2 was made for you to immerse yourself into the whole cowboy life, playing slow and steady, enjoying the wild west for as long possible, and partaking in everything the world has to offer.The single player story is absolutely phenomenal, and please, to anyone reading this and playing, do as much of the side quests, exploration, other activities as you can early on as it simply makes the game better!The online aspect of the game is also great to play. I know a lot of people complain that there is not a lot going on and it's boring, etc. but there's still enough there to make it very enjoyable, and if online does get boring, then start the single player again for another play-through!I hope RockStar does add additional content as they have done for GTA V Online as well, and they "expand" the online world with more roles, and more activities to further enrich the amazing experience Red Dead Redemption 2 already is.

author: {CCC} YT | CultistCaine | TTV
review: Arthur Morgan and the Van der Linde gang are outlaws on the run. With federal agents and the best bounty hunters in the nation massing on their heels, the gang must rob, steal and fight their way across the rugged heartland of America in order to survive. Don't buy for multi player. Buy for single player. Revolvers go pew! Pew! Yeehaw Pardner! This game is like a chewing gum - bright wrapper, a flash of sweet at the beginning, but then you keep chewing it for too long and your jaw is tired, the gum has no taste but you keep chewing it by inertia. When you eventually spit it out, your mouth feels gross and you kinda regret having it in the first place. Only downside is that you can't leave Micah to rot in prison!

author: schwarz
review: I only finished Chapter 2 recently, for me the story is indeed Interesting. I won't give spoiler but I feel like the character development for each character (even the NPC's) are the best so far. The more I play, the more I interested with the story. It also has a dynamic progression where if you start a quest and then you just roam for few days and forgot to do the quest or you didn't do it in purpose, in some case the NPC who gives you the quest just do it by him/herself and then you can still continue the quest like normal.I have no problem with how the gun works on this game. My personal favorite gun is nothing other than Springfield bolt action Rifle. It has low rate of fire and very low ammo capacity (just 1 bullet) but have high range. The deadeye feature for me is just perfectly balanced (especially if I used it for hunting animals). Also The cool thing is now you can use First Person Perspective on a gunfight, just like GTA V. Personally it's 10/10, I just can't describe it with words.For a budget gaming laptop owner, I can't maxed out all the graphic setting, but in medium-high setting I feel like it's good enough as long you played it on 1920x1080p resolution, but I do some have problem on FPS (I still didn't get constant 60 FPS on low-medium setting). But hey, it's not a competitive games like APEX Legends, CSGO, Valorant, ETC, so I don't think it's a major problem for a meantime. Sacrificing FPS for better visual experience is also an option if you have budget gaming laptop like me. There's no doubt that Arthur is the badass anti-hero rather than GTA V trios. For an AAA Games I think Rp640.000 games (Rp320.000 on sale) it's good enough price to paid. Especially if you have a good PC, I would recommended you to buy this game if you like open-world games., the main problem is Rockstar game launcher. I don't know about other player but I feel like the launcher is high demanding on RAM usage, and I also feel like for an AAA games how about just make the account binding for only the first time we open the game, not every time we played the game we need to launch Rockstar game launcher too. I feel like it just take a long time for waiting (Especially if you don't have a good enough Internet like my country does)., for an open-world game, I wish for an option to skip cutscene when boarding trains. Seriously, after 3 times I watched the same cutscene, I get bored and feels like it's consumes too much time. I know it's great for immersion, but after few times watching it I feel bored. Maybe if we can Interact or do robbery when we boarding the train it'll get less boring., I played this game on budget gaming laptop, A Lenovo Legion 5 (Ryzen 5 4600H GTX1650 and 16GB's of RAM) and I still didn't get constant 60 FPS's on low-medium setting on Turbo performance. It only gets 30-40 FPS when inside a Town and 40-50 FPS on less crowded place. That's kinda sad because if I put on higher Graphic it has almost the same FPS (30-36 FPS on Town and Highly crowded area, and 35-48 FPS on less crowded place). I don't feel any significant difference so I just put it on medium-high setting. For non competitive game, I feel like 30 FPS is enough "smoothness" but I really prefer 60 FPS if I can get it. Honestly I preferred this game more than GTA V, the NPC are just better and more lively, You can greet stranger and raises Arthur's or John's Honor and do hunting. I know that GTA V released before RDR 2, but from my experience I already get bored on 5 hours of gameplay on GTA V.  That's why I would recommend this game for you to buy. But again, it's up to you to decide.

author: YungHassle 若者ー面倒
review: One of the best games of my life. The plot is great, as the open world, secondary characters, weapons, hunting, fishing and more were so good that they did not give up the game. - Amazing Detailed World- NPCs feel like real persons. Many different dialogues- Hunting feels fantastic- Side activities are good, I love hunting down wanted criminals- Various mini games RDR2 is great in detailed world but not as great in gameplay. It is still a good fun game if you have patience but the realistic should be optional. For people who want fast paced game, devs should give a choice to skip chore scenes and allow fast travel at the beginning of the game.. For those who hasn't played the game yet, I would advise to wait and see if Rockstar will have a patch to tone down the wanted system or not. I love its realistic though but as it stands now my Witcher 3 is much better game in comparison.

author: Asper Kestaes
review: Can I play this with friends? Yes, playing in a posse in Red Dead Online is a blast.Can I customize my character? Yes, I downright obsess over my character.Why the negative review? Well, Rockstar has failed to update RDO meaningfully practically since it launched, but they have recently shown they simply do not care about this game. -  The daily streak nerfs make buying gold bars (real money currency) even more appealing.-  Players need to buy bounty hunter to start AND again to get the prestige.-  The Outlaw Pass is full of horse hair and camera options, when before it was full of clothing and objectively better rewards.Rockstar has said they won't add anything to the base Red Dead Redemption 2 experience. They released Online as its own standalone game for the money, but they will not add anything meaningful to Online unless something changes. Just look at the daily streak bonus for gold bars as proof; the nerf came out of nowhere, but now it takes two week's worth of time to get something like 0.1 of a gold bar per challenge when that used to be the rate for your first day. Oh wait, it came right before the standalone Online release? What a coincidence, right?If you are a new player looking to play Online, Rockstar is actively making the game harder for you to earn the things that matter so you pay more money.If you are in it for the single player experience, then by all means go ahead, but if you are looking at this with even a chance of playing RDO, you are only valuable for however long Rockstar can tap your wallet for as much as they can force out of you.

author: GHOST- - - -INBOUND
review: So far have been unable to play. The rockstar account that I have and the game is making me sign in to requires 2 factor authentication that I no longer have access to. Currently having to remove it from my account, which if all goes to plan will take 24 hours from this point to actually be removed. The 2 factor authentication is not rockstars fault, but forcing people to download a separate, useless launcher that I don't want just to play a game that I bought on Steam is absolutely ridiculous and the root of my frustration, as if I didn't have to download it and sign in I would not be unable to play the game. Due to the sheer frustration this has caused me I would rate the game itself as a 6/7 out of 10. While the game is good (not my first time playing it) forcing people to download a launcher and sign in when I could just as happily and easily use my steam account is BS. Stop trying to make the Rockstar launcher work, its never going to work, it is just so NOT fetch. Edit: while the game is still held back by the ridiculous rockstar launcher I have ran across yet another issue. And that issue is pertaining to the save files. The game both simultaneously prevents me from saving at certain points, especially in camp after a save. Which leads me to believe it is autosaving. However, it is in fact NOT. Its just being another broken rockstar product and multiple times over the week I have lost hours of progress because it both stops me from saving, and also fails to autosave. The fact that the game came out when it did and somehow doesn't have a decent auto save is as ludicrous and ♥♥♥**** stupid as it requiring the rockstar launcher. I recommend purchasing this product even less than I did before at this point.

author: DrPrime8
review: TL;DR Perhaps one of the finest games ever made. Playing this game gave me LUMBAGO! (you'll only get that joke if you've finished the story)OK, so I have played most of Rockstar's offerings, and I liked GTA5 a lot, but I never really got into online. Playing RDR2 for the first time I was instantly hooked, as I like story-led action and exploration games. The horse mechanics in particular were really immersive and I felt like a genuine gunslinger. Missions are varied, interesting and most of all FUN. There is so much to do, if you want to get full completion you may be looking at hundreds of hours. Taking it medium slow, I completed my first play-through in 100 hours. I was very moved by the story and could think of nothing else for a time. The world felt a little empty with that story behind me. I decided to start a new play through almost instantly, but then I decided to check out Online too. I was surprised to find Online also has a wealth of story missions (not as good, but then that's not the focus). Online became a total blast when I found someone to play with, and I still have my second play through to look forward to! The graphics are brilliant. The acting is second to none. The characters are fleshed out and interesting. It's funny, it's sad, it's violent, it's silly. It's brilliant. Online mode is also great IMHO even though I'm not an online games kinda-guy, and I have seen almost no cheaters online so far and only the odd griefer, who are mince-meat if you have another player with you who is a high-level gunslinger. There is a good community for both aspects of the game, and basically despite the high asking price even on-sale, if you want to live one of the best and most highly acclaimed games ever made to date, it's worth every nugget.

author: ✪ rdg
review: I grew up playing most of Rockstar's games and so far this is the best game I've played in comparison to other open-world games. Very story-rich and has that really sick vibe to become an outlaw. Graphics are stunning in comparison to previous games made by Rockstar. However one thing is for sure this game is NOT WORTH IT at its current price. (Got it from sale for 30$.)Pros- Stunning Graphics.- Great Open-World Experience. (Especially for those more into story mode.)- Lots of things to do. (ALOT!!!)- Story goes depending on your choices.- The game slowly teaches you how to play per mission.- New honor system. (To keep your reputation fine from bystanders around you, actually fun to maintain from time to time.)Cons- Poor Optimization. (Even though I have a decent PC, it struggles to play on higher settings especially when DX12 is on.)- Random Crashing. (Not very frequent, by the time I bought the game it crashes on launch but I fixed it by running it on safe mode, from then on NO ERRORS occurred.)- Price. (Definitely not worth the current price ESPECIALLY without the special edition/ultimate edition of the game, suggest waiting it to lower down over time.)- Rare Glitches? (Very rarely during missions some of the NPCs get stuck to go to the objective, and every time I pause and unpause while on a horse it goes out of direction for a bit then fixes itself back, Rockstar, please fix.)- ALT+TAB Glitch. (Seriously annoying, can't browse through other apps whilst in-game without resulting the game to crash.)Overall I can conclude that this game is a masterpiece, its just that it has issues like every other game during early-release. I know that Rockstar will address the problems soon and they are trying their best to keep the game as fixed as possible.But still its NOT worth the price.~ Still love the game though :)

author: Mdk25
review: Lots of praises were written about this game, so it’s hard to say anything not said already by others.Yeah, obviously it has a huge open world, much bigger than the first game.And obviously the graphics are great, and suppress by far the console versions.Not having played GTA5, the 2 games I played and this game resembles closely are Fallout 4 and Kingdom Come: Deliverance.In comparison, RDR2 offers much less weapon customization than Fallout 4, and much less engaging character progression than Kingdom Come: Deliverance.But it does surpass both in graphics, polish (I encountered almost no bugs, playing 1 year after release), and number of side missions.The fun in the 2 other games, is the freedom they allow you to solve missions in any way you may imagine (even ways the developers wouldn’t have dreamed about), while RDR2 is more linear, and you mostly do missions in one of the few way the developers intended you to.But the sheer number of available side-quests and optional missions is overwhelming.Making you find new unexplored parts of the game every time you play.The worst part of the game is the multiplayer.While the game has you playing as a loner, in a vibrant rich world full of things to do. And seems like a ripe ground for a multiplayer experience.The multiplayer part actually has you either join a group of other people and play together (the opposite of the main game), or has you pitted against other players in small/contained arenas (again very far off the main game).And any attempt to play the multiplayer game in similar lines as the main campaign experience, shortly becomes futile as the rewards are so minuscule they barely give you enough money to buy the bullets you spent doing the task. And are in fact a HUGE bore/grind. Not interesting, and not fun.I would much rather continue playing the main game past the end game sequence, or start a new game altogether, than waste another minute on the pile of trash which is Red Dead Online.

author: Emmel
review: Please note that this is a hot-take from when I began the game, I will be updating this when I have finished story mode and/or when I have unlocked and played all roles in onlineTL;DR: Initially had some technical issues when running the game, they have since been resolved. The story is well worth your money. The online is generally a dumpster fire of misery and microtransactions, unless you're particularly persistent.I got this game for Christmas, and having read some of the things that other people have said, it's apparently a miracle that it even runs for me. Personally I've only had one major issue, and it was with the in-game graphics settings. Apparently the textures apply incorrectly (or something like that) on lower qualities, so if you want to run it on lower settings you can't change the textures from ultra without them looking like they came from a first generation console. I eventually found a fix to this (Nvidia Geforce Experience optimization) but I find it hard to recommend a game that isn't working properly for everyone. (there are definitely worse bugs and errors than the ones that I experienced)Assuming that you're running it without issue, the singleplayer is wonderful, it's got all that you've seen in the trailers; it's got the hunting, the fishing, the outlaw...ing, the everything. I've just got one gripe with it: the bounty system. There's a key detail that the game doesn't tell you. In fact, it misinforms you. Bandanas and masks are near useless in most situations, as lawmen have the power to instantly ID you because of course they do. (thank you R*)Red Dead Online is what I'm really looking at and reviewing. It's starting grind is currently much worse than GTA:O. It'll take you awhile to get any of the roles or businesses so if you don't have friends, if you don't like hunting, and if you're not looking to sink a bunch of time (or money) into it... don't touch it with a 10ft barge pole. Other than that I'm only gonna touch on the combat, as everything else has likely already been talked about. The card sets that you can get (which give you a dead-eye perk + up to 3 passive perks) completely unbalance combat, making you nearly unstoppable with the right build, taking less damage while dealing more. To put it into perspective for those familiar with GTA:O, this is what it's like to fight against someone with a full hand of cards: Imagine... you can only get Bullshark Testosterone at level 120, it's twice as effective and once you get it, it's on forever... and there's only ground combat. --Who needs a MK2 horse when you can 1-tap someone with the first weapon you buy in the game?Edit: clarified something, less sardonic & rant-y

review: Fun as hell, but also buggy as hell. You'd think after a whole year of not being on PC, and a Whole month of Epic / RGSC ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ exclusivity, you'd think this game would be stable as hell, but then you get in the game and NPCs are clipping into eachother all the damn time and the world doesn't even load before the cutscenes are displayed. Ontop of all this, all this DRM makes me just sad. You'd think a company of this size and magnitude wouldn't care about piracy this much, as well as would bug test their own game, but NOPE, they're so damn money hungry for every ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ cent that they won't even let us go on Singleplayer without having a consistant always Online connection, when they claim that you can go completely offline, which is a blatant lie.TL;DR: This game is fun as hell, but Rockstar is now Money Hungry and doesn't care about customers anymore & game suffers from stupid bugs.

author: Professor P4nda
review: Honestly, the game is fun, there is a lot to do in it. I myself have put in almost 10 hours with just side quests, hunting, bounty hunting. That being said, I can't give it thumbs up because the game has crashed on my at least 4 times in the past... well sh*t I guess its been 3 days and its all due to the forced on Rockstar launcher. I never though I'd say this, but if you can struggle with 30 frames per second, just buy the game on a console.It used to be forced on DRM which would hinder our games on PC now its forced on launchers doing it. These publishers are now punishing people who actually buy their games. Hopefully hackers can get passed the launcher so I can properly play the game I already spent money on.My PC specs are in my profile If you want to see it. One Rockstar's high settings at 1440p I'm averaging over 100 FPS indoors and outdoors anywhere between 65- 90  on average depending on how open the area is. Its a real shame because I want to enjoy this game, I DO enjoy this game. However, the launcher problems are just killing my enjoyment, forcing me to play 20-30 minute chunks all over as I disabled that auto save feature which constantly tells me to update my autosave file every 15 minutes.

author: NSomniac2
review: Wait for Rockstar to patch all the bugs before you buy this game.  I purchased this game on December 7, 2019 when the game was first released.  My game kept crashing every 15 to 30 minutes.  I expected some bugs in the game, but not game crashing bugs.  Since, I had other games to play, I stayed off of RDR2 for 2 months.  It is now February 17, 2020.  I am still running into the same problem.  The game crashes 15 to 30 minutes into game play.  Same cryptic error message and a suggestion to lower my graphics setting.  I tried every canned graphics settings.  I tried custom graphics settings.  I have tried this game on 2 separate PCs and I'm running into the same problemIt's pretty sad that an AAA game title has this sort of game breaking bug(s) two months after release.DO NOT BUY UNTIL ALL BUGS ARE FIXED.

author: Stormrise
review: One play through, single player only, 332 hours.  I loved this game!  Everything I want from an open world, without that repetitive grind feel.  Well crafted with so much attention paid to little details.  The pace of a horse on the trail, weather with storms (lightning, rain, snow, dust, wind...) coming in across the horizon then fully enveloping you, terrain vast enough to feel huge yet traveled enough you get to know areas, life of all kinds persistently occurring everywhere, cinematic mode where you still have some control, music soundtrack (that I'd actually like to buy) and so much more.I could make it take longer and milk more out of it (didn't 100% multiple little things), but instead I am planning on getting distracted for a little while and then coming back for a full replay.If you like open world, appreciate being totally taken by the atmosphere of a game, and taking your time to enjoy the details, get this!  (If you're the crash through finish the missions in 40 hours kind of player, just why?  Not impressed by such line of reasoning.  But you would be wasting your money, it's like an iceberg, that's just the tip.)tl; dr  Buy it!  And read.

author: MischivousMic
review: this game is so buggy it drives me nuts, but it's still fun and pretty and better with friends. I mostly have played online and my game crashes, i get dropped from sessions with an error code, i can't rejoin if i'm bumped to the menu without restarting the game, my horse will stop moving entirely and require a game restart, if you try to collect something at the same time as your friend one if you is gonna have to restart your game. but it's still fun, there are lots of details, guns, fancy stuff, team play, team griefing. I just got it to play with my friend, but the good kinda wins over the bad, mostly, kinda, enough for a positive review score bc i can't use a sliding scale. 6/10Edit: Okay the bugs win, I can't even load into my camp without having to reload the game a few times. I'm so over the bugs. omg. changing to not recommended because of these bugs. I had to restart 6 times just to get into the game today, and once i got in, i got kicked back out again "due to an error on rockstar's servers" you can't load into your camp from the start menu, because you'll never actually get into the game with any function other than joining a friend directly or going straight into online mode without trying to go anywhere specific. I just paid to teleport to my camp after finally loading in, and then the game kicked me off the server again. so I load up again, i get back in, and i'm back where I started, and have to pay once again to teleport to my camp. It remembered to keep my money, just not to put me where I paid to be. This game is buggier than hell and honestly I don't know why I'm even bothering to try this hard to play it. What's that, got dropped out of the session again? better restart the game entirely because you will not be able to rejoin. and I just got put back where I paid to teleport from a 3rd time. Is there somebody at rockstar I can personally yell at because this is absolute ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥.

author: Hawke
review: Lenny!Are you Lenny? have you seen my friend Lenny? Lennnay! There you are Lenny! "My name is Clyde". Lennieee! Why *punch* aren't *punch* you *punch* Lenny!Ok well... that's my favourite mission in the entire game, and the most hilarious.The characters in this game are 100% fleshed out, everyone you meet has a story and background, and you will weep at the turning point in the game where you figure out something is seriously wrong, or at least get a really bad feeling in the pit of your stomach.I'm trying hard not to give any spoilers, but it is very difficult. The story is an emotional roller coaster. Don't buy this game for the Online play, it is awful for the most part. Buy it for the very long single player story, the chance to roam the beautifully crafted world, the perfectly rendered wildlife with realistic actions, and the struggle between Good and Evil of the main character.This game is a 10/10. I'd give it 11/10 if it was physically possible, but it isn't. :) FYI I only have 18 hours played here on PC, but have over 300 hours on the PS4, playing the game twice.It did take me over an hour to finally get the graphics perfect (better than PS4) and the framerate to a smooth 60fps, but once you do.. you will want to live in this world. Enjoy!

There are issues that have gone without a fix since release including paid content not working. Beware.

author: Lugal Unuga
review: Beautiful, but flimsy, glitchy, superficial, and more repetitive than a JRPG. Atmosphere, visuals, and story are Red Dead Redemption 2's strongpoints, but the rest of the game is padded out with reused elements and easy but tedious ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥.For a game that offers so much to do, there is surprisingly little genuine variety.Take for example the lack of any meaningful interactions with NPCs. To be fair, the cutscenes can be really charming, and do capture the feel of a Western quite well, but everything else feels choreographed. Outside of pre-scripted scenes in quests, there are no dialogue options to speak of, save for "greet" or "antagonize", or (when faced with a moral dilemma) spare or kill. Just two options when speaking to every NPC in the game. Companions have a few more options, usually tied to quests, but that's it. The Elderscrolls series gets a bad rap for its NPC "arrow to the knee" repetition, but in Red Dead II it is the player who is effectively a broken record. Everything is scripted like a play, and no emergent behavior is allowed. Despite the technically open world, it seems strange to put Red Dead II in the category of "open world games" with actual variation (contrast the meaningful dialogue trees in true open world games like Fallout 3). Having elegantly limited dialogue options isn't necessarily a bad design decision, but Red Dead Redemption 2 was disingenuously marketed. If you bought into the hype and expected Mass Effect-esque character interactions and roleplaying, you will be severely disappointed.Interactions in general are limited as all hell in Red Dead 2. Other than grunting at people (either in greeting or as an angry prelude to beating the crap out of them), the mainstays of the game involve: 1. hunting and skinning animals or shooting and looting people, 2. picking stuff up for collection quests, resale, or to maintain your stats, 3. slowly crafting stuff at a campfire, or 4. undertaking quests. Quests are likewise limited to variations on a few themes: tedious fetch-quests, tedious escort missions, punctuated by charming but inane banter, either while riding to or from a mission, or in the cutscenes that bookend most missions. That's about it.All this would be tolerable if the combat system were more fun. It is fun, for the first hour or so. Then one begins to realize how difficult it would be to lose. The combat system is superficially satisfying but disgustingly shallow. Arthur's absurdly high health, ability to quaff tonics, and the deadeye autoaim system make all battles with NPCs simply a matter of taking cover occasionally or replenishing your stats when needed. If you're a decent shot and smart enough not to stand still in the open, you need not even rely on deadeye. There is no subtlety and scant need for strategy or skill. Arthur the nigh invincible cowboy guns down his foes with such ease that fights become a chore rather than an accomplishment. Dark Souls this ain't. Red Dead's combat is too goofy to feel gritty or meaningful, and not the right sort of goofiness for a Spaghetti Western, either. Frankly, I've spent way more hours, and had way more fun, in janky fan-made Western mods for Mount and Blade Warband, because they feel like actual Westerns rather than just GTA5 with cowboy hats and a better storyline.Another major point against Red Dead Redemption 2 is the AI. Not that the AI is particularly stupid (it is actually quite good in terms of pathfinding), per say, just repetitively implemented. The predictability of AI spawns and lack of variation in AI attack patterns is particularly irritating in the online version. I spent an hour on a spree near the pier at Blackwater, watching as the same pair of lawmen would spawn in the distance every 3 minutes and attempt to hunt me down, alongside one civilian NPC that would spawn next to me on the pier. Easy and boring.In addition, the stealth system is laughably poor and immersion-breaking when combined with AI spawns. There's nothing like finding a victim in an alleyway, carefully checking around for people, and then watching a witness spawn in front of you as you're looting your victim. The post office bounty mechanic is also rather silly.The environments themselves, while beautiful, are also rather closed. In fairness, the natural world is "open" and beautifully rendered with gorgeous wildlife. in the southeast, there are swamps and burnt out plantations. In the southwest, beautiful arroyos to meander over, red-gold mesas, and cacti. And in the north there are steep, unannounced cliffs and winding turns that send you and your wagon plummeting abruptly to certain death, as your tough-as-nails cowpoke shrieks like a small child. All in a good days work, and really funny. The towns and man-made structures, however, leave a lot to be desired. The atmosphere and art design is great, but there sure are a lot of closed doors in those little towns. In the story mode this is perfectly fine, but in online play it is rather irritating and immersion breaking to find Saint Denis only has a handful of shops you can actually go into, not much more than any of those rural Western towns.In sum, Red Dead Redemption is pretty and ambitious, but marred by tedious gameplay and misleading branding as an "open world" game. It is not worth the asking price of 60 bucks. Come for the atmosphere if you're a die-hard Western fan, but wait until it's on-sale.

author: kopek
review: The singleplayer is okay at best and the story is good but I wouldn't praise it like reddit does. A lot of the story is hand holdy and guided and feels like I'm on a set track and plays fairly slow (for me at least). The multiplayer is buggy or just flat out broken with connection issues, crashing, or simple actions that make your character freeze in place. To be able to play with a full group of friends is a roll of the dice. Multiple glitches making this game not worth the time nor effort and I truly regret buying this.Update: Every time I attempt to start up the game it gives me an error message saying it was "exited unexpectedly" and wont launch. There are too many problems for this $60 game and I have given up :)Another Update: I've spent the last week trying to fix my issue and talking to R* Support and it hasn't been at all successful. I'm no longer getting the same error code but every time I try to launch the game, the launcher never starts and the game closes. If I find a fix I will list it here as another update.Update: Managed to fix my issue by disabling the game running through my motherboard which was set by default somehow. You'll also need to run steam as an administrator.2/7/2021 Update: I haven't touched it in about 2 months and it no longer launches again.

author: MysteryPancake
review: Quite a chill game overall, has a good story and characters.Negative rating is because I personally found the story less fun than GTA titles, although some certainly will.I had issues with strangers missions, since some despawn at random when you get close, which is annoying if you travelled across the map to reach them. The shootouts which block your way start fun, but eventually you'd rather die than risk your horse getting shot or waste health potions. The ride horse button is the same button used to tackle a stranger, which may cause unwanted police chases.Whenever the game gets alt-tabbed it exits fullscreen mode, which has to be changed every time in settings. I also got many lag spikes and audio cuts, although this wouldn't be a problem on a decent computer.For anyone looking to buy this game, I think it's certainly worth trying. It has many cool features like characters who remember your past actions, choices within missions, the ability to talk to strangers and the honor system.

author: zedi
review: The game is brilliant on console and for PC would've been better if I could've run it.The rockstar launcher? That's enough said really however after 20 minutes trying to login to that I'm greeted with a game that WILL NOT LAUNCH no matter what I do. Apparently I'm not the only one with this issue and all the 'fixes' just don't work. Rockstars fix just changes the error to 'Unable to start'. Brilliant.I definitely would recommend this game if it worked however it does not - if you want to part with your money to have it sit in your steam library by all means, I guess it looks pretty?Launching a game through steam to load a launcher to click a button in said launcher to load a game via steam, what an amazing system.When Rockstar finally fix this mess it'll absolutely be worth it until then I'd steer very clear.Refund requested.

review: I just finished Red Dead 2, my son encouraged me to play saying it was about the story more than just gameplay. I was a little sceptical as I'd only played FPS games and never really understood story/narrative based games however Red Dead Redemption has changed that. It is an amazing game or should I say story, I struggle to define it.If you haven't already played RDR then play it, if you have played it then encourage someone else to, it is that good...

author: Tacitus Kilgore
review: After about 100 hours on this game i am sure about this review. Red Dead Redemption 2 is one of the best games ever made. This game opened a new path to open world games. The world keeps on going without you, your actions have consequences which you witness yourself during your gameplay, the people and the animals are so real you wont be able to decide easily about their fates and your actions against them. Graphics are perfect even on low settings. Its a good optimised game(not as good as gta 5) but with my GTX1060 6GB i can play mostly on high with some mediums and keep 45-65 fps on 1080p. -NOW THE STORY: One of the best stories that i have ever experienced in a long time. Each and every characters develops throughout the game and you feel connected to them. Your main character, Arthur Morgan...no words. Easily one of Rockstars greatest characters in all their games. During the first hours you will be so bonded with him you wont be able to exit the game. PERFECT CAMPAIGN highly recommended with a solid 60-70 hours gameplay with tons of side missions,stranger meetings,quests,easter eggs,achievements which can keep you busy up to 150 hours more or less.-ONLINE: Its an open world public lobby(no private or invite only) in which you become a cowboy. Good amount of missions,roleplaying which is on point and a lot of stuff to explore such as guns,horses,clothes etc. Its still developing and not on par with gta online but its a different game. Didnt stick to it so much but i will give it some time.OVERALL: This is a game you should play because its a big step up to open world games and offers a lot if you are willing to invest in it. PS I havent played the original RDR so i cant compare them.

author: spedposter
review: Beautiful, very alive world. Probably one of the best games ever made. Unfortunately, online is dead. It didn't make R🤮 enough shekels, so they completely stopped bothering with updates. Still fun with friends just because the world is so well-made and the physics are so good, but it gets boring eventually. If you haven't bought this game yet, I would suggest it, for the singleplayer if nothing else. If you're buying it for the online, wait for a sale.

author: Kordts
review: Had no problems installing and running, previous Rockstar account helped. But the game is broken, super buggy. author: P E R S E U S
review: You love games with a massive, detailed and content filled world with an emphasis on story and characters. You prefer extremely fast paced games and prefer to just rush through them focusing on missions alone.Despite initial criticisms as to the optimization of the game for PC, as far as the latest versions are concerned, Rockstar seems to have finally cracked down on most game breaking bugs and glitches and you should have a pretty pleasant experience with the game now.This game, ladies and gentlemen, is filled to the brim with detail and interesting characters, Rockstar seems to have taken what they learned with RDR 1 and added certain gameplay mechanics to make it even better in RDR 2. Gone are the days when a simple shirt would suffice for our cowboy to make it through snow blizzards and hot humid bayous alike. You didn’t wear warm clothes in the winter? You’ll lose health. You forgot to eat while busy running away from the sheriffs? You’ll lose health. Yes lads and lasses, you have to constantly maintain your character and his inventory to make the best of the game. There’s fishing, hunting, crafting, cooking, the movies, theatre, gambling, drinking, bathing, looting and a heck of a lot more activities to keep you occupied when you don’t want to missions.Another brilliant aspect of the gameplay is the random/chance encounters with people. You’ll be amazed at the detailing and characterization Rockstar has done on these seemingly non-essential NPCs.Rockstar has further polished their RAGE engine for the game which has enhanced things like volumetric lighting, water and foliage quality for the game. If you think GTA V looks gorgeous during sunsets and sunrises wait till you see the amazing vistas of RDR 2. Swamps feel murky, humid and mysterious; the forests feel alive with brilliant lighting, shadows and animals. The major cities definitely feel as they probably did during those times, with the smoke of numerous factories dominating the air and beams of sunlight shining through them. A superb visual atmosphere coupled with brilliant audio work truly makes the game feel alive. Try to run it on high-ultra settings for the best experience.Yes there were criticisms about RDR 2 being not fully optimized for PC users, with many people saying that Rockstar has stopped caring about PC users as the majority of their sales come from console users. I am not here to debate about Rockstar’s business ethics. All I know is that slowly but eventually, Rockstar has managed to deliver a game which in its own right is unparalleled in content and gameplay. Yes it does require a bit of patience to play it as you wander around with your horse but if you love a great story and brilliantly made characters with whom one can resonate, I have only two words for you, 8 months ago i bought this game after saving quite an amount of money, i was truly disappointed when my game didn't even launch even after multiple re-installs and contacting Rockstar support, i refunded it and that was the end of it. (Hence my earlier negative review)Fast forward to a about a couple of months ago, i decided to give it a go again, to my delight I was finally able to play it and lo and behold I was instantly glued to it! Kindly disregard my earlier review!

author: Zwaynegus
review: solid game, great graphics, great story, nice gameplay. It being a rockstar game though there are a couple flaws, for starters as usual the campaign is amazing. The online portion on the other hand might have be born a bit early. Red Dead Online, like Gta online, is primary focused on subtlety making you want to spend money to earn items faster. In my opinion the economy is better in red dead once you start to get things like the trader role maxed out, then money is easy to earn and once you get bounty hunter gold bars aren't a problem either. (the same thing can be said about gta if you get the right business)Although they have reduced payouts of things like daily rewards and hunting since the beta. Another issue can be in the campaign but this is due to rockstars level design. The missions do not blend well with the free roam, they are still similar to the old linear mission designs, this isn't a bad thing but just be warned. Sometimes its nice though to have a heavily scripted satisfying mission thats linear after messing around in the free roam for a while.TLDR,The campaign is definitely worth buying the game for. The online has its moments depending on how you play it, for me the main attraction of online is having a clean slate so you can make up your own story and characters. I will admit though if you have a couple of friends who also have the game just like almost any other online game, no matter how bad, it will still end up being fun because your playing it with friends.

author: Sanjay_2077
review: Excellent story mode but awful multiplayer. Just play the story mode and don't play multiplayer mode because Rockstar is orgasming in strip club in somewhere in GTA V online. They don't care about RDR 2 online. There's only repeated and not so fun content to play and pay to win outlaw pass (Season Pass) in multiplayer. Broken economy, bugs, glitches, frequent game crashing, and modders everywhere. And just like GTA V online this is also peer to peer game so frequent disconnection happens again and again and again... So to summarise my review just play the story and then uninstall the game.

author: bhargavram00798
review: FIRST ISSUE : first thing after downloading the game rockstar launcher fails to install so disable windows defender then after installing launcher again enable windows defenderSECOND ISSUE : some says there are lot of bugs while playing online game apart from that there are no issues with the game i played the whole story mode and it was awesome but it need a strong graphic card  minimum gtx 1060 to run the game that too by lowering some graphic settings still the graphics are crazyif you have any temperature issues with your laptop follow these stepsstep 1 - open control panelstep 2 - open system and securitystep 3 - open power optionsstep 4 -open change plan settings near balance recommendedstep 5 - select processor power managementstep 4 - decrease the maximum power state to 99 or you can decrease upto 70 i decreased upto 70 and my temperatures is not even crossing 70many people already might know it but anyone who dont know it will help

author: crxt
review: Requires the absolute latest GeForce drivers, install of a 3rd party platform outside of Steam. Playing online for 1 day and I already ran into hackers. Being teleported off the map to keep dying over and over, or being set on fire out of nowhere. The same issues existed on GTA 5 for many years and were never addressed. Looks like the same crap again in this game which would otherwise be fun to play.Sometimes you spawn in and your camp is nowhere to be found, sometimes you cannot accept any quests. Sometimes your wheel is locked to items and can't draw or select weapons. Shapiro episode over on your other monitor? Time to switch to Crowder? well good luck tasking out and back in as all the icons will be garbled or replaced with the wrong symbol. All letters will be mangled and be illegible, also messes up poker cards. (Update : Switching to a 3090 seems to not have that issue anymore)Developers still have a lot of work on fixing this game.

author: Thatweirdguy's Hero
review: The game is by far one of the best for graphics ,Story is interesting so far with impressive gameplay  but it still needs a fair bit of patches to optimize the game . Im running on a Ryzen 5 2600 with 16GB 3000 DDR4 and GTX 1070Ti with no SSD , getting a solid 60fps on ultra to high mix setting but it does drop at certain areas even at 1080p so be warned . The Rockstar launcher is the absolute worst thing ever , this game alone can stand on its feet like GTAV pre launcher . I just dont understand why they think its essential to have something that pisses players off . If its not launching for you make sure your game appears on Rockstar launcher with the icon launch from steam . Remove the launcher to compensate us for this horrific 1 month wait. Rockstar you need to fix the random crashing in the game or else this will become a negative review in a months time.If you have a high end build you might get some decent performances without skyrocketing tempertures . For low end gamers please stay away and probably purchase it after it gets some optimization .

author: Marauder
review: Update: Switched from thumbs down to thumbs up, since the crashes and instability has been mostly solved, at least for me. So strong recommendation for the game as of now.Original review before crash/stability was fixed :I am torn. The game itself has enormous potential to be one of my all time favorite games. Storyline, characters and quests are very well written, and the characters seem to be lifelike. The free world is created beautiful, vibrant and full of surprises. But sadly, as it stands, the game is WAY too crash prone for me to really recommend it to anyone... At least for now.On a side note, I really detest that you are made to install Rockstar launcher and create an account to a Rockstar "social club" to be able to play the game, even on single player mode. If I hadn't got the game from a discount, I would have refunded it immediately just on that basis.Game crashing this often combined with quirky "checkpoint" style save system (could be a nice touch to increase immersion), in a game with long unskippable conversations taking part whilst travelling to quest locations will just guarantee frustration.Sometimes game runs smoothly for couple of hours, and sometimes one needs to wrestle with deleting graphics settings files and verifying game files for multiple times to get over it.Hope it gets fixed soon, tho it probably will be too late for me.

author: LumpyGrumpySpaceWhale
review: Attention to detail is great, but the controls on pc are terrible, it is un-optimised on pc (i have a GTX1070 and 16 GB of ram with more than 14GB available at any one time) but i got around that with a somewhat steady 30-40 FPS after tweaking some settings. Im not a PC master race kind of guy i just like to play games but after nearly a decade of 60FPS or higher this is just unacceptable. Especially since i know RDR2 doesnt look nearly as good as it should on PC with my settings (Yes i changed the settings to use DX12). Ill probably keep playing it because of the beckoning of friends to come play Online with them but beyond that, probably not.TLDR;The game is good but runs terribly, controls suck, imo not worth the $90AUD they are charging. not even worth the $70AUD they charge on the 20% off sale they are having right now.Save your money until they really bring the price down.

author: Afgfighter
review: Rockstar raises the bar for graphics yet again.First off, I highly recommend playing this game with a G-Sync compatible monitor. The graphics are extremely demanding and even with the best GPU on the market, you'll barely be hitting 60fps average on 1440p (Ultra settings). G-Sync just makes it look  better and eliminates performance gaps. Secondly, make sure you have your NVIDIA drivers updated to at least version 441.41 to eliminate crashing, stuttering, and launch issues. And finally, don't enable DX12. Currently, it isn't stable and can even prevent your game from launching (the next time you start it).

author: Alluka
review: Honestly i'm not very a big fan of cowboy stuff and i'm not expecting much for the Rdr2 when i bought it.But those all doubt of mine get blown away with this amazing game.The story fairly good with some little minor cons story aspect but that was make the game magicly become so charming with Rockstar style story wise that make me fall in love with Rdr2.the graphic is so stunning and make me can't stop to not get amazed and fall in love with those beauty graphic.every scenery always need to be screen shoot! Every character from the main, side and even npcs its feel so alive and always memorable to be remember along our story.the witness truly is freaking pro stalker xD like really... they always know what we do and report that so fast without we even realize until we notice the bounty hunter appear shocking us.All mission is so freaking fun to do!! beside doing main and side mission, we can also find so much npc and easter egg stuff to do through the game! which make us never bored playing cause we always encounter so much unpredictable thing in our way xD.Even the hunting system its so freaking gorgeous, its feel so detail and really seem like how the real hunter hunt their prey!Hunting slowly and precisely to get your perfect material its sure so challenging and yes it can be stressing.but once we get used how to do and study well the system, we can easily have the most gorgeous clothings for our beloved arthur.This game have a special place in my heart and a few game that rarely can make me feel all those emotions due by how attached i am to this lovely game.even by just only roaming around the map ridding your horse is able to ease my stress and sadness irl.ridding horse while witness the beauty also give a positive vibe and make us feel so chill.I can't stop crying and feel so much emotion inside me play this game until the end..... what a masterpiece indeed.My complain is just for the stable.... there so much beautiful horse in Rdr2 and yet i cant keep much horse in my stable its really make me feel so dillema and sad xD.Also once you get so wealthy, there not much stuff or even a house to buy....so it's kinda feel so weird for having so much money but there nothing stuff to buy since you already bought it all xD. But overall...I'm really happy and content to purchase this amazing game ^^. Can't wait for Rdr3!!!
