author: ItzKen69
review: Overall, a good game with a good story and online mode. Really liked it However did run into a few problems which I would not expect from a triple A title game, such as lag and stuttering. After 1 to 2 hours of fixing and searching, it's all fine now.

author: DatGrunt
review: Wasn't sure if I was going to like this game. It demands a bit from you, pretty much every single action requires input, you need to maintain your weight, hygiene, your clothes, your horse, your camp. Hunting requires you to know what type of weapon to use as well as what type of ammo to use. It can be very overwhelming but if you're the type of person that likes games that take immersion to the next level, this is it. The performance could be better, but the story, the writing, the visuals, the gameplay...it's pretty much world class. If it weren't for the god awful launch and performance this game had, then the ratings would be better. But as far as I'm concerned, it's a good game.

author: Christina
review: When i wrote up and tried to post the review I wrote for this game, steam told me it was "too long". I don't feel like having to edit the whole thing all over again, so here's a link to my full review off-site and an extremely abbreviated version underneath:It's a very pretty game with a lot to explore and a very moving story. It has some technical issues with things like the AI and control interface but they were thankfully never anything game breaking. Overall, a wonderful title that I do recommend.  However, the steam versions also has always-online DRM and makes you install secondary software (rockstar social club) just to play single player. I don't know if the console versions of this game are free of such things, but even if they're not, I'd recommend getting a used copy for consoles so as to not give rockstar money for pulling a sleazy DRM move on their paying customers.

author: y tho
review: Good thing they wrapped such a great western movie around all this middling gameplay. As a game, in the campaign itself? It sucks, it feels like you're playing a shooting gallery from the early 360 era, rockstar has the weirdest fail states you'll see in a game (YOU SCARED THE FISH, You didn't stare long enough in the shootout for rockstar to be pleased with the dramatic tension). The open world stuff is detailed and rich, and nice to poke around. The story and visual design are top of the pile. If they made the mission design kind of exciting, it'd be one of the best games I've ever played but uh, it's bad so RDR2 is just really good.

author: AbdulWasay9
review: Because they have released a Standalone version for Online only, this review will be focusing on Story mode alone because only that is worth playing honestly. Not that pile of hot mess where you grind a mission for 30 minutes over and over againTLDR : =As much as i love this game from all my heart, it breaks me to say that this game gets repetitive. Im not saying the game as a whole is repetitive. but man, The mission design sucks deep.Ride to Point A, Talk to NPC A, Walk with him/her till Point B. *Accidentally* start a GENOCIDE labeled as a shootout. Ride / Run to Point C together. Disband the group, Go back to your Camp / hideout which is Point D.     *Mission Accomplished Screen* Rinse and repeat for 109 MISSIONS. 109 Missions playout the same way as i've explained above.Otherwise its a MasterpieceRDR 2 Summed up. AND......... *I GOT A PLANNNNN.* *ONE MORE SCORE ARTHUR, A BIG ONE. THEN WE'LL BE OFF TO TAHITI*Now the pros : This game never fails to amaze me with its completely rich and detailed world R* has provided us with. I Absolutely love just riding in the swamps, the mountains, plains, cities in different times and weathers because it completely changes the overall feel of the place. The Swamp in Bayou Nwa will completely change if you come around dusk, the fog will be everywhere and it will absolutely blow you away. Come back when its raining and its a different story altogether. Saint Denis gives a different vibe altogether if you come at night, Valentine manages to hit the same feel too.The hunting aspect is really fun, you cant really expect hyper realism at that but again if you shoot a bird with a double barreled shotgun it will obviously Obilterate every meat particle, so you cant expect to get a perfect or good skin after doing that, switching over to a bow will do wonders. The Bounty hunting is actually fun, you have unique missions in that to some extent, sometimes slowing down and trying to stealth kill everyone seems to be the easier part, you cant go guns blazing in every bounty. The Fishing is a fun aspect although i dont like to fish in general in alot of games so i've always skipped over it. but it is fun.They could've focused more on the stats like feeding your horse or taking care of it, like there should've been a mode if you wanted to turn on where if you dont feed your horse properly, it runs away or just dies of starvation, but ive tried not feeding it for weeks and the bad boi still keeps going. same goes for Arthur, you can not feed him for weeks and he'll live. just with a reduced heath and stamina. Either they should've made it hyper realistic or these things should be just cosmetic. not this middle thing. where it affects you slightly but its enough to ignore completely. Huge amount of exploration and replayability is possible if you're willing to do that after the game has finished. not to mention getting 100% is a fun part too. i am also trying to do that currently sitting at 81%.LOVE the ragdoll physics. Its like they ported it straight from GTA IV, and not V which makes crashing your horse on purpose in a tree so much fun.One tip who has read all the way through and wanting to buy the game, DO NOT UPGRADE YOUR GUNS. its just cosmetics and not really worth the money, you are better of buying new guns then upgrading the current ones.Because i used to upgrade my gun and then i would get a newer and better version just by playing the campaign.Rating : 9.25/10. I would've given a complete 10/10 If it had a better mission design but it is what it is.A GEM of a game, A Masterpiece <3*May I? stand unshaken - plays in the background*

author: Nomad13
review: This game is Rockstars's magnum opus! Believe me! These words do not come with poor judgement.I've been a long-time fan of Rockstar's products, since GTA 2 and have purchased every major game of its grandiose fleet such as: Bully, GTA, Manhunt and Red Dead Redemption. It's really inspiring how RED had first come to production with the very first big game incorporating the elements of the Wild West and introducing showdowns and even multiplayer shooting! A very first what-if version of GTA with horses transcending to Red Dead Redemption 2 ! So in general: Graphics: 10/10Gameplay: 8/10Story: 100/10Music: 10/10Game Design: 10/10This game could have won game of the year in 2018 -EASILY- if it had a little bit polished combat...  The story is probably the best I've ever seen in a while. Tearful moments and larger than life characters that give this feeling that you really invested on their struggles and got to know them and really be a part of their life. Mesmerizing graphics overall and really really huge amount of content! Gotta be neck to neck with TESV: Skyrim and Witcher 3 in terms of replayability and personal investment! Thank you Rockstar ! Now stop milking GTA Online and give us GTA VI in the near future!

I even bought it again for pc but that was mostly because my wife took the ps4 when she left me. she also took the kids but that has nothing to do with this review. back then, i had been playing this game so much that i started to see the wild west in my dreams. if you're like me and not normally that interested in westerns, give it a try, it might change your mind

author: mmetully
review: Online mode is rife with hackers ruining the experience.Every time I play with my partner some hacker is making some random person kill me and me kill other random people.Every. Time. I. Play.This game is too high risk low reward without this nonsense.

It took me some time following the online disaster that was GTA5 before I reluctantly decided to give RD2 a try. To its credit I thoroughly enjoyed the single player experience.... but thats where things began to go wrong. I started playing online. There wasnt a single game where hackers would teleport me around like a rag doll or spawn in all sorts weapons. Most times people were unable to be killed at all. At this point, I resigned to the fact that RD2 online was as bad or worse than GTA5. I awoke one day to an email from Rockstar telling me that my account violated their terms and conditions and that my account was suspended for 30 days and my progression reset. Disappointment is an UNDERSTATEMENT. Hackers roam this game with impunity doing whatever they want and innocent accounts are banned as a result. I obviously cannot recommend this game and I can no longer recommend Rockstar as a developer.

author: MrDontCare
review: It's a wonderful game with great graphic. So it is just GTA but western style. It was working ok, got the ERR_GFX_STATE once or twice, now it just wont start. Only getting the ERR_GFX_STATE all the time when it's about to loade the start the game. For what I payed it just not worth the struggle at all. but when it works it NOT GREAT, it's just ok no more than that.I have tried all solutions I could find online but no help. To add -ignorepipelinecache worked for one day and when back to not working. So from me it's a big mehOne more thing, the slow walking in camp and so on is SO IRRITATING.Let us move fast anywhere we want.

author: R2zi3l
review: Well well I thought the beta testers on Epic and RL may have helped them fixed any issues but no I couldn't even get into the game until I realized that keeping the controller attached while launching the game was crashing it! Edit:- After playing a 100+ hours more after writing the review and on steam's continued  insistence, I definitely want to add that this is a great game! Its one of the best games I ever played period.If you thought GTAV was good then this is better at least in the Singleplayer Storytelling and writing department. GTAV may have more side activities that can be termed 'fun' but that is because of the Urban setting of that game. In this game, they obviously have to limit themselves to variations on Banditry, Hunting, Fishing etc because of the time period and setting. Still GTAV goes more for whackyness whereas this game, tries to tell a more serious and sombre tale about Arthur Morgan and his gang of Outlaws.The problem still is the port, Its infuriating that they take an extra year after the console release (without even announcing a PC port) and then after a year, go to Epic for a month and then release on Steam and the game is still not in a perfect or a near perfect state!!!I told you about the controller issue but there are other big and small imperfections too and it really depends on the person if they are acceptable to them or not.Also the lengths to which this company is willing to go to maximise their profits (making some idiots buy twice, once on console and again on PC by not announcing PC port and delaying it, Epic exclusivity AND a super Pay2Win online mode both in this game and GTAV) and then not even bothering to put in the effort to make sure their game runs fine on Nvidia cards or not at all on many systems is just next level ♥♥♥♥♥♥!!You may have heard this game is a hardware killer but no its only a killer of Nvidia hardware. It runs much better on AMD graphics cards which however are still a smaller minority in the PC market despite AMD becoming quite strong against both Intel and Nvidia. Go look at some benchmarks for this game if you don't believe me. Just type in Red Dead Redemption 2 PC benchmarks and watch a couple of videos or visit a website. You will see for yourself how Rockstar didn't bother to put in the effort to optimise for Nvidia's architechture (both pascal, the 10xx series and turing, 20xx and 16xx series cards) which they know very well is still used by a majority of PC gamers!Rockstar/Taketwo is definitely EA level ♥♥♥♥♥♥ in my book now because of all the greed they display and their continued Anti-PC stance since many years.Hopefully this is the last time I give them any money!Specs: Ryzen7 2700x CPU16Gb RAMZotac 2060 GPU

author: Mikjaash
review: 9.5/10 - Only lacking proper optimizationGame is solid. It's probably the most detailed game I've ever played. The attention to detail is mind-boggling. I have never played a game quite like this. It feels like every location, every item, every interaction has been carefully crafted so that you can't mess anything up. The game is a piece of art. It also looks absolutely amazing. I'm only playing it on medium, but it still looks amazing. I wish I could up the settings a bit, but the optimization is way too bad for that. Which is a bit of a letdown since GTA V's optimization was incredible. Be wary of this if you have a low-to-mid range PC.If the optimization was better (Akin to GTA V's, which could run on a toaster), then the game would be a solid 10/10.

author: Axeploseph
review: Wow... I bought this game because I wanted to be a cowboy and duh, Rockstar made it.I played about 15 hours of just being a cowboy and not playing the story before putting it down for something else.I came back excited to dive into it, but wanted to finish it before New World launched so my focus switched primarily to the narrative and what I found... wow... I was not prepared for that. Rockstar did a phenomenal job in getting me to care about the characters in this game and getting me to feel more emotional about a game than I remember in quite a while. This world is a world I could genuinely lose myself in for countless hours.The fact is I compare this game to The Witcher 3 (100% completion in 184 hours) for my favorite game of all time while barely scratching the surface in my first playthrough. Yeah, this game is amazing and I will definitely be prioritizing a second playthrough in my enormous backlog.

author: Fuck Lord of the Moon
review: I spent my last penny on a fox-skin hat. 11/10 GOTY.All jokes aside, this game is phenomenal to play. Unexpectedly deep characterisation, lots of fun things to see and do, compelling narrative and, as an aside, a surprisingly detailed and engaging hunting mechanic that's somehow leagues better than most hunting simulator games. Unexpected, but delightful.My particular favourite touch is the bonding mechanic you have with your horses, and the horses behaving like actual flesh-and-blood horses, and not like, say, a peculiarly-reskinned car; just like you yourself, your horses must be fed, rested, kept in a basic state of hygiene, and given medicine when required. My only wish is that the stables were not so limited-- four stabled horses is not enough, I tell you.Let me collect all the horses, Rockstar, you cowards.

author: Alphα Vulgαris
review: I remember playing through the first RDR several times. I loved it, and still do. I was very excited when I heard that RDR2 would come out on PC but man... what a thorough disappointment it is.The game looks nice, runs awfully and is way too long, but that's all secondary to the big complaint I have about the game. This is the most constricting game I've ever played. In almost all missions, you're accompanied by one or several NPCs, and it's almost like it was designed to limit the things you can do. They will keep yelling the same dialogue, and urge you on to complete the mission in a completely linear and unimaginative way. About 90% of the gameplay consists of glorified QTEs, walking around slowly and listening to dialogue and basically turret sections, where you're riding a horse on a very specific path and shooting at enemies spawning all around you. The linearity of the missions would be funny if it wasn't annoying. The game will force you to hold a button and basically just watch a cutscene play out, as in, you're walking somewhere, but you can't even walk left or right, you can only hold W. What's the point of dialogue prompts if there's only one choice of dialogue, and if you don't press the button, your character will just say it anyway. Hunting, fishing, collecting herbs, it's all horribly slow and made to waste your time, and the new 'survival-like' mechanics like hunger seem pointless and are probably just made for multiplayer, to force you to spend real money on microtransactions. The interface is also bad, to get from cooking a meal to walking again, I have to press F to stop cooking, then backspace to leave the crafting menu, and then escape or something to leave the camp, it's just dumb. There's more characters in the game than in RDR1, but they're all shallow and mostly just obnoxious. I didn't care for any of them honestly, and it even made me care less about John Marston (the protagonist of RDR1).That basically sums the whole game up, a dumb waste of time. Quantity over quality. For the last 40 hours of it I just hoped it would end already.

author: Iron_Skin
review: Game will not run for me. Same issue as everyone else. "Unexpected crash" or "failed to launch. Check game cache" when trying to launch the game with the Rockstar Launcher. I would not recommend that anyone buy this game and take the gamble that it will not launch. I stopped trying to get it to work after 4 hours of troubleshooting and nearly 2 hours of "game play time". I do not want to exceed the 2hr barrier so that I still have the option of refunding this game. I will change my review to positive, as I know for a fact that the content is good, once the launcher issue gets resolved.C'mon R* this is beneath you.Addendum:I finally got the game to work a week later after more troubleshooting and nearly 2 hours of "play time". However I will not be changing my review as I should not have had to do any of that after paying $60 for a AAA game.The game itself is a masterpiece.I got the game to work by doing the following:This issue could be caused by any programs that are running in the background.This can be fixed by following the below-given steps:Disable/shut down all unnecessary programs.Type “MSConfig” in the Cortana Search Box and then click on System ConfigurationOn the Services tab of the System Configuration dialog box, tap or click to select the Hide allMicrosoft services check box, uncheck “Rockstar Games Library Services” from the list and then tap or click Disable all.On the Startup tab of the System Configuration dialog box, tap or click Open Task Manager.On the Startup tab in Task Manager, for each startup item, select the item and then click Disable.Close Task Manager.On the Startup tab of the System Configuration dialog box, tap or click OK, and then restart the computer.

author: ThePHiLsTeR [¬º-°]¬
review: Red Dead Redemption 2 (RDR2) is a masterpiece that has an amazing, gritty, and emotional story. Playing RDR2 is nothing short of an adventure, and a cowboy one at that! The environments are absolutely beautiful. Characters have realistic facial expressions and flawless voice acting that has won awards. You play a member of a gang of outlaws and gameplay consists of robbing trains and banks, escaping lawmen, bar fights, and fire fights with rival gangs.*No Spoilers* RDR2 has an emotional story that has brought many people to tears. It is the prequal to Red Dead Redemption 1 and will be an absolute treat and fan fare to fans of the first game. Although veteran players will appreciate small details referring to the first game and its characters, newcomers will have a unique perspective. Newcomers will have a blank slate and major story developments will shock and surprise while veterans will already know some major things that will happen and the overall direction of the game. Since RDR2 is a prequal, playing the first game is not required to fully enjoy RDR2. That being said watching a video synopsis on the first game after beating RDR2 may be worthwhile.You’re a rootin’ tootin’ cowboy and outlaw who should never ever travel without his cowboy hat. RDR2 is a third-person shootin’ adventure. You’ll be using the guns and equipment of 1899 which include dual revolvers, repeaters, rifles, double barrel shotguns, and lassos. There is a “dead eye” mechanic where you slow time, mark enemies, and shoot. This is especially handy when you’re heavily outnumbered, saving a fellow gang member whose held hostage, or trying to take out a fast-moving enemy on horseback or predatory animal.There are many mission types which include infiltrating a rival gang’s base, robbing a train or bank, saving a gang member from captivity, escaping law enforcement, hunting an animal, capturing an enemy, bounty hunting, gathering intel, and vandalism. Some segments require stealth by moving while crouching and using silent weapons such as bows or throwing knives, but most segments you’re the quintessential rootin’ tootin’ cowboy cappin’ fellas firing dual revolvers from the hip. To add to the drama things can go really wrong making some missions hectic but in a good way.Rockstar focused heavily on realism in RDR2. Guns get dirty and need periodical cleaning. Rockstar, however, went the extra mile and your character and horse get dirty as well and require cleaning. Your horse can be called by whistling to it, but only if it is in range. To increase your horse’s health and stamina, food and attention (by periodically patting it and cleaning it) will be required. It can also permanently die if you don’t heal it in time after taking mortal damage. Eating food is required which can be bought at the shop, but the most satiating food, cooked game meat, takes time to cook. Concocting special tonics and items from ingredients require time. RDR2 is overall a slow-paced game.An optional part of the gameplay includes hunting and fishing. Animals come in different qualities from poor to perfect and will net differing amounts of money. Hunting, though optional, will be required to make special items from animal parts. For example, making a volatile dynamite (which has increased damage radius of a regular dynamite) will require a regular dynamite and animal fat while a dynamite arrow will require a regular dynamite, an arrow, and a bird feather. These types of items I found unnecessary but worthwhile and enhanced the gameplay. Animal parts are also required to upgrade your satchel which has a limited inventory space. The default satchel will certainly get you through single player but the extra space is nice. Animal skins can make nice clothing for your character and decorations for your base.RDR2 has an honor system where you can play dishonorably or honorably. Your level of honor will affect how others treat you and some outcomes of the story. With high honor, NPCs will treat you nicely and shops will give you discounts. While negative honor will net more money when looting the dead and allow you to shoot up enemies and civilians with little remorse.RDR2’s world crosses a pretty large map which will take about 30 minutes to travel from one side to the other by horseback. It sports a variety of different landscapes from frosty mountains, swamps, small towns, deserts, and an upscale city. The wild environments are what you’d expect a landscape relatively untouched by humans would be with treacherous mountains, narrow trails, creeks, and caves. Wildlife are littered throughout and include everything from squirrels, rabbits, raccoons, snakes, and deer to wolves, bears, and cougars, and much much more.RDR2’s landscapes I describe most accurately as a moving painting. It is especially beautiful at night when the moon’s light reflects off every blade of grass, tree, and lake. While riding, you can see all the distinct muscles on your horse and its mane eloquently moving with the wind and each tread. In the snowy mountains, you can see all the snowy mist flying through the air, and the incredibly realistic tracks in the snow made by your horse, feet, and other animals.  You can see the water vapor as it condenses out of each character’s mouth as they breathe. Characters and NPCs move realistically with realistic facial and bodily expressions. It is akin to a movie with superb actors immersing you into its world.I have nothing bad to say about the sound nor anything amazing, except that it serves its purpose. The music captures the wild west and an adventurous tone. Notable music plays during the story’s most emotional moments and those impacted will forever associate the events that transpire and the songs that coincide. For players of the first game, RDR2’s music is in my opinion slower and calmer, while RDR1’s music is more exhilarating.The crashes sadly are what’s stopping people from buying the steam version and the cause of mixed reviews. Troubleshooting the game might require disabling anti-virus, tweaking settings, updating graphics drivers, running the game as administrator, and more. And even then, the game might still crash and the best you can do is limit the crashing but never completely solve the problem. It is such a shame because RDR2 is truly a gem of a game and I’m sure its crashes have soured many people’s experiences.Red Dead Redemption 2 is worth every penny at the full price of $60 and offers potentially hundreds of hours of content or at the minimum 50 hours in single player not counting the extras. However, it should come with a buyer-beware tag as players can experience crashing anywhere from none to an unbearable amount.

author: iSADEGHIAN
review: Few people have not heard the name Rockstar Games and do not know the famous and powerful works of this powerful company. This creative creator has received the Best Game of the Year award from various events for his various games. One of the most popular Rockstar game series is the Red Dead series, the second version of which, Read Dead Redemption, was selected as the best game of the year in 2010. The game also became one of the best-selling games of the seventh generation and became one of the most successful Rockstar creations.After a long wait of 8 years, the next version of this game called Read Dead Redemption 2 has been released, which can be considered one of the best games of the generation. The game offers players a free world in Western and Wild West times, and with its unique gameplay, it has attracted countless players. Read Dead Redemption 2 in action-adventure style and can be experienced in two third-person and first-person cameras.

author: Takoe
review: Can't speak much for the campaign but I have found the attempts to monetize the online mode pretty egregious. In order to actually start making money in the professions, you have to grind for gold. However, the rate of that you get gold at is painfully slow as to encourage you to spend real money to purchase the gold outright from the rockstar store. Furthermore, after grinding for cash and gold, endgame purchases tantamount to clothing (which is extremely expensive), shinier guns, and slightly faster horses. Essentially, the same gameplay you have had the whole time just reskinned, which I do not consider worth the massive amount of effort required. I cannot speak for the new moonshiners update but I have not been incentivized to even bother because of the amount of grinding I presume is needed.Would not recommend to anyone who is coming from GTA V and expecting a similar online experience, but hey, at least its really pretty.Wish I could get a refund lol

author: afk first responder from uvalde
review: i watch kongfu movies and western movies when growing up. there was a rich lady named Mrs. Yi that had a tv. she was the only one with tv in our town. we all go there after school to watch the western movies. very cool cowboys with white skin used guns to kill bad guys. one time i watched a similar movie directed by tarantino. this time it was a cool cowboy with black skin. they are all very cool. it was exciting to play this game and feel like one of those cowboys. made me think back to my childhood when we all wait for the school to end to go to Mrs. Yi's house to watch TV. Mrs. Yi was very kind. gave all of us delicious barley tea and dumplings. she later died peacefully of old age as many older people do in china because of our good healthy lifestyle. eating bokchoy has many health benefits. we drink good tea too. game made me think deep and made me tear up. but i like dota 2 better because i like competitive games more than single player story mode. i also like that they named the game "RED" dead redemption. red is color of china. very cool. probably not coincidence.

author: darthbeanx
review: This game is truly a masterpiece in all ways, gameplay is very addictive, I spent almost the whole game riding my dear Fido and Fidito across the map, I didn't use fast travel because the game deserves to be explored and seen, the RDR's world is huge, a lot of landscapes and pretty woods, in the desert you feel like you're in an actual desert, this game is so immersive, it's full of details that gives you even more immersive gameplay. The Gang of Dutch has people to remember, my favorites were Charles, Uncle (almost the times), Sadie (ily <3), John's Family, Sean and Kieran, those characters have a special place in my heart <3. Through the game you can see how Arthur is more skeptical about Dutch decisions, making 2 sub-bands, but all this carries to Arthur's Redemption. I love this game from beginning to end, it's almost perfect, it has some bugs like any other game, but I didn't pay attention to them. You gotta play this game if you like the cowboy era, 9.8/10, I didn't give the ten because I had some problems with the Rockstar launcher. I love you Arthur Morgan, you're one of my favorite main characters and you will always have a special place in my heart. One of my favorite games ever.

author: Qain
review: Ohhh this is a tricky one.....TL;DR: This is the gaming equivalent of tantric sex, if tantric sex lasted 65 hours and had a 45hr foreplay session.Red Dead Redemption 2 is, in and of itself, a huge undertaking by the guys from Rockstar; i'd even dare to say it's their Magnum Opus in terms of scope, while attempting to deliver a story focused game within the systems of an open world game much like GTA V, but with a much serious tone to it.Let's start with the graphics. The game is absolutely stunning. If it weren't for some particular environments, i'd say the game appears to be raytraced, because DAMN the lightning in this game is just stellar. It's hard to give off the feeling of a dimly lit campfire while singing with friends in a densely fogged up swamp, but these guys managed to do so beautifully. It helps a lot that the team has pushed the engine to its (current) limits to achieve so, which means crushing performance when pushed higher than "console settings". Suffice it to say that pushing the game to its absolute ultra setting is still a hard thing to achieve even with current hardware. The sound is thankfully there to accompany the visual experience, and other than some specific characters who feel a bit forced, their performances really do sell their distinct personalities.The story of the game is not something easy to judge however, for several reasons...The game transports the player back to 1899, to a time when the wild west was nearly tamed by industrialization and the dawn of a new civilization. Younger people learnt the ropes and adapted to the new times, but old dogs just couldn't learn new tricks, as the saying goes. Among them we have Arthur Morgan, member of a gang of outlaws who are constantly running from the consequences of their stealing and murdering, but also of the new civilization which constantly pushes them aside. Of course throughout the game *stuff* happens and suddenly the plot thickens to one of betrayal, love, old age, fraternity and more violence, and this is where we need to put a big asterisk...The story in and of itself is.... nothing short of brilliant, at least in its conclusion; but the path to its conclusion is so diluted through time that it's very difficult to actually CARE about it for a minute. For starters, the first half of the story feels like Groundhog Day, with one of the main characters just repeating something as if it were a mantra which, in the beginning hypes up the player of this majorly eventful situation that simply never happens. Later on, the story unfolds beautifully, but that comes after me forcing myself to play sessions of an hour or two of gaming. Worst thing is that I don't think this is a problem of the story missions themselves but rather the road that leads to them....See, the game is set in a rather large world, maybe smaller than the one in GTA V sure, but big nonetheless. The problem is that, in between certain points of interest, there is a vast nothingness that just.... needs to be traversed. Sure there are sidequests and activities to do in between, but the time they detract from the travelling from one point to the other makes them pointless unless you are one of those completionists. Personally, I tend to complete them as they come, but in this particular game, they posed absolutely nothing for me to gain, and only made me waste time. In the end, they, together with the travelling itself, became a padding that, if removed, would most likely shave off a few hours of time.It doesn't help that the shooting mechanics, while working great, are matched to a shooting STRUCTURE that reminds me of these old western movies where enemies would just come out of the woodwork and become cannon fodder. I mean sure, it fits the game but... is it fun? The beats of every single mission are so predictable you'll see yourself pre-aiming your dual wield revolvers. What doesn't help either is the myriad of systems Rockstar has implemented. From horse's balls shrinking when its cold to a tracking system, foraging system, character progression system, beard and hair growing through time, weight system, horse relationship system, dynamic weather system, weapon maintenance, ammunition creation, all paired up with their own animations. This sounds absolutely mind-blowing, if not for the fact that, coupled with the enormous padding of the travelling and long winded story, it would almost seem that Rockstar just dove right in a journey of self-indulgence, as if it's asking you to stop and gawk at how everything works together..... I mean sure, great the game is screenshot worthy and everything works incredibly well for a game of this scope but.... what's the point? To stall for time?Anyways, I've ranted enough, let's get this over with....Is the game worth it? If you find a discount on it over here, I'd say yes.Just bare in mind, it's not a fast game, it's repetitive, it can get tiring and it's pretty to look at and listen to, but once you reach a certain point in the game, the story draws you in like no other to a beautifully crafted series of endings.

author: Mr. Starguy
review: Graphics are completely fantastic, gameplay is both smooth and enjoyable.  Story is really above average and they added a lot of fun new mechanics and distractions/diversions.  I've only thrown 10 hours into this game (as of this review) and i've thoroughly enjoyed my time so far.  Looking forward to throwing in another 100 hours and going for the achievements. My only gripe so far maybe is that if you don't have a beast of a PC, it may no run great.  I had to downgrade from 1440p to 1080p in order to run the game with maxed out graphics, but the 1080p downgrade isn't a super big jump down from 1440p, and I'd rather have the higher graphics fidelity+framerate over the higher resolution+lower framerate.   All things considered, I'd give this game at least an 8 out of 10, if you have a very strong computer definitely a 10/10 worth playing with everything maxed out.

author: Ramen Bellic
review: "Red Dead Redemption 2" is a masterpiece of a game, with an incredible campaign that offers one of the most immersive and captivating storytelling experiences of any game in recent memory. The game is stunningly beautiful, with an enormous world that is incredibly detailed, and packed with content.The story is gripping and emotionally charged, with characters that are well-developed and memorable. The game's themes of morality, loyalty, and redemption are explored in depth, making for a truly immersive and thought-provoking experience.The gameplay is also fantastic, with tight controls and a variety of activities to engage in. The game's open-world design allows for a great deal of exploration and freedom, with plenty of side missions and activities to keep players engaged for hours on end.However, the game's online multiplayer component is a significant disappointment. The multiplayer mode lacks the depth and immersion of the single-player campaign, with a lackluster progression system and limited content. The game's microtransaction system is also a major drawback, allowing players to pay real money for in-game items and advantages.Overall, "Red Dead Redemption 2" is an incredible game that is well worth playing for the single-player campaign alone. The game's storytelling, world-building, and gameplay are all top-notch, providing an immersive and unforgettable experience. However, the game's multiplayer mode falls short and is not recommended for players looking for a robust online experience.

author: SypieX
review: Red Dead Redemption 2 is an incredible game that truly immerses you in its stunning world. From the breathtaking landscapes to the detailed character models, everything about this game is beautifully crafted and expertly executed.One of the standout features of Red Dead Redemption 2 is its story, which is richly layered and engaging from start to finish. The game's characters are complex and nuanced, with each one feeling like a fully realized person rather than a one-dimensional caricature.The gameplay is also top-notch, with a range of activities to engage in that will keep you coming back for more. Whether you're exploring the wilderness, hunting for game, or engaging in thrilling shootouts, Red Dead Redemption 2 offers a level of depth and variety that is unmatched by most other games.But what truly sets Red Dead Redemption 2 apart is its attention to detail. From the way that characters interact with one another to the way that the environment reacts to your actions, everything in this game feels painstakingly crafted and meticulously thought out.All in all, Red Dead Redemption 2 is an absolute masterpiece of a game that is sure to keep you captivated for hours on end. If you're a fan of immersive storytelling, gorgeous visuals, and engaging gameplay, then this is a game that you absolutely need to check out. Highly recommended!

author: Z4ckZ3r0
review: Everything about this game on the surface appears to exude excellence - the visuals, art style, setting, narrative, audio - I could go on forever about how great all of that is. And everyone knows, Rockstar is one of the best in the business when it comes to providing a single-player experience that is unparalleled in it's ability to immerse the user, and not many studios can say they've managed to expand that single-player story into a multi-player experience. While multiplayer is not personally for me, I can see why people are willing to pour money into both Red Dead Online and GTA V Online.The main reason why I do not recommend Red Dead Redemption 2 is not because of the quality of the game at all, but because of the lack of attention that goes into the holistic product.This game repeatedly crashes at exactly the same spot in the opening sequence for me, which renders it unplayable. Just as I'm about to enter a cabin about 10 minutes into the game, I get an error, "ERR_GFX_STATE", with the only thing I can do is to exit and re-open the game. The "fix" is extremely ridiculous, requiring the user to manually delete game Vulkan files, and to start and stop the in-game benchmark. This game has been out for years, and this is a known issue - why hasn't this been resolved?There is intrusive always-online DRM which runs with the game, Rockstar Social Club. Why do I need to make a Rockstar account if I just want to play in single-player mode? Why does my game need to constantly remain connected to the internet? Just authenticate my license at boot, and that should be enough.I would love for Rockstar to apply the care and attention for the product that they do for the writing and direction, but it seems the people in charge have no interest in improving the experience for the players.

author: pinkaros
review: Red Dead Redemption 2 is a stunning achievement in open-world design and storytelling. The world is vast and alive, with breathtaking vistas, dynamic weather, and a cast of memorable characters. The attention to detail is unparalleled, with every aspect of the game feeling authentic to the time period.The gameplay is equally impressive, with a variety of activities to keep you occupied for hours on end. The gunplay is tight and satisfying, and the horseback riding is a joy. The story is epic in scope, with complex characters and tough moral choices that will keep you engaged throughout the game.Overall, Red Dead Redemption 2 is a must-play for fans of open-world games. The visuals are stunning, the gameplay is top-notch, and the story is one of the best in recent memory. Do not miss out on this incredible experience.

author: portstorm
review: #Buyer Beware# This game has very poor PC compatibility.  I have an 18 month old Alienware PC w/ a G-Force 2070 Max (16G ram), an Intel Core 9750 and 32GB of system Ram.  The game runs horribly choppy with the inbuilt render (it helps to change to Direct-X 12 which isn't documented anywhere in their support forums) and regularly Crashes from being "Out of Resources" (even though I cut the resolution to 1080p and 'Low' textures etc).  This purpose built gaming PC plays almost any game flawlessly, I haven't seen a game this poorly ported to PC in years.  It's nearly unplayable.  There are thousands of forum posts around the internet of people struggling to make the game run, have decent video performance and not crash.  Rockstar should fix this or stop selling it for PC.

author: RiceWrap
review: Red Dead Redemption 2 is a top-notch game that offers players an immersive and engaging experience set in the American Old West. Developed by Rockstar Games, the game is the highly anticipated sequel to the 2010 game Red Dead Redemption and was released in October 2018 for PlayStation 4 and Xbox One.The game is set in a fictionalized version of the American Old West, and follows the story of Arthur Morgan, a member of the Van der Linde gang. As the game progresses, players will follow Arthur as he navigates the world of the Wild West and tries to survive as the age of outlaws comes to an end.One of the standout features of Red Dead Redemption 2 is its vast open world, which is filled with a variety of locations to explore and characters to interact with. The world is super detailed, with bustling cities, vast forests, and rolling hills all rendered in stunning graphics. The game's attention to detail extends to its characters, who are all well-developed and have their own unique personalities and motivations. Players will have the chance to form relationships with these characters and even make choices that will impact the course of the story.In addition to the main story, the game also features a variety of side quests and activities for players to engage in. These range from hunting and fishing to collecting items and playing mini-games such as poker, blackjack, and five finger fillet. The game also has a robust set of mechanics, including a detailed combat system and a character progression system that allows players to tailor Arthur's abilities to their play style.Red Dead Redemption 2 is a game that truly immerses players in the world of the American Old West. The game's stunning graphics and attention to detail make it feel like you're truly living in the Wild West, and the engaging story and well-developed characters make it easy to become invested in the game. Whether you're a fan of the original game or are just looking for a new adventure to dive into, Red Dead Redemption 2 is a must-play. It's a top-notch game that offers hours of entertainment and a truly immersive experience.

author: EerieCosmos
review: Man, this is by far the best game I've played in ages, and I'm upset at myself for not buying it years ago. If you are looking for a story-rich adventure game, this is definitely a must-play. NPCS have lots of dialogue- even after hundreds of hours playing I still feel immersed in the game. PC controls were intuitive and easy to learn. The graphics and animations are beautiful and ran smoothly. The puzzles and treasure maps you run into aren't *too* difficult to solve- do yourself a favor and don't spoil things for yourself!Captions on this game are good overall. There were a handful of points where the text did not match what was being said, but it did not happen frequently. (If you use captions, I'd highly recommend turning on "Speaker Name." It makes the story line much easier to follow, especially if you have difficulty hearing.)

author: aswn
review: This game exceeded all expectation for me.. the story, gameplay, graphics, voice acting were all top notch… It did feel a little slow at start but the story picked up exceptionally well, also most of the slowness was because of the thousand little animation that each action has.. like each time you ‘fast travel’ you have to sit through a thirty sec glorified cut scene that you can’t skip.. but I suppose it all adds to the immersive narrative that they’re trying to set..As for RDO, only played it for a day and I’ve already got dynamite arrowed and set on fire by ghosts / invisible players and saw what looked like a battleship clipping through the desert (definitely didn’t look like it belonged in the land or in the game).. but it was fun, there were some friendlies who just waved when passing by (all the vc users I’ve run into so far spoke foreign languages).. loved the character customisation, probably spent an hour on that alone.. made it to level 9 on day 1 and would probably keep playing

author: 33shin33
review: I've been playing this game for 112.0hrs these last two weeks, there will come a day I will reflect how Read Dead Redemption is important to me. I'll start by saying this game is slow, I'm 120 hours in and I've not completed the main story yet, as a matter of fact I am not even close. The feeling of "I've barely scratched the surface yet" really punches you in the face for at least 20 or 30 hours, even more. Red Dead Redemption 2 is Mind-bogglingly beautiful, the game is so aesthetically pleasant it's impressive, like I've never seen in any other game. NPCs feel like they are alive, so much so as of right now I would crank it in my book as the best game of all time. Back then when we 'was' a little boy we used to equip Link with a bow and ride a horse called "Epona", it revolutionized gaming as we knew it and this game right here is one of the blessings of results we could potentially have almost three decades later. The amount of work people have put into crafting Red Dead Redemption II is shocking. Strawberry a small town inside the game is the most beautiful city of the entire gaming history and it's not even close to the second place, which we could argue it is inside this game as well.     You're really buying an experience, feel it, don't rush it, dive in it. Is this worth it? Yes, easiest yes of my entire life. Is it worth to buy a whole rig to then be able to play this? Yes, I can say it now it was worth it every penny. Thank you for reading. 25th October 2022 Review.

author: Walter White
review: My name is Walter Hartwell White. I live at 308 Negra Arroyo Lane, Albuquerque, New Mexico, 87104. This is my confession. If you're watching this tape, I'm probably dead, murdered by my brother-in-law Hank Schrader. Hank has been building a meth empire for over a year now and using me as his chemist. Shortly after my 50th birthday, Hank came to me with a rather, shocking proposition. He asked that I use my chemistry knowledge to cook methamphetamine, which he would then sell using his connections in the drug world. Connections that he made through his career with the DEA. I was... astounded, I... I always thought that Hank was a very moral man and I was... thrown, confused, but I was also particularly vulnerable at the time, something he knew and took advantage of. I was reeling from a cancer diagnosis that was poised to bankrupt my family. Hank took me on a ride along, and showed me just how much money even a small meth operation could make. And I was weak. I didn't want my family to go into financial ruin so I agreed. Every day, I think back at that moment with regret. I quickly realized that I was in way over my head, and Hank had a partner, a man named Gustavo Fring, a businessman. Hank essentially sold me into servitude to this man, and when I tried to quit, Fring threatened my family. I didn't know where to turn.Eventually, Hank and Fring had a falling out. From what I can gather, Hank was always pushing for a greater share of the business, to which Fring flatly refused to give him, and things escalated. Fring was able to arrange, uh I guess I guess you call it a "hit" on my brother-in-law, and failed, but Hank was seriously injured, and I wound up paying his medical bills which amounted to a little over $177,000. Upon recovery, Hank was bent on revenge, working with a man named Hector Salamanca, he plotted to kill Fring, and did so. In fact, the bomb that he used was built by me, and he gave me no option in it. I have often contemplated suicide, but I'm a coward. I wanted to go to the police, but I was frightened. Hank had risen in the ranks to become the head of the Albuquerque DEA, and about that time, to keep me in line, he took my children from me. For 3 months he kept them. My wife, who up until that point, had no idea of my criminal activities, was horrified to learn what I had done, why Hank had taken our children. We were scared. I was in Hell, I hated myself for what I had brought upon my family. Recently, I tried once again to quit, to end this nightmare, and in response, he gave me this. I can't take this anymore. I live in fear every day that Hank will kill me, or worse, hurt my family. I... All I could think to do was to make this video in hope that the world will finally see this man, for what he really is.

author: Blue Velvet
review: Red Dead Redemption 2 more than lives up to its reputation as a perfect game. A flawless example of video games as an art form, with stunning vistas to look at in awe, a captivating narrative that rivals the best films ever made, and unforgettable moments that will have you sipping your whiskey lost in thought.As a massive fan of the western genre, it hits all the right spots, with a slower paced story that builds up, giving time for character development and for attachments to form. The gameplay doesn't let down either with every moment being a joy, whether its getting in gunfights that feel straight out of something Clint Eastwood or John Wayne would get into, hunting down big game to make money selling hides, or simply exploring the vast open world and seeing what I can find. I almost never used fast travel, as every second on the road with my horse was another second I could appreciate the beauty of this game. Cannot recommend enough. Do yourself a favour and set aside the time to play this perfect work of art. 10/10

author: Z-sama
review: One of the best games I have played (after The Witcher triology). A couple of advises for the beginners without spoiler.When you begin the game first thing to do to buy every Health Items for yourself and for your horse. Always better to be prepared than be sorry. Take your time in Chapter 2 and 3 and focus on upgrading your camp fully.Do not be afraid of spending your money you are going to earn more than you need. Instead of buying a saddle, hunt a Bear with Perfect Pelt and craft the saddle (Bear Dakota Saddle) in the Trapper. But if you want to buy you can buy The Gerden Trail Saddle or Gerden Vaquero Saddle (Improved). Improve your saddle bag.I know that at some point in your game you are gonna want to ride a Shire.. okay enjoy your Shire but change it to a Race horse whenever possible (You don't need to buy a horse until Chapter 4, you can find / loot / steal the horse) Although Shires look magestic they are not fast or strong enough to ride farer withough letting them rest. Doing camp chores will give you + Honour and Dead Eye.Press Alt to learn your location / hour / bounty on your headPress J for your journal and L for missions. When you have a perfect pelt on your horse - do not die. Either give the pelt to Pearson or sell to the Trapper asap. Do not go to missions with your perfect pelt.If you lose your Legendery Animal pelt, no worries, your pelt is safe in the Trapper.Good luck.

They didnt only make a great story, but they also hid so many small details every where. There are so many people you can meet and talk to. i also found it very fun to just take photos of the in game nature. I 100% recomend this game.

author: lisanicolas366
review: Masterpiece. It was my favorite game for a long time! I know it says I have less than 30 hours on it, but I played for almost 500 hours on PS4, and there's a very good reason for that. The story is truly the best story from any game, movie, book or series I've seen. Please, if you haven't played it, do. And also, the game is just pretty. The graphics are really the best graphics I've seen from any game PERIOD. And I'm not only talking about the "realism" of the graphics themselves, but also the prettiness of them. The sunrise covered with clouds each morning is literally one of the most beautiful things I've seen in any game. Overall, I can't really find anything to complain about. It might really be a "perfect" game, at least to me. 10/10

author: Apealee
review: Red Dead Redemption II is honestly one of the best games I have ever played. When I played the first Red Dead Redemption many years ago I was so amazed by what Rockstar could achieve but now that I have played the latest I am so blown away, no game could compare. It seems as if Rockstar took note of the mistakes they were making in GTA V and made this game perfect.From the insane quality to the open world landscape in which you can do what ever you want when you want. The characters movements and speeches are so perfect. The beautiful terrains make this game so enjoyable to explore. There is a story mode and an online, obviously the story mode would follow a story with lots of fun missions, however most people get the game to play online because that's where you can make your own story and choose to do what you want; I would suggest trying both, the story mode can be really fun and exciting, like watching an action movie but your the one making the decisions.If you have not gotten this game yet I highly highly suggest getting it. Although it would probably be best to get it during a discount or black friday because it is quite pricy.

author: MadBone12
review: (Review for single player only)Red Dead Redemption 2 is at its best when you are just roaming the world, exploring, doing side missions and dealing with whatever random encounters the world has to offer. It is at its worst when you are doing quests, as suddenly things become very linear and you just turn into a button masher doing whatever the game tells you to.The world design and story of RDR2 are incredibly good. The characters are interesting with compelling backstories and interesting progression, as well as amazing voice acting. The world is an absolute blast to explore, and I can see myself playing it again just for this.My two biggest complaints:Story quests - while interesting in content - are very linear and it often feels like you are just pressing a button whenever the game demands it. This game LOVES taking choices away from you during quests, down to the speed you can walk at, what weapon you can use, if your inventory is available or not. It was often a very frustrating experience and I was annoyed at being constantly railroaded.The second complaint is that a lot of items you can get are unlocked by challenges, made worse by the fact that the progression of those challenges often makes no sense. For example, two of the final challenges for the Herbalist questline are to collect plants and then make one particular item and use it. However, you would have done that dozens of times over by the time you get to this point in the challenge progression, but your earlier actions don't count until that challenge becomes active. I felt like my time was not being respected.I have other minor complaints, such as the clunky and unresponsive controls. However, I still recommend this game for the world design, story and characters, and the exploration / crafting / survival mechanics this game has to offer. This was a very fun game to play when it stopped getting in its own way.Final note: this game is a prequel to the first game. Since RDR1 is not available on PC, PC-only players interested in knowing what happened to the main characters of RDR2 will need to watch a 'let's play' online or read a summary.

author: IwHtH
review: It's a masterpiece! Buy it!_________________I've been playing computer games since deep childhood. I don't know how many thousand hours at all, but it is a quite huge amount of time.And I had one rule: do not buy the same game twice.Why had? Because this game broke this rule.Not so many story games were finished by me twice. I can count them by the fingers of two hands.BUT I HAD NEVER BOUGHT ONE GAME TWICEUNTIL NOWMy first meeting with RDR2 was in 2018 when it was released on PS4 and Xbox. It was not a pre-order, just release day buying, for the full price of 60$ (for the first time). I didn't know if my PS4 Fat was able to launch this masterpiece and mostly it was a great challenge for it because sometimes its coolers worked like them launch a rocket into space. But generally, everything was all right, the game gave me one of the best game experiences in my life. Great graphics, gameplay, story, additional activities, open world...Everything creates a separate world where you can transform into a cowboy and escape from reality.Once upon a time, I decided to buy this game again for my pc. And OMG IT IS AWESOME AGAIN.The only difference is that it can be playable in 60 frames per second with better quality graphics. And I think that it's enough to pay $ for it and to finish this storyline again, maybe with another morale role (no spoilers).So I'm going to ride my new horse and become a bad-ass cowboy in the Wild West again!God, bless DLSS technolohy!IwHtH's score:10/10Graphics:5/5Gameplay:5/5Story:5/5Optimization:5/5

author: mrlex
review: I will dedicate a few words to this beautiful and one of my personal favorite game.I've heard about this game before but I didn't have a chance to play it until a few months ago (April 2022) and the game is simply beautiful... graphics, story, characters, connection and character relationships... simply everything.Namely, the game consists of six chapters, where already in the first chapter we get to know the main characters and their problems.Each chapter contains something new and unusual for the action of the story.And now a few words about the protagonist, Arthur Morgan, one if not the best protagonist of video games, a charismatic cowboy who changes through the story in a very interesting way, in which players can immerse themselves in the action and sympathize with Morgan. The story can be emotional, so it used to happen that I even shed a few tears at some moments. Also, the plot twists are excellently made and change the course of the plot in a fresh way.Red Dead Redemption 2 is a really emotional and decisive game that starts with a classic western plot and ends with many questions about life and who is really our friend and who is our enemy.In conclusion, I would recommend this masterpiece of a video game to anyone

author: CHAOS
review: RDR2-STORY+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+Red Dead Redemption 2 is personally for me one of the greatest games I have ever played. The story, the characters, the scenery and the sounds are amazing. The game is very detailed and it doesn't get boring if you play over and over again. It took me some time to play though the story since it was very fun to go and explore the world and do stuff besides the story. In my opinion RDR2 is really worth the price. 10/10 rating in story, characters, audio and scenery.RDR2-ONLINE+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+On the one hand RDR2 Online is a bit "annoying" since there are some people that just start killing you for no reason at all, trolls, griefers. The more progress you make after 100 Levels is a bit disappointing for rankups also there aren't updates for Online, so it's kinda slowly dieing. (#SaveRedDeadOnline) , but on the other hand RDR2 Online has nice players that are offering help to people or people are just really nice to play with, even some of my friends are people I met in RDR2 Online.

author: JuneBug
review: Wow. This has got to be the best game I've ever played. I purchased this PC version a little while back when I got my first PC, however I played this game when it first came out on Xbox back in 2018. First off, the graphics are literally better than my local national park's view. Second, the story is like an actual movie that I am surprised doesn't exist. Like honestly, this could be nominated for a movie award even though it's a video game. And lastly this, in my opinion, is Rockstar's best work, by far. This didn't have many annoying gameplay mechanics that I can think of, there were some bugs at launch but they're fixed now, and they went all out and spent over 8 YEARS DEVELOPING IT! That is some serious dedication there. In conclusion, I totally recommend this game for full price, or even more! Best game ever.

author: RogerMcNally39
review: My name is Yoshikage Kira. I'm 33 years old. My house is in the northeast section of Morioh, where all the villas are, and I am not married. I work as an employee for the Kame Yu department stores, and I get home every day by 8 PM at the latest. I don't smoke, but I occasionally drink. I'm in bed by 11 PM, and make sure I get eight hours of sleep, no matter what. After having a glass of warm milk and doing about twenty minutes of stretches before going to bed, I usually have no problems sleeping until morning. Just like a baby, I wake up without any fatigue or stress in the morning. I was told there were no issues at my last check-up. I'm trying to explain that I'm a person who wishes to live a very quiet life. I take care not to trouble myself with any enemies, like winning and losing, that would cause me to lose sleep at night. That is how I deal with society, and I know that is what brings me happiness. Although, if I were to fight I wouldn't lose to anyone.

author: KuriousKiwi
review: I would highly recommend this to everyone. I finished it the first time through in 120 hours, with a fair bit of free roam involved. This game is truly the best I've played so far. The world around you truly lives, every person you meet has a life, it really feels like that. The character development is stunning, the story is just absolutely wonderful. I have no words to express how much I enjoyed this. You really get sucked into the story if you allow it to, it just might take a bit of time, but as you progress through the chapters, it just gets better and better.I have to mention that this was the first open world storyline RPG I have played and needless to say, I was stunned by this. At first, before buying (I bought it in sale, for €30) I was quite hesitant. I had never really played a game like this before and I feared that the world might be too open for me; that I was overwhelmed by the openness of the country and that I wouldn't know what to do with it all, therefore sticking mainly to the story. When I finally bought and started the game, none of that proved to be true. The game is amazingly balanced in my opinion and going out hunting and exploring actually makes sense. You've got to survive in this world, making it necessary for you to go out and hunt. Meeting strangers could happen at any moment and Rockstar did absolutely not shy away with it. 26 stranger missions throughout the whole course of the game might not seem like much, but I did not even get around to playing or finishing all of them in 120 hours of gameplay. The stranger missions make the game so detailed and they absolutely add to the idea that the world around you is living and evolving while you walk through the streets. They also make you go and explore the country, explore the world, which is great. I had a lot of fun and I'm sure I will play through this a couple of times more. Overall, I would definitely recommend this to everyone. Even if you might not fancy the open world too much, the main story line is just too great to ignore.

author: Jet
review: So, RDR2. Would I recommend this game to someone who wants an immersive world with a lot of free roam options, some choices here and there, excellent characters (some better then others, but pretty much everyone good) and some damn fine looking graphics and guns? HELL YES. The singleplayer free roaming is easily the best part of this game in my opinion. Beautiful landscapes, forests, rivers, etc. to the snowy mountains and hills up north, to the bustling streets of Saint Denis. Game looking SHARP. Characters, excellent voice acting and animations for all characters and NPCs, though sometimes you might get the occasional glitch or maybe someone doing something weird, but everything is pretty solid. The details from the forests to customizing your gun styles is beautifully done. If you want this game for a singleplayer experience, BUY THIS GAME.NOW ON THE OTHER HAND....Multiplayer is a damn mess. Some people like it, others do not. I lean on the I don't like it, but I do play it with some friends, so it isn't TERRIBLE. However, there are a lot of people who might just flat out kill you if they so much as look at you, missions can feel pretty repetitive and grindy, almost leaning towards paying for stuff like gold bars to get you special jobs like bounty hunter, moonshiner, etc. Combat is a bit of a crapshoot, since there is this kind of deck type of deal going with deadeye where you pick some things that help with your deadeye like you do more damage on horseback and other little things. If you are playing with friends, I would probably be cautious of it, but it can still be fun just to ride around, do missions and shoot people. Doing it solo? Ehhh it isn't the worst thing in the world, but they could have clearly done it a lot better.So in short, yes if you want a singleplayer game that takes a long time to beat. Maybe to no if you are mostly looking to sink time into multiplayer and such.

author: Mendhak
review: RDR2 can be a full  if you'll allow it.  There are certain slight annoyances, and if you acknowledge those and deal with it, the game rewards you with a great experience.There are a lot of tiny gameplay , and for those mechanics, a lot of button prompts.  Ranging from stowing, brushing, leading, punching, guarding, drawing, many others, all within contexts like camping, or near your horse, and so on.  At first this can be overwhelming and off-putting, but just be patient and note the prompts, then perform the action.  What kept me playing is the world itself.  It's an absolutely amazing detailed  and what made it stand out from other games was the .  Wake up one day, there's a gorgeous sunrise, sometimes rain, sometimes clear skies.  You'll be walking through a forest and there's shafts of light hitting you as you walk.  Sometimes there's a haze and it pervades the air everywhere you go.  Sometimes fog, sometimes chills and your breath is steaming.  Sometimes a frightening thunderstorm passes by, and sometimes you can see it in the distance.  What incredible work they have put in to bring this in game. The weather effects existed to perfectly complement the environment. There are  areas, hills, deserts, swamps, forests.  It's amazing to travel through all these places and see the attention to detail and how realistic things look.  Of course this may not be the same view 10 years from now, but as of today it's really well done.  I took a lot of screenshots.  Don't just take my word for it, have a look at The map is huge and in this environment are scattered about, various towns, people, shelters, cities, hamlets and little cottages.   In between are vast, empty spaces where you are mostly by yourself.  You travel the land, camp, hunt, fish, and experience the wilderness.  You can get ambushed.  You can get lost.  You can meet random people and experience small parts of their stories.  You can turn off the navigation compass and just follow your nose!  It really felt like a great recreation of an , which fit in nicely with the themes of the story around the dawn of the modern age.   I liked it so much I found myself avoiding cities and taking every opportunity to travel between them instead.  And there's a lot more to do.  There's time to spend at camp, side quests, hunting for collectables, tame horses.  A lot of these are optional so you'd only do them if you really wanted to, and you don't get punished for not doing it.  The  was decent, definitely not a cut-and-dry black-and-white good-vs-evil type, it's presented in a somewhat realistic and natural pace, and just like life, there are loose ends and what-ifs.   I liked the subdued,  - there isn't a lot of music playing all the time.  There will be environmental music playing softly sometimes.  And once in a while when an actual song plays, it feels impactful.I should also point out that despite the description and appearances, this is quite a , gory game.  The slow, relaxing exploration will be punctuated by brief periods of intense violence as part of stories or ambushes, and you headshot multiple people in sequence.  There's a mechanic called 'dead eye' which makes combat really satisfying and at the same time a bit too easy.

author: BrandoniousOptimusMaximus
review: Absolutely the best story I have ever experienced in a game. It's long, but engaging the whole way through. I really felt like a cowboy in the wild west, and the world is so much more filled out than in RDR1. Sometimes feels like you are just watching a movie with some interactive parts, and sometimes it turns into a button masher. These are all very small complaints for a game that takes you away to a new world that feels so real that you really do start feeling emotional connections to characters and NPCs like never before. This is an experience that shouldn't be missed by anyone who has ever enjoyed any Rockstar game to date.

author: Depa
review: Red dead redemption was a truly memorable game, I just finished the story line and am busy finishing up the epilogue. I had the most fun while finishing main quests, you really start to form bonds with everyone around you, from the guy that u saved on the road to the people who have been riding with you and the gang for years. The story line is something else, both touching and exciting. Plot twist after plot twist. Hands down one of my favourite games i've played so far.

author: The One True God
review: This is not just a game. This is an experience. A phenomenal one at that.Firstly, mechanical aspect leaves nothing to be desired. I haven't had any glitches but one. The game runs very smoothly and efficiently, even though my graphics is not the strongest.Secondly, the environment is just mind-blowing. I loved every moment on this map. Amazing setting and scenery. Wandering about was breath-taking and I still have many hours  of exploration ahead of me. Pure genius. Thirdly, the plot. ** SPOILERS **The story itself is written in an amazing way. It is very grasping and it is very hard to take any breaks. The progression and development of characters blew my mind. When Arthur died at the end I was gutted. I have never felt anything like that in a game. I felt emptiness after finishing the witcher 3 and kingdom come deliverance, but nothing quite like that.The only ♥♥♥♥♥♥ thing is I cannot play it fresh again. Worth every penny. I actually want to buy it again, because I've paid only half. Amazing, amazing, amazing!

author: Astracus
review: Red Dead Redemption 2, this game was really awesome to play, even though it sometimes feels poorly optimized.The story is really great, it gives a really great immersion and makes you really feel like part of the gang.Even after/during the completion of the story, the game map is awesomely designed and full of details, you could potentially spend full days in the game and still have stuff to explore/discover.I didn't try the online yet, so I can't really give an opinion about that.There was a particular bug which really ticked me off: every second time I launched the game, my FPS would get halved.Now, there's an easy fix to this: you just have to reinstall the latest drivers from GeForce Experience everytime you want to launch the game  (I don't really know if that's just an Nvidia issue or AMD too).

But anyhow, it feels like GTA but in the old Western times with additions such as eating/drinking along with a whole lot of other changes, most you'll see for yourself. author: Korimore
review: Personal rating = 5/5 This game gave me something that no other game ever managed to give me. The whole wolrd is alive, there are no empty spots. Atention to details is perfect. HORSE BALLS ♥♥♥♥♥ SHRINK IN SNOWY ARE The story was.... simply AMAZING. Even side missions. (My eyes are not crying, they are just sweating)Arthur as main character is very likable, perfect anti-hero. At least i made him look like that, you can make him like total vilian if you want.OST, oh my. Well planed and produced. One of my fav. OST from games. Its makig me kinda sad when i see GOTY awards for OST with OSTs that alre just some playlists from spotify in stead own production.Visual is simply stunning, I had to play it on medium and  I still  had a beautiful experience + finaly some gut cutscenesGameplay/Gunplay ,most of it was ctrl+c ctrl+v from GTA V. This doesnt mean its bad thing, thanks to that they had less work and they could focus on other thingsNow time for cons, there are just small useless bunch of them.Fishing/hunting, for example hunting legendary animals. In reality there isnt any big motivation to hunt them . Only motivation  I had was crafting, you can make some special trinkets (some stat. boost)... Well hunting overall is if  want to craft like some cosmetical things or visual things in your camp. Legendary fishing is also there only for a collectible purpose/missionWell, no more cons for me .  Greatest game I ever played (for now) I will see if its going to hold up against Horizon :)

author: Kaiyoda
review: 194 hours or 11640 minutes.Originally, when I found myself getting hooked on the game, I thought I'd have to do bounties and outlaw stuff only in order to achieve 100%. Now I've played poker, dominos, and hunted more squirrels and animals then I've ever imagined, spent hours playing blackjack for certain hands and some other hours collecting and admiring plants, all in order to achieve 100% completion. 194 hours is what it took for me to achieve 100%, admiring the game along the way. I think that should tell you all about how much content is in this game. That drive to 100% a game hasn't come in a loooong time, and honestly I have to credit it to the phenomenal storytelling and beautiful game. Legitimately felt my heart sink and my stomach turn at certain points of the game. Pick this game up if you haven't already, you are missing out.

author: ★- Papi Nut Splash -★
review: Best game ever. Truly a masterpiece in every way possible. I highly highly HIGHLY recommend it! It's genuinely a STEAL on sale and I would say is still definitely worth it even when purchased for full price! This game has become my favorite game of all time shortly after starting it. I have fallen in love with some of the characters, I legit care way too deeply about pixels on my screen. It is a roller coaster of emotions, it manages to be simultaneously hilarious, fun, badass and also hit you right in the feelings. A truly immaculate experience that I don't know if any other game will manage to surpass and that I believe every single person should experience for themselves. I can already feel the emptiness that will come after finishing this game, that is why I sometimes postpone playing it because I truly don't want this experience to ever end. It has completely consumed my heart. In conclusion... just simply buy it, you won't regret it!Edit: THIS GAME HAS CONSUMED MY LIFE AND I DON'T KNOW HOW I WILL EVER RECOVER. I NEED HELP. PLAY IT SO IT CAN CONSUME YOURS TOO!

author: The_zaa
review: The game itself is great and I doubt my negative review will impact the overall score, but I don't care much for Rockstar's ♥♥♥♥♥♥ little launcher. I don't like giving them my email, creating an account so they can sell me stuff or the extra layer of DRM on top of Steam which treats paying customers like potential criminals.I hate the always online BS (on an offline, single player game) that requires validation every time I launch it, insinuating that their $20 is somehow more important than my time. I hate the fact that I can't play the game right now because their ♥♥♥♥♥♥ little servers are down. It basically means I don't own the game because I can only play it when they so graciously allow a mere peasant like myself to play it.It also pisses me off that while their crappy launcher is jerking off in the background, it may be harming performance and I could potentially increase some settings and get the experience I paid for.Putting a small warning about 3rd party DRM on the store front isn't enough. It should be outright banned from Steam and it's a practice which shouldn't be tolerated.
