author: Neox3d
review: This is an amazing game. I haven't played it on the PS4 but on the PC it looks gorgeous. The game also scales very well. My system Specs are:i5 4690Rtx 2060 6gb16 gb ramwin 10Kaspersky Antivirus (running in background)Playing on 1080p with 60 fps with most settings turned to highCPU usage is between 60-80% of the 4 cores.The good:RDR2 is an immensely immersive game. The voice acting is top notch and the story is well written (so far). I have played about 70 hrs for now and have done many side mission and still only completed 30% of the main game. The game looks incredibly polished and well thought of. You can lose yourself in the wilderness for hours at end and not be bored at all. The flora and fauna of the world is diverse and well designed.The bad:My slight complain with the game is that the weapon switching so far feels slow and that always doesn't help when you are hunting or engaged in combat. In addition, the game tries to explain somethings well but there are a ton of hidden mechanics in the game that are not explained at all. Unlike some, I haven't had a single crash since I bought this game and I have played for longer game sessions up to 7 hours nonstop.

author: Akina Dive
review: Slowly but surely(?)The Future of Red Dead Redemption 2 for continuity looks about as cloudy as my bowl of cereal. Having played the Console version and coming to PC, my preferred platform. A couple things to note that my computer has a 2700x, 32GB Ram and a 2080 in it, the game runs just fine and there aren't any really noticeable differences between running the game at Ultra/Max and dropping a few things to Medium/High, so visually looks the same but becomes less taxing on the computer. Just have to note that Vulkan is pretty unstable it's not a RDR2 problem it's a vulkan problem, but to push Vulkan will pave the way forward so I find it cool, should come defaulted to Dx12 though instead of Vulkan in my opinion and R* could've avoided a lot of ignorant reviews about "gaMe RUns LIke CRAP".Visually, the game is stunning. The game really shines if you have a High Refresh Rate monitor in the 144hz+ ballpark, and I haven't observed any FPS stuttering or crashes having switched to Dx12 aside from some heavily populated areas and the snow particles swirling everywhere. Story is the same, meaningful choices and slow storytelling. It's not GTA, it's a big brain game with every minute detail crammed in. I love RDR/RDR2 over GTA , you can tell how much time and effort R* has put into the game.Some negatives that irk me; No character transfer from Console to PC, and that seriously sucks. So I have to do everything again and go through the grind all over again.If you don't spend like an ungodly amount of time, your character is going to look horrendous in online. (Fun Fact, Online Characters have no Eyelashes which really negatively impact the appearance of the characters) It's a far cry better than GTAV where everyone is built like a 6ft professional NFL Linebacker. Clothing could fit better, Namely things like Belts and Bandoliers.   and R* should do away with limited time items in my opinion and just make things accessible. Currently matchmaking is entirely desolate, I can spend 3 hours in matchmaking waiting for at least 1 person to queue up with and get shafted. But then as soon as I quick join for story missions, it's instant but only for the first 2-3 missions and seemingly only those. So level progression is painstakingly slow unless you can grab a few friends and start a posse up. I'd recommend it for now personally because the game isn't unplayable and far from broken, R* just needs to keep the ball rolling and get it going faster but without sacrificing any quality.

author: InsertValue
review: I am sorry for anyone having technical issues with the game. I myself am lucky that I had no major issues. I am only 17 hours in the game so far, but only had 3 crashes. Surely I prefer no crash at all, but ~ every 5 hours a crash I can forgive for such an amazing game.Technical issues aside, this game is probably one of the best if not the best Singleplayer open World RPG/Action/Adventures I ever played. Witcher 3 as for many has been my favorite game in that category for years, but this game comes close if not exceeds it. Largely it combines 4 areas that lift this game to a true masterpiece for me:1. Amazing graphics (granted, I have a beast machine, but except MSAA can run the game on Ultra and it looks the part)2. Great Story and Voice Acting: You can make many small and bigger choices in the game and I love that many are not black or white. You are not a good person but you can decide how bad of an outlaw you want to be.3. Immersive Gameplay: From the way you shop by picking and inspecting items from the shelves, to hunting game, brewing coffee, the way the weapons dangle on your back, loosing and picking up your hat, letting your beard grew, reading about your choices in the newspaper and so much more. The game is probably the most immersive game I ever played. Almost every small detail is taken care of to a degree where the smallest flaw (e.g. when Arthur doesn't grab the can correctly) is noticeable because everything else is so well done.4. Hidden quests: There is so many detail in the game that I am afraid of missing the many small things you can discover. For instance by listening to conversations you can discover hidden quests, that are not marked anywhere. As an example: by passing by a conversation I learned about a shopkeeper hiding something in the cellar, upon closer inspection you actually find out that there is someone hidden, who you can then proceed to help, just to learn about a heartbreaking tragedy the shopkeeper encountered. Nothing of that is marked on your map, you have to discover it yourself. All in all this game is an absolute masterpiece. I hope it does well for Rockstar and it is great to see that they are still focused on great Singleplayer experiences, despite RDR2 Online being a thing.

author: CrazyJow
review: ***Edit Review Change*****Read the bottom for original review**Story:Simply one of the greatest games I've ever played in my entire life. I'm not even finished, as I just started John Marston. The story.. what can I say about the story? One of the best stories in my life. Next to OG FF7 this the best story ever. I laughed, I cried, I wanted to it never end. "Thank you" Seriously... that part. My heart man.. my heartGameplay:Really great over all. Has its moments like any 3rd person game where its a little clunky at times. But it makes up for those moments for the sheer amount of stuff you can just do. It can be overwhelming at first and seems like a lot to put in/remember, but the story makes it all worth it.Graphics:Whatca got? Anything good or basic GPU? If you have less than an 8G card you're only hurting yourself. I have a 5700xt red devilRyzen 5 2600+ o/c 4ghz Samsung 970 Pro M.2144hz monitor 1ms refresh rate I got an average of 40-55fps w/ low grass, high/ultra on literally everything else.Social Club/Rockstar Launcher:There is a way to fix it, its now the only way i start the game. It SUCKS but.. The game.. Its worth it. Open Search --> Virus & threat protection --> Virus & Threat Protection Settings --> Manage Settings --> Turn off Real Time ProtectionAlso allow RDR2/SocialClub/RockStar Launcher thru the Firewall, you may/may not have to go and do it manually. ORIGINAL REVIEW:Disappointment is an understatement when it comes to this game. Gameplay and the game itself are GREAT. Rockstar socialclub? utter piece of garbage. My 1st 6 hours of owning the game was spent with support just trying to get it to run. Not a hardware issue, socialclub is just a garbage fire. Every issue I've had has dealt with Socialclub. No other game I've owned EVER have had to contact support more than once. Now I'm on my 3rd time getting intouch with support over this garbage fire. Its really sad, i spent 80 on this game for the full pack and was looking forward to playing. Now I'm just pissed off

author: AmbyPan
review: I wish there was more detail in the "Do you recommend this game?". The story of this game is amazing, it looks beautiful, amazing music and many other amazing things. The game is so unoptimised though it is comical. It has crashed twice in 10 hours, so many graphical glitches and a few game breaking bugs. The game framerate-wise actually runs ok, on ultra I get on average 70fps. My system though is rather good, 1080ti, i7-6700k and 16gb of ram. The loading times aren't too long on single player at least, not tried online yet. If you want an immersive world, good story, fun gameplay and a very pretty game, then I recommend this at a discount. The amount of bugs so far though is comical. So far I have had leaves that turn weird and show reflections, the lighting just stopping so the world is black full of glowy things (I wish I took a screenshot, it looked really funny), npcs just vanishing, the world turning half transparent, getting stuck on carriages so I have to restart, animations stopping so npcs and animals just tpose slide around, flickering lights (this one is really annoying and very frequent, and the worst bug so far is loud crackly sound. My headphones work on other games and applications, I tried another pair of headphones and still got the same bug. It isn't constant, but happens after an hour or so of playing. Whether I recommend this game or not I guess really just depends on whether you are willing to put up with that. When the game runs well, which it does, it is an amazing game. As of writing this though the game is so buggy I don't know whether I recommend it. When they fix it, which I really hope they do, it will be amazing. The price I paid, £43.99 as it was on a %20 is very expensive for the quality of the game. This is obviously just my opinion, but while I don't regret buying it, I wouldn't recommend anyone buying it till it is on a better discount. It depends on how much you want this game though obviously. Tl;dr, very buggy but when it works it is really good. Wait for a better discount unless you really want it and hope it gets some serious patches.

author: AndrewVu125
review: The graphic, soundtrack/ambient, combat and story is amazing.But yeah, I won't recommend you buying this game for Online, really no. (Not to mention that the performance suck too, you don't wanna trust "SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS" down there.As I got 2k+ hours on GTA Online from PS3 to PC that has encounter bunch of cheaters in the Public session, I can guarantee that Rockstar didn't learn their lesson for Red Dead Redemption 2 on PC. (Well I do research sometimes on R* Titles what can I say, i'm such a fool)At first, I played RDO on RGL version, didn't got any cheaters on my way, friendly players kinda stuff, thought to myself maybe Rockstar did something good to the anti-cheat system.HAHAHAHA....I was wrong... Since Steam version released, there's a bunch of cheaters now, from invincible/1 shot kill/teleporting,... ect ect you name it.- There's no invite Session like GTA Online, which mean you will hop into a session full of strangers.- If someone have a controller in the session, they can auto lock on into you, while you have to free aim with a mouse.- You will get disconnected IF you trying to do Solo Public Session like GTA Online or you have a bad Internet or Strict NAT. It wont be like GTA Online, where you got disconnected and then all the players in the session left, no this time you're the only person got disconnect with an error code pop in your face.- Same above, if you got disconnect while doing a sell for your trader role, all of your stock will be lost.- No Text chat like GTA Online, just voice chat only.Overall, the single player is good, just don't buy the game for Online.Edit : Ah yes, there will be a Online standalone version with cheaper price, you could go with that.

author: Drafter
review: Every bit as great a game as it is on PS4. There are definitely some performance issues that will hopefully get patched at some point, but it's extremely playable on my 4+ year old PC. I've crashed twice in 12 hrs of gameplay, but the autosave works great, fortunately. Pay no attention to the bad reviews this early. Most people are starting to figure out you have to unplug your controller before launching the game, wait for it to load and then plug it in. I'm sure that will get fixed soon. Really happy to see this game on Steam.Edit: ok so I realize the controller fix isn’t working for everyone, so maybe it’s best to wait it out and see how quickly the devs fix the problems. I still love the game, although I did crash again last night. I hope they get it working right. We need this game on PC.

author: Raven Dumron
review: One of the greatest immersive games I've ever played. The story is a slow burn but with excellent and gripping character writing, and the gameplay, while initially a little tedious, does its absolute best to keep the game as realistic and grounded as possible. The end result is a game that feels like you're truly immersed in its character's dirty shoes, and that will keep wanting to play more, whether it is to see the band of outlaws further unravel, or merely just to lose yourself in the life of one for hours on end.I guess I should mention I experienced some random crashes for a little while, which was fixed by switching from DirectX12 to Vulkan. Otherwise the game runs very smoothly on high/ultra graphics on my computer, but admittedly it's on the beefy end.

The world feels real and there are plenty of things to do besides story.

It is a bit slow, but it is very welcomed in today's videogame climate where everything feels so fast (Modern Warfare, etc.). The writing is great, it has charm, and above all, it feels like an experience. I cannot wait to continue and seeing how the story unfolds.

review: Too early to judge for now, but game is a masterpiece so far.Had one CTD after 3 hours of gameplay but I will let it slide. The necessity to have their beta-code launcher running all the time sucks, but anyway this review is about the game itself, if it was for their launcher and the technical difficulties with it I would give it 1/10. Take a look why their launcher sucks, after the crash it wouldn't even let me into the game:Had to Task Manager kill the launcher because it wouldn't terminate normally, after that the game ran fine.Game optimization isn't all that bad though, I've seen much worse.Overall the game is really worth it and I totally recommend it, hopefully all these crashes and the issues that come from their launcher will be fixed with the upcoming updates.I will be updating this review the more I progress into the game.

Login, Captcha please select all the cross walks, please try again, login successful. Launch game from poor needless launcher, finally done. author: Kaiser-Fahim
review: I think it’s safe to say we all enjoyed the game, but now having been out for over a month I think it’s time for some honest reviews. I’m really curious as to what you guys think, but here’s mine to start things off:Story: (10/10) - The story telling in this game is near perfect. Probably the best narrative I’ve ever had the chance of experiencing in a video game. Although I have some issues with how things went (Milton always somehow avoiding death in the shootouts) this was by far the best thing about the game.World: (9/10) - The open world in this game was again one of the best I’ve had the pleasure of exploring. So much detail on such a big map. Flowing rivers with dynamic weather. It’s hard not to feel like you’re actually there. The big disappointment here is that the enemy/animal spawns are ♥♥♥♥. There are almost no predators and the ones that do exist always spawn in the exact same spot. I have over 100 hours in the game and I’ve only seen 1 brown bear outside of a scripted event. Same can be said about enemy spawns. The camps are always in the same spot, and outside of scripted events you are safe to explore everywhere else.Gameplay/Mechanics: (8/10) - By far my biggest disappointment with the game is how little they improved on actual gameplay mechanics. Trains don’t do anything interesting, and carts are essentially useless as well. You can’t rob banks, and the bounty system is broken. There is no bullet drop, and the shooting feels like a lateral move (maybe even a step down) from the first game. Also there are no underwater or above ground components. With such great draw distance you’d figure they’d add in some sort of flying mechanic. Swimming is pretty standard in most other open world games, but I guess they felt that wasn’t necessary either. Most buildings are closed off. Makes sense in Saint-Denis, but even in the rest of the world only like 10% of buildings are accessible. It feels like a big tease.This game definitely lacks a lot of things that would make it more fun, but it is still a top of the line game.Overall I’ll give it a 9/10. Great, but left a lot to be desired

author: The Crescent Hawk
review: Red Dead Redemption 2 to put it bluntly this piece of software is a masterpiece and nothing less from the moment I started it up until the time I switched camps the game is absolutely gorgeous the gun plays fantastic the story it's one of the best I've ever seen in a game it's Witcher 3 quality the game does suffer from some optimization issues my computer has a 2080ti and I can max out everything with the exception of anti-aliasing I can only run that at two times despite those things the game has true depth of which I haven't seen in a very long time and I've been gaming since 1990 I think one of the things that I like the most about the game is the story the voice acting is unparalleled when a character in the game world speaks it sounds like the voice actor had real stake in the lines that he or she was given the main character Arthur it's fantastic as you play the game while progressing the story it makes you want to see what happens next it really is that good I haven't had an opportunity to play online because I'm engrossed in the single player campaign but I'm sure that that is where the real faults lie as any recent Rockstar game you online seems to be plagued with cheaters and connectivity faults I will say that I am extremely glad Rockstar decided to give us a PC port now I know I'm going to catch a lot of flak from my PC compatriots but I would really like to see a port of The Last of Us but back to the original review if you're expecting a bunch of silliness as in Grand Theft Auto look elsewhere this is a very serious gritty game there's a lot of elements that try to simulate real life like hair growth and rest and eating the best advice I could give is if you want this game and you want to experience it and its fullest you need to have a moderate PC that's a large portion of where the beauty of this game comes from the graphics are phenomenal I haven't seen graphics on par with Red Dead Redemption 2 ever I take that back maybe The Witcher 3 for me Red Dead Redemption 2 is definitely in the top 5 list for me of must have PC games of 2019-2020 do yourself a favor by this game do it as soon as you possibly can the next time you have a spare $60 get Red Dead Redemption 2

author: RogueLyfe
review: The online is wonky, it kicks me out on my gaming laptop, but on my PC it's fine. The story mode is exceptional. Rockstar succeeded in making one of the most likable and relatable main characters it's ever made. I appreciate the graphical ingenuity behind this game and the very engaging questlines and sidequests. I really enjoy reading Arthur's journal entries, which is a first for me considering how uninteresting main characters tend to be in games (deliberately in order to allow players to imprint themselves on the character). But I think they did a great job.

author: JollyRoger1516 ☠
review: A visually stunning game with an amazing open world. Ruined by horrible optimisation even after over 1 month after release on the PC and the shadiest ripoff business practice that would normally be expected from the likes of EA. The online mode, utiilising the same amazing looking landscape, generally offers a very nice gameplay. However, while the activities are much freer, the roles which is one of the main activities online can be very repetitive and are in many ways very limited and can do with some serious extensions.ALSO THE ONLINE MODE SUFFERS FROM EVERY POSSIBLE ONLINE BUG - camp not spawning, camp being packed up without it being requested, posse not join-able, posse members joining but not having access to the camp, missions ending in endless loading, missions randomly disconnecting and, among many others, of course JUST PLAIN NOT BEING ABLE TO CONNECT TO ROCKSTAR GAME SERVICES - the online bugs can be gone for a full day or just hit you every 5mins - this just plain needs fixing... Setting aside the many online bugs, no matter how good your game is I will not give you a positive review if you make people pay full price and then put the game on a 20-25% sale 1 week after release. Witcher 3 also had an amazing open world and somehow CD Projekt Red manages to make money despite putting effort into stable releases and a business model that isn't geared to drain the last cent out of people. DO BETTER!

author: Jackbooted Thug
review: Probably one of the most frustrating and disappointing games I've ever played. If they cut the budget in half and got their heads out of their asses this could be a much better game. Instead they invested money into making "realistic" animal rotting and 30,000 "random" events that 90% of players will experience. This is having your hand held by an adult, pulled through an art gallery with no intention of letting you see anything on your own. If you don't play how you are told to, you are sent back to the last cutscene and told to do it over. The story isn't some masterpiece like everyone says and I constantly found myself rolling my eyes at different parts of the game. I very much want to like the game because it is very beautiful, voice acting is great, some of the characters are great, and I find the era to be fascinating, but it falls apart as it is. I would go as far to say that it is unplayable without mods that fix the economy, combat, hunting, and law. Even after adding those mods that doesn't fix the tediousness of the practically on-rails story mode, the awkward and slow/cinematic way your character does things, or the sheer amount of clutter in all departments. This game has a cult like community that associates any criticism with people who play fortnite. Bringing up that any tension a scene has is immediately dissolved by the fact that you can use deadeye mode to immediately head shot all 4 attackers at any given part, will immediately result in you being labeled as a kid who cannot appreciate a good story! Not to mention the fact that your character can take about two dozen hits before even considering if he should lose health or not. If you think this game might be fun as a fan of more freeform titles, simply watch youtube videos of the gameplay with a critical eye, whenever the game can't force you to do something it wants you to do, you immediately break any part of the game.While there is plenty more I could say, and I have to friends who asked about it, I can only recommend this game if its on sale at a serious discount, above 50% off. A lot of my hours in game are when I left the game running on my computer, and I only played as long as I did because I was told the story was great, I never could bother with finishing it. I will hold that Red Dead Redemption 1 was a much much better game, despite it having its own issues.Also cope and sneed, this game requires always online DRM, meaning you can't launch the game without an internet connection and a rockstar account. Requires something like 120 GB on your hard drive.

author: MadMortigan
review: There's a lot of fun stuff in this game, but let's talk about making a cup of coffee.Step #1 Go to a campfire, and not just any campfire, a scout campfire and find the very specific spot you need to stand to get the "sit" prompt. Click sit and wait for the animation to end.Step #2 Click crafting and wait for the animation to finishStep #3 Hit the button for place percolator and wait for the animation to finishStep #4 Hit the button for fill percolator with water and wait for the animation to finishStep #5 Select Coffee and hit the button to add it to the percolator and wait for the animation to finishStep #6 Hit the button for pour coffee and wait for the animation to finishStep #7 Hit the button to drink your coffee and gain a small stat boostAltogether it's nearly a 5 minute process. You can literally make a real cup of coffee in less time than it takes to in game and that's a problem for me. Of course this isn't limited to coffee. Want to play poker? Well get ready for some real-time card shuffling and slowly passing and dealing cards. On one level I like the immersiveness of the game but on the other hand there needs to be a balance between immersion and fun. I don't want to see this whole production every time I want to do something simple in the game and I end up just avoiding it. Then I find myself avoiding half the game because I don't want to just sit there watching these sequences of animations play out over and over again.

author: Kleist
review: Absolutely a masterpiece. Been playing for several hours, no stuttering or crashes so far. The game runs pretty smooth with an average frame rate of 70+ fps with optimized settings that are generally between high and ultra. I definitely recommend taking more time to tweak the graphic settings due to the fact that some settings can heavily tax the performance but don't make much difference in terms of graphics. Be aware that the recommended specs from Rockstar are clearly misleading (GTX 1060 can barely archive 30 fps), you'll need at least a RTX 2060 to get 60 fps with good graphics.

author: phonon5891
review: TLDR:(This is a review of RDR2, *not* RDO, as I refuse to touch the latter.) Beautiful game and great story ruined by flaky control system and nonsensical+un-fun mechanics, which makes it hard to recommend. Also, I hope you like being labeled as dishonorable scum.[edited to add:] If you're looking for a good story, save your money and watch the many RDR2 clips on youtube, because the story is quite good. If you're looking for a fun open-world experience, then look elsewhere unless you enjoy hours of grinding for pennies and pelts. I burned out after crafting the best satchel and have resorted to just watching the rest of the story on youtube.Pros:+ Beautiful game world; I spent hours riding around slowly just enjoying the scenery.+ Great story and interesting characters.+ Open world is open world (except for a chunk of the southern map).Cons:- Honor system is garbage. You take a huge honor penalty when you kill/harm non-bandits, EVEN IN SELF-DEFENSE. You also can get unlucky and get massive honor maluses just because the system decided to put certain random events in your path. Example 1: was escaping from failed attempt at taking over a small bandit camp. System spawns random encounter of lady trapped under horse yelling for help. Can't stop and help because still dodging bullets = dishonorable scum. Example 2: Helped a kidnapped lady by killing the kidnapper and moving to free the victim. Before I could reach her a cougar/panther spawns, spooks the horse she's on, and kills her. Somehow that also makes me dishonorable scum. Would've been minor annoyance, except these events usually wipe out all honor progress you made over hours from doing chores and greeting people.- Obnoxious hunting and crafting system that tries to be realistic but fails miserably in a similar fashion to the honor system. To craft clothes/satchels/trinkets/something something game mechanic upgrade, you're going to need a LOT of animal pelts in perfect condition, which means a LOT of the following: Decide on needed animal; look up ideal weapon for said animal (online, because the in-game compendium is sometimes WRONG); go spend minutes/hours looking for perfect specimen of needed animal; track and kill it IN ONE SHOT with the right weapon; skin and stow the pelt. Oh, and for larger animals like elk, bison, etc. you can only carry one pelt at a time, so you have to go back and forth to sell/donate the thing before getting more, or you just waste a bunch of them. Also killing (too many?) animals without skinning them, EVEN IN SELF-DEFENSE = dishonorable scum. Also easily frightened small critters + high grass = hours of "FUN". Hope you love grinding.- Idiotically specific challenge requirements that often anti-synergizes with the other two mechanics above. Example: one sharpshooter challenge requires you to shoot 5 flying birds from a moving train. Get ready to either risk your life and/or get massive honor penalty, because A) you killed 5 innocent(?) birds, and B) all the guards on the train are now alerted and coming to kill you (even if you used silent weapons like the bow), and defending yourself makes you dishonorable scum. Also all the bandit challenges, because somehow the face masks help you stay anonymous from the law but people still know you're dishonorable scum.- Wonky, inconsistent control scheme (at least with mouse+keyboard, which was what I used) that seems to have been coded up by different groups for different parts of the game and they never all sat down together to make things coherent. Also whoever decided there needs to be a separate button to slow down the horse (instead of just using w to accelerate and s to slow/stop) needs to be shot.Epic fails:-- Requiring online login to play an offline single-player game.

author: Aimbot
review: Red Dead Redemption Two has been an immersive, stunning and bountiful horse ride journey through a landscape offering plentiful trades and skills to master. Hunting in this game really makes you feel like a real hunter. Some men came and tried to shoot me off my supply wagon - which honestly made me rage a little, frown a bit and re-spawn having been killed multiple times however! I did not relinquish my cart and supplies to just any chancing Trevor who lassoed me from my horse and dragged me through the dirt shooting me in the head 3 times.... The moral of the story is - FIGHT BACK, GET UP and don't let your stuff go even if it costs you your dignity and 3 horses lives, feel free to allow vengeance to fill your heart; "borrow" fishing boats, dump strangers dead bodies off of cliffs and accidentally steal other online players hats riding off into the sunset with a sweet new bowler hat. This is my review of RDR2 online. Thank you for your time. What I have played of story mode looks just as beautiful and engaging.

author: Chupa^
review: Red Dead Redemption 2 is an action-adventure game developed and published by Rockstar Games. RDR2 serves as a prequel to the first game. I have not played the first game. The story follows outlaw Arthur Morgan. Arthur must deal with the decline of the Wild West whilst attempting to survive against government forces, rival gangs, and other adversaries.+ Visually RDR2 is probably the most beautiful game I have ever played.+ The game ran without any issues for my system. Never experienced a crash and ran smooth as silk @1440p.+ Bounty hunting is really fun in RDR2. I wish there was more of that.+ The first 20 hours of the game I was pretty immersed in the game.- Lack of a character progression system.- The map is too big and empty. Traveling between locations is a tiresome task.- The story is boring and too long. In my opinion the game should have been half as long. I was literally forcing myself to finish this damn game. With the money Rockstar is making you would think they would be able to hire some fine writers to compose a compelling story. - Money is meaningless. After a certain point in the game () you just have more money than you can ever hope to spend. Not to mention all the weapons feel exactly the same.- Dull and repetitive combat and story missions. The combat at the 60h mark is exactly the same as on the first hour. 95% of the story missions follow the same formula: every mission ends with either A) a shootout until all enemies die, or B) you run away on your horse while shooting enemies chasing you down. In the later parts of the game I had to switch to first-person mode to have ANY sort of variation in combat and story.- Numerous plot details are left unexplained and ambiguous.- Horse controls are absolutely horrendous.- Fast travel is very limited and poorly executed.RDR2 is an okay game for about 20h, but then becomes a chore to play and finish as you grow tired of the game mechanics and realise how bad the story really is.Is it worth the full price? No. If you must, buy RDR2 at a discounted price.I should also mention that I only played the single-player mode. I bought this game for that. I have not touched Red Dead Online nor am I interested in it.

author: Hanakuso
review: Update:The game could be a good game, but it is still broken... I am enjoying the game while playing it.  Overall, I think Rockstar has performed one of the greatest trolls of all time.After applying quite a few changes, the crashes are now after 1-2 hours of gameplay, but it will still crash every single time.- deleted config and profile from: documents\rockstar games\ red dead redemption 2- turn off cloud saves in rockstar launcher (this was the biggest time increase)- launch option: -ignorepipelinecache- rdr2.exe run as admin for all users- launcher.exe run as admin for all users- removed read only setting from game folder- removed read only setting from documents\rockstar games\ red dead redemption 2- delete SGA files- turned off Windows Defender- turned off Windows antivirus- turned off windows desktop notifications and overlay- turned off Windows game overlay (game bar)- turned off steam overlay- turned off GOG overlay- turned off GPU software overlay- on router opened TCP ports: 27015-27030,27036-27037,30211-30217- on router opened UDP ports: 4380,6672,27000-27031,27036,61455-61458- unplug non-essential USB devices; mouse, keyboard, controller only  (why is this a thing... a thumbdrive that is non-related to the game can cause it to crash)- turned off bluetooth- reformat and re-install windows 10There are some other things that got me to this point that I am forgetting...-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Been trouble shooting for 6 months and my longest session was 45 minutes.Problems are from random crashes, caused by a variety of problems, that have been mentioned many times by others.  Whether it is the bugs in the game or the launcher, the game is broken.9 hours of worth of crashing in 6 months.I can benchmark it on ultra at very playable frame rate... but I can't play the game.  I have tried the lowest settings all the way to the absolute max, game constantly crashes.

author: Aelphais
review: The single player is fine. This review is solely about the online play. If you at all have any interest in online, look somewhere else. Assuming you can even log into a session (infinite loading screens like to keep you out) and don't disconnect randomly (usually after a mission or event), then you're going to have a hard time. Between animals not spawning if there are a moderate amount of players in your session (an issue that has been around for months apparently and still has yet to be fixed), the game flat out crashing with "unknown error: ffffff", and script kiddies plaguing the online (making your body explode over and over again, teleporting on top of you with infinite health, spawning hundreds of cougars and bears on top of you, making your trade cart fly up into the skybox on a jet of water... and a hundred other things), you're going to have a bad time.But at least RockStar is working on the game. They just released a new hat!Edit: There was an update on Tuesday the 14th of January 2020. The only line in the patch notes said that it improved general stability, but my group of friends has been experiencing more trouble than ever. Joining each others' sessions fails more often than not when it did not do so before this patch. When we finally get into the same session, posse joining fails over and over again. If I could give this two thumbs down, I probably would.

author: rolovthom
review: I have a pretty good PC, 48 gb of ram, Radeon 5700 xt, Ryzen 5, and this game freezes every time I play. Honestly it is not worth 6 dollars let alone 60. I regret buying it. It is fun when it works, but the port to PC is so bad its literally unplayable. I switched the graphics display settings after I looked it up and would say it would help. It did not. I also lowered settings to high, which uses half of my GPU. Still freezes. I also validated all the files, which were all correct. I don't know what to do, this game has made me so mad.

author: JshKlsn
review: I am still having a blast with this game, but I must update that RDR2 Online is dead and Rockstar doesn't care. This game is essentially abandoned while GTAO continues to be supported. It's a shame that Rockstar doesn't care about anything other than GTA5 Online.If you want a good single player game with some of the best attention to detail, give this game a try. I still am not changing it to "recommended" because of the fact the game requires a 3000 series GPU to be playable - something that didn't even exist at the time of release, but I am loving the game otherwise.I have recently upgraded my GPU to an RTX 3080. While the game is playable now, you shouldn't need a $1300 CAD GPU to play a game past low/medium. My original review still stands. The game is a ton of fun, it looks beautiful (if you have an RTX 2000 or 3000 series card), and I will continue to play more of it. Still one of the worst ports. It's seriously such a shame this game is so poorly optimized because it's incredibly fun.An RTX 3080 with a powerful CPU can run this game at 60fps ultra.I'm having a ton of fun with this game, and I am going to continue playing it a ton and having fun with it. However, the only reason I am NOT recommending it at this point in time, is because it's a horrible port of the console version.The PC version of GTA is the best version of the game. The PC release is so incredibly polished and is one of Rockstars best PC games built from the ground up with PC specific options. RDR2 is not this.It's a horrible console port that runs at 50fps on high end computers with graphics all set to low/medium. The key bindings make no sense with pressing E/R/TAB to loot, depending on what you're looting. Why this isn't all the same key is beyond me.So while I am having a ton of fun, Rockstar needs to be criticized for the quality of the game.Specs for reference; i7-8700K, 16GB DDR4, 1TB SSD, GTX 980.

author: Faint
review: Loved it, I advice everyone thinking to just buy it and play it. DO NOT SPOIL YOURSELF IF YOU CAN HELP IT! I spoiled a bunch of it myself just achievement hunting and although I still loved the experience a part of me was mad I knew about certain things here and there.Here's THE BAD:Crashes a lot "unexpectedly" and looks like ♥♥♥♥ until you fiddle with the advance settings (cheated and used a tweaked version of Nvidia Experience recommendations). Don't let this deter you though since the game is AWESOME. Love everything about it and honestly it autosaves so unless you're really unlucky you don't lose much. Here's THE GOOD:The gameplay following and ignoring the story is AAA imho. With all the stranger missions, side missions, hunting, crafting, exploring, etc. you have well over a 100 hours of entertainment. I spent a LOT of time hunting and I'm still not really done but I'm also not bored of it.The story itself if fantastic, like you're taking part in an old western with a deep story centered around a group of very interesting people. I hit almost every emotion playing and watching the cut-scenes; screaming at my screen in some cases.100% recommend, if it takes them another 7 years to make RDR3 I'll wait in excitement for this kind of gaming experience.

If you find yourself getting rekt, and saying "wtf, is everyone hacking?!?", USE A CONTROLLER.

author: NickN2
review: Awesome game. The graphics and map setting are very nice and the views are incredible. The draw distance is impressive, and makes for awesome views when standing on mountains and such. The story and dialogue are amazing, and the voice acting talent here is truly top notch. The attention to detail, game mechanics, graphics, map size, and variety of activities all live up to the standard of quality you can expect from Rockstar. Except for the online mode (*cough* micro-transactions *cough*), this game is a 9/10.

author: Cody
review: First off, Thank You Rock Star for making a PC port of RDR2!  Please continue this with future games.  I'm loving it, but I'm gonna talk about bugs for a sec.  There's many complaints about bugs.  I'm 35.7 hrs in before my first crash to desktop.  The only bug I've seen is info on items not showing in the buy menu sometimes.  I bought it knowing there would be issues.  I did the same for KCD when it came out.  My first playthrough on KCD was flawless, but my brothers was fraught with bugs and eventually broken, as was my second playthrough.  I guess it's the same for this game, some are fine, others are not.  The way I see it, is there's two options.  Wait for issues to be resolved and buy.  Or buy now and roll the dice on bugs.Some of the issues deal with graphical settings, so I decided not to touch mine.  I'm not sure what they're set too lol, but the game looks great.  Everything I've seen from the game, lore wise, is really fleshed out too.  I haven't seen any blame whitey messages, so that's a plus.  RockStar did a great job on the game, and I have every confidence they will smooth out the PC port.  Incase there's a connections with hardware and crashes, here's my specs:  RTX2080 8gbRam, Ryzen 7 2700 3.7GHz, 16GB ram

author: MrVoxPopuli
review: A perfect game to escape reality for the next couple of hundreds hours. Especially if you play on PC in 4K. Absolutely outstanding graphics experience comparing to PS4 version. But all the existing bugs from console version are still here. Like your horse will just disappear 2-3 times during the story mode. Plus after 5 hours the game will start to crash (same thing in GTA V - same engine, same bugs). And of course animal hunting is a huge pain in the ass since some animals such as cougar won't spawn at the designated locations, so you have to visit the same list of locations so the script would work and you'll finally skin your big cat. Nevertheless, the game is worth buying. It's the last of its kind game because NOW all the market can offer you is The Last of Untolerated to Ugly Girls 2.

author: Telendrial
review: You've all read the hype and reviews or you've played this game on console. So, I will get right to the point.Short Form:BEFORE YOU BUY: I cannot stress this enough, read the requirements to run this game. This is a PC eating beast and it will NOT be fun for you in any way shape or form if your PC or connection cannot meet or beat the requirements listed. It seems alot of the negative reviews are related to either not meeting PC or Internet connection minimum. I'm sure not all of them, but the majority.Long form:OFFLINE:This game is amazing, both console and on PC. The world has so much detail, so much life it's often very hard to stay focused on just the main story since there is so much to see and do. The graphics are breathtaking, the environments are incredible with their sharpness and detail. The missions are fun, the storyline is immersive and the characters are interesting.The PC controls are actually easy to learn when transferring from the console game. The game itself, at least offline, is stable with minor glitches here and there.ONLINE:I happen to be one of the many that was never able to take advantage of online play with the console and this version had finally allowed me to join that ever growing online world. I have not been disappointed, I love online play! Each server can be stable for hours or you may find one that fails after a few minutes. It is currently a crap shoot. So far, in my experience, I find more stable servers than unstable. Are they all perfect? No. There are still bugs and glitches to work out. The game is new to PC, the servers are new, everything is new. I remember being told the console online play was absolutely miserable to start as well. PC online play isn't miserable in my opinion, but you may need patience to find a good stable server at times. Let's also not forget that online play is FREE. NO SUB. I can have patience for Rockstar to fix those glitches since I'm not paying a monthly sub for the ability to go online and play then not be able to...TLDR;OFFLINE:Bootyful, rich and detailed environments with oodles to do!ONLINE:Not completely stable on all servers but still a ton of fun with friends or even alone with all the missions and roles to do. Not to mention FREE to play online.

author: uffinator
review: Really, really horribly done. I can understand that people on a console might like it because they are used to not being able to do ♥♥♥♥ and a buggy game engine. Red Dead Online is included but to be able to actually play it, you have to buy gold bars (or grind ♥♥♥♥♥♥ missions for weeks and weeks) with real money just to start your "trade" or "role".There is some complete idiotic ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ in online where I have mostly spent the time. The different roles are all the exact same thing over and over and you just end up grinding for xp. As a bounty hunter you spend 10-20 minutes riding on your horse to the destination where you kill someone with absolute ease in 2 minutes, and then you ride 10-20 minutes again to pick up a new mission.As a trader, 99% of the time you are out hunting. Playing Red Dead Online is like a very crappy Deer Hunter with buggy mechanichs and hours of loading times. Then after spending a whole night shooting deer and possums with my rifle and crossbow, I got this mission where I had to deliver it with my wagon. Now, you get 22 minutes to do it and other online players can kill you during that time and steal your wagon. And I'm not talking about anything sensible. Like, if you kill them, they spawn 3 seconds later literally 50 meters away from you. How many times? Infinite amount of times. So, if there is even one other player online and you don't have a "posse", a group of other players to help you - it's completely impossible. I spent my 20 minutes killing the same 2 players a total amount of over 50 times. Because if I sit up on my slow ass wagon obviously I'm getting shot.Again, as a console gamer - maybe. As a PC gamer used to working mechanics, playing instead of waiting for repetitive useless animations and a very very very monotone mission database - nope.

After every session of playing for sure you will end up with a few amazing screenshots as it's impossible to pass by a gorgeous scenery and not want to immortalize it.I don't have anything I dislike about this game as it's great from every aspect in my opinion and it deserves the hype it got and it still gets.

review: The game is broken and saturated with hackers. Can't play without being blown up or having a cage fall from out of nowhere to lock me up. Also can't do the Trader job because the butcher's table is unable to be purchased, and that locks me out of the Moonshiner business as well. Rockstar doesn't respond to tickets. I have had one open for two weeks now. No response. Wish the game was better.

author: Mochi Balls Deep
review: Content-wise the game is a masterpiece. I'm sorry to see Dan Houser leave the team at Rockstar. Tech-wise the copy protection is annoying AF. I bought the game, happily, only to be locked out of it when im offline. Initially, the game crashed a ton but this has improved over time with updates. So, first it crashed. Then when they fixed the crashing, copy protection locks you out of your own game. I should be able to play offline.

author: Raven™
review: Absolutely recommend it for singleplayer. There's just so much to do, it's insane. The world building is truly breathtaking as well. Definitely recommend having a decent rig to run this though. Only have had 2 CTDs in 10 hours of playing and haven't experienced any other errors. I was kinda apprehensive about buying it because of everything I heard about the game at launch but I honestly haven't had any other problems apart from those 2 crashes. I haven't messed around much with Online but from what I've played, it can't possibly compare to GTA Online so if you're expecting the kind of depth GTA Online has and only in it for the online aspect, maybe hold off on it a little bit longer. For singleplayer? Absolutely buy it. It's worth the money and you'll have a blast.EDIT: Turns out my crashes might be related to RAM usage. Probably doesn't help having Chrome running in the background lmao

author: 14ReD
review: I think I am one of the few people who just don't like this game. After playing it for 14,3 hours at the time of writing, I just concluded that I find myself avoiding the game. Not wanting to go ahead with the storyline. And the main reason being, that playing this game is more annoying than doing household chores. At this time, I’d rather take out the trash, wash the dishes and clean the toilet, then continue playing Red Dead Redemption 2. When the game was released in 2019 I was all excited! This looks cool and something I want to do! But since I was into other games, I skipped the launch and waited for the next Summer Sale. Some friends said: Don’t do it, I didn’t like it and neither will you! But it looked too cool and I just wanted to play! So I ignored their complaints and got the game.And there are a lot of reasons to like the game though, don’t get me wrong! The graphics are brilliant. You may even call it stunning. It played well on my rig, no stuttering or bugs as some people claim. The storyline is even interesting. And where in most other games I just “spacebar” myself through a conversation, while shouting “like I care, like I care,”or “blah blah, blah” or “I want to shoot those guns!” I now actually listened to most of it! The theme may be more interesting to Americans. For the rest of the world, most of us don’t really care about the western theme. But I can get past that and be happy that at least it’s not yet another zombie/end of the world theme. The sound, by the way, is excellent! As an audio enthusiast, I enjoyed that even more than anything else in the game. It’s vibrant and alive. The sound in “the wild” is accurate and makes it easy to identify the source. And the sound in towns is busy and makes you feel you’re really there. Gunfights are cool and every gun sounds different. But that all wasn’t enough for me to like the game.And the main reason is that it feels that the game doesn’t want you to win and make it to the end. It wants to irritate you as much as possible and not allow progress. It feels like it’s working against you. It only wants you to give you a fine for everything you do and mostly for no apparent reason.For instance, I walked into a town and some guy started to shoot at me. Maybe because I gave him a bad look or something, I don't know. The shooting was in front of a police station, with a policeman in front of the door, standing right in front of the event. The other guy hit me. The police didn't do anything, so I shot back. Of course I get thrown in jail and fined! My horse was gone, the deer I shot was gone and even more fines added to the list. So much for honest work by hunting!But also, there is a mission where the Van der Linde gang gangs up on you in a town after you break someone out of jail. To get out of town, which is part of the mission, you need to shoot the whole town. I mean every single person that walks there got shot. So you get fined and there is a search party active there. Now that county is a no go zone and maybe, maybe after some time, you may enter again. After paying the fines off course! And that is for doing a mission!Certainly not the least thing that annoyed me, are those search parties. They will spawn at random and try to find you and then capture you because you are wanted! You’re wanted, because of the fines you got from doing the storyline missions. The fines are either paid, but you never have enough money. So you have to take cover and hope they don’t find you. If you get in a firefight with them, you will lose. Thankfully, after some time they will just despawn right in front of you and you can carry on doing chores (and get more fines). Then there are the NPC’s, who’s only reason for existence is being in the way and annoying you. In the countryside some of them have sheep and those sheep will always move in front of you. So, since you don’t care about virtual sheep, you run them over with your horse at full speed. Shouldn’t have walked there, buddy boy! Of course that’s a reason for the NPC to start shooting at you and they will almost always get a near one shot kill! So you start shooting back at him. If you’re unlucky, some other dude sees that, and you have a limited time to shoot him too, because he will run off and tell the police! Then the police will give you, and you guessed it, another fine! So you end up shooting bunches of people, which is yet another chore.Another stupid thing NPC’s do is blame you for everything. In a town there was a robbery and some people on a cart got shot. I just stood still and watched the whole thing from a distance. Didn’t come near it. But still some NPC who stood like 1 metre from the event and saw everything. He could easily identify the robbers. But started screaming at me and, you guessed it, I got a fine! That made me annoyed and so I looted the bodies and shot the screamer. And another fine was given. Happy days.Yet another way to keep you busy is grinding. In defence of Red Dead Redemption 2, a lot of games involve grinding. And I love grinding like in the Assassins Creed series, so I’m up for the challenge. One of the grinding missions is that you can search for dinosaur bones. Finally something to do to make a honest living! And hopefully I won’t get fined (yet I feel that the game will find a way!). But those bones are hard to spot and the map is immense. So, you end up looking at the internet for walkthroughs and grind from there. As you Alt Tab your way from bone to bone you’re bound to be harassed by the search parties. Fun times for everyone!And at last there is the camp of the main mission/storyline. You have to earn money to get to the next part of the storyline and the leader is very strong about this. Earn money! But no one in the camp seems to care! They’re just sitting around, saying “Good day Arthur”! And then get back to doing nothing. At least the women in the camp seem to be doing something. The men are doing absolutely nothing. Some of them do donate some cents to “the good cause”, but when you add dollars you start to wonder what the point of this collective is. The thought “Get off your behinds and do something useful!” entered my head. If I was Arthur in real life, I would just leave and get my own life back on the road. And now I just don’t care for the game anymore. It now feels like a big chore to at least get through the storyline. You know, like one of those chores that you have been putting off for such a long time. Like unpacking that last box from moving, or painting that one window that nobody ever sees or that picture your wife wants you to hang up in the attic. After 10 hours of playing I had to force myself to do this chore, just to get the storyline done. Now, after 14 hours I just stopped caring about the storyline at all. And the game seems to be fine with it. We leave each other in peace now. I don’t care anymore and the game is happy that it achieved its goal of not letting me make it to the end of the game. And not because the game is prolonging the experience by making it fun to play and makes you want to savour every moment of playing, but from being annoying and irritating.

author: Gesia
review: This will be a long review so let me TLDR: It's an amazing game with a bad PC port. Bring time. Lots of it.Edit: Like many people here I don't think that going on sale one week after release is good sportsmanship, as early supporters and adopters are made the fools for showing faith.However, if youre reading this youre wondering if this game is worth the money and it definitely is, especially at -20%, so I will not change the review to thumbs down like all the others.Now I always wanted to play the RDR series but never was a big console player so RDR2 coming to PC made me smile from one ear to the other.I wont talk about much about the premise of the game (outlaw in the last days of the Wild West) or the core Gameplay (GTA with Horses) but will focus on some of the things that made the game a blast to play and some of the things that really need improvement. (Though im sure some of things will never be improved)The game looks beautiful, not even so much technically, but more in terms of aesthetics - The sundown over the hills with the water in the background looks beautiful, even if the textures arent the crispest. The GTA gameplay went very well into the Wild West, shooting feels good, Arthur Morgan is a more likable character that any of the protagonists of the GTA franchise, actually most characters are quite distinct, the missions are fun an much more - basically if youre looking for a more-or-less open world Wild West game this one is for you.So alls good? Well theres some spunk on this otherwise perfect game. For the Story, the only flaw i could find so far is that every character in this game has the moral standard between Trevor from GTA5 and Stalin and will kill without remorse for no reason. If youre a little goody-two-shoes like me, some of the murders YOU commit or actively help commit just feel... wrong.... Theres a metric ton of scenes where members of your gang are "distracting" people and you need to "silence" them which means some innocent stablehand is talking for literal minutes to a gangmember about how much he likes flowers, his newborn child and not being stabbed in the neck before you have to approach him from behind and unfulfil one of the three wishes. In other scenes youre shooting up entire towns, in a particularily mindboggling moment in the beginning of the game, youre mudering everyone through a town, to get to a house, to murder some innocents there, and then run away murdering some more. The entire way your main protagonist complains about the murdering and how the other guy hes with is wrong for all the murdering, but never stops to reconsider letting anything live.This is especially weird since Arthur Morgan is THEORETICALLY a pretty decent guy, constantly helping people. So after killing hundreds of people you suddenly get the chance to let one person live, then donate to charity and one mission for example actually makes you return a cross to a nun for no reward out of the goodness of your heart.All of this makes the game feel like it was written by quite a few different writers who werent allowed to communicate with each other.Another Problem of the story are the basically invincible gangmembers of the van der linde gang. While a few die during the story (spoiler alert...) youre spending about half the game in shootouts of 100vs5 and win without losing anyone. Your gang hideout gets ambushed by 100 men shooting at it with the women and children playing in the streets? Nope, no one dies. Youre walking into a trap in the middle of town with 100 men shooting down on you from the rooftops? Nope no one dies.This does take a huge amount of urgency from the story to the point where I actually rejoiced every time one of my own gang died cause it felt like it was only fair that after having shot thousands of people we would lose a single one.In terms of gameplay itself I cant find much faults at all, except riding. Now I've never played the PS4 version so i dont know if this is actually a gameplay or a PC-Port issue but my Horse quite frequently just starts turning in circles. I ASSUME this has to do with the "autoride" function screwing up. See the button (shift) for "ride fast" is the same button for "ride next to someone at their speed to listen to dialog".So theoretically during the MAAAAAAANY hours you spend just riding next to someone you dont need to control your horse but just press shift+w and your character rides next to that person while you can drink heavily. nice.but there are few things more infuriating than your horse deciding to do donuts in the middle of a chase!Last but not least the problems with the PC port.The first and worst problem are the crashes. I have clocked something like 20 hours into the game and had 5 crashes to desktop. All of them during end-of-mission-cutscenes. This is extra annoying since in this case the game does not always remember the last checkpoint which is why i had to at least 3 times replay the entire mission, which can take quite a while.The second problem with the port are the controls. Everything needs too many clicks. An example for this would be that if youre riding on horseback and want to aim your gun in every other game you would need to press and hold the right mouse button.You also need to do that here, but additionally you need to click the left button for some reason. Walking up to talk to someone? You dont press E you have to keep the right mouse button pressed and then press E for no reason.Search the drawer or pick up the money? Get that right mouse button ready before pressing the R key...You get the pattern. Once youre used to it, like anything in life really, its not too much of a bother anymore but it still confuses me why this would be how they decided to handle it.All in all I am having an absolute blast with the game and would recommend it. non-leathal takedowns and more stability wouldnt hurt, but i can absolutely recommend it.

author: crabdip
review: Enough can't be said about how great this game is, so I'll hit on the highlights. Red Dead Redemption 2 is a narrative-driven game lead by an engaging story and a complex cast of characters set in a beautiful, immersive open world. The story is captivating from the start, but is a bit of a slow-burn as the game encourages the players to explore the world and get distracted by random encounters from stranger missions, horse races, shootouts, and much much more. There are so many great things about RDR2, but personally, the best part is experiencing how each character and their relationships with one another changes/develops over the course of the story.The word "masterpiece" gets thrown around a lot, but Red Dead Redemption 2 is one of those games that is absolutely deserving of that title. The game expertly pieces together character, world-building, and exploration along with amazing music and voice acting to bring us one of the most polished, detailed games ever made.

author: pduckh.
review: Геймплей (СПОЙЛЕРІВ НЕМАЄ)   Рокстар провели дуже велику роботу над цією грою . Навряд чи хтось хоч наблизився до такої ж деталізації , яка є в рдр . Ви забуваєте, що таке реальність , вона  надзвичайно красива , а технічний стан просто дивує (Мабуть, найкраще, що я бачив).     Багато людей починали проходити рдр , але через її повільність просто закидували гру . Можливо , вона не для всіх . Але ця гра дає змогу насолодитися навколишнім світом , кожною деталлю цієї гри. Рокстар намагається , щоб гравець поринув  в ту епоху , в той світ.  Але думаю , що якщо навіть дійти до 6 глави, то  вже ніхто не буде зважати на повільність цієї гри , так як там зносить голову від того , що починає відбуватися.      Повільність гри обґрунтовується тим , що ми стаємо більш прив'язаними до персонажів і тим , що нам дають змогу розвідати світ , відчути кожну деталь. В цій грі не дають мільйон інформації за хвилину , в цій грі ми відпочиваємо - медитуємо. Потрібно просто спробувати зануритися в цю гру, відвернутися від сюжету,  по подорожувати  по полювати , проникнутися атмосферою цієї гри! Світ гри дуже великий та живий, купа випадкових подій, завдань, купа дрібних, але приємних деталей.    Ви маєте їсти , щоб відновлювати здоров'я , чим більше ви їсте , то відповідно тим гладкішими ви стаєте. Так само працює з конями , якщо коня не годувати , він помре , чим грязнішим він є , тим менша його швидкість. Вам також потрібен час , щоб виросла довіра коня до вас , чим більша довіра - тим краща статистика в коня .   Якщо ви міняєте зачіску Артуру і зістригаєте волосся , назад як в гта ви його уже не повернете , воно має відрости заново. Вам потрібно перегортати журнал вручну , щоб перейти до наступної сторінки, йти в ванну та мити окремі частини тіла теж вручну , потрібно проїздити десятки кілометрів , щоб відкрити нові локації.   Наскільки пророблений табір банди , напевно , потрібно провести сотні годин в цій грі , щоб почути всі діалоги в ньому.     Npc починають будувати будинки в містах , і через декілька ігрових днів чи тижнів , вони можуть добудувати той дім. Якщо публічно влаштувати бійню та втекти, на місце прискачуть законники та приберуть трупи. А якщо прикінчити когось у глушині, тіла почнуть розкладатися. Туші вбитих звірів приваблюють стерв'ятників, причому тварини чутливі до запахів — якщо застосувати жувальний тютюн за кілька метрів від алігатора, і вітер дме у його бік, він зашморгає носом.   Режисура , Світло, Звук , Музика , Картинка - все це також на найвищому рівні в цій грі. Можливо , мінусом цієї гри може бути те , що в більшості випадках ви стаєте термінаторами і вбиваєте всіх і вся , а самі не ушкоджені. Також до третьої глави можна задуматися над тим , як це ніхто з персонажів банди не був навіть пошкоджений за стільки перестрілок то , але після 3 глави гра стає набагато цікавішою і все стає на свої місцяАртур Морган (СПОЙЛЕРИ!!!!)  Ми відчуваємо симпатію до людини , яка вбила сотні людей , але ж чому так? Я думаю , тому що Ден Хаузер (головний сценарист гри) створив найживішого персонажа в історії комп‘ютерних ігор та також те , що його  історія , яким би він не був , стала для багатьох дуже особистою та зворушливою.  Здавалося б ірландець, який спочатку навіть трохи бісить , але через деякий час він стає настільки рідним, як молодший брат , що від такої різкої його смерті аж серце завмирає, те ж саме Кіран , Ленні , Хозея. Ми стали більш прив'язаними до цих персонажів саме через повільність гри. Навіть кінь , який так само різко помирає , виявляється був таким близьким. Те саме і з Артуром.   Характер Артура розвивається глибоко та переконливо протягом історії, особливо якщо грати  з високою честю .Еволюція його особистості подана дуже життєво. Він був по коліна у гріхах, але так ще легше асоціювати його з самим собою. Та й вплинути на його рішення хоч і нечасто, але можна.  Після того як Артуру ставлять діагноз невиліковного туберкульозу , ми розуміємо , що він помре . Але він не помирає швидкою смертю в якійсь битві , він помирає помалу і дивитись на те , як він кашляє з кожним разом все сильніше дуже важко , ми ніби помираємо разом з ним.   Після виявлення діагнозу , Артур починає замислюватися над тим , що буде після нього? А що він після себе залишив? Чи були виправдані всі його вбивства? Чи за тою людиною(Датчем) він міг піти хоч на край світу? Артур хоче зробити хоч щось хороше , поки він не помер , хоче спокутувати свої гріхи і він стає на шлях хорошої людини та допомагає Місіс Даунс і її сину та рятує Джона з його сім'єю. Світ буде далі рухатися після його смерті .    Після смерті Артура нам одразу показують сцену , як Джон зі своєю дружиною рухаються в нове місце - світ рухається.

author: Sambombe
review: In short, the best game I've ever played, in all respects...Now, let's get down to the details:- Perfect setting of the old west, just after the beginning of industrialization;- Very well written and touching protagonist story arc;- Open world quests and side quests, for the most part, very well written too;- Living and beautiful world full of encounters, sights, curiosities and secrets;- Excellent voice acting;- Very well written characters;- Excellent graphics;- Excellent sounds and music;- Production quality far above the best in the market;- Extremely immersive;Cons:- Very short, could explore the map more and have more gang quests, better integrating the world and the story;- Keyboard controls are sometimes unresponsive compared to the joystick;- Confusing and impractical crafting system and menus;- Some minor bugs a few crashes.After this game, it's going to be hard to play others by comparison... the quality here is extremeNote: I played a little online but I didn't find it interesting at all

author: keaton
review: Those are my opinions on Red Dead Redemption 2 and while I loved the first game, I found the sequel to be a mixed bag. The main campaign is slow-paced and restrictive, and the hunger and stamina depletion system gets tedious. I also had issues with the weapon wheel and found the story to be uninteresting. However, the game is visually stunning and has entertaining side missions and characters. It didn't blow me away, but I'm glad I played it. Overall, I would pay its price rating, not including the online aspect.The game world is vast and detailed, with a variety of landscapes and wildlife. The game also features a realistic hunting and fishing system, and players can interact with other characters in a variety of ways, such as through dialogue or combat. The game's attention to detail is impressive, and the game's physics and animations are realistic. The game's soundtrack is also noteworthy, with an original score that adds to the game's atmosphere.One of the main criticisms of the game is that it can be slow-paced and sometimes feels like a chore to play. The restrictive movement and interactive points can be frustrating, especially when you just want to move on to the next mission. The hunger and stamina depletion system can also become tedious, as you constantly need to buy replenishment items to keep your character from slowing down.The game's story, while well-written, is not as memorable as the first Red Dead Redemption. The cutscenes can be long and uninteresting, and the story's pacing can be slow. The game's missions are also generally uninspired, with many of them being just "shoot-out" objectives. There are a few missions that stand out, but they are few and far between.In conclusion, Red Dead Redemption 2 is a visually stunning game with a vast and detailed world, but it can be slow-paced and restrictive. The game's story is not as memorable as the first Red Dead Redemption and the missions are uninspired. The game's attention to detail is impressive, but the game's restrictive gameplay and gradually draining story really hurt my experience. Overall, I would recommend the game with reservation and only if you are willing to invest time and patience.

author: Not Toxic
review: Red Dead Redemption 2 is truly a feat of modern video game development that provides breathtaking graphics and careful attention to detail to create a vast and immersive world complete with gorgeously produced environments and fascinating characters. The world features a diverse range of settings including forests, mountains, and wetlands, each depicted with great detail. The characters are also well designed, each having their own unique appearance and personality. Every location feels alive and authentic, with its own unique culture, and architecture.Another thing that makes Red Dead Redemption 2 stand out is its strong narrative. The game follows the story of Arthur Morgan, a Van der Linde gang member, as he navigates the changing landscape of the Old West. The story is rich and complex, with a cast of well-developed characters who feel like real people, except for Micah, ♥♥♥♥ Micah. He kicks dogs n ♥♥♥♥. Who the ♥♥♥♥ kicks dogs? The player is free to make choices that affect the course of the story, and the writing is excellent, with great dialogue and character interactions. The game also tackles themes of loyalty, morality, and the consequences of one's actions in a thoughtful and nuanced way.In terms of gameplay, Red Dead Redemption 2 is a feast for the senses. The game offers a wide range of activities for the player to engage in, including hunting, fishing, poker, or killing/torturing NPCs in the most gruesome, concerning ways possible. The combat in the game is seamless and fulfilling, offering a diverse selection of weapons and a cover system that is intuitive (Also first-person killing is incredibly satisfying). The horse riding is (mostly) well done and the game does an excellent job of immersing the player in the world of the Old West.Overall, Red Dead Redemption 2 is a masterfully crafted game that offers an immersive and unforgettable experience for players. Its compelling gameplay, excellent storytelling, and technical prowess make it the best video game in recent memory and a must-play for fans of the open-world genre.Also cowboy shenanigans are fun :)

author: Meribiaa
review: I'm horrible at first person shooters and in general don't like violent games, but every horse nerd I know swears by this game so I thought I'd try it! I screamed and yelled playing the first few missions, to the point of stressing out my irl partner, but once I got into the game I was able to appreciate how awesome and special it is. I've been having a grand time hunting, catching horses, and slowly completing the story.Highly recommend even if this isn't your usual style of game. Aside from the story missions, you have a lot of options with choosing to be violent or just walk around being a normal dude.

author: Elias
review: I would recommend this game to other players because it has the best narrative I've ever encountered in a video game. The story is so well thought-out and written so intelligently that you feel exactly what you need to feel toward every character: deep, warranted hatred for your enemies; undying loyalty and love for the members of your gang. The atmosphere —although tense — is inviting, with soundtracks that amp you up for a big battle, bring you complete serenity when you're enjoying a relaxing horseback ride across the country, or just deliver unbridled joy when you're relishing in one of the few, but well spaced-out, moments of comic relief in the saga. The environment is visually stunning at every point of the game, with dazzling fauna and flora throughout and a true attention to detail brought to both. RDR2 proves the degree to which games can outdo other forms of media in creating a deep bond between a protagonist and the viewer. It's a masterpiece, and everyone must play this game in their lifetime.

author: FunkGraven
review: Red Dead Redemption 2. One of the greatest games of our generation maybe even the greatest game of ALL TIME. This game makes you feel like your starring in a western movie. I have never fell in love with a world such as this one, The world is just so dense and so MANY activities to do, Whether that is Fishing, Hunting, Meeting strangers, Doing side missions and just exploring the amazing world Rockstar Games have created, there is just so much to do. The characters in this game are phenomenal, each character is so unique with the actions they do and the dialogue that they speak. The story is Amazing from beggining to end, its such a complex and emotional ride with the Dutch van der Linde Gang. Riding from town to town with the westernized music in the background with the drums pacing with your gallops is just an amazing feeling. Sound design is great for everything (Weapons, Explosions, Galloping, etc...). Overall the game is truly a classic and one of the GREATEST games of all time

author: nicksoup
review: Well, heh - the name's Butch, Butch Beergut. Born in 1842, I was abandoned very early on - raised by a small orphanage in Annesburg I was soon adopted into the Dalton Gang where I was raised to be a killer. I lived a very dangerous life, holding up trains, outright robbing every man I see and shooting stray dogs multiple times for a chuckle. Then on one fated night in 1874, during a shootout in Rhodes - I was heavily wounded after taking out several of the rival gang members. I thought that was it for me - it was me versus them, but I had already used the last of my strength. then suddenly a hand reaches towards me, with no power to resist I let it come closer. He jacked me up on ketamine and said to me; "Butch? I finally found you brother.." In disbelief and being completely zooted I opened my eyes and shifted my gaze towards this man. "Who..? I ain't got no brothers" He sighed, stood up and tilted his hat. "The name's Baxter, Baxter Beergut - I finally found you after all this time." We share a warm embrace. (still ♥♥♥♥♥♥ up btw) And this is just the beginning of our story as semi-professional bounty hunters.
